\f0\fs24 \cf2 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0
\outl0\strokewidth0 \strokec2 In 2154, humans have depleted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth}}'s natural resources, leading to a severe energy crisis. The Resources Development Administration (RDA for short) mines for a valuable mineral \'97\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unobtainium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 unobtanium}}\'a0\'97 on Pandora, a densely forested\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Habitable_moon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 habitable moon}}\'a0orbiting the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gas_giant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gas giant}}\'a0Polyphemus in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alpha_Centauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alpha Centauri}}\'a0star system.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Pandora, whose atmosphere is poisonous to humans, is inhabited by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Na%CA%BCvi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Na'vi}}, a species of 10-foot tall (3.0\'a0m), blue-skinned,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wisdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sapient}}\'a0humanoids
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0that live in harmony with nature and worship a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mother_goddess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mother goddess}}\'a0named Eywa.\
To explore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandora's biosphere}}, scientists use Na'vi-human hybrids called "avatars", operated by genetically matched humans; Jake Sully, a paraplegic former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Marine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marine}}, replaces his deceased identical twin brother as an operator of one. Dr. Grace Augustine, head of the Avatar Program, considers Sully an inadequate replacement but accepts his assignment as a bodyguard. While protecting the avatars of Grace and fellow scientist Dr. Norm Spellman as they collect biological data, Jake's avatar is attacked by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 thanator}}\'a0and flees into the forest, where he is rescued by Neytiri, a female Na'vi. Witnessing an auspicious sign, she takes him to her clan, whereupon Neytiri's mother Mo'at, the clan's spiritual leader, orders her daughter to initiate Jake into their society.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Colonel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Colonel}}\'a0Miles Quaritch, head of RDA's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Private_military_company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 private security force}}, promises Jake that the company will restore his legs if he gathers information about the Na'vi and the clan's gathering place, a giant tree called Hometree,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 which stands above the richest deposit of unobtanium in the area. When Grace learns of this, she transfers herself, Jake, and Norm to an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/outpost"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 outpost}}. Over the following three months, Jake grows to sympathize with the natives. After Jake is initiated into the tribe, he and Neytiri choose each other as mates, and soon afterward, Jake reveals his change of allegiance when he attempts to disable a bulldozer that threatens to destroy a sacred Na'vi site. When Quaritch shows a video recording of Jake's attack on the bulldozer to Administrator Parker Selfridge,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [37]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and another in which Jake admits that the Na'vi will never abandon Hometree, Selfridge orders Hometree destroyed.\
Despite Grace's argument that destroying Hometree could damage the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_neural_network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 biological neural network}}\'a0native to Pandora, Selfridge gives Jake and Grace one hour to convince the Na'vi to evacuate before commencing the attack. While trying to warn the Na'vi, Jake confesses to being a spy, and the Na'vi take him and Grace captive. Seeing this, Quaritch's men destroy Hometree, killing Neytiri's father (the clan chief) and many others. Mo'at frees Jake and Grace, but they are detached from their avatars and imprisoned by Quaritch's forces. Pilot Trudy Chac\'f3n, disgusted by Quaritch's brutality, frees Jake and Grace and airlifts them to Grace's outpost, but during the escape Quaritch fires at them, hitting Grace.\
To regain the Na'vi's trust, Jake connects his mind to that of Toruk, a dragon-like predator feared and honored by the Na'vi. Jake finds the refugees at the sacred\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fictional_universe_in_Avatar#The_Tree_of_Souls"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tree of Souls}}\'a0and pleads with Mo'at to heal Grace. The clan attempts to transfer Grace from her human body into her avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls, but she dies before the process can be completed. Supported by the new chief Tsu'tey, Jake speaks to unite the clan and tells them to gather all of the clans to battle against the RDA. Noticing the impending gathering, Quaritch organizes a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Preemptive_war"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pre-emptive strike}}\'a0against the Tree of Souls, believing that its destruction will demoralize the natives. On the eve of battle, Jake prays to Eywa, via a neural connection with the Tree of Souls, to intercede on behalf of the Na'vi.\
During the subsequent battle, the Na'vi suffer heavy casualties, including Tsu'tey and Trudy; but are rescued when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Characters_and_wildlife_in_Avatar#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandoran wildlife}}\'a0unexpectedly join the attack and overwhelm the humans, which Neytiri interprets as Eywa's answer to Jake's prayer. Jake destroys a makeshift bomber before it can reach the Tree of Souls; Quaritch, wearing an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mecha"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 AMP suit}}, escapes from his own damaged aircraft and breaks open the avatar link unit containing Jake's human body, exposing it to Pandora's poisonous atmosphere. Quaritch prepares to slit the throat of Jake's avatar, but Neytiri kills Quaritch and saves Jake from suffocation.\
With the exceptions of Jake, Norm and a select few others, all humans are expelled from Pandora and sent back to Earth, after which Jake is permanently transferred into his avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls.\
In 1996, treasure hunter Brock Lovett and his team aboard the research vessel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Akademik_Mstislav_Keldysh"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Akademik Mstislav Keldysh}}\'a0search the wreck of RMS\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 \'a0for a necklace with a rare diamond, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heart_of_the_Ocean"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heart of the Ocean}}. They recover a safe containing a drawing of a young woman wearing only the necklace dated April 14, 1912, the day the ship struck the iceberg.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [Note 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Rose Dawson Calvert, the woman in the drawing, is brought aboard\'a0
\f1\i Keldysh
\f0\i0 \'a0and tells Lovett of her experiences aboard\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 .\
In 1912\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Southampton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Southampton}}, 17-year-old first-class passenger Rose DeWitt Bukater, her fianc\'e9 Cal Hockley, and her mother Ruth board the luxurious\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 . Ruth emphasizes that Rose's marriage will resolve their family's financial problems and retain their high-class persona. Distraught over the engagement, Rose considers suicide by jumping from the stern; Jack Dawson, a penniless artist, intervenes and discourages her. Discovered with Jack, Rose tells a concerned Cal that she was peering over the edge and Jack saved her from falling. When Cal becomes indifferent, she suggests to him that Jack deserves a reward. He invites Jack to dine with them in first class the following night. Jack and Rose develop a tentative friendship, despite Cal and Ruth being wary of him. Following dinner, Rose secretly joins Jack at a party in third class.\
Aware of Cal and Ruth's disapproval, Rose rebuffs Jack's advances, but realizes she prefers him over Cal. After rendezvousing on the bow at sunset, Rose takes Jack to her state room; at her request, Jack sketches Rose posing nude wearing Cal's engagement present, the Heart of the Ocean necklace. They evade Cal's bodyguard, Mr. Lovejoy, and have sex in an automobile inside the cargo hold. On the forward deck, they witness a collision with an iceberg and overhear the officers and designer discussing its seriousness.\
Cal discovers Jack's sketch of Rose and an insulting note from her in his safe along with the necklace. When Jack and Rose attempt to inform Cal of the collision, Lovejoy slips the necklace into Jack's pocket and he and Cal accuse him of theft. Jack is arrested, taken to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Master-at-arms"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 master-at-arms}}' office, and handcuffed to a pipe. Cal puts the necklace in his own coat pocket.\
With the ship sinking, Rose flees Cal and her mother, who has boarded a lifeboat, and frees Jack. On the boat deck, Cal and Jack encourage her to board a lifeboat; Cal claims he can get himself and Jack off safely. After Rose boards one, Cal tells Jack the arrangement is only for himself. As her boat lowers, Rose decides that she cannot leave Jack and jumps back on board. Cal takes his bodyguard's pistol and chases Rose and Jack into the flooding first-class dining saloon. After using up his ammunition, Cal realizes he gave his coat and consequently the necklace to Rose. He later boards a collapsible lifeboat by carrying a lost child.\
After braving several obstacles, Jack and Rose return to the boat deck. The lifeboats have departed and passengers are falling to their deaths as the stern rises out of the water. The ship breaks in half, lifting the stern into the air. Jack and Rose ride it into the ocean and he helps her onto a wooden panel buoyant enough for only one person. He assures her that she will die an old woman, warm in her bed. Jack dies of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hypothermia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hypothermia}}
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but Rose is saved.\
With Rose hiding from Cal en route, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/RMS_Carpathia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 RMS\'a0
\f1\i Carpathia}}\'a0takes the survivors to New York City where Rose gives her name as Rose Dawson. Rose says she later read that Cal committed suicide after losing all his money in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wall_Street_Crash_of_1929"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wall Street Crash of 1929}}.\
Back in the present, Lovett decides to abandon his search after hearing Rose's story. Alone on the stern of\'a0
\f1\i Keldysh
\f0\i0 , Rose takes out the Heart of the Ocean\'a0\'96 in her possession all along\'a0\'96 and drops it into the sea over the wreck site. While she is seemingly asleep or has died in her bed,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0photos on her dresser depict a life of freedom and adventure inspired by the life she wanted to live with Jack. A young Rose reunites with Jack at the\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grand_Staircase_of_the_RMS_Titanic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grand Staircase}}, applauded by those who died on the ship.\
Thirty years after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Civil War}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0has risen from the fallen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}\'a0and seeks to eliminate the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}. The Resistance, backed by the Republic and led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Leia Organa}}, opposes them while Leia searches for her brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}.\
On the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jakku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jakku}}, Resistance pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0receives a map to Luke's location from Lor San Tekka.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stormtrooper_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stormtroopers}}\'a0commanded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}\'a0destroy the village and capture Poe, while Kylo kills San Tekka. Poe's droid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}\'a0escapes with the map and encounters a scavenger,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}, near a junkyard settlement. Kylo tortures Poe using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0and learns of\'a0BB-8. Stormtrooper\'a0FN-2187, unwilling to kill for the First Order, frees Poe, and they escape in a stolen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE fighter}}; Poe names\'a0FN-2187\'a0"{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}}". As they turn back to Jakku to retrieve\'a0BB-8, they are shot down by a First Order\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0and crash-land. Finn survives and assumes that Poe died in the crash. He encounters Rey and\'a0BB-8, but the First Order tracks them and launches an airstrike. Finn, Rey, and\'a0BB-8\'a0flee the planet in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, which they steal from a junkyard.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by a larger ship piloted by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}, looking to reclaim their former vessel. The group is attacked by gangs seeking to settle debts with Han, and flee in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . At the First Order's Starkiller Base, a planet converted into a superweapon that harnesses star energy,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0allows\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Hux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Hux}}\'a0to use the weapon for the first time. Snoke questions Kylo's ability to deal with emotions relating to his father, Han Solo, who Kylo says means nothing to him.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0crew determines BB-8's map is incomplete. Han explains that Luke attempted to rebuild the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Order}}\'a0but exiled himself when an apprentice turned to the dark side, destroyed the temple, and slaughtered the other apprentices. The crew travels to the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Takodana"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Takodana}}\'a0and meets with cantina owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maz_Kanata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maz Kanata}}, who offers assistance getting\'a0BB-8\'a0to the Resistance. Rey is drawn to a secluded vault and finds the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}\'a0that once belonged to Luke and his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}. She experiences disturbing visions and flees into the woods. Maz gives Finn the lightsaber for safekeeping.\
Starkiller Base destroys a few planets including the Republic capital and a portion of its fleet. The First Order attacks Takodana in search of\'a0BB-8. Han, Chewbacca, and Finn are saved by Resistance\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing fighters}}\'a0led by Poe, who is revealed to have survived the crash on Jakku. Leia arrives at Takodana with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}\'a0and reunites with Han and Chewbacca. Meanwhile, Kylo captures Rey and takes her to Starkiller Base, but she resists his mind-reading attempts. Discovering she can use the Force, Rey escapes by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_mind_trick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi mind trick}}\'a0on a nearby guard.\
At the Resistance base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%27Qar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 D'Qar}}, BB-8 finds\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who has been inactive since Luke's disappearance. As Starkiller Base prepares to fire on D'Qar, the Resistance devises a plan to destroy it by attacking a critical facility. Using the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , Han, Chewbacca, and Finn infiltrate the facility, find Rey, and plant explosives. Han confronts Kylo, calling him by his birth name, Ben, and implores him to abandon the dark side. Kylo refuses and kills Han, enraging Chewbacca, who shoots Kylo and sets off the explosives, allowing the Resistance to attack and destroy the base.\
The injured Kylo pursues Finn and Rey to the surface. Kylo defeats Finn in a lightsaber duel, leaving him wounded. Rey takes the lightsaber and uses the Force to defeat Kylo before they are separated by a fissure as the planet begins to disintegrate. Snoke orders Hux to evacuate and bring Kylo to him to complete his training. Rey and Chewbacca escape with the unconscious Finn in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . On D'Qar, Leia, Chewbacca, and Rey mourn Han's death.\'a0R2-D2\'a0awakens and reveals the rest of the map, which Rey follows to the oceanic planet Ahch-To. She finds Luke and presents him with the lightsaber.\
Having acquired the Power Stone, one of the six\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}, from the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Xandar#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Xandar}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0and his lieutenants\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ebony_Maw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ebony Maw}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Dwarf_(comics)#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cull Obsidian}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Proxima_Midnight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Proxima Midnight}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Corvus_Glaive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Corvus Glaive}}\'97intercept a spaceship carrying the last survivors of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0As they extract the Space Stone from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cosmic_Cube"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tesseract}}, Thanos subdues\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, overpowers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, and kills\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}. The latter of which sends the Hulk to Earth using the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st#Adaptations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st}}\'a0before being killed. Thanos departs with his lieutenants and obliterates the ship.\
Hulk crash-lands at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sanctum_Sanctorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sanctum Sanctorum}}\'a0in New York City, reverting to Bruce Banner. He warns\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Strange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Strange}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wong_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wong}}\'a0about Thanos' plan to kill half of all life in the universe; in response, Strange recruits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}. Maw and Obsidian arrive to retrieve the Time Stone from Strange, drawing the attention of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}. Maw captures Strange, but fails to take the Time Stone due to an enchantment. Stark and Parker pursue Maw's spaceship, Banner contacts\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}, and Wong stays behind to guard the Sanctum.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edinburgh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edinburgh}}, Midnight and Glaive ambush\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlet_Witch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}\'a0in order to retrieve the Mind Stone in Vision's forehead. Rogers,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}\'a0rescue them and take shelter with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0and Banner at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'a0Facility. Vision offers to sacrifice himself by having Maximoff destroy the Mind Stone to keep Thanos from retrieving it, but Maximoff refuses. Rogers suggests they travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakanda}}, which he believes has the resources to remove the stone without destroying Vision.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(2008_team)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Guardians of the Galaxy}}\'a0respond to a distress call from the Asgardian ship and rescue Thor, who surmises Thanos seeks the Reality Stone, which is in the possession of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Collector_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Collector}}\'a0on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knowhere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knowhere}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocket_Raccoon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocket}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Groot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Groot}}accompany Thor to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nidavellir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nidavellir}}, where they and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eitri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eitri}}\'a0create Stormbreaker, a battle-axe capable of killing Thanos. On Knowhere,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star-Lord"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Quill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gamora}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drax}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mantis}}\'a0find Thanos with the Reality Stone already in his possession. Thanos kidnaps Gamora, his adopted daughter, who reveals the location of the Soul Stone to save her captive adopted sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nebula_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nebula}}\'a0from torture. Thanos and Gamora travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_planets_in_Marvel_Comics#Vormir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vormir}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, keeper of the Soul Stone, informs him the stone can only be retrieved by sacrificing someone he loves. Thanos reluctantly kills Gamora, earning the stone.\
Nebula escapes captivity and asks the remaining Guardians to meet her on Thanos' destroyed homeworld,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Titan_(Marvel_Comics_location)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Titan}}. Stark and Parker kill Maw and rescue Strange. Landing on Titan, they meet Quill, Drax, and Mantis. The group forms a plan to remove Thanos' Infinity Gauntlet after Strange uses the Time Stone to view millions of possible futures, seeing only one in which Thanos loses. Thanos arrives, revealing his plans to be necessary to ensure the survival of a universe threatened by overpopulation. The group subdues him until Nebula deduces that Thanos has killed Gamora. Enraged, Quill attacks him, allowing Thanos to break the group's hold and overpower them. Stark is seriously wounded by Thanos, but is spared after Strange surrenders the Time Stone.\
In Wakanda, Rogers reunites with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0before Thanos' army invades. The Avengers, alongside\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}\'a0and the Wakandan forces, mount a defense while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shuri}}\'a0works to extract the Mind Stone from Vision. Banner, unable to transform into the Hulk, fights in Stark's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulkbuster_armor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulkbuster armor}}. Thor, Rocket, and Groot arrive to reinforce the Avengers; Midnight, Obsidian, and Glaive are killed and their army is routed. Despite Maximoff's attempt to destroy the Mind Stone, Thanos arrives and reverts time to remove it from Vision's head, killing him.\
Thor severely wounds Thanos, but Thanos activates the completed Infinity Gauntlet and teleports away. Half of all life across the universe disintegrates, including Barnes, T'Challa, Groot, Maximoff, Wilson, Mantis, Drax, Quill, Strange, and Parker, as well as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, although Fury is able to transmit a signal first.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Stark and Nebula remain on Titan while Banner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Man-Ape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M'Baku}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Okoye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Okoye}}, Rhodes, Rocket, Rogers, Romanoff, and Thor are left on the Wakandan battlefield. Meanwhile, Thanos watches a sunrise on another planet.\
Teenaged brothers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Zach_Mitchell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zach}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Gray_Mitchell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gray Mitchell}}\'a0visit Jurassic World, a dinosaur theme park at the original\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jurassic Park}}\'a0site on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isla_Nublar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Nublar}}\'a0of which their aunt\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Claire_Dearing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Claire Dearing}}\'a0is the operations manager. Claire assigns her assistant as the boys' guide but they evade her and explore on their own. Elsewhere on the island, U.S. Navy veteran and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethology"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ethologist}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Owen_Grady"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Owen Grady}}\'a0has been training four\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptors}}\'a0and researching their intelligence. Based on the raptors' ability to follow commands,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Vic_Hoskins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vic Hoskins}}, the head of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jurassic_Park#InGen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 InGen Security}}, believes the animals can be weaponized, an idea Owen and his assistant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Barry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Barry}}\'a0strongly oppose.\
Prior to its opening, Claire and park owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Simon_Masrani"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simon Masrani}}\'a0inspect the park's newest attraction\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_cloned_animals_in_the_Jurassic_Park_series#Indominus_rex"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indominus rex}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genetic_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genetically-engineered}}\'a0dinosaur created by geneticist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_characters#Dr._Henry_Wu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Henry Wu}}. Masrani tasks Owen with evaluating the enclosure. Owen warns Claire the\'a0
\f1\i Indominus
\f0\i0 \'a0lacks social skills, making it dangerous and unpredictable. When it appears the\'a0

\f0\i0 \'a0has escaped, Owen and two park workers enter the enclosure. The\'a0
\f1\i Indominus
\f0\i0 , which can camouflage itself and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Multi-spectral_camouflage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mask its heat signature}}, suddenly appears. Owen survives the attack, but it kills the other two men before escaping into the island's interior. Owen tells Masrani to have the\'a0
\f1\i Indominus
\f0\i0 \'a0killed; to protect his company's investment, however, Masrani dispatches a specialized unit to subdue it with non-lethal weaponry. After most of the unit is wiped out, Claire orders the evacuation of the island's northern sector.\
While exploring the park in a vehicle, Zach and Gray enter a restricted area. The\'a0

They find the ruins of the original Jurassic Park facility, repair an old\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeep_Wrangler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeep Wrangler}}, and drive back to the park resort. \f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pteranodon}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dimorphodon"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i Indominus

\f0\i0 \'a0is cornered at the lagoon's edge, where it is dragged underwater by the park's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mosasaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mosasaurus}}. The survivors are evacuated and the island is abandoned again. Zach and Gray are reunited with their parents; Owen and Claire decide to stay together.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgardian}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0encounters the Other, the leader of an extraterrestrial race known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chitauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chitauri}}. In exchange for retrieving the Tesseract,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0a powerful energy source of unknown potential, the Other promises Loki an army with which he can subjugate Earth.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, director of the espionage agency\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}, and his lieutenant Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0arrive at a remote research facility during an evacuation, where physicist Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0is leading a research team experimenting on the Tesseract. Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0explains that the object has begun radiating an unusual form of energy. The Tesseract suddenly activates and opens a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormhole}}, allowing Loki to reach Earth. Loki takes the Tesseract and uses his scepter to enslave Selvig and a few other agents, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}, to aid him in his getaway.\
In response to the attack, Fury reactivates the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers Initiative}}". Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}\'a0is sent to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kolkata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Calcutta}}\'a0to recruit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Bruce Banner}}\'a0to trace the Tesseract through its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamma_ray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gamma radiation}}\'a0emissions. Coulson visits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0to have him review Selvig's research, and Fury approaches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0with an assignment to retrieve the Tesseract.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stuttgart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stuttgart}}, Barton steals\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iridium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iridium}}\'a0needed to stabilize the Tesseract's power while Loki causes a distraction, leading to a brief confrontation with Rogers, Stark, and Romanoff that ends with Loki's surrender. While Loki is being escorted to S.H.I.E.L.D.,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, his adoptive brother, arrives and frees him, hoping to convince him to abandon his plan and return to Asgard. After a confrontation with Stark and Rogers, Thor agrees to take Loki to S.H.I.E.L.D.'s flying aircraft carrier, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarrier}}. Upon arrival, Loki is imprisoned while Banner and Stark attempt to locate the Tesseract.\
The Avengers become divided, both over how to approach Loki and the revelation that S.H.I.E.L.D. plans to harness the Tesseract to develop weapons as a deterrent against hostile extraterrestrials. As the group argues, Barton and Loki's other possessed agents attack the Helicarrier, disabling one of its engines in flight and causing Banner to transform into the Hulk. Stark and Rogers work to restart the damaged engine, and Thor attempts to stop the Hulk's rampage. Romanoff reluctantly fights Barton, and knocks him unconscious, breaking Loki's mind control. Loki escapes after killing Coulson and ejecting Thor from the airship, while the Hulk falls to the ground after attacking a S.H.I.E.L.D. fighter jet. Fury uses Coulson's death to motivate the Avengers into working as a team. Stark and Rogers realize that for Loki, simply defeating them will not be enough; he needs to overpower them publicly to validate himself as ruler of Earth. Loki uses the Tesseract, in conjunction with a device Selvig built, to open a wormhole above\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark Tower}}\'a0to the Chitauri fleet in space, launching his invasion.\
Rogers, Stark, Romanoff, Barton, and Thor rally in defense of New York City, the wormhole's location. Banner arrives and transforms into the Hulk, and together the Avengers battle the Chitauri while evacuating civilians. The Hulk finds Loki and beats him into submission. Romanoff makes her way to the wormhole generator, where Selvig, freed from Loki's mind control, reveals that Loki's scepter can be used to shut down the generator. Meanwhile, Fury's superiors from the World Security Council attempt to end the invasion by launching a nuclear missile at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Midtown Manhattan}}. Stark intercepts the missile and takes it through the wormhole toward the Chitauri fleet. The missile detonates, destroying the Chitauri mothership and disabling their forces on Earth. Stark's suit runs out of power, and he falls back through the wormhole just as Romanoff closes it. Stark goes into freefall, but the Hulk saves him from crashing into the ground. In the aftermath, Thor returns Loki and the Tesseract to Asgard, while Fury expresses confidence that the Avengers will return if and when they are needed.\
In a mid-credits scene, the Other confers with his master
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0about the failed attack on Earth. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the Avengers eat in silence at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shawarma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shawarma}}\'a0restaurant.\
After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dominic_Toretto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dominic "Dom" Toretto}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brian_O%27Conner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brian O'Conner}}\'a0and the rest of their team have returned to the United States to live normal lives again. Brian begins to accustom himself to life as a father, while Dom tries to help Letty Ortiz regain her memory. Meanwhile, Owen's older brother, Deckard Shaw, breaks into the secure hospital that the comatose Owen is being held in and swears vengeance against Dom and his team, before breaking into Luke Hobbs'\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Diplomatic_Security_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Diplomatic Security Service}}\'a0(DSS) office to extract profiles of Dom's crew. After revealing his identity, Shaw engages Hobbs in a fight, and escapes when he detonates a bomb that severely injures Hobbs. Dom later learns from his sister Mia that she is pregnant again and convinces her to tell Brian. However, a bomb, disguised in a package sent from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tokyo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tokyo}}, explodes and destroys the Toretto house just seconds after Han, a member of Dom's team, is killed by Shaw in Tokyo.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Dom later visits Hobbs in a hospital, where he learns that Shaw is a rogue special forces assassin seeking to avenge his brother. Dom then travels to Tokyo to claim Han's body, and meets and races Sean Boswell, a friend of Han's who gives him personal items found at Han's crash site.\
Back at Han's funeral in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Los_Angeles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Los Angeles}}, Dom notices a car observing them, and after a chase, confronts its driver, who is revealed to be Shaw. Both prepare to fight, but Shaw flees when a covert ops team arrives and opens fire, led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_The_Fast_and_the_Furious_characters#Mr._Nobody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mr. Nobody}}. Nobody says that he will assist Dom in stopping Shaw if he helps him obtain God's Eye, a computer program that uses digital devices to track down a person, and save its creator, a hacker named Ramsey, from a mercenary named Mose Jakande. Dom, Brian, Letty, Roman Pearce, and Tej Parker then\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Airdrop"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 airdrop}}\'a0their cars over the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caucasus_Mountains"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caucasus Mountains}}\'a0in Azerbaijan, ambush Jakande's convoy, and rescue Ramsey. The team then heads to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abu_Dhabi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abu Dhabi}}, where a billionaire has acquired the flash drive containing God's Eye, and manages to steal it from the owner. With God's Eye near\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Repeater"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telecommunications repeaters}}, the team tracks down Shaw, who is waiting at a remote factory. Dom, Brian, Nobody and his team attempt to capture Shaw, but are ambushed by Jakande and his men and forced to flee while Jakande obtains God's Eye. At his own request, the injured Nobody is left behind to be evacuated by helicopter while Brian and Dom continue without him. To reduce their disadvantage, the crew returns to Los Angeles to fight Shaw, Jakande and his men. Meanwhile, Brian promises Mia that once they deal with Shaw, he will retire and fully dedicate himself to their family.\
While Jakande pursues Brian and the rest of the team with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stealth_helicopter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stealth helicopter}}\'a0and an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unmanned_combat_aerial_vehicle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 aerial drone}}, Ramsey attempts to hack into God's Eye. Hobbs, seeing the team in trouble, leaves the hospital and destroys the drone with an ambulance. Brian engages Jakande's henchman Kiet and throws him down an elevator shaft before hijacking a signal repeater tower, allowing Ramsey to regain control of God's Eye and shut it down. Dom and Shaw engage in a one-on-one brawl on top of a public parking garage, before Jakande intervenes and attacks them both. Shaw is defeated when part of the parking garage collapses beneath him. Dom then launches his vehicle at Jakande's helicopter, tossing Shaw's bag of grenades onto its skids, before injuring himself when his car lands and crashes. Hobbs then shoots the bag of grenades from ground level, destroying the helicopter and killing Jakande. Dom is pulled from the wreckage of his car, believed to be dead. As Letty cradles Dom's body in her arms, she reveals that she has regained her memories, and that she remembers their wedding. Dom regains consciousness soon after, remarking, "It's about time".\
Shaw is taken into custody by Hobbs and locked away in a secret, high-security prison. At a beach, Brian and Mia play with their son while Dom, Letty, Roman, Tej, and Ramsey observe, acknowledging that Brian is better off retired with his family. Dom silently leaves, Ramsey asks if he's gonna say goodbye. Dom says, "It's never goodbye." He drives away, but Brian catches up with him at a crossroad. As Dom remembers the times that he had with Brian, they bid each other farewell and drive off\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Missing_man_formation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 in separate directions}}.\
In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eastern_Europe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eastern European}}\'a0country of Sokovia, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bruce Banner}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Natasha_Romanoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clint_Barton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}\'97raid a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}\'a0facility commanded by Baron\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wolfgang_von_Strucker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wolfgang von Strucker}}, who has been experimenting on humans using the scepter previously wielded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}. They encounter two of Strucker's test subjects\'97twins\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pietro_Maximoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pietro Maximoff}}, who has superhuman speed, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}, who has telepathic and telekinetic abilities\'97and apprehend Strucker, while Stark retrieves Loki's scepter.\
Stark and Banner discover an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_intelligence_in_fiction#Sentient_AI"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artificial intelligence}}\'a0within the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scepter's gem}}, and secretly decide to use it to complete Stark's "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ultron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ultron}}" global defense program. The unexpectedly sentient Ultron, believing he must eradicate humanity to save Earth, eliminates Stark's A.I.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J.A.R.V.I.S."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.A.R.V.I.S.}}\'a0and attacks the Avengers at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 their headquarters}}. Escaping with the scepter, Ultron uses the resources in Strucker's Sokovia base to upgrade his rudimentary body and build an army of robot drones. Having killed Strucker, he recruits the Maximoffs, who hold Stark responsible for their parents' deaths by his company's weapons, and goes to the base of arms dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klaw_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ulysses Klaue}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Johannesburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Johannesburg}}\'a0to obtain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakandan}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vibranium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vibranium}}. The Avengers attack Ultron and the Maximoffs, but Wanda subdues them with haunting visions, causing the Hulk (Banner) to rampage until Stark stops him with his anti-Hulk armor.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
A worldwide backlash over the resulting destruction, and the fears Wanda's hallucinations incited, send the team into hiding at a safe house. Thor departs to consult with Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0on the apocalyptic future he saw in his hallucination, while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}\'a0arrives and encourages the team to form a plan to stop Ultron. In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Seoul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Seoul}}, Ultron uses Loki's scepter to enslave the team's friend Dr. Helen Cho. They use her synthetic-tissue technology, vibranium, and the scepter's gem to craft a new body. As Ultron uploads himself into the body, Wanda is able to read his mind; discovering his plan for human extinction, the Maximoffs turn against Ultron. Rogers, Romanoff, and Barton find Ultron and retrieve the synthetic body, but Ultron captures Romanoff.\
The Avengers fight amongst themselves when Stark secretly uploads J.A.R.V.I.S.\'97who is still operational after hiding from Ultron inside the Internet\'97into the synthetic body. Thor returns to help activate the body, explaining that the gem on its brow\'97one of the six\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Stones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}, the most powerful objects in existence\'97was part of his vision. This "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}" and the Maximoffs accompany the Avengers to Sokovia, where Ultron has used the remaining vibranium to build a machine to lift a large part of the capital city skyward, intending to crash it into the ground to cause global extinction. Banner rescues Romanoff, who awakens the Hulk for the battle. The Avengers fight Ultron's army while Fury arrives in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarrier}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0agents to evacuate civilians. Pietro dies when he shields Barton from gunfire, and a vengeful Wanda abandons her post to destroy Ultron's primary body, which allows one of his drones to activate the machine. The city plummets, but Stark and Thor overload the machine and shatter the landmass. In the aftermath, the Hulk, unwilling to endanger Romanoff by being with her, departs in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_Quinjet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quinjet}}, while the Vision confronts and seemingly destroys Ultron's last remaining body.\
Later, with the Avengers having established a new base run by Fury, Hill, Cho, and Selvig, Thor returns to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}\'a0to learn more about the forces he suspects have manipulated recent events. As Stark leaves and Barton retires, Rogers and Romanoff prepare to train new Avengers: Rhodes, the Vision,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}, and Wanda.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}, dissatisfied by the failures of his pawns, dons a gauntlet
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and vows to retrieve the Infinity Stones himself.\
Thousands of years ago, five African tribes war over a meteorite containing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vibranium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vibranium}}. One warrior ingests a "heart-shaped herb" affected by the metal and gains superhuman abilities, becoming the first "Black Panther". He unites all but the Jabari Tribe to form the nation of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakanda}}. Over centuries, the Wakandans use the vibranium to develop advanced technology and isolate themselves from the world by posing as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Third_World"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Third World}}country. In 1992, Wakanda's King\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Chaka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Chaka}}\'a0visits his brother N'Jobu, who is working undercover in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oakland,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Oakland, California}}. T'Chaka accuses N'Jobu of assisting black-market arms dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klaw_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ulysses Klaue}}\'a0with stealing vibranium from Wakanda. N'Jobu's partner reveals he is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zuri}}, another undercover Wakandan, and confirms T'Chaka's suspicions.\
In the present day, following T'Chaka's death,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0his son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Challa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}\'a0returns to Wakanda to assume the throne. He and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Okoye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Okoye}}, the leader of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dora_Milaje"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dora Milaje}}\'a0regiment, extract T'Challa's ex-lover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Malice_(Nakia)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nakia}}\'a0from an undercover assignment so she can attend his coronation ceremony with his mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ramonda_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ramonda}}\'a0and younger sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shuri}}. At the ceremony, the Jabari Tribe's leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Man-Ape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M'Baku}}\'a0challenges T'Challa for the crown in ritual combat. T'Challa defeats M'Baku and persuades him to yield rather than die.\
When Klaue and his accomplice\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Killmonger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Stevens}}\'a0steal a Wakandan artifact from a London museum, T'Challa's friend and Okoye's lover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/W%27Kabi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 W'Kabi}}\'a0urges him to bring Klaue back alive. T'Challa, Okoye, and Nakia travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Busan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Busan, South Korea}}, where Klaue plans to sell the artifact to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CIA}}\'a0agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Everett_K._Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Everett K. Ross}}. A firefight erupts and Klaue attempts to flee but is caught by T'Challa, who reluctantly releases him to Ross' custody. Klaue tells Ross that Wakanda's international image is a front for a technologically advanced civilization. Erik attacks and extracts Klaue as Ross is gravely injured protecting Nakia. Rather than pursue Klaue, T'Challa takes Ross to Wakanda, where their technology can save him.\
While Shuri heals Ross, T'Challa confronts Zuri about N'Jobu. Zuri explains that N'Jobu planned to share Wakanda's technology with people of African descent around the world to help them conquer their oppressors. As T'Chaka arrested N'Jobu, the latter attacked Zuri and forced T'Chaka to kill him. T'Chaka ordered Zuri to lie that N'Jobu had disappeared and left behind N'Jobu's American son in order to maintain the lie. This boy grew up to be Stevens, a U.S.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_ops"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black ops}}\'a0soldier who adopted the name "Killmonger". Meanwhile, Killmonger kills Klaue and takes his body to Wakanda. He is brought before the tribal elders, revealing his identity to be N'Jadaka and claim to the throne. Killmonger challenges T'Challa to ritual combat, where he kills Zuri, defeats T'Challa, and hurls him over a waterfall to his presumed death. Killmonger ingests the heart-shaped herb and orders the rest incinerated, but Nakia extracts one first. Killmonger, supported by W'Kabi and his army, prepares to distribute shipments of Wakandan weapons to operatives around the world.\
Nakia, Shuri, Ramonda, and Ross flee to the Jabari Tribe for aid. They find a comatose T'Challa, rescued by the Jabari in repayment for sparing M'Baku's life. Healed by Nakia's herb, T'Challa returns to fight Killmonger, who dons his own Black Panther suit. W'Kabi and his army fight Shuri, Nakia, and the Dora Milaje, while Ross remotely pilots a jet and shoots down planes carrying the vibranium weapons. M'Baku and the Jabari arrive to reinforce T'Challa. Confronted by Okoye, W'Kabi and his army stand down. Fighting in Wakanda's vibranium mine, T'Challa disrupts Killmonger's suit and stabs him. Killmonger refuses to be healed, choosing to die a free man rather than be incarcerated.\
T'Challa establishes an outreach center at the building where N'Jobu died, to be run by Nakia and Shuri. In a mid-credits scene, T'Challa appears before the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Nations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Nations}}\'a0to reveal Wakanda's true nature to the world. In a post-credits scene, Shuri helps\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0with his recuperation.\
After burying\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dobby_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dobby}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Potter_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Potter}}\'a0asks the goblin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Griphook"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Griphook}}\'a0to help him,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ron_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ron Weasley}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermione_Granger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hermione Granger}}\'a0break into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bellatrix Lestrange}}'s vault at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gringotts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gringotts}}\'a0bank, suspecting a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Horcrux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Horcrux}}\'a0may be there. Griphook agrees in exchange for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sword_of_Gryffindor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sword of Gryffindor}}. Wandmaker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ollivander"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ollivander}}\'a0tells Harry that two wands taken from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Malfoy_Manor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Malfoy Manor}}\'a0belonged to Bellatrix and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Draco_Malfoy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Draco Malfoy}}, though Malfoy's has changed its allegiance to Harry.\
In the vault, Harry discovers the Horcrux is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helga_Hufflepuff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helga Hufflepuff}}'s cup. He retrieves it, but Griphook snatches the sword and abandons the trio, leaving them cornered by security. The three release the dragon guardian and flee on its back. Harry sees a vision of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lord_Voldemort"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lord Voldemort}}\'a0killing goblins including Griphook, and learns Voldemort is aware of the theft. Harry also realises there is a Horcrux at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogwarts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogwarts}}\'a0somehow connected to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rowena_Ravenclaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rowena Ravenclaw}}. The trio\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Apparate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 apparate}}\'a0into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogsmeade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogsmeade}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aberforth Dumbledore}}\'a0reluctantly instructs the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Portrait_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 portrait}}\'a0of his deceased younger sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ariana}}\'a0to fetch\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neville_Longbottom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Neville Longbottom}}, who leads the trio through a secret passageway into Hogwarts.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Severus_Snape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Severus Snape}}\'a0hears of Harry's return and warns staff and students of punishment for aiding Harry. Harry confronts Snape, who flees after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minerva McGonagall}}\'a0challenges him to a duel. McGonagall gathers the Hogwarts community for battle. At\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luna_Lovegood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luna Lovegood}}'s insistence Harry speaks to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helena_Ravenclaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helena Ravenclaw}}'s ghost, who reveals that Voldemort performed "dark magic" on her mother's diadem, located in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Room_of_Requirement"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Room of Requirement}}. In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chamber of Secrets}}, Hermione destroys the Horcrux cup with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Basilisk_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Basilisk}}\'a0fang. In the Room of Requirement, Draco,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blaise_Zabini"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blaise Zabini}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gregory_Goyle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gregory Goyle}}\'a0attack Harry, but Ron and Hermione intervene. Goyle casts a Fiendfyre curse; unable to control it, he is burned to death while Harry and his friends save Malfoy and Zabini. Harry stabs the diadem with the Basilisk fang and Ron kicks it into the Room of Requirement to be destroyed. As Voldemort's army attacks, Harry, seeing into Voldemort's mind, realises that Voldemort's snake\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nagini_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nagini}}\'a0is the final Horcrux. After entering the boathouse, the trio witness Voldemort telling Snape that the Elder Wand cannot serve Voldemort until Snape dies; he then orders Nagini to kill Snape. Before dying, Snape tells Harry to take his memories to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pensieve"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pensieve}}. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fred_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fred Weasley}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Remus_Lupin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Remus Lupin}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nymphadora Tonks}}\'a0are killed in the chaos at Hogwarts.\
Harry learns from Snape's memories that while Snape despised Harry's late father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Potter_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James}}, who bullied him, he loved his late mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lily_Potter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lily}}. Following her death, Snape worked with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Albus Dumbledore}}\'a0to protect Harry from Voldemort due to his love for Lily. Harry also learns that Dumbledore was dying and wished for Snape to kill him, and that the Patronus doe he saw in the woods that led him to the sword was conjured by Snape. Harry discovers that he himself became a Horcrux when Voldemort originally failed to kill him; he must die to destroy the piece of Voldemort's soul within him. Harry surrenders himself to Voldemort in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogwarts#Forbidden_Forest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Forbidden Forest}}. Voldemort casts the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avada_Kedavra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Killing Curse}}\'a0upon Harry, who finds himself in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Limbo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 limbo}}. Dumbledore's spirit meets him and explains that the part of Voldemort within Harry was killed by Voldemort's curse. Harry returns to his body, determined to defeat Voldemort.\
Voldemort announces Harry's apparent death to everyone at Hogwarts and demands their surrender.
