Arthur is chained and presented before Orm, who blames Arthur and the surface for Atlanna's death. He offers Arthur an opportunity to leave forever, but Arthur instead challenges him to a duel in a ring of underwater lava. Orm gains the upper hand and nearly kills Arthur before Mera rescues him. Together, Arthur and Mera journey to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sahara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sahara}}\'a0desert where the trident was forged and unlock a holographic message that leads them to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sicily"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sicily}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Italy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Italy}}, where they retrieve the trident's coordinates. Meanwhile, Orm provides David with a prototype Atlantean battle suit to kill Arthur, imprisons Vulko upon learning of his betrayal, and coerces the remaining kingdoms of Atlantis to pledge their allegiance to him and his campaign against the surface.\
After modifying Orm's technology, a fully armored David rechristens himself as Black Manta and ambushes Arthur and Mera in Sicily, injuring Arthur before being thrown off a cliff to his apparent death. Mera nurses Arthur's wounds as they journey to the trident's whereabouts, and encourages him to embrace his destiny as a hero. Arriving at their destination, Arthur and Mera are attacked by the amphibious monsters called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Trench_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Trench}}, but manage to fend them off and reach a wormhole that transports them to an uncharted sea located at the center of the Earth. There, they are unexpectedly reunited with Atlanna, who was sacrificed to the Trench for her crimes but managed to escape and reach the uncharted sea, where she has been stranded ever since.\
Arthur faces Karathen, a mythical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leviathan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 leviathan}}\'a0and keeper of the trident, and voices his determination to protect both Atlantis and the surface, proving his worth and reclaiming the trident, which grants him control over the seven seas. Orm and his allies lead an army against the crustacean forces of the Kingdom of the Brine with the intent of completing Orm's surface battle preparations. As Orm declares himself Ocean Master, Arthur, and Mera, with the assistance of Karathen and the Trench, intervene and lead an army of marine creatures in a battle against him. Orm's followers renounce their obedience to him and embrace Arthur as the true king upon learning he wields the trident. Arthur defeats Orm in combat but chooses to spare his life and Orm accepts his fate after discovering Arthur has found and rescued Atlanna. Atlanna returns to the surface to reunite with Thomas while Arthur ascends to the throne with Mera by his side.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, David is rescued by Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Shin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Shin}}, a scientist and conspiracy theorist obsessed with the Atlanteans, and agrees to lead Shin there in exchange for his help in his revenge on Arthur.\
Two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hobbit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hobbits}}, Sm\'e9agol and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%C3%A9agol"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 D\'e9agol}}, are fishing when D\'e9agol discovers the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/One_Ring"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 One Ring}}\'a0in the river. Sm\'e9agol is ensnared by the Ring, and kills his friend for it. He retreats into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Misty_Mountains"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Misty Mountains}}\'a0as the Ring twists his body and mind, until he becomes the creature\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gollum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gollum}}.\
Centuries later,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gandalf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gandalf}}\'a0leads\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aragorn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aragorn}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Legolas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Legolas}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gimli_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gimli}}, and King\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Th%C3%A9oden"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Th\'e9oden}}\'a0to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isengard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isengard}}, where they reunite with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Meriadoc_Brandybuck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Merry}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peregrin_Took"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pippin}}. Gandalf retrieves the defeated\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Saruman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Saruman}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palant%C3%ADr"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 palant\'edr}}. Pippin later looks into the seeing-stone, and is telepathically attacked by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sauron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sauron}}. Gandalf deduces that Sauron will attack\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gondor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gondor}}'s capital\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minas_Tirith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minas Tirith}}. He rides there to warn Gondor's steward\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Denethor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Denethor}}, taking Pippin with him.\
Gollum leads\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frodo_Baggins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frodo Baggins}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samwise_Gamgee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samwise Gamgee}}\'a0to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minas_Morgul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minas Morgul}}. The hobbits begin climbing a stair carved in the cliff face that will take them into Mordor via a 'secret way' - unaware that Gollum plans to kill them and take the Ring. Sauron's army strikes and overwhelms\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Osgiliath"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Osgiliath}}, forcing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Faramir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Faramir}}\'a0and his garrison to retreat to Minas Tirith.\
Gollum disposes of the Hobbits' food, blaming Sam. Frodo tells Sam to go home, before Frodo and Gollum continue to the tunnel leading to Mordor, where Gollum tricks him into venturing into the lair of the giant spider\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shelob"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shelob}}. Frodo narrowly escapes and confronts Gollum, telling him that he must destroy the Ring for both their sakes. Gollum attacks Frodo, but falls down a chasm. Frodo continues on, but Shelob discovers, paralyses and binds him. However, Sam arrives and drives her away. Sam hides as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orc"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Orcs}}\'a0appear and take Frodo with them. Sam follows the Orcs into the Tower of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cirith_Ungol"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cirith Ungol}}, and frees Frodo so they can continue their journey.\
Aragorn learns from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elrond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elrond}}\'a0that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arwen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arwen}}\'a0is dying, having refused to leave Middle Earth after seeing a vision of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eldarion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 her son with Aragorn}}. Elrond gives Aragorn\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/And%C3%BAril"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 And\'faril}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isildur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isildur}}'s sword\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Narsil"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Narsil}}\'a0reforged, so he can reclaim his birthright while gaining reinforcements from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dead_Men_of_Dunharrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dead Men of Dunharrow}}. Joined by Legolas and Gimli, Aragorn travels to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paths_of_the_Dead"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paths of the Dead}}, recruiting the Army of the Dead by pledging to release them from the curse Isildur put on them. Faramir is gravely wounded after a futile effort to retake Osgiliath; believing his son to be dead, Denethor falls into madness. Gandalf is left to defend the city against the Orc army, led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gothmog_(Third_Age)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gothmog}}. As Gothmog's army forces its way into the city, Denethor attempts to kill himself and Faramir on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pyre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pyre}}. Pippin alerts Gandalf and they save Faramir, but a burning Denethor leaps to his death from the top of Minas Tirith just before Th\'e9oden and his nephew,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/%C3%89omer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 \'c9omer}}, arrive with the Rohirrim. During the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_the_Pelennor_Fields"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ensuing battle}}, they are overwhelmed by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oliphaunt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Oliphaunt}}-riding\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Haradrim"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Haradrim}}, while the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Witch-king_of_Angmar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Witch-king of Angmar}}\'a0mortally wounds Th\'e9oden. Though Th\'e9oden's niece\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/%C3%89owyn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 \'c9owyn}}\'a0destroys the Witch-King with Merry's help, Th\'e9oden dies of his wounds. Aragorn arrives with the Army of the Dead, who overcome the Orcs and win the battle; Aragorn then frees them from the curse. Aragorn decides to lead his army upon the Black Gate as a distraction, so Frodo and Sam can get to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mount_Doom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mount Doom}}.\
Aragorn's army\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_the_Morannon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 draw out Sauron's forces}}\'a0and empties Mordor, allowing Frodo and Sam to reach the volcano, but Gollum attacks them just as they reach Mount Doom. Frodo succumbs to the Ring and claims it as his own. Gollum attacks Frodo and bites his finger off to reclaim the Ring. Frodo fights back and knocks Gollum, who is holding the Ring, into the volcano, destroying the Ring and killing Gollum. As Frodo and Sam escape, Sauron is destroyed and Mordor crumbles. Gandalf flies in with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eagle_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 eagles}}\'a0to rescue the Hobbits, who awaken later in Minas Tirith and are reunited with the surviving Fellowship members. Aragorn is crowned King of Gondor and takes Arwen as his queen. The Hobbits return home to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shire_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shire}}, where Sam marries\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rosie_Cotton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rosie Cotton}}. A few years later, Frodo departs Middle Earth for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Undying_Lands"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Undying Lands}}\'a0with his uncle\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bilbo_Baggins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bilbo}}, Gandalf, and the Elves. He leaves Sam the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Book_of_Westmarch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Book of Westmarch}}, which details their adventures. Sam then returns to the Shire, where he embraces Rosie and their children.\
In Istanbul,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Secret_Intelligence_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MI6}}\'a0agents\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Bond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Bond}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miss_Moneypenny"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eve Moneypenny}}\'a0pursue mercenary\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_henchmen_of_James_Bond_villains#Skyfall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Patrice}}, who has stolen a hard drive containing details of undercover agents. As Bond and Patrice fight atop a moving train,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M}}\'a0orders Moneypenny to shoot Patrice; Moneypenny inadvertently hits Bond, who falls into a river. Bond is presumed dead and Patrice escapes with the hard drive.\
Three months later, M is pressured by Gareth Mallory, the chairman of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joint_Intelligence_Committee_(United_Kingdom)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joint Intelligence Committee (United Kingdom)}}\'a0and a former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Special_Air_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SAS}}\'a0officer, to retire. MI6's servers are hacked and M receives a taunting computer message moments before the MI6 building explodes. Bond, who used his presumed death to retire, learns of the attack and returns to London. Although he fails a series of physical, medical and psychological examinations, M approves his return to the field, ordering him to identify Patrice's employer, recover the stolen hard drive, and kill Patrice. He meets\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Q_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Q}}, MI6's new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quartermaster"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quartermaster}}, who gives him a radio beacon and a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Walther_PPK"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Walther PPK}}\'a0pistol.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghai"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shanghai}}, Bond follows Patrice into a skyscraper but is unable to prevent him from killing a target. The two fight, but Patrice falls to his death before Bond can learn his employer's identity. Bond finds a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Casino_token"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 casino token}}\'a0that Patrice intended to cash in for the assassination, which leads him to a casino in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Macau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Macau}}. There, Bond is approached by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S%C3%A9v%C3%A9rine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S\'e9v\'e9rine}}, Patrice's accomplice, and asks to meet her employer. She warns him that he is about to be killed by her bodyguards, but promises to help Bond if he will kill her employer. Bond thwarts the attack and joins S\'e9v\'e9rine on her yacht, the\'a0
\f1\i Chimera
\f0\i0 . They travel to an abandoned island off the coast of Macau where they are taken prisoner by the crew and delivered to S\'e9v\'e9rine's employer,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raoul_Silva"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raoul Silva}}. Silva, once an MI6 agent, has now turned to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cyberterrorism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cyberterrorism}}\'a0and orchestrated the attack on MI6. Silva kills S\'e9v\'e9rine, but Bond captures Silva for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rendition_(law)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rendition}}\'a0to Britain.\
At MI6's new underground headquarters, Q attempts to decrypt Silva's laptop, but inadvertently gives it access to the MI6 servers, which allows Silva to escape. Bond deduces that Silva, who has disguised himself as a police officer, wanted to be captured as part of a plan to kill M, whom he resents for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Burn_notice_(document)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 disavowing}}\'a0and betraying him to the Chinese government. Bond gives chase through the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London_Underground"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London Underground}}\'a0and, despite a train crash, reaches a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Public_inquiry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 public inquiry}}\'a0into M's handling of the stolen hard drive, repels Silva's attack on it, and extracts M by car.\
Instructing Q and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bill_Tanner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bill Tanner}}\'a0to leave an electronic trail for Silva to follow, Bond takes M to Skyfall, the Bond family estate in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scottish_Highlands"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scottish Highlands}}. They meet Skyfall's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamekeeper"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gamekeeper}}\'a0Kincade, and together the trio set up a series of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Booby_trap"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 booby traps}}\'a0throughout the house. When Silva's men arrive, Bond, M, and Kincade manage to kill most of them, but M is wounded. Silva himself arrives by helicopter with more men and heavy weapons, so Bond sends M and Kincade through a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Priest_hole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 priest hole}}\'a0to a nearby chapel. As the house is destroyed Bond escapes down the same tunnel and heads toward the chapel.\
Silva survives the destruction of the house and follows Kincade and M to the chapel. He forces his gun into M's hand and presses his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Temple_(anatomy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 temple}}\'a0to hers, begging her to kill them both. Bond arrives and kills Silva by throwing a knife into his back, but M succumbs to her wounds and dies in Bond's arms. Following M's funeral, Moneypenny formally introduces herself to Bond and tells him she is retiring from field work to become secretary for the newly appointed M, who Bond finds to be Mallory.\
Sixty-five million years ago, an alien race known as the \'93Creators\'94 used devices called Seeds to terraform Planet Earth, covering it with an alloy called Transformium. In the present day,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Geologist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 geologist}}\'a0Darcy Tyril excavates the Transformium for K.S.I. Industries, which uses it to build man-made Transformer drones.\
Five years after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers:_Dark_of_the_Moon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Battle of Chicago}}, humans have begun to view the Transformers as a threat, leading the U.S. government to terminate all human-Autobot joint programs. Although the public believes the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Autobots"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Autobots}}\'a0have been granted sanctuary, they are being hunted by a rogue\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CIA"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CIA}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_ops"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black ops}}\'a0division known as Cemetery Wind, led by opportunistic government official Harold Attinger, who believes all Transformers should be exterminated regardless of their faction. They are aided by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lockdown_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lockdown}}, a Cybertronian\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bounty_hunter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bounty hunter}}\'a0working for the Creators, promising to give Attinger a Seed if his division manages to capture\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Optimus_Prime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Optimus Prime}}. Cemetery Wind locates\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ratchet_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ratchet}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mexico_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mexico City}}\'a0and Lockdown kills him when he refuses to give up the whereabouts of Optimus Prime.\
Optimus, damaged in Mexico City and disguised as a rundown semi-truck, is discovered in an abandoned theater by Cade Yeager, a financially struggling Texan inventor, and brings him back to his farm. While his teenage daughter Tessa and business partner Lucas Flannery encourage him to turn Optimus over to the authorities after realizing what he really is, Cade instead fixes Optimus, hoping to understand his technology and unexpectedly revives him. Still skeptical of Optimus, Lucas calls Cemetery Wind, who attacks and destroys the farm, but Optimus and Tessa's boyfriend, Irish\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rally_car"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rally car}}\'a0driver Shane Dyson, come to the family's aid. While on the run from Cemetery Wind and Lockdown, Lucas is killed by one of Lockdown's grenades. Escaping into the desert, they take refuge in an abandoned gas station. Later, Optimus scans a passing truck and turns into a Western Star 5700 Phantom Custom truck with the original red and blue paint with flames, and summons the surviving Autobots \'96\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bumblebee_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bumblebee}}, who has assumed an alternate form,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hound_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hound}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drift_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drift}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crosshairs_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Crosshairs}}\'a0\'96 who have come to distrust humans due to Cemetery Wind constantly hunting them down. Using a CIA drone which he stole during the home invasion, Cade discovers K.S.I.'s involvement in the attacks on the Autobots. Optimus vows to personally kill Attinger for his actions against his brethren.\
Infiltrating K.S.I.'s headquarters in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chicago"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chicago}}, Cade discovers the remains of Autobots and Decepticons are being melted down to make the drones. Joshua Joyce, the ambitious company CEO, is in league with Attinger to revolutionize global defenses and improve human society using the Seed. He has captured Brains and used him and data from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Megatron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Megatron}}'s head to create the drones and prototype Transformer soldiers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galvatron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galvatron}}\'a0and Stinger. In a fit of rage, the Autobots storm the building, during which Bumblebee regains his original form by scanning a passing car, where they rescue Brains and destroy the laboratory, but they soon leave after Joshua announces that they are no longer needed. Attinger forces Joshua to deploy Galvatron and Stinger to attack the Autobots. During the battle, Galvatron's behavior becomes slightly erratic when it starts destroying vehicles, and when it fights Optimus it speaks to him. Lockdown then arrives and abducts Optimus while Galvatron and Stinger retreat; Tessa is inadvertently captured alongside Optimus in the midst of the chaos, leaving Cade and Shane devastated.\
While Lockdown's large prison spacecraft hovers over Chicago to hand over the Seed, Cade, Shane, and the Autobots use the opportunity to sneak on board and rescue Optimus and Tessa, hijacking a smaller ship containing a group of Autobots called the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dinobots"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dinobots}}, just before Lockdown leaves Earth. The Autobots reveal to Cade that "Galvatron" is in fact Megatron, who gave K.S.I. the data to build the Transformer drones so he could transfer his consciousness into the Galvatron drone, after they had unknowingly revived him. What's more, Galvatron is plotting to use the Seed and the K.S.I. drones to conquer the world by detonating the Seed in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}, as K.S.I. has brought it there to use it in the remote Mongolian desert to create vast amounts of usable Transformium. Cade informs Joshua of Megatron's presence, causing him to have a change of heart and agreeing to hand over the Seed with help from Darcy and his Chinese business associate Su Yueming. Meanwhile, Lockdown discovers Optimus' escape with the Dinobots, and returns to Earth to retrieve them. Optimus decides for the Autobots to no longer help the humans because of how they revived Megatron, but Cade explains to Optimus why he shouldn't lose faith in them. At the K.S.I. facility, during a disagreement between Joshua and Attinger over the Seed, Galvatron reactivates himself and promptly takes control of the K.S.I. drones, and a battle follows in Hong Kong's streets between Cade's group, the Autobots, Cemetery Wind, Galvatron, and his drones. During the fight, Optimus gains the alliance of the Dinobots, who become essential to the Autobots' victory while Bumblebee kills Stinger.\
Lockdown returns to capture Optimus and the Dinobots, using a large\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magnet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 magnet}}\'a0in his ship that picks up and drops metal objects, causing destruction to the city. After disabling the magnet, Optimus fights Lockdown at an abandoned factory. In the ensuing duel, Optimus kills Attinger (who still angrily deems all Cybertronians aside from Lockdown as a threat) to save Cade, and avenging the deaths of his fellow Autobots, but this allows Lockdown to pin Optimus down by impaling his chest with his own sword. Cade, Bumblebee, Tessa, and Shane fight Lockdown, with Cade ending up fighting him one-on-one while Tessa and Shane use a tow truck to free Optimus, who kills Lockdown by cutting him in half before using one of his grenades to finish off the remaining drones. Galvatron retreats, vowing to return.\
As Lockdown's ship leaves Earth, Optimus tells the Autobots to protect the Yeagers (with Joshua offering to help the Yeagers build a new home) and lets the Dinobots go, before flying away into space with the Seed to hide it away, sending a message to the Creators that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers:_The_Last_Knight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 he is coming for them}}.\
Eight years after the death of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/District_Attorney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 District Attorney}}\'a0Harvey Dent,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman}}\'a0has disappeared and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Organized_crime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 organized crime}}\'a0has been eradicated in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gotham_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gotham City}}\'a0thanks to the Dent Act giving expanded powers to the police. Commissioner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Gordon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Gordon}}\'a0has kept secret Dent's murderous rampage and allowed blame for his crimes to fall on Batman. He writes a resignation speech revealing the truth, but decides that the city is not yet ready to hear it.\
Bruce Wayne has become a recluse, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wayne_Enterprises"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wayne Enterprises}}\'a0is losing money after Wayne discontinued his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fusion_power"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fusion reactor}}\'a0project when he learned that it could be weaponized. Cat burglar\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Catwoman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Selina Kyle}}\'a0obtains Wayne's fingerprints from his home and tries to sell the fingerprints to Wayne's corporate rival John Daggett. She is double-crossed at the exchange, but alerts the police. Gordon and the police arrive and pursue Daggett's henchmen into the sewers while Selina flees. The men capture Gordon and take him to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bane_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bane}}, a mysterious masked figure and former member of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/League_of_Shadows"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 League of Shadows}}, who has set up his base in the sewers. Gordon escapes and is found by rookie officer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robin_in_other_media#The_Dark_Knight_Rises"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Blake}}. Blake, a fellow orphan, confronts Bruce and convinces him to return as Batman.\
Bane attacks the Gotham Stock Exchange by using Wayne's fingerprints in a series of transactions that leaves Wayne bankrupt. Wayne's butler,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alfred Pennyworth}}, reveals that Rachel Dawes had intended to marry Dent before she died, and resigns in an attempt to save Bruce from death at the hands of Bane. Wayne finds comfort in new Wayne Enterprises CEO Miranda Tate.\
Kyle agrees to take Batman to Bane but instead leads him into Bane's trap. Bane reveals that he intends to fulfill\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ra%27s_al_Ghul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ra's al Ghul's}}\'a0mission to destroy Gotham, and then steals Batman's technology from Wayne Enterprises. Bane fights Batman and cripples him, before taking him abroad to an underground prison. There, the inmates tell Wayne the story of Ra's al Ghul's child, who was born and raised in the prison before finally escaping \'97 the only prisoner to have done so.\
Bane lures Gotham's police into the underground sewer network and uses explosives to trap them, and destroy the bridges surrounding the city. He kills Mayor Anthony Garcia and forces a nuclear physicist to convert the reactor core into a decaying\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neutron_bomb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 neutron bomb}}\'a0before killing him as well. Bane reads Gordon's speech to the public, and releases the prisoners of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blackgate_Penitentiary"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blackgate Penitentiary}}, initiating chaos while holding the city hostage and isolated with the bomb.\
Months later, a recovered Wayne escapes from the prison and returns to Gotham. Batman frees the trapped police and they clash with Bane's army in the streets; during the battle, Batman overpowers Bane. Tate intervenes and stabs Batman, revealing herself to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Talia_al_Ghul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Talia al Ghul}}, Ra's al Ghul's daughter. She activates the bomb's detonator, but Gordon blocks her signal. Talia leaves to find the bomb while Bane prepares to kill Batman, but Kyle arrives and kills Bane. Batman and Kyle pursue Talia, hoping to bring the bomb back to the reactor chamber where it can be stabilized. Talia's truck crashes, but she remotely floods and destroys the reactor chamber before dying. With no way to stop the detonation, Batman uses the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batplane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batplane}}\'a0to haul the bomb far over the bay, where it safely explodes. Before takeoff, Batman reveals his identity to Gordon.\
In the aftermath, Batman is presumed dead and is honored as a hero. With Wayne presumed dead as well,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wayne_Manor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wayne Manor}}\'a0becomes an orphanage and his remaining estate is left to Alfred. Gordon finds the previously destroyed Bat Signal repaired, while Lucius Fox discovers that Wayne had fixed the previously malfunctioning auto-pilot on the Bat. While visiting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Florence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Florence}}, Alfred discovers that Wayne is alive, and in a relationship with Kyle. Blake resigns from the police force and a parcel left to him in Wayne's will (under his real first name,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robin}}) leads him to find the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batcave"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batcave}}.\
17-year-old Andy is headed to college, and his toys have not been played with for years. Most of his toys are gone except for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sheriff_Woody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Woody}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buzz_Lightyear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buzz Lightyear}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jessie_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jessie}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bullseye_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bullseye}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rex_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rex}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Slinky_Dog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Slinky}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hamm_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hamm}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mr._Potato_Head_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mr.}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mrs._Potato_Head_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mrs. Potato Head}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Squeeze_Toy_Aliens"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aliens}}, and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sarge_and_the_Bucket_O_Soldiers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 army men}}. He intends to take Woody with him and puts the other toys in a trash bag to be stored in the attic, except for the army men, who leave. Andy's mother mistakenly throws the bag out. The toys escape and climb into her car, into the donation box with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Molly_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Molly}}'s old\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Barbie_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Barbie}}\'a0doll, bound for Sunnyside Daycare. Woody follows but is unable to convince them Andy meant to keep them before Andy's mother donates them.\
Andy's toys are welcomed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lots-O%27-Huggin%27_Bear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lots-O'-Huggin' Bear}}\'a0("Lotso") and the other toys at Sunnyside. Except Woody, Andy's toys are delighted to learn that Sunnyside never runs out of children to play with, and Barbie is enamored of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ken_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ken}}. Woody attempts to return home, but is found by Sunnyside student Bonnie, who brings him home and plays with him and her other toys, which are well-treated. Bonnie's toy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chuckles_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chuckles}}\'a0explains that he, Lotso, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Big_Baby_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Big Baby}}\'a0once had a beloved owner named Daisy, but were lost during a family trip. They made it home, where Lotso found he had been replaced. Lotso's personality changed; he lied to Big Baby, saying Daisy had replaced all of them. When they found Sunnyside, Lotso took over it, turning it into a toy prison, and Chuckles only escaped because Bonnie took him home for repair.\
At Sunnyside, Andy's toys are horrified at the toddlers' rough play. Buzz asks Lotso to move the toys to the older children's room, but Lotso turns on Buzz and restores him to original factory setting, erasing his memory. Mrs. Potato Head, through an eye she lost in Andy's room, sees Andy searching for them. They realize Woody was telling the truth and try to leave. Andy's toys are imprisoned by Lotso's henchmen who rely on "new recruits" to save themselves from the preschoolers' abuse.\
Woody returns to Sunnyside and learns from a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chatter_Telephone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chatter Telephone}}\'a0that the only way out is through the trash. Andy's toys accidentally reset Buzz to Spanish mode instead of his old persona. Spanish Buzz promptly allies himself with Woody and falls in love with Jessie. The toys reach a dumpster, but are cornered by Lotso's gang. As a garbage truck approaches, Woody reveals Lotso's deception to Big Baby, who throws Lotso into the dumpster. As the toys try to leave, Lotso's henchmen retreat and Lotso drags Woody into the dumpster as the truck collects the trash. The rest of the toys fall into the truck while trying to rescue him, except Barbie, Ken and Big Baby. A falling television lands on Buzz, restoring his memory and personality. The truck brings the toys to a landfill, where the Aliens are swept away by spotting an industrial claw and the other toys are deposited on a conveyor belt that leads to an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Incineration"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 incinerator}}. Woody and Buzz help Lotso reach an emergency stop button, only for Lotso to abandon them and escape. The toys resign themselves to their fate and prepare to die, but are rescued by the Aliens operating the claw. Lotso is found by a garbage truck driver, who ties him to his truck's radiator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grille_(motor_vehicle)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 grille}}\'a0and drives away. Woody and the other toys board another garbage truck back to Andy's house.\
Woody leaves a note for Andy, who, thinking the note is from his mother, donates the toys to Bonnie. To Andy's surprise, Woody is at the bottom of the donation box and Bonnie recognizes him. Though hesitant at first, Andy passes Woody on to Bonnie, and they play together before he leaves. Woody and the other toys witness Andy's departure as they begin their new lives with Bonnie.\
In the credits scene, Barbie, Ken, and Big Baby have made vast improvements to Sunnyside and maintain contact with the other toys through letters. After parachuting in, the army men are welcomed to Sunnyside.\
The wedding of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Will_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Will Turner}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elizabeth_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elizabeth Swann}}\'a0is halted when Lord\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cutler_Beckett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cutler Beckett}}, chairman of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/East_India_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 East India Trading Company}}, arrives with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arrest_warrant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 arrest warrants}}\'a0for them, and also for Commodore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Norrington"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Norrington}}, who allowed Captain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Sparrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jack Sparrow}}\'a0to escape. Norrington has resigned and disappeared after losing the Navy's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flagship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flagship}}, HMS\'a0
\f1\i Dauntless
\f0\i0 , in a hurricane while pursuing Jack. Meanwhile, Jack is visited by Will's father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bootstrap_Bill_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bootstrap Bill Turner}}, aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Pearl"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Pearl}}. Bootstrap is now a crewman on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flying_Dutchman_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Flying Dutchman}}, captained by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones}}. Jack previously bartered a deal with Jones to raise the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0from the depths; now Jack must join Jones' crew or be dragged to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Davy_Jones'_Locker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones' Locker}}\'a0by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kraken_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kraken}}. Beckett, meanwhile, promises to free Elizabeth if Will brings him Jack's magic compass which points to whatever the holder wants most.\
Will finds Jack and the crew on an island and frees them from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cannibalism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cannibals}}. Shortly after,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_characters#Governor_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Governor Swann}}\'a0frees Elizabeth from jail, but he is then captured. Elizabeth bargains with Beckett to find the compass. Disguised as a cabin boy aboard a Scottish merchant vessel, she makes her way to Tortuga where she later finds Jack and also a drunken Norrington. After escaping the cannibals, Jack and the crew visit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/voodoo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 voodoo}}\'a0priestess\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tia_Dalma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tia Dalma}}, who reveals Jones' weakness is his heart, which is locked within the Dead Man's Chest. Jack must find it and the key that opens it. Locating the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , Will makes a deal with Jack to find the key to the chest in return for Jack's compass. Jack tricks Will, who is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghaiing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shanghaied}}\'a0into service aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 . Jones agrees to release Jack from their bargain in exchange for one hundred souls. Will meets his father aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0and learns that Jones possesses the key to the chest. They play a game of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Liar%27s_Dice"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Liar's Dice}}\'a0against Jones to try and win the key, but they lose. Despite this, Will escapes with the key and is taken aboard the same ship Elizabeth was on. Jones sends the Kraken after him, sinking the ship, but Will escapes.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Tortuga"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tortuga}}, Jack hires a new crew, including Elizabeth and Norrington. With Elizabeth's use of Jack's compass, they are able to locate the chest. All parties arrive on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Isla_Cruces"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Cruces}}, where the chest is buried, but a three-way sword fight breaks out between Jack, Will, and Norrington, who all want the heart for their respective goals: Jack wants to call off the Kraken; Will wants to rescue his father; and Norrington wants to regain his life as a Navy officer. In the chaos, Norrington secretly steals the heart and runs off, pretending to lure away the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 's crew. Jones attacks the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0with the Kraken, which kills most of the crew and destroys all but one of the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 's lifeboats, but Jack, who briefly flees the battle, returns and wounds the Kraken with a net full of gunpowder and rum.\
Jack orders the survivors to abandon ship, but Elizabeth, realizing the Kraken only wants Jack, tricks him and chains him to the mast so that the crew can escape. The Kraken drags Jack and the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0to Davy Jones' Locker. Jones opens the chest to discover his heart is gone. In Port Royal, Norrington gives Beckett the heart and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Letters_of_Marque"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Letters of Marque}}\'a0meant for Jack, allowing him back into the navy as well as allowing Beckett to gain control of Davy Jones and the seas. The\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 's crew take shelter with Tia Dalma, where they all agree to rescue Jack. Tia Dalma introduces the captain who will guide them: the resurrected\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hector_Barbossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hector Barbossa}}.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the cannibalistic tribe now worships the prison dog in replacement of Jack.\
Research scientist Galen Erso and his family are in hiding on the planet Lah'mu when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Imperial}}\'a0weapons developer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orson_Krennic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Orson Krennic}}\'a0arrives to press him into completing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}, a moon-sized\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space station}}\'a0with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Superweapon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 superweapon}}\'a0capable of destroying entire planets. Galen's wife, Lyra, attempts to confront Krennic, but she is shot dead by Krennic's Death Troopers while their daughter,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jyn_Erso"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jyn}}, escapes and is rescued by rebel extremist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Saw_Gerrera"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Saw Gerrera}}.\
Fifteen years later, cargo pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bodhi_Rook"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bodhi Rook}}\'a0defects from the Empire, taking a holographic message recorded by Galen to Gerrera on the desert moon of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedha"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedha}}. After learning about the Death Star from an agent at the Ring of Kafrene trading outpost,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}\'a0intelligence officer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cassian_Andor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cassian Andor}}\'a0frees Jyn from an Imperial transport at Wobani before bringing her to the Rebel leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mon_Mothma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mon Mothma}}, who convinces her to find and rescue Galen so the Alliance can learn more about the Death Star. Cassian is covertly ordered to kill Galen rather than extract him.\
Jyn, Cassian, and reprogrammed Imperial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 droid}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/K-2SO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 K-2SO}}\'a0travel to the moon of Jedha, where the Empire is removing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kyber_crystal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 kyber crystals}}\'a0from the holy city to power the Death Star. However, Gerrera and his partisans engage in a guerrilla battle against one convoy transporting kyber crystals, and then steal the load as Imperial reinforcements arrive. With the aid of blind spiritual warrior\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chirrut_%C3%8Emwe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chirrut \'cemwe}}\'a0and his mercenary friend\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baze_Malbus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baze Malbus}}, Jyn makes contact with Gerrera, who has been holding Rook captive. Gerrera shows her the message, in which Galen reveals he has secretly built a vulnerability into the Death Star and directs them to retrieve the schematics from an Imperial data bank on the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarif"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scarif}}.\
On the Death Star, which has entered orbit above the moon of Jedha, Krennic orders a low-powered test shot which destroys Jedha's capital. Jyn and her group take Rook and flee the moon, but Gerrera remains to die with the city.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grand_Moff_Tarkin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grand Moff Willhuff Tarkin}}\'a0congratulates Krennic before using Rook's defection and security leak as a pretext to take control of the project. Rook leads the group to Galen's Imperial research facility on the storm-covered planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eadu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eadu}}, where Cassian chooses not to kill Galen. Jyn makes her presence known moments before Rebel bombers attack the facility. Galen is fatally wounded and dies in his daughter's arms, before she escapes with her group on board a stolen Imperial cargo shuttle. Following the attack, Krennic is summoned by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}\'a0to his palace at Mustafar to answer for the attack on Eadu. Krennic seeks his support for an audience with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Emperor}}, but Vader instead orders him to ensure no further breaches occur.\
Jyn proposes a plan to steal the Death Star schematics using the Rebel fleet, but fails to gain the Alliance Council's approval; many members do not believe the Death Star exists, and those who do feel that victory over the Empire has become impossible. Frustrated at their inaction, Jyn's group leads a small squad of volunteers to raid the data bank themselves. Arriving at Scarif on the stolen Imperial shuttle, which Rook dubs "Rogue One", a disguised Jyn and Cassian enter the base with\'a0K-2SO\'a0while the other rebels attack the resident\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stormtrooper_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Imperial garrison}}\'a0as a diversion. The Rebel fleet learns of the raid from intercepted Imperial communications and deploy in support. K-2SO sacrifices himself so Jyn and Cassian can retrieve the data. \'cemwe is killed after activating the master switch to allow communication with the Rebel fleet, and Malbus dies in battle shortly afterwards. During the battle, Rook is killed by a thermal detonator explosion after informing the Rebel fleet that they must breach the shield surrounding the planet to allow the transmission of the schematics. Jyn and Cassian obtain the schematics, but they are ambushed by Krennic, who is eventually shot and wounded by Cassian. Jyn transmits the schematics to the Rebel command ship. The Death Star enters orbit above Scarif, where Tarkin uses another low-power shot to destroy the compromised base, killing Krennic, Cassian, Jyn, and anyone still alive on the surface.\
The Rebel fleet prepares to jump to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace_(science_fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperspace}}, but many of its ships are intercepted by Vader's flagship. Vader boards the Rebel command ship and attempts to regain the schematics, but a small starship, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tantive_IV"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tantive IV}}, escapes with them. Aboard the fleeing ship,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Leia}}\'a0declares that the plans will provide a new hope for the Rebellion, thus leading to the beginning of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_(film)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the original film}}.\
After a failed attempt to rescue his first mate,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joshamee_Gibbs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joshamee Gibbs}}, in London,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Sparrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Jack Sparrow}}\'a0is brought before\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_II_of_Great_Britain"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King George II}}. The king wants Jack to guide an expedition to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fountain_of_Youth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fountain of Youth}}\'a0before\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ferdinand_VI_of_Spain"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Ferdinand}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spanish_Navy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spanish Navy}}\'a0can locate it. Jack's old nemesis, Captain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hector_Barbossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hector Barbossa}}, now a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Privateer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 privateer}}\'a0in service to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Royal_Navy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British Navy}}\'a0after losing his leg and ship, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Pearl"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Pearl}}, which he says was sunk, is heading the expedition.\
Jack refuses the offer and escapes. He meets up with his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Teague"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Teague}}, who warns Jack about the Fountain's rituals. Jack learns someone is impersonating him to recruit a crew to find the Fountain. The impostor is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Angelica_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Angelica}}, Jack's former lover, and the daughter of the ruthless pirate\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blackbeard_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blackbeard}}, who practices\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Haitian_Vodou"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 voodoo}}\'a0magic and wields the mythical "Sword of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Triton_(mythology)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Triton}}" that controls his ship, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Queen_Anne%27s_Revenge"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Queen Anne's Revenge}}. While Jack is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghaiing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shanghaied}}\'a0aboard Blackbeard's ship, Gibbs escapes execution by memorizing and destroying Jack's map showing the Fountain's location, forcing Barbossa to take him along.\
Meanwhile, after a failed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mutiny"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mutiny}}\'a0aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Queen Anne's Revenge
\f0\i0 , Jack is forced to guide the crew to the Fountain. Blackbeard seeks the Fountain's power to circumvent his predestined fatal encounter with a "one-legged man", who happened to be Barbossa. Jack must find two silver chalices aboard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Juan_Ponce_de_Le%C3%B3n"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Juan Ponce de Le\'f3n}}'s missing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flagship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flagship}}, the\'a0
\f1\i Santiago
\f0\i0 . The Fountain's water must simultaneously be drunk by two people from the chalices. Drinking from one chalice containing a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mermaid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mermaid}}'s tear will extend life; the second person dies, their remaining years of life transferred to the other drinker. Jack also discovers that the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0was captured and shrunk before being added to Blackbeard's collection of other shrunken\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ship_in_a_bottle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ships in bottles}}.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Queen Anne's Revenge
\f0\i0 \'a0heads for Whitecap Bay to find and harvest mermaid tears. After managing to lure in a mermaid named Tamara, she summons other mermaids to attack the crew before Jack causes an explosion that scares them away. A mermaid named Syrena is caught, but Philip Swift, a captive missionary, falls in love with her. Reaching Ponce de Le\'f3n's ship on an uncharted island, Angelica and Blackbeard coerce Jack into retrieving both chalices. Jack locates the grounded, decaying vessel, only to find Barbossa there. Both guess that the Spanish have taken the chalices, after they are nowhere to be found on the vessel.\
Jack and Barbossa team up to sneak into the Spanish camp and steal the chalices. Barbossa reveals he only wants revenge against Blackbeard for attacking the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 , and his leg being amputated. Jack and Barbossa escape with the chalices. Meanwhile, Syrena, reciprocating Philip's love, is tricked into shedding a tear. Blackbeard collects it, leaving her to die of dehydration while Philip is forced to go with them. Jack returns with the chalices and bargains with Blackbeard for Angelica's safety, Jack's confiscated magical compass (which they took from him before sending him to get the chalices), and Gibbs' release. In return, Jack vows to give Blackbeard the chalices and lead him to the Fountain; Blackbeard agrees, and Gibbs is set free with the compass.\
At the Fountain, Blackbeard's crew is confronted by Barbossa and his men and they battle while Barbossa and Blackbeard fight. The Spanish suddenly arrive, intending to destroy the Fountain, believing its power an abomination against God. They crush the chalices and throw them in the swamp. When Barbossa stabs Blackbeard with a poisoned sword, Angelica pulls it out but is cut and poisoned. Jack notices Angelica is poisoned and begins frantically searching the swamp for the chalices. Barbossa obtains Blackbeard's magic sword and gains control of the\'a0
\f1\i Queen Anne's Revenge
\f0\i0 \'a0and her crew. Despite resistance from Blackbeard's crew, the Spanish successfully pull down a pillar, crushing the Fountain of Youth. The Spanish army leaves once the fountain is in ruins. Philip is mortally wounded, but he returns to free Syrena. She helps Jack retrieve the missing chalices and gives them to him, telling him not to waste her tear. Syrena goes back to the dying Philip. She says she can save him if he asks her to. When he asks for her forgiveness, she kisses him and takes him underwater.\
With Blackbeard and Angelica both nearing death, Jack retrieves the last remaining drops of water from the destroyed fountain and puts the tear in one of them. Knowing that one of them must be sacrificed, he wants Angelica to drink from the chalice containing the tear. Instead, Blackbeard drinks it, asking his daughter to save him. Angelica agrees and drinks from the second chalice. Jack is upset to lose Angelica, but reveals that he made a mistake about which chalice contained the tear. Neither of the two are happy, and they both believe Jack deliberately tricked them. Angelica's wounds are healed as the Fountain fatally consumes Blackbeard's body, killing him.\
Eventually, Jack and Angelica admit their love for each other, yet he distrusts her intentions (aware that she may try to avenge her father) and strands her on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cay"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cay}}. Now wielding Blackbeard's magical sword, Barbossa captains the\'a0
\f1\i Queen Anne's Revenge
\f0\i0 \'a0and returns to piracy. Jack finds Gibbs, who had used the compass to locate the\'a0
\f1\i Revenge
\f0\i0 . He reclaims the shrunken\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0and the other conquered ships in bottles, carrying them in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gunny_sack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gunny sack}}. The two leave,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pirates_of_the_Caribbean:_Dead_Men_Tell_No_Tales"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hoping to revert the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0to its original size and continue living the pirates' life}}.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Voodoo_doll"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 voodoo doll}}\'a0of Jack crafted by Blackbeard washes ashore and is found by Angelica, who then smiles.\
Former villain Gru is now an agent for the Anti-Villain League (AVL). He and his partner/new wife Lucy are sent to foil the plans of Balthazar Bratt, a former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Child_actor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 child actor}}\'a0from the 1980s who has turned evil. Gru manages to stop Bratt from stealing the Dumont Diamond, a giant pink diamond, but is unable to capture him. As a result of constantly failing to capture Bratt, Gru and Lucy are\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Termination_of_employment"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fired}}\'a0from the AVL by its unreasonable new director Valerie Da Vinci, following the retirement of the AVL's former director, Silas Ramsbottom.\
When Gru and Lucy return home, Gru and Lucy reluctantly tell their kids, Margo, Edith, and Agnes, of their dismissal, but assure them they will find new jobs. Most of Gru's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minions_(Despicable_Me)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minions}}\'a0leave Gru when he refuses to return to villainy despite losing his job, with Kevin, Stuart, and Bob staying due to not knowing. Meanwhile, Lucy struggles to adapt to her new role as the children's new mom. The next morning, when a butler named Fritz arrives at the Gru house, Gru discovers that he has a twin brother named Dru, who lives in a distant country named Freedonia, who longs to meet him. Shocked to learn he has a twin, Gru confronts his mother, who reveals that when she and her husband\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Divorce"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 divorced}}, they agreed to keep one child each. The family decides to travel to meet Dru, and they are surprised at his immense wealth, the size of the mansion, which Fritz attributes to their pig farm business. Meanwhile, the Minions are arrested for trespassing at a talent show set. Bratt manages to steal the diamond again, intending to use it to power a giant robot and destroy Hollywood as revenge for the cancellation of his show.\
Dru reveals to Gru that their recently deceased father was a legendary supervillain, whose villainous activities are the real source of the family's wealth. As Dru was dismissed by their father as a disgrace, he asks his brother to teach him how to be a villain. When Gru refuses to revert to his old ways, Dru takes him on a joyride around Freedonia in their father's technologically advanced car and the siblings bond. Meanwhile, Lucy tries to balance her new tasks as a mom, which she exhibits after turning away a young boy named Niko who had fallen for Margo in the midst of a traditional cheese festival, while Edith and Agnes stumble into a local tavern and learn from the bartender about a mythical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unicorn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 unicorn}}\'a0which lurks in a nearby forest. Gru tries to convince Agnes that unicorns are imaginary, but decides against it to avoid hurting her feelings. The next day, Agnes and Edith set out into the woods to track the mythical 'unicorn', only to find a one-horned\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Goat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 goat}}\'a0whom Agnes adopts and dubs "Lucky". Meanwhile, the Minions' longing for Gru motivates them to escape from prison and return to their former master.\
Dru convinces Gru to steal the diamond, with Gru secretly intending to bring it to the AVL, which he hopes will convince Da Vinci to rehire him and Lucy. Despite several setbacks, they manage to retrieve the diamond and are rescued by Lucy after narrowly escaping. After finding out Gru's true motives, Dru confronts his brother about his lie. In return, Gru insults him and decides to leave Freedonia, ending their relationship. Bratt, disguised as Lucy, kidnaps the children, and once again acquires the diamond. Gru and Dru resolve their differences and pursue him after finding the real Lucy.\
With his robot powered by the diamond, Bratt terrorizes Hollywood, intending to send it into space with the use of superpowered gum. Lucy saves the children while Gru and Dru weaken Bratt's robot with the weapons of their father's car. Gru is knocked unconscious when the car is destroyed, and Dru manages to destroy the robot's core from the inside when Bratt threatens to kill Gru. When Gru recovers, he battles Bratt in a dance fight, using it as a distraction to grab his weaponized\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Keytar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 keytar}}, and defeats him. Having rendezvoused with Gru, the Minions manage to destroy the gum already covering the city, and Gru and Dru reunite.\
Soon afterward, Gru and Lucy are reinstated in the AVL and the newly united family celebrate in Gru's home. Lucy is acknowledged by the children as their mother. Lured back to villainy, Dru, along with most of the Minions, steals Gru's airship, with Gru's emblem replaced with a "D" graffiti. Gru and Lucy decide to give them a five-minute head-start before engaging pursuit.\
Industrialist John Hammond and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bioengineering}}\'a0company, InGen, have created a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Animal_theme_park"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 theme park}}\'a0featuring cloned dinosaurs and prehistoric plants, called Jurassic Park, on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isla_Nublar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Nublar}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Costa_Rica"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Costa Rican}}\'a0island. After a dinosaur handler is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}, the park's investors, represented by lawyer Donald Gennaro, demand that experts visit the park and certify it is safe. To perform the inspection, Gennaro invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mathematician"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mathematician}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chaos_theory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chaos theorist}}\'a0Ian Malcolm, while Hammond invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleontologist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleontologist}}\'a0Dr. Alan Grant and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleobotanist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleobotanist}}\'a0Dr. Ellie Sattler. Upon arrival, the group is shocked to see a live\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}, in addition to two more with a herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parasaurolophus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Parasaurolophus}}.\
