At the park's visitor center, the group learns the cloning was accomplished by extracting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_DNA"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dinosaur DNA}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mosquito"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mosquitoes}}\'a0preserved in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 amber}}. DNA from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 frogs}}\'a0was used to fill in gaps in the dinosaurs'\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genome}}. To prevent breeding, all the dinosaurs were made female. Malcolm scoffs at the idea, saying it will inevitably break down. The group witnesses the hatching of a baby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}\'a0and visits the raptor enclosure. At lunch, the group debates the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethics_of_cloning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ethics of cloning}}\'a0and the creation of the park. Malcolm gives a harsh warning about the implications of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genetic_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genetic engineering}}.\
The group is joined by Hammond's grandchildren, Tim and Lex, for a tour of the park, while Hammond oversees the tour from the park's control room. The tour does not go as planned. Most of the dinosaurs fail to appear and the group encounters a sick\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Triceratops"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Triceratops}}. It is cut short as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tropical_cyclone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tropical storm}}\'a0approaches Isla Nublar. Most park employees leave for the mainland on a boat, while the visitors return to their electric tour vehicles. Sattler stays behind with the park's veterinarian to study the\'a0
\f1\i Triceratops
\f0\i0 .\
Jurassic Park's lead computer programmer, Dennis Nedry, has been bribed by Dodgson, a man working for Hammond's corporate rival, to steal fertilized dinosaur\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Embryo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 embryos}}. Nedry deactivates the park's security system to gain access to the embryo storage room and puts the stolen embryos inside a canister disguised as a shaving cream bottle. The power goes out, stalling the tour vehicles. Most of the park's electric fences are deactivated, allowing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tyrannosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tyrannosaurus rex}}\'a0to escape and attack the group. Grant and Hammond's grandchildren survive. The\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0injures Malcolm and devours Gennaro. While taking the embryos to the island's dock, Nedry becomes lost in the rain, crashes his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeep_Wrangler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeep Wrangler}}, and is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dilophosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dilophosaurus}}.\
Sattler helps the park's game warden, Robert Muldoon, search for survivors. They find only Malcolm before the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0returns. Grant, Tim, and Lex take shelter in a treetop. They later discover broken dinosaur egg shells. Grant concludes the dinosaurs have been breeding. This occurred because their frog DNA\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/African_bullfrog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 West African bullfrogs}}\'a0can change their sex in a single-sex environment, allowing the dinosaurs to do so as well, proving Malcolm right.\
Unable to decipher Nedry's code to reactivate the security system, Hammond and the park's chief engineer Ray Arnold reboot the park's system. The group shuts down the park's grid and retreats to an emergency bunker, while Arnold heads to a maintenance shed to complete the rebooting process. When Arnold fails to return, Sattler and Muldoon head to the shed. They discover the shutdown has deactivated the remaining fences and released the\'a0
\f1\i Velociraptors
\f0\i0 . Muldoon distracts the raptors, while Sattler goes to turn the power back on, before being attacked by a raptor and discovering Arnold's severed arm. Muldoon is caught off guard and killed by the other two raptors.\
After encountering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}\'a0and narrowly escaping the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0during a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gallimimus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gallimimus}}\'a0stampede, Grant, Tim, and Lex reach the visitor center. Grant heads out to look for Sattler, leaving Tim (who was injured while scaling one of the fences) and Lex inside. They are pursued by the raptors in an industrial kitchen but escape and join Grant and Sattler. Lex restores full power from the control room, allowing them to call Hammond, who in turn calls for help. Grant, Tim, Lex, and Sattler are cornered by the raptors, but they escape when the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0suddenly appears and kills the raptors. Hammond arrives in a jeep with Malcolm, and the survivors board a helicopter to leave the island.\
Dory, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paracanthurus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 regal blue tang}}, gets separated from her parents as a child. As she grows up, Dory attempts to search for them, but gradually forgets them due to her short-term memory loss. In the flashback of the previous film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finding_Nemo"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finding Nemo}}, she joins Marlin \'96 a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clownfish"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 clownfish}}\'a0looking for his missing son Nemo \'96 after accidentally swimming into him.\
One year later, Dory is living with Marlin and Nemo on their reef. One day, Dory has a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flashback_(psychology)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flashback}}\'a0and remembers that she has parents. She decides to look for them, but her memory problem is an obstacle. She eventually remembers that they lived at the Jewel of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Morro_Bay,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Morro Bay, California}}\'a0across the ocean, thanks to Nemo mentioning its name.\
Marlin and Nemo accompany Dory. With the help of Crush, their sea turtle friend, they ride the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California_Current"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California Current}}\'a0to California. Upon arrival, they explore a shipwreck full of spilt cargo, where Dory accidentally awakens a giant, glowing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Humboldt_squid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Humboldt squid}}, who immediately pursues them and almost devours Nemo. They successfully trap the squid in a large shipping container. Marlin berates Dory for endangering them. Her feelings hurt, Dory travels to the surface to seek help and is captured by staff members from the trio's nearby destination, the Marine Life Institute after getting entangled in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Six_pack_rings"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 six pack rings}}.\
Dory is placed in the quarantine section and tagged. There she meets a grouchy, but well-meaning\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Octopus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 octopus}}\'a0named Hank (who is now a "septopus", due to apparently having had one of his eight tentacles ripped off by a child.) Dory's tag shows that she will be sent to an aquarium in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cleveland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cleveland}}. Due to a traumatic ocean life, Hank wants to live in the aquarium instead of being released back into the ocean, so he agrees to help Dory find her parents in exchange for her tag. In one exhibit, Dory encounters her childhood friend Destiny, a nearsighted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Whale_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 whale shark}}, who used to communicate with Dory through pipes, and Bailey, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Beluga_whale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 beluga whale}}, who mistakenly believes he has lost his ability to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Animal_echolocation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 echolocate}}. Dory subsequently has flashbacks of life with her parents, and struggles to recall details. She finally remembers how she was separated from her parents: she overheard her mother crying one night, left to retrieve a shell to cheer her up, and was pulled away by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Undertow_(water_waves)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 undertow current}}.\
Marlin and Nemo attempt to rescue Dory. With the help of two lazy,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/British_English"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British}}-accented\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California_sea_lion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California sea lions}}\'a0named Fluke and Rudder and a disfigured and utterly incompetent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Common_loon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 common loon}}\'a0named Becky, they manage to get into the institute and find her in the pipe system. Other blue tangs tell them that Dory's parents escaped from the institute a long time ago to search for her and never came back, leaving Dory believing that they have died. Hank retrieves Dory from the tank, accidentally leaving Marlin and Nemo behind. He is then apprehended by one of the employees and unintentionally drops Dory into the drain, flushing her out to the ocean. While wandering aimlessly, she comes across a trail of shells; remembering that when she was young, her parents had set out a similar trail to help her find her way back home, she follows it. At the end of the trail, Dory finds an empty\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brain_coral"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 brain coral}}\'a0with multiple shell trails leading to it. As she turns to leave, she sees her parents Jenny and Charlie in the distance. They tell her they spent years laying down the trails for her to follow in the hopes that she would eventually find them.\
Marlin, Nemo, and Hank end up in the truck taking various aquatic creatures to Cleveland. Destiny and Bailey escape from their exhibit to help Dory rescue them. Once on board the truck, Dory persuades Hank to return to the sea with her, and together, they hijack the truck and drive it over busy highways, creating havoc, before crashing it into the sea, freeing all the fish. Dory, along with her parents and new friends, return to the reef with Marlin and Nemo.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the tank gang from the first film, still trapped inside their (now\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Algae"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 algae}}-covered) plastic bags, reach California one year after floating across the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pacific_Ocean"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pacific Ocean}}. They are eventually picked up by staff members from the Marine Life Institute. Meanwhile, Fluke and Rudder's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unibrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 unibrowed}}\'a0neighbor, Gerald, due to having finally gotten on their rock without them knowing (as they had spent the entire film shooing him away whenever he tried to get on their rock) pops up and giggles goofily, as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iris_shot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iris}}\'a0closes in on him, revealing the film's end.\
The Trade Federation upsets order in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Republic}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blockade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blockading}}\'a0the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Naboo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Naboo}}\'a0in preparation for a full-scale\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Invasion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 invasion}}. The Republic's leader,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor_Valorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Chancellor Valorum}}, dispatches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Master}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Qui-Gon Jinn}}\'a0and his apprentice,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}, to negotiate with Trade Federation Viceroy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nute_Gunray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nute Gunray}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Sidious}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sith Lord}}\'a0and the Trade Federation's secret benefactor, orders the Viceroy to kill the Jedi and begin their invasion with an army of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 battle droids}}. The Jedi escape and flee to Naboo. During the invasion,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0saves the life of a clumsy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gungan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gungan}}\'a0outcast,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jar_Jar_Binks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jar Jar Binks}}, from being run over by a droid transport. Indebted to\'a0Qui-Gon,\'a0Jar Jar\'a0leads the Jedi to Otoh Gunga, an underwater city of Naboo. The Jedi try to persuade the Gungan leader,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boss_Nass"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Boss Nass}}, to help the planet's surface dwellers, but are unsuccessful. However, the Jedi manage to obtain\'a0Jar Jar's\'a0guidance and underwater transport to Theed, the capital city of Naboo; they narrowly avoid getting eaten by sea monsters on the way. They rescue Naboo's queen,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Padm\'e9 Amidala}}, and escape from the blockaded planet on her Royal Starship, intending to reach the Republic capital planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coruscant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coruscant}}.\
Amidala's ship is damaged as they pass the Federation blockade and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperdrive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperdrive}}\'a0is caught in the crossfire, rendering it useless. They land for repairs on the desert planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}.\'a0Qui-Gon,\'a0Jar Jar,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Astromech_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astromech droid}}{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}},\'a0and Padm\'e9\'97disguised as one of her handmaidens\'97visit a settlement of Mos Espa to purchase spare parts at a junk shop. They meet the shop's owner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Watto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Watto}}, and his nine-year-old slave,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}, a gifted pilot and engineer who has built a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Protocol_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 protocol droid}}\'a0called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0senses a strong presence of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0within Anakin, and is convinced that he is the prophesied "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Messiah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chosen One}}". Unable to buy the required hyperdrive parts due to the Republic's currency being worthless on Tatooine,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0wagers both the parts and Anakin's freedom with Watto in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Podrace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 podrace}}. Anakin wins, and joins the group to be trained as a Jedi, leaving behind his mother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shmi_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shmi}}. En route to their starship,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0encounters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Maul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Maul}}, Darth Sidious' apprentice, who intends to capture Amidala. A duel ensues, but\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0quickly disengages and escapes onboard the starship.\
Qui-Gon and Obi-Wan escort Amidala to Coruscant so that she can plead her people's case to Chancellor Valorum and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Senate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Senate}}.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0asks the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_Council"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Council}}\'a0for permission to train Anakin as a Jedi, but the Council refuses, concerned that Anakin is vulnerable to the dark side of the Force. Undaunted,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0vows to take up Anakin as his new disciple. Meanwhile, Naboo's senator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Palpatine}}\'a0persuades Amidala to call for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vote_of_no_confidence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vote of no confidence}}\'a0in Chancellor Valorum to elect a more capable leader to resolve the crisis. Though she is successful in pushing for the vote, Amidala grows frustrated with the corruption in the Senate and decides to return to Naboo.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0and\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0are ordered by the Jedi Council to accompany the queen, and investigate the return of the Sith, whom they had believed to be extinct.\
On Naboo, Padm\'e9 reveals herself to the Gungans as Queen Amidala and persuades them to join in an alliance against the Trade Federation. Despite being inept at combat,\'a0Jar Jar\'a0joins his people in a battle against the droid army, while Padm\'e9 leads the search for Viceroy Gunray in Theed. During a battle in the starship hangar,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0tells Anakin to wait in the cockpit of a vacant starfighter. Anakin inadvertently triggers its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Autopilot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 autopilot}}, joining the battle against the Federation droid control ship in space. Anakin blunders into the hangar of the droid control ship and causes its destruction from within before escaping, deactivating the droid army in the process. Meanwhile,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0and\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0battle Darth Maul, who mortally wounds\'a0Qui-Gon, but is then bisected by\'a0Obi-Wan.\
As he lays dying, Qui-Gon requests that\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0train Anakin. Palpatine is elected as the new supreme chancellor, and Gunray is arrested.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}\'a0promotes\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0to the rank of Jedi Knight and reluctantly accepts Anakin as\'a0Obi-Wan's\'a0apprentice. Padm\'e9 presents a gift of thanks to the Gungans during a celebratory parade.\
Troubled by a strange recurring dream and mourning the loss of her father, 19-year-old\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alice_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alice Kingsleigh}}\'a0attends a garden party at Lord Ascot's estate. There, she is confronted by an unwanted marriage proposal to Lord Ascot's son, Hamish, and the stifling expectations of the society in which she lives. Unsure of how to proceed, she pursues a rabbit wearing a blue waistcoat and accidentally falls into a large rabbit hole under a tree. She emerges in a forest where she is greeted by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_Rabbit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White Rabbit}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Dormouse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Dormouse}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dodo_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dodo}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_minor_characters_in_the_Alice_series#Live_Flowers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Talking Flowers}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tweedledum_and_Tweedledee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tweedledum and Tweedledee}}. They argue over whether Alice is "the right Alice" who must slay the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Queen_(Through_the_Looking-Glass)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Queen}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jabberwocky"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jabberwocky}}\'a0and restore the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_Queen_(Through_the_Looking-Glass)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White Queen}}\'a0to power, as foretold by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caterpillar_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Absolem the Caterpillar}}\'a0and his prophetic scroll. The group is then ambushed by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bandersnatch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bandersnatch}}\'a0and a group of playing-card soldiers led by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knave_of_Hearts_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knave of Hearts}}. Alice, Tweedledum and Tweedledee escape into the woods. The Knave steals the Caterpillar's scroll. The Dormouse leaves the others behind with one of the Bandersnatch's eyes in her possession. Tweedledum and Tweedledee are then captured by the Red Queen's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jubjub_bird"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jubjub bird}}.\
The Knave informs the Red Queen that Alice threatens her reign, and the soldiers and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Puppy_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bayard the Bloodhound}}\'a0are ordered to find Alice immediately. Meanwhile, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cheshire_Cat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cheshire Cat}}\'a0guides Alice to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/March_Hare"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 March Hare}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hatter_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mad Hatter}}. The Hatter helps Alice avoid capture by allowing himself to be seized instead. Later, Alice is found by the Bloodhound, but Alice insists upon helping the Hatter. At the Red Queen's citadel and palace, the Red Queen is unaware of Alice's true identity and therefore welcomes her as a guest. Alice learns that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vorpal_sword"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vorpal sword}}, the only weapon capable of killing the Jabberwocky, is locked inside the den of the Bandersnatch. The Knave attempts to seduce Alice, but she rebuffs him, causing a jealous Red Queen to order that Alice be beheaded. Alice obtains the sword and befriends the Bandersnatch by returning her eye. She then escapes on the back of the grateful Bandersnatch and delivers the sword to the White Queen. The Cheshire Cat saves the Hatter from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_minor_characters_in_the_Alice_series#The_Executioner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 executioner}}, and the Hatter calls for rebellion against the Red Queen. The rebellion is quickly put down by the Jubjub bird, but the resistance flees to the White Queen's castle, and both armies prepare for battle. Absolem advises Alice to fight the Jabberwocky just before completing his transformation into a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pupa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pupa}}.\
On the appointed day, the White Queen and the Red Queen gather their armies on a chessboard-like battlefield and send Alice and the Jabberwocky to decide the battle in single combat. Encouraged by the advice of her late father, Alice fights the Jabberwocky among the ruins surrounding the battlefield and finally jumps from the remains of a spiral staircase onto the Jabberwocky's neck and beheads it. During this fight, a catapult stone kills the Jubjub bird. As punishment for their crimes, the White Queen banishes the Red Queen and the Knave into exile together. The Knave attempts to kill the Red Queen, yet the Hatter protects the Red Queen from his attack. After the Hatter performs a celebration dance called Futterwacken, the White Queen gives Alice a vial of the Jabberwocky's purple blood whose power will bring her whatever she wishes. She decides to rejoin the everyday world after saying farewell to her friends. Back in England, Alice impresses Lord Ascot with her idea of establishing oceanic trade routes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}, inspiring him to take her as his apprentice. As the story closes, Alice prepares to set off on a trading ship. A light-blue butterfly with dark vein markings lands on her shoulder, and Alice recognizes him as Absolem.\
In a world populated by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anthropomorphism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 anthropomorphic}}\'a0mammals, rabbit Judy Hopps from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rural_area"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rural}}\'a0Bunnyburrow fulfills her childhood dream of becoming a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Police_officer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 police officer}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Urban_area"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 urban}}\'a0Zootopia. Despite being the academy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valedictorian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 valedictorian}}, Judy is delegated to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parking_enforcement_officer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 parking duty}}\'a0by Chief Bogo, who doubts her potential because she is a rabbit. On her first day, she is hustled by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Confidence_trick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 con artist}}\'a0fox duo, Nick Wilde and Finnick.\
Judy abandons parking duty to arrest Duke Weaselton, a weasel who stole a bag of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crocus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crocus}}\'a0bulbs known as\'a0
\f1\i Midnicampum holicithias
\f0\i0 . Bogo reprimands her, but an otter named Mrs. Otterton enters Bogo's office pleading for someone to find her husband Emmitt, one of fourteen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Predation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 predators}}\'a0who are missing. When Judy volunteers and Assistant Mayor Dawn Bellwether praises the assignment, Bogo has no choice but to let Judy take the case. He gives her 48 hours to find Emmitt Otterton on the condition that if she fails, she resigns.\
Judy blackmails Nick into assisting her by covertly recording his confession to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tax_evasion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tax evasion}}, having ascertained from the 'last-sighting' photo of Otterton that Nick was the last to see him. They track Otterton to a limousine owned by crime boss Mr. Big, who reveals Otterton went "savage"\'97reverted to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Feral_animal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 feral state}}\'97and attacked his chauffeur Manchas. At his home, Manchas mentions Otterton yelled about "night howlers" before the attack. Moments later, Manchas himself turns savage and chases the pair. Judy saves Nick by trapping Manchas and calls the ZPD for help, but when they arrive, Manchas has vanished. Bogo demands that Judy turn in her badge, but Nick reminds Bogo that Judy still has ten hours to solve the case.\
At City Hall, Bellwether allows Judy and Nick access to the city's traffic cameras. They discover Manchas was captured by wolves, who Judy surmises are the "night howlers". They locate the missing predators\'97all gone savage\'97imprisoned at Cliffside Asylum, where Mayor Leodore Lionheart hides them from the public while trying to determine the cause of their behavior. Lionheart and the asylum staff are arrested for false imprisonment and Bellwether becomes the new mayor.\
Judy, praised for solving the case, has become friends with Nick and asks him to join the ZPD as her partner. However, she upsets him at a press conference by suggesting a predatory biological cause for the recent savage behavior; her comments also incite hateful speech and discrimination against predators throughout Zootopia. Wracked with guilt for the consequences of her words, Judy quits her job and returns to Bunnyburrow.\
Back home, Judy learns that the night howlers are actually the crocus bulbs Weaselton stole, and they contain a neurotoxin that has severe\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychoactive_drug"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 psychotropic effects}}\'a0on mammals, causing them to go savage. After returning to Zootopia and reconciling with Nick, the pair confront Weaselton, who (with persuasion from Mr. Big) tells them the bulbs he stole were for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sheep"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ram}}\'a0named Doug. They find Doug in a laboratory hidden in the city subway, developing a drug made from night howlers, which he has been shooting at predators with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tranquillizer_gun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dart gun}}.\
Judy and Nick obtain the serum as evidence, but before they can reach the ZPD, Bellwether confronts them in the Natural History Museum and takes the evidence, revealing herself as the mastermind behind a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supremacism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 prey-supremacist}}\'a0conspiracy to frame predators as dangerous and savage. Bellwether traps Judy and Nick in an exhibition after Nick refuses to abandon an injured Judy. She shoots a serum pellet at Nick to make him attack Judy and summons the ZPD for help, but Judy and Nick have replaced the serum pellets in Bellwether's gun with blueberries. Enraged, Bellwether threatens to frame the pair for the attacks before discovering that Judy baited her into openly declaring her role in the attacks and recorded the confession with her recording device; Bellwether attempts to escape, only to find herself and her crooked group of cops surrounded by Chief Bogo and his loyal officers.\
Bellwether is arrested and sent to prison for her actions. Lionheart publicly denies knowledge of Bellwether's plot and states that his imprisonment of the savage predators was a "wrong thing for the right reason". With the cause of the epidemic identified, the savage animals are cured and Judy rejoins the ZPD. Nick graduates from the Zootopia Police Academy as the city's first fox police officer and becomes Judy's partner.\
Approaching his 111th birthday,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [a]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hobbit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hobbit}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bilbo_Baggins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bilbo Baggins}}\'a0begins writing down the full story of his adventure 60 years earlier for the benefit of his nephew\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frodo_Baggins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frodo}}. Long before Bilbo's involvement, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dwarf_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dwarf}}\'a0king\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thr%C3%B3r"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thr\'f3r}}brought an era of prosperity for his kin under the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lonely_Mountain"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lonely Mountain}}\'a0until the arrival of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dragon_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dragon}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Smaug"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Smaug}}. Destroying the nearby town of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dale_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dale}}, Smaug drove the Dwarves out of their mountain and took their hoard of gold. Thr\'f3r's grandson,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thorin_Oakenshield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thorin}}, sees\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thranduil"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Thranduil}}\'a0and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Silvan_Elves"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wood-elves}}\'a0on a nearby hillside, and is dismayed when they leave rather than aid his people, resulting in Thorin's everlasting hatred of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elf_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elves}}.\
In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shire_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shire}}, 50-year-old Bilbo is tricked by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wizard_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wizard}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gandalf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gandalf the Grey}}\'a0into hosting a party for Thorin and his company of Dwarves:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Balin_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Balin}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dwalin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dwalin}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/F%C3%ADli"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 F\'edli}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/K%C3%ADli"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 K\'edli}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dori_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dori}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nori_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nori}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ori_(dwarf)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ori}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/%C3%93in,_son_of_Gl%C3%B3in"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 \'d3in}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gl%C3%B3in"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gl\'f3in}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifur}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bofur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bofur}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bombur_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bombur}}. Gandalf's aim is to recruit Bilbo as the company's "burglar" to aid them in their quest to enter the Lonely Mountain. Bilbo is unwilling to accept at first, but has a change of heart after the company leaves without him the next day. Travelling onward, the company is captured by three\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Troll_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Trolls}}. Bilbo stalls the Trolls from eating them until dawn, and Gandalf exposes the trolls to sunlight, turning them to stone. The company locates the Trolls' cave and finds treasure and Elven blades. Thorin and Gandalf each take an Elf-made blade,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orcrist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Orcrist}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Glamdring"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Glamdring}}, respectively; Gandalf also finds an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sting_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elven dagger}}, which he gives to Bilbo.\
The wizard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Radagast"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Radagast the Brown}}\'a0finds Gandalf and the company, and recounts an encounter at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dol_Guldur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dol Guldur}}\'a0with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sauron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Necromancer}}, a sorcerer who has been corrupting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mirkwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greenwood}}\'a0with dark magic. Chased by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orc_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Orcs}}, Gandalf leads the company through a hidden passage to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rivendell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rivendell}}. There,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elrond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lord Elrond}}\'a0discloses a hidden indication of a secret door on the company's map of the Lonely Mountain, which will be visible only on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Durin%27s_Day"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Durin's Day}}. Gandalf later approaches the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_Council"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White Council}}\'a0\'97 consisting of Elrond,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galadriel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galadriel}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Saruman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Saruman the White}}\'a0\'97 and presents a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Morgul_blade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Morgul blade}}, a weapon of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Witch-king_of_Angmar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Witch-king of Angmar}}, which Radagast obtained from Dol Guldur as a sign that the Necromancer is linked to an eventual return of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sauron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sauron}}. While Saruman presses concern to the more present matter of the Dwarves' quest, requesting that Gandalf put an end to it, Gandalf secretly reveals to Galadriel he had anticipated this and had the Dwarves move forward without him.\
The company journeys into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Misty_Mountains"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Misty Mountains}}, where they find themselves amid a colossal battle between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Giant_(mythology)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stone Giants}}. They take refuge in a cave and are captured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orc_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Goblins}}, who take them to their leader, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_Goblin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Great Goblin}}. Bilbo becomes separated from the Dwarves and falls into a crevice where he encounters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gollum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gollum}}, who unknowingly drops a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/One_Ring"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 golden ring}}. Pocketing the ring, Bilbo finds himself confronted by Gollum. They play a riddle game, wagering that Bilbo will be shown the way out if he wins or eaten by Gollum if he loses. Bilbo eventually wins by asking Gollum what he has in his pocket. Noticing his ring is lost, Gollum realizes that Bilbo possesses it and chases him. Bilbo discovers that the ring grants him invisibility, but when he has a chance to kill Gollum, Bilbo spares his life out of pity and escapes while Gollum shouts his hatred towards the hobbit Baggins.\
Meanwhile, the Great Goblin reveals to the Dwarves that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Azog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Azog}}, an Orc war-chief who killed Thr\'f3r and lost his forearm to Thorin in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_of_the_Dwarves_and_Orcs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 battle}}\'a0outside the Dwarven kingdom of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Moria_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Moria}}, has placed a bounty on Thorin's head. Gandalf arrives and leads the Dwarves in an escape, killing the Great Goblin. Bilbo exits the mountain and rejoins the company, keeping his newly obtained ring secret. The company is ambushed by Azog and his hunting party, and takes refuge in trees. Thorin charges at Azog, who overpowers and severely injures him with his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warg_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warg}}. Bilbo saves Thorin from the Orcs just as the company is rescued by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eagle_(Middle-earth)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 eagles}}. They escape to the safety of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carrock#Carrock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Carrock}}\'a0where Gandalf revives Thorin, who renounces his previous disdain for Bilbo after being saved by him. They see the Lonely Mountain in the distance, where a sleeping Smaug is awoken by a thrush knocking a snail against a stone.\
A gang of criminals rob a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gotham_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gotham City}}\'a0mob bank, murdering each other for a higher share of the money until only the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Joker_(The_Dark_Knight)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joker}}\'a0remains, who escapes with the money.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman}}, District Attorney\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harvey_Dent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harvey Dent}}\'a0and Lieutenant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Gordon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Gordon}}\'a0form an alliance to rid Gotham City of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Organized_crime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 organized crime}}. Bruce Wayne believes that with Dent as Gotham's protector, he can retire from being Batman and lead a normal life with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rachel_Dawes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rachel Dawes}}\'a0\'96 even though she and Dent are dating.\
Mob bosses\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sal_Maroni"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sal Maroni}}, Gambol, and the Chechen hold a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Videoconferencing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 video-conference}}\'a0with their corrupt accountant, Lau, who has taken their funds for safekeeping and fled to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}. The Joker interrupts the meeting to warn them that Batman is unhindered by the law, and offers to kill him in exchange for half of their money. The mob bosses disagree, and a bounty is placed on the Joker by Gambol. The Joker finds and kills Gambol, taking over his gang. The mob ultimately decides to take the Joker up on his offer. Batman finds Lau in Hong Kong and brings him back to Gotham to testify, allowing Dent to apprehend the entire mob. The Joker threatens to keep killing people unless Batman reveals his identity, and starts by murdering Police Commissioner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gillian_B._Loeb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gillian B. Loeb}}\'a0and the judge presiding over the mob trial. The Joker also tries to kill Mayor Anthony Garcia, but Gordon sacrifices himself to stop the assassination. Dent kidnaps one of Joker\'92s henchmen and threatens him with a seemingly deadly game of heads-or-tails using Dent's lucky coin, which is revealed to be heads on both sides. Dent learns that Rachel is Joker's next target.\
Bruce decides to reveal his secret identity to prevent more deaths. Before he can, however, Dent falsely announces that\'a0
\f1\i he
\f0\i0 \'a0is Batman. Dent is taken into protective custody, but the Joker appears and attacks the convoy. Batman comes to Dent's rescue and Gordon, who faked his death, apprehends the Joker, securing a promotion to Commissioner. Rachel and Dent are escorted away by detectives on Maroni's payroll; Gordon later learns that they never arrived home. Batman interrogates the Joker, who reveals that they have been trapped in separate locations rigged with explosives and that Batman must choose one to save. Batman races to save Rachel, while Gordon attempts to rescue Dent. Batman arrives at the building, but realizes that the Joker sent him to Dent's location instead. Both buildings explode, killing Rachel and disfiguring half of Dent's face. The Joker escapes with Lau, who leads him to the Mob's funds. The Joker burns the money before killing Lau and the Chechen.\
Coleman Reese, an accountant at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wayne_Enterprises"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wayne Enterprises}}, deduces that Bruce is Batman and threatens to publicize the information. Not wanting Reese's revelation to interfere with his plans, the Joker threatens to destroy a hospital unless Reese is killed within an hour. All hospitals are evacuated and Gordon travels to secure Reese. The Joker, disguised as a hospital nurse, discovers Dent's ward and hands him a gun, convincing him to seek revenge for Rachel's death. The Joker then destroys the hospital and escapes with a busload of hostages. Dent goes on a killing spree, deciding the fates of people he holds responsible for Rachel's death by flipping his lucky coin, which was disfigured on one face by the explosion. Dent eventually apprehends Gordon's family, believing Gordon's love for his family parallels his love for Rachel.\
After announcing that Gotham City will be subject to his rule by nightfall, the Joker rigs two evacuating ferries with explosives; one containing civilians and the other containing prisoners. The passengers have been supplied with a trigger to the other boat's explosives, and the Joker announces through an intercom that he will blow both ferries if one of them has not been destroyed by midnight. Batman finds the Joker by using a sonar device that spies on the entire city, with the reluctant help of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lucius_Fox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lucius Fox}}. Both the civilians and the prisoners refuse to kill each other, while Batman apprehends the Joker after a brief fight. Before the police arrive to take the Joker into custody, he gloats that Gotham's citizens will lose hope once Dent's rampage becomes public knowledge.\
Gordon and Batman arrive at the building where Rachel perished and find Dent threatening to kill Gordon's family. Dent again flips his coin and shoots Batman, spares himself, and aims to kill Gordon's son while claiming that Gordon's negligence is responsible for Rachel's death. Before he can flip his coin for the boy, Batman, who was wearing body armor, tackles Dent off the building to his death. Batman persuades Gordon to let him take responsibility for the killing spree to preserve Dent's heroic image. As the police launch a manhunt for Batman, Gordon destroys the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bat-signal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bat-signal}}, Fox watches as the sonar device self-destructs, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alfred}}\'a0burns a letter from Rachel saying she plans to marry Dent. Batman flees from the police, taking Dent's place for Two-Face's crimes.\
In late 1981,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Albus Dumbledore}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minerva McGonagall}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rubeus Hagrid}}, professors of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry}}, deliver a recently orphaned infant named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Potter_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Potter}}\'a0to his only remaining relatives,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Dursleys"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Dursleys}}. Ten years later, Harry has been battling a disjointed life with the Dursleys. After inadvertently causing an accident during a family trip to the zoo, Harry begins receiving unsolicited letters by owls. After the Dursleys escape to an island to avoid more letters, Hagrid re-appears and informs Harry that he is actually a wizard and has been accepted into Hogwarts against the Dursleys' wishes. After taking Harry to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Diagon_Alley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Diagon Alley}}\'a0to buy his supplies for Hogwarts and a pet owl named Hedwig as a birthday present, Hagrid informs him of his past; Harry's parents\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix_(fictional_organisation)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James and Lily Potter}}\'a0met their demise via a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magic_in_Harry_Potter#Unforgivable_Curses"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Killing Curse}}\'a0at the hands of the malevolent and all-powerful wizard,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lord_Voldemort"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lord Voldemort}}. Harry, the only survivor in the chaos, thus becomes well-known in the wizarding world as "The Boy Who Lived".\
Harry is then taken to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London_King%27s_Cross_railway_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King's Cross station}}\'a0to board a train to Hogwarts, where he meets three other students:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ron_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ron Weasley}}, whom he quickly befriends;\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermione_Granger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hermione Granger}}, an intelligent witch born to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Muggle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 muggle}}\'a0parents; and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Draco_Malfoy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Draco Malfoy}}, a child from a wealthy wizarding family whom he immediately clashes with. After arriving at school the students assemble in the Great Hall, where all the first-years are sorted by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magical_objects_in_Harry_Potter#Sorting_Hat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sorting Hat}}\'a0between four houses:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gryffindor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gryffindor}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hufflepuff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hufflepuff}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ravenclaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ravenclaw}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Slytherin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Slytherin}}. Although the Sorting Hat considers putting Harry in Slytherin, he is placed into Gryffindor alongside Ron and Hermione.\
At Hogwarts, Harry begins learning magic spells and discovers more about his past and parents. After recovering the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magical_objects_in_Harry_Potter#Remembrall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Remembrall}}\'a0of Gryffindor student\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neville_Longbottom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Neville Longbottom}}, Harry is recruited for Gryffindor's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quidditch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quidditch}}team as a Seeker, an extremely rare feat for first-year students. While exploring the school one night, Harry, Ron, and Hermione discover a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cerberus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 giant three-headed dog}}\'a0named Fluffy in a restricted area of the school. Ron then insults Hermione after being embarrassed by her in a charms lesson, causing Hermione to lock herself in the girls' bathroom. She is attacked by a marauding troll but Harry and Ron save her, befriending her in the process.\
The children later find out Fluffy is guarding the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Philosopher's Stone}}, an object that can grant its owner immortality. Harry suspects that potions teacher and head of Slytherin House\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Severus_Snape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Severus Snape}}\'a0is trying to obtain the stone in order to return Voldemort to physical form. Hagrid accidentally reveals to the trio that Fluffy will fall asleep if played music. Harry, Ron, and Hermione decide that night to try and find the stone before Snape. They discover an already asleep Fluffy and face a series of safeguards including a deadly plant known as Devil's Snare, a room filled with aggressive flying keys that bruise Harry, and a dangerous life-sized game of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chess}}\'a0that almost kills Ron.\
After getting past the tasks, Harry discovers that it was\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Defence Against the Dark Arts}}\'a0teacher\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quirinus Quirrell}}\'a0who was trying to claim the stone, and that Snape was actually protecting Harry all along. Quirrell removes his turban and reveals a weak Voldemort living on the back of his head. Through an enchantment placed by Dumbledore, Harry finds the stone in his possession. Voldemort attempts to bargain the stone from Harry in exchange for reviving his parents, but Harry refuses, causing Quirrell to attack. Harry kills Quirrell by burning his skin and reducing him to dust, after which Voldemort's spirit rises from Quirrell's ashes and knocks Harry unconscious.\
Harry recovers in the school hospital with Dumbledore at his side. Dumbledore explains that the stone has been destroyed and that Ron and Hermione are safe. Dumbledore also reveals how Harry was able to defeat Quirrell: when Harry's mother died to save him, her death gave Harry a love-based protection against Voldemort. Harry, Ron, and Hermione are rewarded with house points for their heroic performances, tying them for first place with Slytherin. Dumbledore then awards ten points to Neville for attempting to stop the trio, granting Gryffindor the House Cup. Harry returns home for the summer, happy to finally have a real home in Hogwarts.\
A mysterious vehicle using a giant magnet steals a highly potent mutagen known as PX-41 from a secret laboratory in the Arctic Circle. The Anti-Villain League (AVL), led by Silas Ramsbottom, tries to recruit former super-villain Gru to track down the culprit and recover the mutagen. However, Gru refuses, claiming that he is now a legitimate businessman and the devoted father to Margo, Edith, and Agnes. Longing to resume his criminal life, Dr. Nefario, Gru's friend and assistant, leaves Gru for new employment. Gru reluctantly agrees to investigate the theft and works with undercover AVL agent Lucy Wilde.\
The pair begin their search in the Paradise Shopping Mall, disguised as bakery employees. Gru immediately suspects the Mexican restaurant owner, Eduardo P\'e9rez, of being the infamous "El Macho", a legendary super-villain who supposedly died by riding a shark into the mouth of an active volcano with 250 pounds of dynamite strapped to his chest. Gru and Lucy break into Eduardo's restaurant at night but find no proof. Meanwhile, Agnes, who dreams of having a mother one day, believes that Gru will fall in love with Lucy. Gru denies it, saying his relationship with Lucy is only professional.\
Although holding Eduardo as his prime suspect, Gru agrees to pursue others, including wig merchant Floyd Eagle-san. After witnessing Eduardo's two-timing son, Antonio, woo Margo and invite everyone to his Cinco de Mayo party, Gru renews his focus on Eduardo. His neighbor, Jillian, sets him up on a dinner date with her vacuous friend Shannon. The date goes awry, but Lucy arrives and rescues Gru from being humiliated by shooting Shannon with a tranquilizer gun. While they take Shannon home, Gru and Lucy spend personal time together, and Gru falls in love with her.\
The next day, the AVL arrest Eagle-san after finding an almost-empty jar of the mutagen in his shop, and the investigation is closed by Ramsbottom. Lucy is reassigned to Australia and gives Gru her lipstick taser as a gift before leaving. A heartbroken Gru, having lacked the courage to ask Lucy out on a date, instead takes the girls to the Cinco de Mayo party. There, he follows Eduardo and discovers a secret musical steps-activated elevator, where he finally finds proof that Eduardo is El Macho.\
On her flight, Lucy, realizing that she has also fallen in love with Gru, jumps out of the plane and uses a hang-glider to reach the party. Gru discovers that El Macho, who has hired Nefario as a partner, has been abducting Gru's Minions and using the stolen PX-41 serum to make them rabid and indestructible. El Macho plans to launch rockets full of the mutated Minions into major cities in order to dominate the world. He offers Gru the chance to team up with him, but Gru walks away.\
Lucy later arrives at the party, but El Macho captures Lucy after Pollito, El Macho's pet chicken, retrieves her AVL ID badge from her purse. Nefario rejoins Gru, who fakes being captured with two other minions to help him enter El Macho's fortress. Nefario creates an antidote to the serum. Gru, Nefario, and the girls use it as a weapon to return the Minions to their normal state. El Macho then applies the mutagen on himself and turns into a monster, but Gru and Nefario defeat him using Lucy's lipstick taser and a fart gun.\
Gru finds Lucy strapped to a TNT-loaded shark rocket and starts to untie her, but Pollito launches the rocket, sending it flying towards the same volcano where El Macho previously faked his death. Lucy accepts Gru's invitation for a date, and the pair dive into the ocean seconds before the rocket enters the volcano and violently explodes. Gru rejoins the AVL, and he and Lucy eventually get married, giving Margo, Edith and Agnes a mother.\
In the Pride Lands of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Africa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Africa}}, a pride of lions rule over the animal kingdom from Pride Rock. King Mufasa's and Queen Sarabi's newborn son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Simba"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simba}}\'a0(whose name is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swahili_language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Swahili}}\'a0for lion
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 ), is presented to the gathering animals by Rafiki the baboon (with the colorful facial marking of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mandrill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mandrill}})
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0who serves as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shamanism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shaman}}\'a0and advisor. Mufasa shows Simba the Pride Lands and explains to him the responsibilities of kingship and the "circle of life", which connects all living things. Mufasa's younger brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scar_(The_Lion_King)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scar}}, covets the throne and plots to eliminate both Mufasa and Simba, so he may become king. He tricks Simba and his best friend Nala\'97to whom Simba is betrothed\'97into exploring a forbidden\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elephants%27_graveyard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 elephants' graveyard}}, where they are attacked by three\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spotted_hyena"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 spotted hyenas}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_characters_in_The_Lion_King#Shenzi,_Banzai_and_Ed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shenzi, Banzai, and Ed}}, who are in league with Scar. Mufasa is alerted about the incident by his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Majordomo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 majordomo}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hornbill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hornbill}}\'a0Zazu, and rescues the cubs. Though upset with Simba, Mufasa forgives him and explains that the great kings of the past watch over them from the night sky, from which he will one day watch over Simba.\
Scar sets a trap for his brother and nephew, luring Simba into a gorge and having the hyenas drive a large herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wildebeest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wildebeest}}\'a0into a stampede that will trample him. He informs Mufasa of Simba's peril, knowing that king will rush to save his son. Mufasa saves Simba but ends up hanging perilously from the gorge's edge. Scar refuses to help Mufasa, instead sending him falling to his death. He then convinces Simba that the tragedy was Simba's own fault and advises him to leave the kingdom. He then orders the hyenas to kill the cub, but Simba escapes. Scar tells the pride that both Mufasa and Simba were killed in the stampede and steps forward as the new king, allowing his three hyena minions and the rest of their large pack to live in the Pride Lands.\
Simba collapses in a desert and is rescued by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Timon_and_Pumbaa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Timon and Pumbaa}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Meerkat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 meerkat}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Common_warthog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 warthog}}, who are fellow outcasts. Simba grows up in the jungle with his two new friends, living a carefree life under the motto "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hakuna_matata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hakuna matata}}" ("no worries" in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swahili_language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Swahili}}). Now a young adult, Simba rescues Timon and Pumbaa from a hungry lioness, who turns out to be Nala. She and Simba reunite and fall in love, and she urges him to return home, telling him the Pride Lands have become a drought-stricken wasteland under Scar's reign. Feeling guilty over his father's death, Simba refuses and storms off. He encounters Rafiki, who tells him that Mufasa's spirit lives on in Simba. Simba is visited by the ghost of Mufasa in the night sky, who tells him he must take his rightful place as king. Realizing that he can no longer run from his past, Simba decides to return to the Pride Lands.\
Aided by his friends, Simba sneaks past the hyenas at Pride Rock and confronts Scar, who had just struck Sarabi. Scar taunts Simba over his role in Mufasa's death and backs him to the edge of the rock, where he reveals to him that he murdered Mufasa. Enraged, Simba pins Scar to the ground and forces him to reveal the truth to the rest of the pride. Timon, Pumbaa, Rafiki, Zazu, and the lionesses fend off the hyenas while Scar, attempting to escape, is cornered by Simba at the top of Pride Rock. Scar begs for mercy and attempts to blame the hyenas for his actions; Simba spares his life, but orders him to leave the Pride Lands forever. Scar attacks his nephew, but Simba manages to toss him from the top of the rock. Scar survives the fall, but is attacked and killed by the hyenas, who overheard his attempt to betray them. Afterwards, Simba takes over the kingship as rain begins to fall.\
Later, with Pride Rock restored to its usual state, Rafiki presents Simba and Nala's newborn cub to the assembled animals, continuing the circle of life.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mowgli"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mowgli}}\'a0is a "man cub" raised by the wolf\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raksha_(The_Jungle_Book)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raksha}}\'a0and her pack, led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Akela_(The_Jungle_Book)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Akela}}, in an Indian jungle ever since he was brought to them as a infant by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_panther"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black panther}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bagheera"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bagheera}}. Bagheera trains Mowgli to learn the ways of the wolves, but the boy faces certain challenges and falls behind his wolf siblings, while Akela disapproves of him using human "tricks", like building tools, instead of learning the ways of the pack.\
One day, during the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dry_season"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dry season}}, the jungle animals gather to drink the water that remains as part of a truce during a drought that enables the jungle's wildlife to drink without fear of being eaten by their predators. The truce is disrupted when a fire-scarred\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bengal_tiger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bengal tiger}}\'a0named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shere_Khan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shere Khan}}\'a0arrives, detecting Mowgli's scent in the large crowd. Resentful against man for scarring him, he issues a warning that he will kill Mowgli at the end of the drought. After the drought ends, the wolves debate whether they should keep Mowgli or not. Mowgli decides to leave the jungle for the safety of his pack. Bagheera agrees with the decision and volunteers to guide him to the nearby man village.\
En route, Shere Khan ambushes them and injures Bagheera, but Mowgli manages to escape. Later, Mowgli meets an enormous python named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kaa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kaa}}, who hypnotizes him. While under her influence, Mowgli sees a vision of his father being killed by Shere Khan while protecting him, which also warns of the destructive power of the "red flower" (fire). Kaa attempts to devour Mowgli, but she is attacked by a large animal who rescues the unconscious Mowgli. Mowgli later awakens to find that the animal that rescued him from Kaa was a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Himalayan_brown_bear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 himalayan brown bear}}\'a0named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baloo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baloo}}. The two bond while retrieving some difficult-to-access honey, and Mowgli agrees to stay with Baloo until the winter season arrives. Meanwhile, upon learning that Mowgli has left the jungle, Shere Khan throws Akela off to his death and threatens the pack to lure Mowgli out.\
Bagheera eventually finds Mowgli and Baloo and is shocked that Mowgli has not joined the humans as he had agreed, but Baloo calms him down and persuades both of them to sleep on it. During the night, Mowgli finds a herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indian_elephant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indian elephants}}\'a0led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hathi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hathi}}\'a0gathered around a ditch and uses vines to save a baby elephant from the ditch.
