Pasha is reported\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Missing_in_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 missing in action}}\'a0following a daring charge attack on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German forces}}. Lara enlists as a nurse to search for him. Yuri Zhivago is drafted and becomes a battlefield doctor.\
During the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/February_Revolution"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 February Revolution}}\'a0in 1917, Zhivago enlists Lara's help to tend to the wounded. Together they run a field hospital for six months, during which time radical changes ensue throughout Russia as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vladimir_Lenin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vladimir Lenin}}arrives in Moscow. Before their departure, Yuri and Lara fall in love, but Yuri remains true to Tonya, who became his wife.\
After the war, Yuri returns to his wife Tonya, son Sasha, and Alexander (Anna has since died), whose house in Moscow has been divided into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tenements"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tenements}}\'a0by the new Soviet government. Yevgraf, now a member of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cheka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cheka}}, informs him his poems have been condemned by Soviet censors as antagonistic to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Communism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Communism}}. Yevgraf arranges for passes and documents in order for Yuri and his family to escape from the new political capital of Moscow to the far-away Gromeko estate at Varykino, in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ural_Mountains"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ural Mountains}}. Zhivago, Tonya, Sasha, and Alexander board a heavily guarded cattle train, at which time they are informed that they will be travelling through contested territory, which is being secured by the infamous Bolshevik commander named Strelnikov, who is, in fact, Pasha Antipov.\
While the train is stopped early one morning, Zhivago wanders away. He stumbles across the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Armoured_train"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 armoured train}}\'a0of Strelnikov sitting on a hidden siding. Yuri is summoned before Strelnikov, whom he recognizes as the former Pasha Antipov. During a tense interview, Strelnikov informs Yuri that his estranged wife Lara is now living in the town of Yuriatin, then occupied by the anti-Communist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White Army}}\'a0forces. He permits Zhivago to return to his family, although it is hinted by Strelnikov's right-hand man that most people interrogated by Strelnikov end up being shot.\
The family lives a peaceful life in a cottage at the Varykino estate until Zhivago finds Lara in nearby Yuriatin, at which point they surrender to their long-repressed feelings. When Tonya becomes pregnant, Yuri breaks off with Lara, only to be abducted and conscripted into service by Communist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Partisans_(military)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 partisans}}.\
After two years, Zhivago at last deserts and trudges through the deep snow to Yuriatin where he finds Lara. Lara tells Yuri that Tonya had discovered her while searching for him, and that his family is now in Moscow. She reveals a sealed letter Tonya had mailed to Lara 6 months ago to give to Yuri: Tonya, her father, and their children are being deported and will live in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paris"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paris}}. Yuri and Lara renew their relationship.\
One night, Komarovsky arrives and informs them they are being watched by the Cheka due to Lara's connection by marriage to Strelnikov and Yuri's "counter-revolutionary" poetry and desertion. Komarovsky offers Yuri and Lara his help in leaving Russia. They refuse. Instead, they return to the abandoned Varykino estate, taking up residence in the banned main house, where Yuri begins writing the "Lara" poems. These will later make him famous but also incur government displeasure. Komarovsky reappears and tells Yuri that Strelnikov was captured only five miles away while apparently returning to Lara, but then committed suicide en route to his own execution. Therefore, Lara is in immediate danger of execution herself, as the Cheka had only left her free to lure Strelnikov out of hiding. Zhivago sends Lara and Katya away with Komarovsky, who has been appointed a government official in the nominally independent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Far_Eastern_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Far Eastern Republic}}\'a0of the early 1920s. Refusing to accompany a man he despises, Yuri remains behind to face his fate.\
Years later, Yevgraf finds a sick and destitute Yuri in Moscow during the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stalinist_era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stalinist era}}\'a0and gives him a new suit and a job. While riding a tram, Yuri spots a woman he surely thinks is Lara walking on a nearby street. Unable to call her from the tram, Yuri struggles to get off at the next stop. Yuri runs after her but suffers a fatal heart attack before he can even signal to her, and the woman walks away oblivious to Yuri's presence. Yuri's funeral is well attended, a surprise to Yevgraf as Yuri's poetry was officially "unobtainable at the time". Lara approaches Yevgraf at the funeral and reveals she had given birth to Yuri's daughter, but lost her in the collapse of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Occupation_of_Mongolia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White-controlled government in Mongolia}}. After vainly looking over hundreds of orphans with Yevgraf's help, Lara disappears during\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joseph_Stalin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joseph Stalin}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_Purge"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Great Purge}}\'a0of the late 1930s, and "died or vanished somewhere ... in one of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gulag"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 labour camps}}", according to Yevgraf.\
While Yevgraf strongly feels that Tanya Komarova is Yuri and Lara's daughter, he is still not convinced. But as Tanya leaves, Yevgraf notices that she carries a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Balalaika"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 balalaika}}, an instrument that Yuri's mother was especially gifted at playing. Questioning her further, he learns that Tanya is self-taught \'97 in fact, her fianc\'e9 proclaims her an 'artist' with the balalaika. Yevgraf smiles, "Ah. Then it's a gift", thereby implying she truly must be Yuri and Lara's daughter after all.\
During a beach party at dusk on Amity Island,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New England}}, a young woman, Chrissie Watkins, goes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nude_swimming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skinny dipping}}\'a0in the ocean. While\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Treading_water"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 treading water}}, she is violently pulled under. The next day, her partial remains are found on shore. The medical examiner's ruling that the death was due to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark_attack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark attack}}\'a0leads police chief Martin Brody to close the beaches. Mayor Larry Vaughn overrules him, fearing that the town's summer economy will be ruined. The coroner now concurs with the mayor's theory that Chrissie was killed in a boating accident. Brody reluctantly accepts their conclusion until another fatal shark attack occurs shortly thereafter. A bounty is placed on the shark, prompting an amateur shark-hunting frenzy. Local professional shark hunter Quint offers his services for $10,000. Meanwhile, consulting oceanographer Matt Hooper examines Chrissie's remains, and confirms her death was caused by a shark\'97an unusually large one.\
When local fishermen catch a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tiger_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tiger shark}}, the mayor proclaims the beaches safe. Hooper disputes that it is the same predator, confirming this after no human remains are found inside it. Hooper and Brody find a half-sunken vessel while searching the night waters in Hooper's boat. Underwater, Hooper retrieves a sizable\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_white_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 great white shark}}'s tooth embedded in the submerged hull. He drops it in fright after encountering a partial corpse. Vaughn discounts Brody and Hooper's claims that a huge great white shark is responsible for the deaths, and refuses to close the beaches, allowing only added safety precautions. On the Fourth of July weekend, tourists pack the beaches. Following a juvenile prank in which the presence of a shark is simulated, the real shark enters a nearby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Estuary"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 estuary}}, killing a boater and causing Brody's oldest son, Michael, to go into shock. Brody then convinces Vaughn to hire Quint.\
Quint, Brody, and Hooper set out on Quint's boat, the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 , to hunt the shark. While Brody lays down a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chumming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chum}}\'a0line, Quint waits for an opportunity to hook the shark. Without warning, it appears behind the boat. Quint, estimating its length at 25 feet (7.6\'a0m) and weight at 3 tons, harpoons it with a line attached to a flotation barrel, but the shark pulls the barrel underwater and disappears.\
At nightfall, Quint and Hooper drunkenly exchange stories about their assorted scars and Quint reveals that he survived the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Indianapolis_(CA-35)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USS\'a0
\f1\i Indianapolis}}. The shark returns unexpectedly, ramming the boat's hull, and disabling the power. The men work through the night, repairing the engine. In the morning, Brody attempts to call the Coast Guard, but Quint, who has become obsessed with killing the shark without outside assistance, smashes the radio. After a long chase, Quint harpoons another barrel into the shark. The line is tied to the stern cleats, but the shark drags the boat backward, swamping the deck and flooding the engine compartment. Quint prepares to sever the line to prevent the transom from being pulled out but the cleats break off, keeping the barrels attached to the shark. Quint heads toward shore to draw the shark into shallower waters, but he intentionally pushes the damaged engine past the safety limits and the overtaxed engine fails.\
With the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 \'a0slowly sinking, the trio attempt a riskier approach. Hooper puts on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scuba_set"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scuba gear}}\'a0and enters the water in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark-proof_cage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark-proof cage}}, intending to lethally inject the shark with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Strychnine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 strychnine}}, using a hypodermic spear. The shark demolishes the cage before Hooper can inject it, but he manages to escape to the seabed. The shark then attacks the boat directly and devours Quint. Trapped on the sinking vessel, Brody jams a pressurized scuba tank into the shark's mouth, and, climbing the crow's nest, shoots the tank with a rifle. The resulting explosion obliterates the shark. Hooper surfaces, and he and Brody paddle back to Amity Island clinging to the remaining barrels.\
Thirty years after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Civil War}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0has risen from the fallen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}\'a0and seeks to eliminate the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}. The Resistance, backed by the Republic and led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Leia Organa}}, opposes them while Leia searches for her brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}.\
On the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jakku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jakku}}, Resistance pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0receives a map to Luke's location from Lor San Tekka.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stormtrooper_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stormtroopers}}\'a0commanded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}\'a0destroy the village and capture Poe, while Kylo kills San Tekka. Poe's droid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}\'a0escapes with the map and encounters a scavenger,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}, near a junkyard settlement. Kylo tortures Poe using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0and learns of\'a0BB-8. Stormtrooper\'a0FN-2187, unwilling to kill for the First Order, frees Poe, and they escape in a stolen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE fighter}}; Poe names\'a0FN-2187\'a0"{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}}". As they turn back to Jakku to retrieve\'a0BB-8, they are shot down by a First Order\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0and crash-land. Finn survives and assumes that Poe died in the crash. He encounters Rey and\'a0BB-8, but the First Order tracks them and launches an airstrike. Finn, Rey, and\'a0BB-8\'a0flee the planet in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, which they steal from a junkyard.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by a larger ship piloted by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}, looking to reclaim their former vessel. The group is attacked by gangs seeking to settle debts with Han, and flee in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . At the First Order's Starkiller Base, a planet converted into a superweapon that harnesses star energy,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0allows\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Hux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Hux}}\'a0to use the weapon for the first time. Snoke questions Kylo's ability to deal with emotions relating to his father, Han Solo, who Kylo says means nothing to him.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0crew determines BB-8's map is incomplete. Han explains that Luke attempted to rebuild the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Order}}\'a0but exiled himself when an apprentice turned to the dark side, destroyed the temple, and slaughtered the other apprentices. The crew travels to the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Takodana"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Takodana}}\'a0and meets with cantina owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maz_Kanata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maz Kanata}}, who offers assistance getting\'a0BB-8\'a0to the Resistance. Rey is drawn to a secluded vault and finds the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}\'a0that once belonged to Luke and his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}. She experiences disturbing visions and flees into the woods. Maz gives Finn the lightsaber for safekeeping.\
Starkiller Base destroys a few planets including the Republic capital and a portion of its fleet. The First Order attacks Takodana in search of\'a0BB-8. Han, Chewbacca, and Finn are saved by Resistance\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing fighters}}\'a0led by Poe, who is revealed to have survived the crash on Jakku. Leia arrives at Takodana with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}\'a0and reunites with Han and Chewbacca. Meanwhile, Kylo captures Rey and takes her to Starkiller Base, but she resists his mind-reading attempts. Discovering she can use the Force, Rey escapes by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_mind_trick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi mind trick}}\'a0on a nearby guard.\
At the Resistance base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%27Qar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 D'Qar}}, BB-8 finds\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who has been inactive since Luke's disappearance. As Starkiller Base prepares to fire on D'Qar, the Resistance devises a plan to destroy it by attacking a critical facility. Using the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , Han, Chewbacca, and Finn infiltrate the facility, find Rey, and plant explosives. Han confronts Kylo, calling him by his birth name, Ben, and implores him to abandon the dark side. Kylo refuses and kills Han, enraging Chewbacca, who shoots Kylo and sets off the explosives, allowing the Resistance to attack and destroy the base.\
The injured Kylo pursues Finn and Rey to the surface. Kylo defeats Finn in a lightsaber duel, leaving him wounded. Rey takes the lightsaber and uses the Force to defeat Kylo before they are separated by a fissure as the planet begins to disintegrate. Snoke orders Hux to evacuate and bring Kylo to him to complete his training. Rey and Chewbacca escape with the unconscious Finn in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . On D'Qar, Leia, Chewbacca, and Rey mourn Han's death.\'a0R2-D2\'a0awakens and reveals the rest of the map, which Rey follows to the oceanic planet Ahch-To. She finds Luke and presents him with the lightsaber.\
The film follows two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/juxtaposed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 juxtaposed}}\'a0families. One is the Northern Stonemans:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abolitionism_in_the_United_States"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 abolitionist}}\'a0U.S. Representative Austin Stoneman (based on the Reconstruction-era Representative\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thaddeus_Stevens"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thaddeus Stevens}}),
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13][14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0his daughter, and two sons. The other is the Southern Camerons: Dr. Cameron, his wife, their three sons and two daughters. Phil, the elder Stoneman son, falls in love with Margaret Cameron, during the brothers' visit to the Cameron estate in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/South_Carolina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 South Carolina}}, representing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Old_South"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Old South}}. Meanwhile, young Ben Cameron idolizes a picture of Elsie Stoneman. During the Civil War, the young men from both families enlist in their respective armies for the war. The younger Stoneman and two of the Cameron brothers are killed in the war. Meanwhile, the Cameron women are rescued by Confederate soldiers who rout a black militia, after an attack on the Cameron home. Ben Cameron leads a heroic charge at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Siege_of_Petersburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Siege of Petersburg}}, earning the nickname of "the Little Colonel", but he is also wounded and captured. He is then taken to a Union hospital in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Washington,_D.C."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Washington, D.C.}}\
During his stay at the hospital, he is told that he will be hanged. Also at the hospital, he meets Elsie Stoneman, whose picture he has been carrying; she is working there as a nurse. Elsie takes Cameron's mother, who had traveled to Washington to tend her son, to see\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abraham_Lincoln"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abraham Lincoln}}, and Mrs. Cameron persuades the President to pardon Ben. When\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Assassination_of_Abraham_Lincoln"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lincoln is assassinated}}\'a0at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ford%27s_Theatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ford's Theatre}}, his conciliatory postwar policy expires with him. In the wake of the president's death, Austin Stoneman and other\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Radical_Republican"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Radical Republicans}}\'a0are determined to punish the South, employing harsh measures that Griffith depicts as having been typical of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reconstruction_Era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reconstruction Era}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [15]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Stoneman and his prot\'e9g\'e9 Silas Lynch, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychopath"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 psychopathic}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mulatto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mulatto}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0head to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/South_Carolina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 South Carolina}}\'a0to observe the implementation of Reconstruction policies firsthand. During the election, in which Lynch is elected lieutenant governor, blacks are observed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ballot_box_stuffing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stuffing the ballot boxes}}, while many whites are denied the vote. The newly elected, mostly black members of the South Carolina legislature are shown at their desks displaying inappropriate behavior, such as one member taking off his shoe and putting his feet up on his desk, and others drinking liquor and feasting on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fried_chicken#Racial_stereotype"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fried chicken}}.\
Meanwhile, inspired by observing white children pretending to be ghosts to scare black children, Ben fights back by forming the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ku Klux Klan}}. As a result, Elsie, out of loyalty to her father, breaks off her relationship with Ben. Later, Flora Cameron goes off alone into the woods to fetch water and is followed by Gus, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Freedman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 freedman}}\'a0and soldier who is now a captain. He confronts Flora and tells her that he desires to get married. Frightened, she flees into the forest, pursued by Gus. Trapped on a precipice, Flora warns Gus she will jump if he comes any closer. When he does, she leaps to her death. Having run through the forest looking for her, Ben has seen her jump; he holds her as she dies, then carries her body back to the Cameron home. In response, the Klan hunts down Gus, tries him, finds him guilty, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lynching"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lynches}}\'a0him.\
Lynch then orders a crackdown on the Klan after discovering Gus's murder. He also secures the passing of legislation allowing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Interracial_marriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mixed-race marriages}}. Dr. Cameron is arrested for possessing Ben's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan_regalia_and_insignia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Klan regalia}}, now considered a crime punishable by death. He is rescued by Phil Stoneman and a few of his black servants. Together with Margaret Cameron, they flee. When their wagon breaks down, they make their way through the woods to a small hut that is home to two sympathetic former Union soldiers who agree to hide them. An\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intertitle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intertitle}}\'a0states, "The former enemies of North and South are united again in defense of their\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aryan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aryan}}\'a0birthright."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Congressman Stoneman leaves to avoid being connected with Lt. Gov. Lynch's crackdown. Elsie, learning of Dr. Cameron's arrest, goes to Lynch to plead for his release. Lynch, who had been lusting after Elsie, tries to force her to marry him, which causes her to faint. Stoneman returns, causing Elsie to be placed in another room. At first, Stoneman is happy when Lynch tells him he wants to marry a white woman, but is then angered when Lynch tells him that it is Stoneman's daughter. Undercover Klansmen spies go to get help when they discover Elsie's plight after she breaks a window and cries out for help. Elsie falls unconscious again, and revives while gagged and being bound. The Klan, gathered together and with Ben leading them, rides in to gain control of the town. When news about Elsie reaches Ben, he and others go to her rescue. Elsie frees her mouth and screams for help. Lynch is captured. Victorious, the Klansmen celebrate in the streets. Meanwhile, Lynch's militia surrounds and attacks the hut where the Camerons are hiding. The Klansmen, with Ben at their head, race in to save them just in time. The next election day, blacks find a line of mounted and armed Klansmen just outside their homes, and are intimidated into not voting.\
The film concludes with a double wedding as Margaret Cameron marries Phil Stoneman and Elsie Stoneman marries Ben Cameron. The masses are shown oppressed by a giant warlike figure who gradually fades away. The scene shifts to another group finding peace under the image of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jesus_in_Christianity"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jesus Christ}}. The penultimate title is: "Dare we dream of a golden day when the bestial War shall rule no more. But instead \'97 the gentle Prince in the Hall of Brotherly Love in the City of Peace."\
This complex film consists of four distinct, but parallel, stories\'97intercut with increasing frequency as the film builds to a climax\'97that demonstrate humankind's persistent intolerance throughout the ages. The timeline covers approximately 2,500 years.\
Breaks between the differing time periods are marked by the symbolic image of a mother rocking a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cradle_(bed)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cradle}}, representing the passing of generations. The film simultaneously cross-cuts back and forth and interweaves the segments over great gaps of space and time, with over 50 transitions between the segments.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0One of the unusual characteristics of the film is that many of the characters do not have names. Griffith wished them to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Emblem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 emblematic}}\'a0of human types. Thus, the central female character in the modern story is called The Dear One. Her young husband is called The Boy, and the leader of the local\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mafia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mafia}}\'a0is called The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Musketeer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Musketeer}}\'a0of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Slum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Slums}}. Critics and film theorists maintain that these names reveal Griffith's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sentimentalism_(literature)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sentimentalism}}, which was already hinted at in\'a0
\f1\i The Birth of a Nation
\f0\i0 , with names such as\'a0
\f1\i The Little Colonel
\f0\i0 .\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 Because the film has been lost, the following summary is reconstructed from a description in a contemporary film magazine.
\f0\i0 \
Cleopatra (Bara), the Siren of Egypt, by a clever ruse reaches Caesar (Leiber) and he falls victim to her charms. They plan to rule the world together, but then Caesar falls. Cleopatra's life is desired by the church, as the wanton woman's rule has become intolerable. Pharon (Roscoe), a high priest, is given a sacred dagger to take her life. He gives her his love instead and, when she is in need of some money, leads her to the tomb of his ancestors, where she tears the treasure from the breast of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mummy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mummy}}. With this wealth she goes to Rome to meet Antony (Hall). He leaves the affairs of state and travels to Alexandria with her, where they revel. Antony is recalled to Rome and married to Octavia (Blinn), but his soul cries out for Cleopatra. He sends her a message to arm her ships and meet him at Actium, where they\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Actium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 battle}}\'a0the opposing forces. They are overpowered, and flee to Alexandria. There they are captured by Octavius (De Vries), and Antony dies in Cleopatra's arms. Before Cleopatra is to be dragged behind the wheels of Octavius' chariot, Pharon the priest, who has never ceased to love her, brings her the serpent that she joyously brings to her breast, dying royally with her crown on her head and scepter in her hand as becomes Egypt.\
Mickey (Normand) is an adult orphan who has been raised since girlhood in poverty near Feather River, California by an unsuccessful miner, Joe Meadows, and his housekeeper, Minnie. Mickey is the free-spirited, uncultured daughter of the miner's deceased partner. Meadows took charge of Mickey at his dying partner's request. Mickey is sent to live in Great Neck, Long Island\'97part of suburban\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}}\'97with her aunt (Mrs. Geoffrey Drake) and her family. Mrs. Drake is under the impression that Mickey is wealthy and well refined. When Mickey arrives at her aunt's luxurious home, the aunt is disappointed that she is not well-to-do and puts her to work as a servant. Mickey's presence there sparks an awkward love triangle involving her, her cousin (Elsie Drake), and young mining executive Herbert Thornhill (Wheeler Oakman) whom Mickey first encountered in California. Just after Mickey is sent packing, a telegram arrives for her announcing that a vein has been struck on Joe's Tomboy mine and she is suddenly worth millions. Mrs. Drake's opinion of Mickey changes quickly and she is welcomed back\'97in the hope she and Mrs Drake's feckless son, Reggie, will become a couple. Herbert had recently proposed to Elsie, but realizes he truly loves Mickey. Shortly afterward, Herbert receives a telegram from his lawyer, Tom Rawlings, explaining that his mining claims are now invalid and thus worthless. Elsie and Mrs. Drake find the telegram and call off the wedding because Herbert is now bankrupt. Herbert tries to regain his fortune by borrowing $5,000 and betting it on a horse race. The race is rigged\'97and Mickey finds out about the plot. Just as the race is about to begin, Mickey dresses in jockey silks, unhorses the crooked jockey, and tries to win the race by riding it for Herbert. Just as it appears Mickey's horse will win, she falls from her mount. Some time later Mickey reluctantly goes horseback riding with Reggie who tries to molest her in an abandoned house. Herbert arrives on the scene, battles Reggie, and rescues Mickey as she is dangling dangerously from the rooftop. Mickey and Herbert are married. As they depart on their honeymoon, a note arrives from lawyer Rawlings explaining the earlier telegram about his mining interests being worthless was a ruse designed to get Herbert out of his loveless engagement to Elsie Drake. The film ends with both Mickey and Herbert happily in love, wed, and exceedingly wealthy.\
The film takes place in a small,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New England}}\'a0town in 1919 (the Broadway play 1914), where a group of con men plan to use a faith healer to collect money.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chinatown,_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chinatown}}, four crooks conspire to swindle a small New England town. The gang consists of Tom Burke (Thomas Meighan), the head of the group; Rose (Betty Compson), a con artist posing as a street walker; "The Dope" (J.M. Dumont), who pretends to pimp Rose; and The Frog (Lon Chaney), a contortionist.\
The plan is clear: in a small town outside of Boston there is a Patriarch (Joseph Dowling) who has been healing people. The group heads to the town and plans to use the Patriarch in a faith healing scheme. When the townspeople gather to see the Patriarch heal the sick, the Frog is there, posing as a cripple. As he crawls to the path of the man, his limbs become straightened and soon he walks to the Patriarch, supposedly healed. Unexpectedly, a crippled boy, his faith in the Patriarch overpowering him, loses his crutches and runs to the Patriarch.\
The story spreads across the country (mostly on account of Burke), and people flock in from all over to visit the Patriarch and be healed. When a millionaire, Richard King (W. Lawson Butt), brings his sister to be healed, he gives Burke $50,000 after the Patriarch cures her. During this visit, King meets Rose, and the two fall in love.\
Meanwhile, all is not well with Burke. One by one, he sees his gang disbanding because, unbeknownst to him, the healing power of the Patriarch is at work. The Dope gives up his drug addiction, The Frog gives up his life of crime and takes care of a widow left all alone, and Rose laments King's departure.\
Burke becomes jealous, but when King returns to propose marriage to Rose, she realizes that she loves Burke. The Patriarch dies, and the two lovers begin anew.\
The rich, typified by the handsome man-about-town Lennox ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lowell_Sherman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lowell Sherman}}), are exceptionally selfish and think only of their own pleasure.\
Anna ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lillian_Gish"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lillian Gish}}) is a poor country girl whom Lennox tricks into a fake wedding. When she becomes pregnant, he leaves her. She has the baby, named Trust Lennox, on her own.\
When the baby dies she wanders until she gets a job with Squire Bartlett ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Burr_McIntosh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Burr McIntosh}}). David ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Richard_Barthelmess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Richard Barthelmess}}), Squire Bartlett's son, falls for her, but she rejects him due to her past. Then Lennox shows up lusting for another local girl, Kate. Seeing Anna, he tries to get her to leave, but she refuses to go, although she promises to say nothing about his past.\
Finally, Squire Bartlett learns of Anna's past from Martha, the town gossip. In his anger, he tosses Anna out into a snow storm. Before she goes, she fingers the respected Lennox as her despoiler and the father of her dead baby. Anna becomes lost in the raging storm while David leads a search party. In the famous climax, the unconscious Anna floats on an ice floe down a river towards a waterfall, until rescued at the last moment by David, who marries her in the final scene.\
Subplots relate the romances and eventual marriages of some of the picaresque characters inhabiting the village.\
Madariaga "The Centaur" (Pomeroy Cannon), a harsh but popular\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Argentina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Argentine}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Landowner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 landowner}}, has a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German}}\'a0son-in-law whom he dislikes and a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/France"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 French}}\'a0one whose family he openly favors. He is particularly fond of his grandson Julio ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rudolph_Valentino"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rudolph Valentino}}), with whom he often carouses at seedy dives in the Boca district of Buenos Aires. In one of these bars, the movie's famous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tango_(dance)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tango}}\'a0sequence occurs. A man and a woman (Beatrice Dominguez) are dancing the tango. Julio strides up and asks to cut in. The woman stares at Julio alluringly. The man brushes him off, and they resume dancing. Julio then challenges the man and strikes him, knocking him into some tables and out of the scene. Julio and the woman then dance a dramatic version of the tango that brings cheers from the people in the establishment. Following the dance, the woman sits on Julio's lap. Madariaga then slides to the floor, drunk. The woman laughs at Madariaga. Julio casts her aside in scorn and helps his grandfather home.\
Sometime later, Madariaga dies. The extended family breaks up, one half returning to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Germany}}\'a0and the other to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/France"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 France}}.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paris"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paris}}, Julio enjoys a somewhat shiftless life as a would-be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artist}}\'a0and sensation at the local tea dances. He falls in love with Marguerite Laurier ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alice_Terry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alice Terry}}), the unhappy and much younger wife (by an arranged marriage) of Etienne Laurier, a friend of Julio's father. The affair is discovered, and Marguerite's husband agrees to give her a divorce to avoid a scandal. It seems as though Julio and Marguerite will be able to marry, but both end up getting caught up in the start of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Great War}}.\
Marguerite becomes a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nurse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 nurse}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lourdes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lourdes}}. The bravery of Etienne is reported, and he is blinded in battle. Etienne happens to end up at the hospital where she is working, and Marguerite attends to him there. Julio travels to Lourdes to see Marguerite and instead sees her taking care of Etienne. Julio, ashamed of his wastrel life, enlists in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/French_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 French Army}}.\
In the meantime, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_Army_(German_Empire)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Army}}\'a0overruns Julio's father Marcelo's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marne_(river)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marne}}\'a0Valley castle in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Battle_of_the_Marne"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Battle of the Marne}}. Marcelo is forced to host a German general and staff in the castle. One of Marcelo's three German nephews is amongst the staff and tries to protect him, but Marcelo is arrested after a melee involving an officer's assault of a woman. Marcello is to be executed in the morning, but his life is spared when the French Army counterattacks in the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Battle_of_the_Marne"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miracle of the Marne}}". The castle is destroyed by the French counterattack.\
Four years later Julio has survived and become renowned for his bravery in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trench_warfare"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 trenches}}\'a0at the front. During a mission in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/No_man%27s_land"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 no man's land}}, he encounters his last surviving German cousin. Moments later, they are both killed by a shell. Back in Paris, Marguerite considers abandoning the blinded Etienne, but Julio's ghost guides her to continue her care for him.\
The ending scene shows Marcelo Desnoyers mourning over his son's grave. The man who lived upstairs from Julio watches over him. Marcelo asks him, "Did you know my son?" The man, with a remorseful expression, lifts his arms, forming the shape of a cross with his body, and says "I knew them all!" He then points to the sky and shows Marcelo the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Four_Horsemen_of_the_Apocalypse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse}}\'a0riding away into the clouds. With this, the man assures him that "Peace has come\'97but the Four Horsemen will still ravage humanity\'97stirring unrest in the world\'97until all hatred is dead and only love reigns in the heart of mankind."\
The opening has the dashing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earl_of_Huntingdon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earl of Huntingdon}}\'a0besting his bitter enemy, Sir Guy of Gisbourne, in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jousting"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 joust}}. Huntingdon then joins\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Richard_I_of_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Richard the Lion-Hearted}}, who is going off to fight in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crusade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Crusades}}\'a0and has left his brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_of_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Prince John}}, as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Regent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 regent}}. The prince soon emerges as a cruel, treacherous tyrant. Goaded on by Sir Guy, he usurps Richard's throne. When Huntingdon receives a message from Lady Marian Fitzwalter, his love interest, telling him of all that has transpired, he requests permission to return to England. King Richard assumes that the Earl has turned coward and denies him permission. The Earl seeks to leave in spite of this, but is ambushed by Sir Guy and imprisoned as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Deserter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 deserter}}. Upon escaping from his confines, he returns to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 England}}, endangering his life and honor, to oppose Prince John and restore King Richard's throne. He finds himself and his friends outlawed and Marian apparently dead.\
Huntingdon returns to Nottingham and adopts the name of Robin Hood, acrobatic champion of the oppressed. Leading a band that steals from the rich to give to the poor, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Friar_Tuck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Friar Tuck}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Little_John"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Little John}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Will_Scarlet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Will Scarlet}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alan-a-Dale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alan-a-Dale}}, he labors to set things right through swashbuckling feats and makes life miserable for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_of_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Prince John}}\'a0and his cohort, the High Sheriff of Nottingham. After rescuing Marian from Prince John's prison and defeating Sir Guy in a final conflict, Robin is captured. The timely reappearance of King Richard returns him to Marian and foils the efforts of Prince John.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f2\b \cf2 Cast notes
\f0\b0 \
At the instigation of his half brother Lionel ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lloyd_Hughes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lloyd Hughes}}), Oliver Tressilian ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Milton_Sills"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Milton Sills}}), a wealthy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baronet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 baronet}}, is shanghaied and blamed for the death of Peter Godolphin ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wallace_MacDonald"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wallace MacDonald}}), brother of Oliver's fianc\'e9e, whom Lionel actually has slain. At sea Oliver is captured by Spaniards and made a galley slave, but when he escapes to the Moors he becomes Sakr-el-Bahr, the scourge of Christendom. Learning of Rosamund's ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Enid_Bennett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Enid Bennett}}) impending marriage to his half brother, he kidnaps both of them, but to avoid the risk of giving her to Asad-ed-Din ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Currier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Currier}}), the Basha of Algiers, he surrenders to a British ship. Rosamund intercedes to save his life, and following the death of Lionel they are married.\
In the United States in 1917, James "Jim" Apperson's ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Gilbert_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Gilbert}}) idleness (in contrast to his hardworking brother) incurs the great displeasure of his wealthy businessman father. Then America enters World War I. Jim informs his worried mother that he has no intention of enlisting, and his father threatens to kick him out of the house if he does not join. However, when he runs into his patriotic friends at a send-off parade, he is persuaded to enlist, making his father very proud.\
During training, Jim makes friendships with Southern construction worker Slim ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Karl_Dane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Karl Dane}}) and Bronx bartender Bull (Tom O'Brien). Their unit ships out to France, where they are billeted at a farm in the village of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Champillon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Champillon}}\'a0in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marne_(department)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marne}}.\
All three men are attracted to Melisande ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ren%C3%A9e_Ador%C3%A9e"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ren\'e9e Ador\'e9e}}), whose mother owns the farm. She repulses all their advances, but gradually warms to Jim, bonding at first over\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewing_gum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chewing gum}}. They eventually fall in love, despite not being able to speak\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/French_language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 each other's language}}. One day, however, Jim receives a letter and a photograph from Justyn ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Claire_Adams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Claire Adams}}), which reveals that they are engaged. When Melisande sees the picture, she realizes the situation and runs off in tears. Before Jim can decide what to do, his unit is ordered to the front. Melisande hears the commotion and races back, just in time for the lovers to embrace and kiss.\
The Americans march towards the front and are\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Strafing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 strafed}}\'a0by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Attack_aircraft#World_War_I_and_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 enemy fighter}}\'a0before it is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anti-aircraft_warfare#First_World_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shot down}}. The unit is sent to the attack immediately, advancing against snipers and machine guns in the woods, then more machine guns, artillery, and poison gas in the open. They settle down in a makeshift line. Jim shelters in a shellhole with Slim and Bull.\
That night, orders come down for one man to go out and eliminate a troublesome mortar crew; Slim wins a spitting contest for the opportunity. He succeeds, but is spotted and wounded on the way back. After listening to Slim's pleas for help, Jim cannot stand it any longer and goes to his rescue against orders. Bull follows, but is shot and killed. By the time Jim reaches Slim, he is already dead. Jim is then shot in the leg. When a German ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Beranger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Beranger}}) comes to finish him off, Jim shoots and wounds him. The German starts crawling back to his line. Jim catches up to him in another shellhole, but, face to face, cannot bring himself to finish him off with his bayonet. Instead, he gives his erstwhile enemy a cigarette. Soon after, the German dies. However, Jim is not stuck in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/No_man%27s_land"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 no man's land}}\'a0for long; the Americans attack, and he is taken away to a hospital.\
From another patient, he learns that Champillon has changed hands four times. Worried about Melisande, Jim sneaks out of the hospital and hitches a ride. When he gets to the farmhouse, he finds it damaged and empty. Melisande and her mother have joined a stream of refugees. Jim collapses and is carried off in an ambulance by retreating soldiers.\
After the war ends, Jim goes home to America. Before he arrives, his mother overhears Justyn and Jim's brother Harry (Robert Ober) discussing what to do; in Jim's absence, they have fallen in love. When Jim appears, it is revealed that he has had his leg amputated. Later, Jim tells his mother about Melisande; she tells him to go back and find her. When he returns to the farm, Melisande rushes into his arms.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Judah_Ben-Hur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ben-Hur}}\'a0is a wealthy young Jewish prince and boyhood friend of the powerful Roman\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tribune"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tribune}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Messala_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Messala}}. When an accident and a false accusation leads to Ben-Hur's arrest, Messala, who has become corrupt and arrogant, makes sure Ben-Hur and his family are jailed and separated.\
Ben-Hur is sentenced to slave labor in a Roman war\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 galley}}. Along the way, he unknowingly encounters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jesus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jesus}}, the carpenter's son who offers him water. Once aboard ship, his attitude of defiance and strength impresses a Roman admiral,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quintus_Arrius_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quintus Arrius}}, who allows him to remain unchained. This actually works in the admiral's favor because when his ship is attacked and sunk by pirates, Ben-Hur saves him from drowning.\
Arrius then treats Ben-Hur as a son, and over the years the young man grows strong and becomes a victorious\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chariot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chariot}}\'a0racer. This eventually leads to a climactic showdown with Messala in a chariot race, in which Ben-Hur is the victor. However, Messala does not die, as he does in the more famous 1959 remake of the film.\
Ben-Hur is eventually reunited with his mother and sister, who are suffering from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leprosy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 leprosy}}\'a0but are miraculously cured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jesus_Christ"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jesus Christ}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Millionaire J. Harold Manners ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harold_Lloyd"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harold Lloyd}}) finds himself in the poor part of town one day. When he accidentally sets fire to a charity\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Food_cart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pushcart}}\'a0dispensing free coffee and owned by do-gooder Brother Paul ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paul_Weigel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paul Weigel}}), he pulls out his checkbook to cover the damage. Brother Paul, who was talking to another person about his dream to build a mission, assumes he wants to pay for the mission and tells him $1000. Though he finds that a rather hefty amount for a mere pushcart, Manners pays without complaint.\
Once Manners reads in the newspaper that he is sponsoring a mission, he goes there to dissociate himself from it. He is aghast to find it named the J. Harold Manners Mission. When he starts to tear down the sign, he is scolded by Brother Paul's pretty daughter, Hope ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jobyna_Ralston"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jobyna Ralston}}), who does not know who he is. Far from being offended, he is smitten with her. Thus, when Brother Paul returns and invites him inside to tour the place, he readily accepts. Hope, once she learns his identity, apologizes.\
In order to build up attendance, Manners runs through town provoking people, and winds up with a crowd chasing him right into the mission. Some of the men are in possession of the proceeds of a jewel robbery. Before they can beat him up, however, the police arrive. The quick-witted Manners takes up a "collection"; the crooks deposit their loot in the hat he is using while the police search everybody. This act earns him the friendship of the gang.\
He eventually wins the girl and they decide to get married at the mission. His high-brow friends decide to kidnap him, believing they are saving him from a terrible mistake. As they drive away, one of them tells the wedding's "reception committee" that Manners is not going to marry Hope. The disappointed committeemen get drunk. Then their leader decides to go to Manner's club to confirm the news. They free Manners and head back to the mission. Manners has his hands full shepherding five drunks, but finally gets them all there and marries Hope.\
Jack Powell and David Armstrong are rivals in the same small American town, both vying for the attentions of pretty Sylvia Lewis. Jack fails to realize that "the girl next door", Mary Preston, is desperately in love with him. The two young men both enlist to become combat pilots in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Army_Air_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Air Service}}. When they leave for training camp, Jack mistakenly believes Sylvia prefers him. She actually prefers David and lets him know about her feelings, but is too kindhearted to turn down Jack's affection.\
Jack and David are\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Billet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 billeted}}\'a0together. Their tent mate is Cadet White, but their acquaintance is all too brief; White is killed in an air crash the same day. Undaunted, the two men endure a rigorous training period, where they go from being enemies to best friends. Upon graduating, they are shipped off to France to fight the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Germans}}.\
Mary joins the war effort by becoming an ambulance driver. She later learns of Jack's reputation as the ace known as "The Shooting Star" and encounters him while on leave in Paris. She finds him, but he is too drunk to recognize her. She puts him to bed, but when two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Military_police"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 military police}}\'a0barge in while she is innocently changing from a borrowed dress back into her uniform in the same room, she is forced to resign and return to the United States.\
The climax of the story comes with the epic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Saint-Mihiel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Saint-Mihiel}}. David is shot down and presumed dead. However, he survives the crash landing, steals a German\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biplane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 biplane}}, and heads for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Allied}}\'a0lines. By a tragic stroke of bad luck, Jack spots the enemy aircraft and, bent on avenging his friend, begins an attack. He is successful in downing the aircraft and lands to retrieve a souvenir of his victory. The owner of the land where David's aircraft crashed urges Jack to come to the dying man's side. He agrees and becomes distraught when he realizes what he has done. David consoles him and before he dies, forgives his comrade.\
At the war's end, Jack returns home to a hero's welcome. He visits David's grieving parents to return his friend's effects. During the visit he begs their forgiveness for causing David's death. Mrs. Armstrong says it is not Jack who is responsible for her son's death, but the war. Then, Jack is reunited with Mary and realizes he loves her.\
After years of hopeful struggle, Al Stone (Jolson) is on his way. "I'm Sittin' on Top of the World", he sings to an appreciative speakeasy crowd. But, as Al discovers, getting there is one thing. Staying there is another. Singing waiter Stone gets his huge break on a magical night when his song wows a big-time producer\'a0
\f1\i and
\f0\i0 \'a0a gold-digging showgirl he fancies. Broadway success and marriage follow, but sure enough, hard times are on the way. Al's fickle wife abandons him, taking the beloved son he calls Sonny Boy with her. Heartbroken, Al becomes a devastated loner until friends from the speakeasy that launched his career rescue him from a life on the streets. Soon, Al is back in lights. But another crisis awaits: Sonny Boy is in the hospital and dying.\
Eddie Kearns ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charles_King_(musical_actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charles King}}) sings "The Broadway Melody", and tells some chorus girls that he brought the Mahoney Sisters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vaudeville"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vaudeville}}\'a0act to New York to perform it with him in the latest revue being produced by Francis Zanfield ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eddie_Kane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eddie Kane}}). Harriet "Hank" Mahoney ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bessie_Love"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bessie Love}}) and her sister Queenie Mahoney ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anita_Page"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anita Page}}) are awaiting Eddie's arrival at their apartment. Hank, the older sister, prides herself on her business sense and talent, while Queenie is lauded for her beauty. Hank is confident they will make it big while Queenie is less eager to put everything on the line to become a star. Hank declines the offer of their Uncle Jed ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jed_Prouty"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jed Prouty}}) to join a 30-week traveling show but consents to think it over.\
Eddie, who is engaged to Hank, arrives and sees Queenie for the first time since she was a girl and is instantly taken with her. He tells them to come to a rehearsal for Zanfield's revue to present their act. A blond woman sabotages their performance by placing a bag in the piano, which causes a fight with Hank. Zanfield isn't interested in it, but says he might have a use for Queenie, who begs him to give Hank a part as well, saying both will work for one wage. She also convinces him to pretend that Hank's business skills won him over. Eddie witnesses this exchange and becomes even more enamored of Queenie for her devotion to her sister. During a dress rehearsal for the revue, Zanfield says the pacing is too slow for "The Broadway Melody" and cuts Hank and Queenie from the number. Meanwhile, another woman is injured after falling off a set prop and Queenie is selected to replace her. Nearly everyone is captivated by Queenie, particularly notorious playboy Jacques "Jock" Warriner ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kenneth_Thomson_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kenneth Thomson}}). While Jock begins to woo Queenie, Hank is upset that Queenie is building her success on her looks rather than her talent.\
Over the following weeks, Queenie spends a lot of time with Jock, of which Hank and Eddie fervently disapprove. They forbid her to see him, which results in Queenie pushing them away and the deterioration of the relationship between the sisters. Queenie is only with Jock to fight her growing feelings for Eddie, but Hank thinks she's setting herself up to be hurt. Eventually, Eddie and Queenie confess their love for each other, but Queenie, unwilling to break her sister's heart, runs off to Jock once again.\
Hank, after witnessing Queenie's fierce outburst toward Eddie and his devastated reaction to it, finally realizes that they are in love. She berates Eddie for letting Queenie run away and tells him to go after her. She claims to never have loved him and that she'd only been using him to advance her career. After he leaves, she breaks down and alternates between sobs and hysterical laughter. She composes herself enough to call Uncle Jed to accept the job with the 30-week show.\
There's a raucous party at the apartment Jock had recently purchased for Queenie, but he insists that they spend time alone. When she resists his advances, he says that it's the least that she could do after all he's done for her. He begins to get physical, but Eddie bursts in and attempts to fight Jock, who knocks him through the door with one punch. Queenie runs to Eddie and leaves Jock and the party behind.\
Sometime later, Hank and Uncle Jed await the return of Queenie and Eddie from their honeymoon. The relationship between the sisters is on the mend, but there is obvious discomfort between Hank and Eddie. Queenie announces she's through with show business and will settle down in their new house on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Long_Island,_New_York"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Long Island}}. She insists that Hank live with them when her job is over. After Hank leaves with her new partner and Uncle Jed, Queenie laments the fact that she wasn't able to help her sister find the happiness she deserves. Ironically, Hank's new partner is the blond who tried to sabotage the act when the sisters first arrived in New York. The final scene shows Hank on her way to the train station. She promises her new partner that they'll be back on Broadway within six months.\
The film centres around a\'a0
\f1\i Will-they won't-they
\f0\i0 \'a0romance. Wealthy Jack Cromwell from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Long_Island"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Long Island}}\'a0runs off to New York City on account of his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fiancee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fiancee}}'s relentless flirting. He attends an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Independence_Day_(United_States)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Independence Day}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Block_party"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 block party}}where Molly Carr, from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yorkville,_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yorkville, Manhattan}}, falls in love with him. Comic relief is provided by grocer Eric Swenson, above whose shop Molly and her flatmate, Bea Nichols, live.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3][4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Gaynor performs a charming singing and dancing version of the song "(Keep Your) Sunny Side Up" for a crowd of her neighbors, complete with top hat and cane. Later in the film, a lavish pre-Code dance sequence for the song "Turn on the Heat", including scantily clad and gyrating island women enticing bananas on trees to abruptly grow and stiffen, with the graphic metaphor lost on no one, occurs without Gaynor's participation.\
Professor Kantorek gives an impassioned speech about the glory of serving in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_Army_(German_Empire)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Army}}\'a0and "saving the Fatherland". On the brink of becoming men, the boys in his class, led by Paul Baumer, are moved to join the army as the new 2nd Company. Their romantic delusions are quickly broken during their brief but rigorous training under the abusive Corporal Himmelstoss, who bluntly informs them, "You're going to be soldiers\'97and that's\'a0
\f1\i all
\f0\i0 ."\
The new soldiers arrive by train at the combat zone, which is mayhem, with soldiers everywhere, incoming shells, horse-drawn wagons racing about, and prolonged rain. One in the group is killed before the new recruits can reach their post, to the alarm of one of the new soldiers (Behn). The new soldiers are assigned to a unit composed of older soldiers, who are not exactly accommodating. The young soldiers find that there is no food available at the moment. They have not eaten since breakfast, but the men they have joined have not had food for two days. One of them, "Kat" Katczinsky, had gone to locate something to eat and he returns with a slaughtered hog he has stolen from a field kitchen. The young soldiers "pay" for their dinner with soaps and cigarettes.\
The new recruits' first trip to the trenches with the veterans, to re-string barbed wire, is a harrowing experience, especially when Behn is blinded by shrapnel and hysterically runs into machine-gun fire. After spending several days in a bunker under bombardment, they at last move into the trenches and successfully repulse an enemy attack; they then counterattack and take an enemy trench with heavy casualties, but have to abandon it. They are sent back to the field kitchens to get their rations; each man receives double helpings, simply because of the number of dead.\
The men start out eating greedily, but then settle into a satiated\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/torpor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 torpor}}. They hear that they are to return to the front the next day and begin a semi-serious discussion about the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Origins_of_World_War_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 causes of the war}}\'a0and of wars in general. They speculate about whether geographical entities offend each other and whether these disagreements involve them. Tjaden speaks familiarly about himself and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wilhelm_II,_German_Emperor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kaiser}}; Kat jokes that instead of having a war, they should have the leaders of Europe be stripped to their underwear and "fight it out with clubs".\
One day, Corporal Himmelstoss arrives to the front and is immediately spurned because of his bad reputation; he is forced to go over the top with the 2nd Company and is promptly killed. In an attack on a cemetery, Paul stabs a French soldier, but finds himself trapped in a hole with the dying man for an entire night. Throughout the night, he desperately tries to help him, bringing him water, but fails miserably to stop him from dying. He cries bitterly and begs the dead body to speak so he can be forgiven. Later, he returns to the German lines and is comforted by Kat.\
Going back to the front line, Paul is severely wounded and taken to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Catholic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Catholic}}\'a0hospital, along with his good friend Albert Kropp. Kropp's leg is amputated, but he does not find out until some time afterwards. Around this time, Paul is taken to the bandaging ward, from which, according to its reputation, nobody has ever returned alive; but he later returns to the normal rooms triumphantly, only to find Kropp in depression.\
Paul is given a furlough and visits his family at home. He is shocked by how uninformed everyone is about the actual situation of the war; everyone is convinced that a final "push for Paris" is soon to occur. When Paul visits the schoolroom where he was originally recruited, he finds Professor Kantorek prattling the same patriotic fervor to a class of even younger students. Professor Kantorek asks of Paul to detail his experience, to which the latter reveals that war was not at all like he had envisioned and mentions the deaths of his partners; this revelation upsets the professor, as well as the young students who promptly call Paul a "coward". Disillusioned and angry, Paul returns to the front and comes upon another 2nd company that is filled with new young recruits who are now disillusioned; he is then happily greeted by Tjaden.
