"Doc" ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Powell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Powell}}), the ship's doctor and Roberts' friend, confides to him that the crew risked court-martial by submitting a transfer request with Morton's forged\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Imprimatur#Other_senses"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 imprimatur}}. Before he leaves, the crew presents Roberts with a handmade medal, the Order of the Palm, for "action against the enemy".\
Several weeks later, Pulver, who has been appointed cargo officer, receives a couple of letters. The first is from Roberts, who speaks enthusiastically about his new assignment aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 destroyer}}\'a0USS\'a0
\f1\i Livingston
\f0\i0 \'a0during the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Okinawa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Okinawa}}. He goes on to say that he would rather have the Order of the Palm than the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Medal_of_Honor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Medal of Honor}}. The second letter is from a college classmate of Pulver's who is also assigned to the\'a0
\f1\i Livingston
\f0\i0 , which reveals that Roberts was killed in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kamikaze"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 kamikaze}}\'a0attack shortly after the first letter had been posted.\
Incensed, Pulver throws the captain\'92s replacement palm tree overboard. He then marches into Morton's cabin, openly bragging about it and brazenly demanding to know why Morton has cancelled the showing of a film that night. Morton slowly shakes his head, realizing that his problems have not gone away.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pharaoh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pharaoh}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ramesses_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rameses I}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_Egypt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Egypt}}\'a0orders the death of all newborn\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Israelites"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hebrew}}\'a0males.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jochebed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoshebel}}\'a0saves her infant son by setting him adrift in a basket on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nile"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nile}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bithiah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bithiah}}, the Pharaoh's daughter, finds the basket and decides to adopt the boy even though her servant, Memnet, recognizes the child is Hebrew. Bithiah names the baby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Moses"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Moses}}.\
Prince Moses grows up to become a successful general, winning a war with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethiopia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ethiopia}}\'a0and establishing an alliance. Moses and princess\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nefertari"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nefretiri}}\'a0fall in love, but she must marry the next Pharaoh. While working on the building of a city for Pharaoh\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Seti_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sethi}}'s jubilee, Moses meets the stonecutter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joshua"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joshua}}, who tells him of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yahweh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hebrew God}}. Moses saves an elderly woman from being crushed not knowing that she is his biological mother, Yoshebel, and he reprimands the taskmaster and overseer Baka.\
Moses reforms the treatment of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Slaves"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 slaves}}\'a0on the project, but Prince\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ramesses_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rameses}}, Moses's adoptive brother, charges him with planning an insurrection. Moses says he is making his workers more productive, making Rameses wonder if Moses is the man the Hebrews are calling the Deliverer.\
Nefretiri learns from Memnet that Moses is the son of Hebrew slaves. She kills Memnet but reveals the story to Moses only after he finds the piece of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Levite"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Levite}}\'a0cloth he was wrapped in as a baby, which Memnet had kept. Moses follows Bithiah to Yoshebel's house where he meets his biological mother, Brother Aaron, and Sister Miriam.\
Moses learns more about the slaves by working with them. Nefretiri urges him to return to the palace so he may help his people when he becomes pharaoh, to which he agrees after he completes a final task. Moses saves Joshua from death by killing Baka, telling Joshua that he too is Hebrew. The confession is witnessed by the overseer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dathan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dathan}}, who then reports to Rameses. After being arrested, Moses explains that he is not the Deliverer, but would free the slaves if he could. Sethi banishes Moses to the desert leaving Rameses as the sole heir. Yoshebel dies sometime later.\
Moses makes his way across the desert to a well in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Midian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Midian}}. After defending seven sisters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amalekites"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amalekites}}, Moses is housed with the girls' father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jethro_(Bible)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jethro}}, a Bedouin sheik, who worships the God of Abraham. Moses marries Jethro's eldest daughter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zipporah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sephora}}. Later, he finds Joshua, who has escaped hard labor. While farming, Moses sees the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Burning_bush"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 burning bush}}\'a0on the summit of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mount_Sinai"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mount Sinai}}\'a0and hears the voice of God. Moses returns to Egypt to free the Hebrews.\
Moses comes before Rameses, now pharaoh, to win the slaves' freedom, turning his staff into a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cobra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cobra}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jannes_and_Jambres"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jannes}}\'a0performs the same trick with his staves, but Moses's snake swallows his. Rameses prohibits straw from being provided to the Hebrews to make their bricks. Nefretiri rescues Moses from being stoned to death by the Hebrews wherein he reveals that he is married.\
Egypt is visited by plagues. Moses turns the river Nile to blood at a festival of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Khnum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Khnum}}\'a0and brings burning hail down upon Pharaoh's palace. Moses warns him the next plague to fall upon Egypt will be summoned by Pharaoh himself. Enraged at the plagues, Rameses orders all first-born Hebrews to die, but a cloud of death instead kills all the firstborn of Egypt, including the child of Rameses and Nefretiri. Angrily, Pharaoh exiles the Hebrews, which begins\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Exodus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Exodus}}\'a0from Egypt.\
Rameses takes his army and pursues the Hebrews to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Sea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Sea}}. Moses uses God's help to stop the Egyptians with a pillar of fire and parts the Red Sea. After the Hebrews make it to safety, Moses releases the walls of water, drowning the Egyptian army. A devastated Rameses returns empty-handed to Nefretiri, stating that he now acknowledges Moses's god as God.\
Moses again ascends the mountain with Joshua. Impatiently, Dathan urges a reluctant Aaron to construct a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golden_calf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 golden calf}}\'a0idol as a gift for Rameses. A wild and decadent orgy is held by most of the Hebrews.\
Moses sees the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ten_Commandments"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ten Commandments}}\'a0created by God in two stone tablets. Moses descends from the mountain to the sight of decadence. Enraged, he throws the tablets at the golden calf, which explodes, killing the wicked revelers, and causing the others to wander in the wilderness for 40 years.\
Forty years later, an elderly Moses leads the Hebrews towards\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Canaan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Canaan}}. However, he could not enter the Promised land due to his disobedience to the Lord at the Waters of Strife. He instead names Joshua as leader, and spends the rest of his life at Mount Nebo until his death.\
In early 1943, British\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prisoner_of_war"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 POWs}}\'a0arrive by train at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Empire_of_Japan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Japanese}}\'a0prison camp in Burma. The commandant, Colonel Saito, informs them that all prisoners, regardless of rank, are to work on the construction of a railway bridge over the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Khwae_Yai_River"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 River Kwai}}\'a0that will connect Bangkok and Rangoon. The senior British officer, Lieutenant Colonel Nicholson, informs Saito that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Geneva_Convention_(1929)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Geneva Conventions}}\'a0exempt officers from manual labour. Nicholson later forbids any escape attempts because they had been ordered by headquarters to surrender, and escapes could be seen as defiance of orders.\
At the morning assembly, Nicholson orders his officers to remain behind when the enlisted men march off to work. Saito threatens to have them shot, but Nicholson refuses to back down. When Major Clipton, the British medical officer, warns Saito there are too many witnesses for him to get away with murder, Saito leaves the officers standing all day in the intense heat. That evening, the officers are placed in a punishment hut, while Nicholson is locked in an iron box.\
Meanwhile, three prisoners attempt to escape. Two are shot dead, but\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Navy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United States Navy}}\'a0Commander Shears gets away, although badly wounded. He stumbles into a village of natives, who nurse him back to health and then help him leave by boat.\
Meanwhile, the prisoners work as little as possible and sabotage whatever they can. Should Saito fail to meet his deadline, he would be obliged to commit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Seppuku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ritual suicide}}. Desperate, he uses the anniversary of Japan's victory in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Russo-Japanese_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Russo-Japanese War}}\'a0as an excuse to save face and announces a general amnesty, releasing Nicholson and his officers and exempting them from manual labour.\
Nicholson is shocked by the poor job being done by his men. Over the protests of some of his officers, he orders Captain Reeves and Major Hughes to design and build a proper bridge to maintain his men's morale. As the Japanese engineers had chosen a poor site, the original construction is abandoned and a new bridge begun downstream.\
Shears is enjoying his hospital stay in Ceylon when British Major Warden invites him to join a mission to destroy the bridge before it is completed. Shears is so appalled, he confesses he is not an officer; he impersonated one, expecting better treatment from the Japanese. Warden responds that he already knew and that the American Navy agreed to transfer him to the British to avoid embarrassment. Realising he has no choice, Shears volunteers.\
Meanwhile, Nicholson drives his men hard to complete the bridge on time. For him, its completion will exemplify the ingenuity and hard work of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/British_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British Army}}\'a0long after the war's end. When he asks that their Japanese counterparts pitch in as well, a resigned Saito replies that he has already given the order. Clipton expresses grave doubts about the sanity of Colonel Nicholson's efforts to build the bridge in order to show up his Japanese captors.\
The four commandos parachute in, though one is killed on landing. Later, Warden is wounded in an encounter with a Japanese patrol and has to be carried on a litter. He, Shears, and Canadian Lieutenant Joyce reach the river in time with the assistance of Siamese women bearers and their village chief, Khun Yai. Under cover of darkness, Shears and Joyce plant explosives on the bridge towers below the water line.\
A train carrying important dignitaries and soldiers is scheduled to be the first to cross the bridge the following day, so Warden waits to destroy both. However, by daybreak the water level has dropped, exposing the wire connecting the explosives to the detonator. Nicholson spots the wire and brings it to Saito's attention. As the train approaches, they hurry down to the riverbank to investigate.\
Joyce, manning the detonator, breaks cover and stabs Saito to death. Nicholson yells for help, while attempting to stop Joyce from reaching the detonator. When Joyce is mortally wounded by Japanese fire, Shears swims across the river, but is himself shot. Recognising the dying Shears, Nicholson exclaims, "What have I done?" Warden fires a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mortar_(weapon)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mortar}}, wounding Nicholson. The dying colonel stumbles towards the detonator and collapses on the plunger just in time to blow up the bridge and send the train hurtling into the river below. Warden turns toward the only survivors of the commando raid, the women bearers, and begs their forgiveness for having to kill Joyce and Shears, and throws the mortar launcher away in disgust, and prepares to leave. Clipton, observing the carnage, shakes his head muttering, "Madness!, Madness!".\
In AD 26,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Judah_Ben-Hur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Judah Ben-Hur}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charlton_Heston"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charlton Heston}}) is a wealthy Jewish prince and merchant in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jerusalem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jerusalem}}, who lives with his mother, Miriam ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Martha_Scott"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Martha Scott}}); his sister, Tirzah ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cathy_O%27Donnell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cathy O'Donnell}}); and their female servant Amrah (Stella Vitelleschi). The family's loyal slave, the merchant Simonides ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sam_Jaffe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Jaffe}}), pays a visit with his daughter,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Esther_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Esther}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Haya_Harareet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Haya Harareet}}). Judah and Esther fall in love at first sight, but she is bethrothed to another. Judah's childhood friend, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_citizenship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman citizen}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Messala_(Ben-Hur)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Messala}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Boyd"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Boyd}}), is now a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Military_tribune"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tribune}}. After several years away from Jerusalem, Messala returns as the new commander of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Roman_legions#Early_Empire_legions"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman garrison}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Antonia_Fortress"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fortress of Antonia}}. Messala believes in the glory of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rome and its imperial power}}, while Judah is devoted to his faith and the freedom of the Jewish people. This difference causes tension between the friends, and results in their split after Messala issues an ultimatum demanding that Judah deliver potential rebels amongst the populace to the Roman authorities.\
During the parade for the new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prefect"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 governor}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iudaea_Province"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Judea}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valerius_Gratus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Valerius Gratus}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mino_Doro"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mino Doro}}), loose tiles fall from the roof of Judah's house. Gratus is thrown from his spooked horse and nearly killed. Although Messala knows this was an accident, he condemns Judah to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galley_slave"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 galleys}}\'a0and imprisons Miriam and Tirzah due to his residual anger at Judah for his refusal to help. By punishing a known friend and prominent citizen, he hopes to intimidate the Jewish populace. Judah swears to take revenge on Messala. As he and other slaves are being marched to the galleys, they stop in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazareth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nazareth}}\'a0to water the Romans' horses. Desperate with thirst, Judah begs for water, but the commander of the Roman detachment denies it to him. He collapses, but is revived when Jesus of Nazareth ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Claude_Heater"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Claude Heater}}) gives him water. After three years as a galley slave, Judah is assigned to the flagship of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_Consul#Under_the_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman Consul}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quintus_Arrius_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quintus Arrius}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Hawkins"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jack Hawkins}}), who has been charged with destroying a fleet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Macedon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Macedonian}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pirates"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pirates}}. Arrius admires Judah's determination and self-discipline, and offers to train him as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gladiator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gladiator}}\'a0or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chariot_racing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 charioteer}}. Judah declines the offer, declaring that God will aid him in his quest for vengeance. When the Roman fleet encounters the Macedonians, Arrius orders all the rowers except Judah to be chained to their oars. Arrius' galley is rammed and sunk, but Judah unchains the other rowers and rescues Arrius. In despair, Arrius wrongly believes the battle ended in defeat and attempts to atone in the Roman way by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Suicide#Ritual_suicide"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 falling on his sword}}, but Judah stops him. They are rescued, and Arrius is credited with the Roman fleet's victory. Arrius successfully petitions Emperor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tiberius"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tiberius}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Relph"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Relph}}) to free Judah, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adoption_in_ancient_Rome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 adopts him as his son}}.\
Another year passes. Wealthy again, Judah learns\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Culture_of_ancient_Rome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman ways}}\'a0and becomes a champion charioteer, but still longs for his family and homeland. Judah returns to Judea. Along the way, he meets\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biblical_Magi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Balthasar}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finlay_Currie"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finlay Currie}}) and an Arab,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sheik_Ilderim"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sheik Ilderim}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hugh_Griffith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hugh Griffith}}). After noting Judah's prowess as a charioteer, the sheik asks him to drive his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quadriga"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quadriga}}\'a0in a race before the new governor of Judea,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pontius_Pilate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pontius Pilate}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Thring"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Thring}}). Judah declines, even after he learns that Messala will also compete. Judah returns to his home in Jerusalem. He meets Esther, and learns her arranged marriage did not occur and that she is still in love with him. He visits Messala and demands his mother and sister's freedom. The Romans discover that Miriam and Tirzah have contracted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leprosy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 leprosy}}\'a0in prison, and expel them from the city. The women beg Esther to conceal their condition from Judah so that he may remember them as they were before, so she tells him that they died. This false revelation changes Judah's mind, and he decides to seek vengeance on Messala by competing against him in the chariot race. During the chariot race, Messala drives a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scythed_chariot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chariot with blades on the hubs}}\'a0to tear apart competing vehicles. He attempts to destroy Judah's chariot but wrecks his own instead. Messala is fatally trampled on by another passing chariot, while Judah wins the race. Before dying, Messala tells Judah that "the race is not over" and, in one last act of pure hatred, tells him to search for his family in the Valley of the Lepers "if you can even recognise them".\
Judah visits the nearby leper colony, where he confronts Esther while she is delivering supplies for his mother and sister. Esther convinces Judah to remain hidden from them for now and not break Miriam's wishes. Blaming Roman rule for his family's fate, Judah visits Pilate and rejects his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Property"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 patrimony}}\'a0and Roman citizenship. He returns with Esther to the Leper colony, reveals himself to Miriam and finds out that Tirzah is dying. Judah and Esther take Miriam and her daughter to see Jesus of Nazareth, but the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trial_of_Jesus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 trial of Jesus}}\'a0has begun. As Jesus is being marched through the streets he collapses while carrying his cross. Judah recognizes him as the man who gave him water years before, and returns the gesture. Judah witnesses the crucifixion of Jesus, and Miriam and Tirzah are miraculously healed during the rainstorm following the crucifixion. Judah returns home a changed man and embraces Esther, Miriam and Tirzah.\
A family on their way to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Guinea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Guinea}}\'a0is chased by pirates into a storm. The captain and crew abandon the ship leaving the family shipwrecked off an uninhabited island. Father ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Mills"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Mills}}) and his two eldest sons Fritz and Ernst ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_MacArthur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James MacArthur}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tommy_Kirk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tommy Kirk}}) salvage as much as they can from the wreck including livestock, tools, and even an organ. As they gather what can be removed from the ship, the pirates return and begin shooting at the ship. Fritz and Ernst begin readying the ship's cannon, but they only have one shot. Suddenly, the pirates turn around; Father has\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/File:ICS_India.svg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 put up a flag}}\'a0indicating the ship is under\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quarantine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quarantine}}\'a0and that there is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Death"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Death}}\'a0aboard. The three men construct a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tree_house"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tree house}}\'a0home on the island while the youngest boy Francis ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kevin_Corcoran"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kevin Corcoran}}) investigates the wildlife and starts an impressive collection of animals including a young elephant, a capuchin monkey and two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_Dane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Great Danes}}\'a0rescued from the ship which they name Duke and Turk. Mother ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dorothy_McGuire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dorothy McGuire}}) prays to be rescued. The boys, particularly Ernst, also build inventions to provide modern amenities to the family such as drawing water and preserving food.\
Fritz and Ernst head off to explore the island to see if anyone else lives on it, or if it is connected to any other lands. While at a distant corner of the island, they again spot the pirates who originally drove them into the storm. The pirates have captured another ship and have the ship's captain, Captain Moreland ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cecil_Parker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cecil Parker}}), and cabin boy "Bertie" captives for ransom. Fritz and Ernst rescue Bertie but Captain Moreland, Bertie's grandfather, stays behind. The three dodge the pirates and head back to the family's tree house. En route, they discover that Bertie is really Roberta ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Janet_Munro"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Janet Munro}}) and not a boy at all. The three fend off snakes and hyenas as they head home and even rescue a zebra foal, then lead it home. They arrive back at the treehouse at Christmas.\
Father realizes the pirates will try to reclaim Roberta and decides to make a stand against them. Defenses are prepared by building booby-traps and fortifying a rocky outcropping. They blow up the ship's wreckage in an attempt to make it difficult for the pirates to remember where the family went aground. While prepping for the pirate attack, Fritz and Ernst vie for the affections of Roberta. Ernst is more studious and attempts to impress her with his knowledge and intelligence while Fritz, older and more experienced, uses his charm and physical attributes to attract her. Fritz and Ernst eventually come to blows over her and are stopped only by the intervention of Father. He declares the next day the first holiday for "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Switzerland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Switzerland}}" in an attempt to divert everyone. While prepping for the race (everyone has an animal to ride: Francis has the elephant, Ernst the ostrich, Roberta the zebra, the monkey on Duke, etc.), Mother fires the gun to signal the start of the race; the pirates, who are at that time sailing the coast looking for the place they last saw the ship that brought the family to the island, hear the gun and know the family is near.\
Led by their captain ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sessue_Hayakawa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sessue Hayakawa}}), the pirates storm the island. The family manages a brave defense but are sorely pressed. Their defenses include pits with a tiger in one pit, rock piles, a log pile and coconut bombs (hollowed out coconuts filled with gunpowder with a fuse), all of which cause problems for the attacking pirates. When the pirate leader waves a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_flag"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 white flag}}\'a0the family imagines they have routed the pirates, but the pirates instead are sneaking around the back of the fort. Francis' much-maligned "pirate alarm" is the only thing that warns them of the surprise attack. They begin defending the fortress but are soon down to only a few shots with their muskets. At this critical moment, a ship appears on the horizon captained by Roberta's grandfather Captain Moreland and fires its cannons while the retreating pirates are trying to make a desperate escape. The cannon fire hits the pirate ship while the family rejoices. Father, Mother and Francis choose to remain on the island with Duke, Turk, and Francis' collection of animals while Captain Moreland notes that Father will likely be recommended as Governor of the new colony. As for the rest of the family, Ernst chooses to return to Europe with the rescuers in order to enroll in a university to continue his studies while Fritz and Roberta plan to marry (presumably by virtue of her grandfather's sea captaincy) and make New Switzerland their home.\
In the 1st century BC, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman Republic}}\'a0has slid into corruption, its menial work done by armies of slaves. One of these, a proud and gifted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thrace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thracian}}\'a0named Spartacus ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kirk_Douglas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kirk Douglas}}), is so uncooperative in his position in a mining pit that he is sentenced to death by starvation. By chance, he is displayed to unctuous Roman businessman Lentulus Batiatus ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Ustinov"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Ustinov}}), who - impressed by his ferocity - purchases Spartacus for his gladiatorial school, where he instructs trainer Marcellus ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charles_McGraw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charles McGraw}}) to not overdo his indoctrination because he thinks "he has quality". Amid the abuse, Spartacus forms a quiet relationship with a serving woman named Varinia ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jean_Simmons"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jean Simmons}}), whom he refuses to rape when she is sent to "entertain" him in his cell. Spartacus and Varinia are subsequently forced to endure numerous humiliations for defying the conditions of servitude.\
Batiatus receives a visit from the immensely wealthy Roman senator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marcus_Licinius_Crassus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marcus Licinius Crassus}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Laurence_Olivier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Laurence Olivier}}), who aims to become dictator of the stagnant republic. Crassus buys Varinia on a whim, and for the amusement of his companions arranges for Spartacus and three others to fight in pairs. When Spartacus is disarmed, his opponent, an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethnic_groups_of_Africa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 African}}\'a0named Draba ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Woody_Strode"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Woody Strode}}), spares his life in a burst of defiance and attacks the Roman audience, but is killed by an arena guard and Crassus. The next day, with the ludus' atmosphere still tense over this episode, Batiatus takes Varinia away to Crassus's house in Rome. Spartacus kills Marcellus, who was taunting him over his affections, and their fight escalates into a riot. The gladiators overwhelm their guards and escape into the Italian countryside.\
Spartacus is elected chief of the fugitives and decides to lead them out of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Italy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Italy}}\'a0and back to their homes. They plunder Roman country estates as they go, collecting enough money to buy sea transport from Rome's foes, the pirates of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cilicia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cilicia}}. Countless other slaves join the group, making it as large as an army. One of the new arrivals is Varinia, who escaped while being delivered to Crassus. Another is a slave entertainer named Antoninus ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Curtis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Curtis}}), who also fled Crassus's service. Privately, Spartacus feels mentally inadequate because of his lack of education during years of servitude. However, he proves an excellent leader and organizes his diverse followers into a tough and self-sufficient community. Varinia, now his informal wife, becomes pregnant by him, and he also comes to regard the spirited Antoninus as a sort of son.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_Senate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roman Senate}}\'a0becomes increasingly alarmed as Spartacus defeats the multiple armies it sends against him. Crassus's populist opponent Gracchus ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charles_Laughton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charles Laughton}}) knows that his rival will try to use the crisis as a justification for seizing control of the Roman army. To try and prevent this, Gracchus channels as much military power as possible into the hands of his own protege, a young senator named Julius Caesar ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Gavin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Gavin}}). Although Caesar lacks Crassus's contempt for the lower classes of Rome, he mistakes the man's rigid outlook for nobility. Thus, when Gracchus reveals that he has bribed the Cilicians to get Spartacus out of Italy and rid Rome of the slave army, Caesar regards such tactics as beneath him and goes over to Crassus.\
Crassus uses a bribe of his own to make the pirates abandon Spartacus and has the Roman army secretly force the rebels away from the coastline towards Rome. Amid panic that Spartacus means to sack the city, the Senate gives Crassus absolute power. Now surrounded by Romans, Spartacus convinces his men to die fighting. Just by rebelling and proving themselves human, he says that they have struck a blow against slavery. In the ensuing battle, after initially breaking the ranks of Crassus's legions, the slave army ends up trapped between Crassus and two other forces advancing from behind, and most of them are massacred. Afterward, the Romans try to locate the rebel leader for special punishment by offering a pardon (and return to enslavement) if the men will identify Spartacus, living or dead. Every surviving man responds by shouting "I'm Spartacus!" (an idea from Fast's novel, not documented by history). As a result, Crassus has them all sentenced to death by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crucifixion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crucifixion}}\'a0along the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Via_Appia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Via Appia}}\'a0between Rome and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Capua"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Capua}}, where the revolt began.\
Meanwhile, Crassus has found Varinia and Spartacus's newborn son and has taken them prisoner. He is disturbed by the idea that Spartacus can command more love and loyalty than he can and hopes to compensate by making Varinia as devoted to him as she was to her former husband. When she rejects him, he furiously seeks out Spartacus (whom he recognizes from having watched him at Batiatus' school) and forces him to fight Antoninus to the death. The survivor is to be crucified, along with all the other men captured after the great battle. Spartacus kills Antoninus to spare him this terrible fate. The incident leaves Crassus worried about Spartacus's potential to live in legend as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Martyr"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 martyr}}. In other matters, he is also worried about Caesar, whom he senses will someday eclipse him.\
Gracchus, having seen Rome fall into tyranny, commits suicide. Before doing so, he bribes his friend Batiatus to rescue Spartacus's family from Crassus and carry them away to freedom. On the way out of Rome, the group passes under Spartacus's cross. Varinia is able to comfort him in his dying moments by showing him his little son, who will grow up free and knowing who his father was.\
During a lunchtime tryst in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phoenix,_Arizona"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phoenix}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arizona"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arizona}}\'a0hotel, real-estate secretary,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marion_Crane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marion Crane}}, and her boyfriend, Sam Loomis, discuss how they cannot afford to get married because of Sam's debts. After lunch, Marion returns to work, where a client leaves a $40,000 cash payment on a property. Marion's boss asks her to deposit the money in the bank, and allows her to leave work early after she complains of a headache. Once home, she decides to steal the money and drive to Fairvale,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California}}, where Sam lives.\
En route to Fairvale, Marion pulls over on the side of the road and falls asleep; she is awakened by a state patrol trooper. Suspicious about her skittish behavior, he follows her as she drives away. Hoping to lose him, Marion stops at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bakersfield,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bakersfield}}, California automobile dealership and trades in her\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ford_Mainline"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ford Mainline}}, with its Arizona license plates, for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ford_Custom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ford Custom}}\'a0300 with California tags. The officer sees Marion at the car dealership and eyes her suspiciously as she abruptly drives away.\
During a heavy rainstorm, Marion stops for the night at the Bates Motel. The proprietor,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Norman_Bates"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Norman Bates}}, invites her to share a light dinner after she checks in. She accepts his invitation but overhears an argument between Norman and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Norma_Bates_(Psycho)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his mother}}\'a0about bringing a woman into their\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gothic_Revival_architecture"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gothic}}\'a0house, which sits perched above the motel. Instead they eat in the motel parlor, where he tells her about his life with his mother, who is mentally ill and forbids him to have an independent life.\
Moved by Norman's story, Marion decides to drive back to Phoenix in the morning to return the stolen money, which she hides in a folded newspaper on the nightstand. As she showers, a shadowy figure stabs her to death with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chef%27s_knife"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chef's knife}}. After seeing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blood}}, Norman panics and runs to Marion's room, where he discovers her body. He cleans up the crime scene, putting Marion's corpse and her possessions\'97including the stolen money\'97into the trunk of her car and sinking it in the swamps near the motel.\
A week later, Marion's sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lila_Crane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lila}}\'a0arrives in Fairvale and confronts Sam about Marion's whereabouts. Private investigator Milton Arbogast approaches them and confirms that Marion is wanted for stealing the $40,000. He sleuths local hotels and motels, and Norman's evasive and inconsistent answers arouse his suspicion. After hearing that Marion met Norman's mother, he asks to speak with her, but Norman refuses to allow it. Arbogast updates Sam and Lila about his search for Marion and promises to phone again soon. He goes to the Bates' home in search of Norman's mother; as he reaches the top of the stairs, he is murdered.\
When Lila and Sam do not hear from Arbogast, Sam visits the motel. He sees a figure in the house who he assumes is Mrs. Bates, but she ignores his knocking. Lila and Sam go to the local deputy sheriff, who informs them that Mrs. Bates died in a murder-suicide ten years ago. The sheriff concludes that Arbogast lied to Sam and Lila so he could pursue Marion and the money. Convinced that some ill has befallen Arbogast, Lila and Sam make their way to the motel. Norman carries his mother from her room and hides her in the fruit cellar against her will.\
At the motel, Sam distracts Norman by engaging in conversation while Lila cases the property and sneaks inside the house. After Sam grills him, Norman becomes agitated, knocks Sam out, and rushes to the house. Lila hides in the cellar, where she finds Mrs. Bates in a chair. Lila turns her around and discovers she is a mummified corpse. Lila screams as Norman runs into the cellar, holding a knife and wearing his mother's clothes and a wig. Before Norman can attack Lila, Sam, having regained consciousness, subdues him.\
At the courthouse, a psychiatrist explains that Norman murdered Mrs. Bates and her lover ten years ago out of jealousy. Unable to bear the guilt, he\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Exhumation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 exhumed}}\'a0her corpse and began to treat it as if she were still alive. He recreated his mother in his own mind as an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Multiple_personality_disorder"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 alternate personality}}, dressing in her clothes and talking to himself in her voice. This "Mother" personality is jealous and possessive: whenever Norman feels attracted to a woman, "Mother" kills her. As "Mother", Norman killed two young girls before stabbing Marion and Arbogast to death. The psychiatrist says the "Mother" personality has taken permanent hold of Norman's mind. While Norman sits in a holding cell, "Mother"'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Voice-over"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 voice-over}}\'a0protests that the murders were Norman's doing. Marion's car is pulled out of the swamp.\
Songwriter Roger Radcliffe lives in a bachelor flat in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}, along with his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dalmatian_dog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dalmatian}}, Pongo. Bored with bachelor life, Pongo decides to find a wife for Roger and a mate for himself. While watching various female dog-human pairs out the window, he spots the perfect one, a woman named Anita and her female Dalmatian, Perdita. He quickly gets Roger out of the house and drags him through the park to arrange a meeting. He and Anita fall in love and get married.\
Later, Perdita gives birth to a litter of 15 puppies. That same night, they are visited by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cruella_De_Vil"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cruella De Vil}}, a wealthy former schoolmate of Anita's. She offers to buy the entire litter, but Roger says they are not for sale, leading to a falling out. A few weeks later, she hires her henchmen, Jasper and Horace, to steal them. When\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Metropolitan_Police_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scotland Yard}}\'a0is unable to find them, Pongo and Perdita use the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Twilight_bark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Twilight bark}}", a canine gossip line, to ask for help from the other dogs in London.\
Colonel, an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Old_English_Sheepdog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Old English Sheepdog}}, along with his compatriots Captain, a gray horse, and Sergeant Tibbs, a tabby cat, find the puppies in a place called Hell Hall (Cruella's abandoned and dilapidated family estate, also known as The De Vil Place), along with 84 other Dalmatian puppies that she had bought from various dog stores. When Tibbs learns they are going to be made into dog-skin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fur_coat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fur coats}}, Colonel quickly sends word back to London. Upon receiving the message, Pongo and Perdita leave town to retrieve their puppies. Winter has come, and they must cross the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/River_Stour,_Suffolk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stour River}}\'a0which is running fast and laden with slabs of broken ice. Meanwhile, Tibbs overhears Cruella ordering Jasper and Horace to kill the puppies that night out of fear the police will soon find them. In response, Tibbs attempts to rescue them while Jasper and Horace are preoccupied watching television, but they finish their show and come for them before he can get them out of the house. Pongo and Perdita break in and confront Jasper and Horace just as they are about to kill the puppies. While the adult dogs attack them, Colonel and Tibbs guide the puppies from the house.\
After a happy reunion with their own puppies, Pongo and Perdita realize there are dozens of others with them, 99 altogether including their own. Shocked at Cruella's plans, Pongo and Perdita decide to adopt all of the puppies, certain that Roger and Anita would never reject them. The Dalmatians begin making their way back to London through deep snow, as all open water is frozen solid. Other animals help them along the way, while Cruella, Jasper, and Horace chase them. In one town, they cover themselves with soot to disguise themselves as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Labrador_Retriever"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Labradors}}, then pile inside a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Moving_van"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 moving van}}\'a0bound for London. As it is leaving, melting snow clears off the soot and Cruella sees them. Enraged, she follows the van in her car and rams it, but Jasper and Horace, who try to cut it off from above, end up crashing into her. Both vehicles are smashed to smithereens and fall into a deep ravine, leaving Cruella and her henchmen stranded and defeated at last. Cruella yells in frustration as the van drives away.\
Back in London, Roger and Anita are attempting to celebrate Christmas and his first big hit, a song about Cruella, but they miss their canine companions. Suddenly, barking is heard outside and, after their nanny opens the door, the house is filled with dogs. After wiping away the rest of the soot, they are delighted to realize their pets have returned home. After counting 84 extra puppies, they decide to use the money from the song to buy a large house in the country so they can keep all 101 Dalmatians.\
In the summer of 1957 in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/West_Side_(Manhattan)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 West Side}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lincoln_Square,_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lincoln Square}}\'a0neighborhood in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Manhattan}}, there is tension between a white American gang, the Jets, led by Riff, and a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Puerto_Ricans"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Puerto Rican}}\'a0gang, the Sharks, led by Bernardo. After a brawl erupts, Lieutenant Schrank and Officer Krupke arrive and break it up. The Jets decide to challenge the Sharks to a rumble at an upcoming dance for neighborhood control.\
Riff decides that his best friend Tony, the co-founder of the Jets who left the gang, should fight. Riff invites Tony to the dance, but Tony is uninterested. He tells Riff that he senses something important will happen, which Riff suggests could have a correlation with the dance.\
Bernardo's younger sister, Maria, tells her best friend and Bernardo's girlfriend, Anita, how excited she is about the dance. At the dance, the gangs and girls refuse to intermingle. Tony arrives and he and Maria fall in love. However, Bernardo angrily demands Tony stay away from her. Riff proposes a meeting with Bernardo at Doc's drug store.\
Maria is sent home; Anita argues that Bernardo is overprotective of Maria and they compare the advantages of Puerto Rico and the United States.\
Tony discreetly visits Maria on her fire escape, where they reaffirm their love. Krupke, who suspects the Jets are planning something, visits them and warns them not to cause trouble. When the Sharks arrive, both groups agree to have the showdown the following evening under the highway, with a one-on-one fist fight. When Schrank arrives, the gangs feign friendship. Schrank orders the Sharks out and unsuccessfully tries to discover information about the fight.\
The next day at the bridal shop, Anita accidentally tells Maria about the rumble. Tony arrives to see Maria, which shocks Anita. They profess their love and Anita warns them about the consequences if Bernardo learns of their relationship. Maria has Tony promise to prevent the rumble. Tony and Maria fantasize about their wedding ceremony.\
The Jets and Sharks approach the area under the highway. Tony arrives to stop the fight, but Bernardo antagonizes him. Unwilling to watch Tony be humiliated, Riff initiates a knife fight. Tony tries to intervene, which leads to Bernardo killing Riff. Tony kills Bernardo with Riff's knife and a melee ensues. Police sirens blare and everyone flees, leaving behind the dead bodies.\
Maria waits for Tony on the rooftop of her apartment building when Chino arrives and tells her what happened. Tony arrives and explains what transpired and asks for her forgiveness before he turns himself in to the police. Maria confirms her love for him and asks Tony to stay with her.\
The Jets have reassembled outside a garage, with their new leader, Ice having them focus on reacting to the police. Anybodys arrives and warns them that Chino is now after Tony. Ice sends the Jets to warn Tony.\
Anita enters the apartment while Tony and Maria are in the bedroom. Tony and Maria arrange to meet at Doc's, where they will pick up getaway money to elope. Anita spots Tony leaving through the window and chides Maria for the relationship, but Maria convinces her to help them elope.\
Schrank arrives and questions Maria about the rumble. To cover for Tony, Maria has Anita tell him that Maria is detained from meeting him. When Anita reaches Doc's, the Jets harass her, until Doc intervenes. Anita declares that Bernardo was right about them and that Chino killed Maria. Doc banishes the Jets and gives Tony his getaway money in the basement and delivers Anita's message. Tony runs into the streets, shouting for Chino to kill him as well.\
In the playground next to Doc's, Tony spots Maria and they run toward each other, only for Chino to shoot Tony. The Jets and Sharks arrive to find Maria holding Tony, who dies. Maria stops the gangs from fighting and takes the gun from Chino and threatens to shoot everyone, blaming their hate for the deaths. Schrank, Krupke and Doc arrive and the gangs form a funeral procession, with Maria following. The police arrest Chino and lead him away.\
The film is presented in two parts, divided by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intermission#Films"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intermission}}.\
The film opens in 1935 when Lawrence is killed in a motorcycle accident. At his memorial service at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/St_Paul%27s_Cathedral"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 St Paul's Cathedral}}, a reporter tries (with little success) to gain insights into this remarkable, enigmatic man from those who knew him.\
The story then moves backward to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First World War}}, where Lawrence is a misfit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/British_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British Army}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lieutenant_(British_Army_and_Royal_Marines)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lieutenant}}, notable for his insolence and education. Over the objections of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Archibald_Murray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Murray}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mr._Dryden"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mr. Dryden}}\'a0of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arab_Bureau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arab Bureau}}sends him to assess the prospects of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Faisal_I_of_Iraq"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Prince Faisal}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arab_Revolt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his revolt}}\'a0against the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ottoman_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Turks}}. On the journey, his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bedouin_people"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bedouin}}\'a0guide, Tafas, is killed by Sherif Ali for drinking from his well without permission. Lawrence later meets Colonel Brighton, who orders him to keep quiet, make his assessment, and leave. Lawrence ignores Brighton's orders when he meets Faisal. His outspokenness piques the prince's interest.\
Brighton advises Faisal to retreat after a major defeat, but Lawrence proposes a daring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Aqaba"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 surprise attack on Aqaba}}; its capture would provide a port from which the British could offload much-needed supplies. The town is strongly fortified against a naval assault but only lightly defended on the landward side. He convinces Faisal to provide fifty men, led by a sceptical Sherif Ali. Teenage orphans Daud and Farraj attach themselves to Lawrence as servants. They cross the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nefud_Desert"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nefud Desert}}, considered impassable even by the Bedouins, travelling day and night on the last stage to reach water. One of Ali's men, Gasim, succumbs to fatigue and falls off his camel unnoticed during the night. When Lawrence discovers him missing, he turns back and rescues Gasim\'97and Sherif Ali is won over. He gives Lawrence Arab robes to wear.\
Lawrence persuades\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Auda_abu_Tayi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Auda abu Tayi}}, the leader of the powerful local\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Howeitat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Howeitat}}\'a0tribe, to turn against the Turks. Lawrence's scheme is almost derailed when one of Ali's men kills one of Auda's because of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blood_feud"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blood feud}}. Howeitat retaliation would shatter the fragile alliance, so Lawrence declares that he will execute the murderer himself. He is then stunned to discover that the culprit is Gasim, the very man whom he risked his own life to save in the desert, but he shoots him anyway.\
The next morning, the Arabs overrun the Turkish\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Garrison"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 garrison}}. Lawrence heads to Cairo to inform Dryden and the new commander,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edmund_Allenby,_1st_Viscount_Allenby"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Allenby}}, of his victory. While crossing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sinai_Desert"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sinai Desert}}, Daud dies when he stumbles into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dry_quicksand"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quicksand}}. Lawrence is promoted to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Major_(United_Kingdom)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 major}}\'a0and given arms and money for the Arabs. He is deeply disturbed, however, confessing that he enjoyed executing Gasim, but Allenby brushes aside his qualms. He asks Allenby whether there is any basis for the Arabs' suspicions that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sykes%E2%80%93Picot_Agreement"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British have designs on Arabia}}. When pressed, the general states that they do not.\
Lawrence launches a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guerrilla_war"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 guerrilla war}}, blowing up trains and harassing the Turks at every turn. American\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_correspondent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 war correspondent}}\'a0Jackson Bentley publicises Lawrence's exploits, making him famous. On one raid, Farraj is badly injured. Unwilling to leave him to be tortured by the enemy, Lawrence shoots him dead before fleeing.\
When Lawrence scouts the enemy-held city of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Daraa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Deraa}}\'a0with Ali, he is taken, along with several Arab residents, to the Turkish\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bey}}. Lawrence is stripped, ogled, and prodded. Then, for striking out at the Bey, he is severely\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flogging"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flogged}}\'a0before being thrown into the street. The experience leaves Lawrence shaken. He returns to British headquarters in Cairo but does not fit in.\
A short time later in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jerusalem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jerusalem}}, General Allenby urges him to support the "big push" on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damascus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damascus}}. Lawrence hesitates to return but finally relents.\
Lawrence recruits an army that is motivated more by money than by the Arab cause. They sight a column of retreating Turkish soldiers who have just massacred the residents of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tafas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tafas}}. One of Lawrence's men is from Tafas; he demands, "No prisoners!" When Lawrence hesitates, the man charges the Turks alone and is killed. Lawrence takes up the dead man's battle cry; the result is a slaughter in which Lawrence himself participates. Afterwards, he regrets his actions.\
Lawrence's men take Damascus ahead of Allenby's forces. The Arabs set up a council to administer the city, but the desert tribesmen prove ill-suited for such a task. Despite Lawrence's efforts, they bicker constantly. Unable to maintain the public utilities, the Arabs soon abandon most of the city to the British.\
Lawrence is promoted to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Colonel_(United_Kingdom)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 colonel}}\'a0and immediately ordered back to Britain, as his usefulness to both Faisal and the British is at an end. As he leaves the city, his automobile is passed by a motorcyclist who leaves a trail of dust in his wake.\
The film begins with narration by Spencer Tracy as the aerial-borne camera sweeps over the Rocky Mountains. "This land has a name today," says Tracy in the opening lines of the film, "and is marked on maps."\
The film then moves into "The Rivers" sequence (considerably to the east of the Rockies).\
Mountain man Linus Rawlings (Stewart) is making his way by horse and waterway through the mountains. He confers with a group of Indians. The scene then shifts to Zebulon Prescott and his family.\
Prescott (Malden) and his family set out west for the frontier via the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erie_Canal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erie Canal}}, the "West", at this time, being the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ohio_River"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ohio River}}\'a0country, at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battery_Rock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 southern edge}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Illinois"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Illinois}}. Along the journey, they meet Rawlings, who is traveling east, to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pittsburgh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pittsburgh}}, to trade his furs. Rawlings and Zebulon's daughter, Eve ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carroll_Baker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Carroll Baker}}), are attracted to each other, but Linus is not ready to settle down.\
Linus Rawlings stops at an isolated trading post, run by a murderous clan of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/River_pirate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 river pirates}}, headed by "Alabama Colonel" Jeb Hawkins ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Walter_Brennan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Walter Brennan}}). Linus is betrayed when he accompanies seductive Dora Hawkins ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brigid_Bazlen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brigid Bazlen}}), into a cave, modeled after a real outlaw haunt, now a part of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cave-in-Rock_State_Park"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cave-in-Rock State Park}}, to see a "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Varmint"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 varmint}}". Dora Hawkins stabs him in the back and Rawlings falls into a deep hole. He is not seriously wounded, and he rescues the Prescott party from a similar fate. The bushwhacking thieves ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lee_Van_Cleef"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lee Van Cleef}}\'a0plays one), including Dora and Hawkins, are dispatched, being killed in an attack by Rawlings, in a form of rough frontier justice.\
After Zebulon prays to God for their lost loved ones and commends to Him the thieves' souls "whether You want 'em or not", the settlers continue down the river, but their raft is caught in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rapids"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rapids}}, and Zebulon and his wife Rebecca ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Agnes_Moorehead"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Agnes Moorehead}}) drown. Linus, finding that he cannot live without Eve, reappears and marries her. She insists on homesteading at the spot where her parents died.\
This section was directed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Henry_Hathaway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry Hathaway}}.\
Eve's sister Lilith ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Debbie_Reynolds"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Debbie Reynolds}}) chose to go back East but after some years finds herself touring in St. Louis, where she and her troupe are hired to perform trendy acts at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Music_hall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Music hall}}. She attracts the attention of professional gambler Cleve Van Valen ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gregory_Peck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gregory Peck}}). After overhearing that she has just inherited a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California_Gold_Rush"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California gold mine}}, and to avoid paying his debts to another gambler ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Larch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Larch}}), Cleve joins the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wagon_train"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wagon train}}\'a0taking her there. Wagonmaster Roger Morgan ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Preston_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Preston}}) and he court her along the way, but she rejects them both, much to the dismay of her new friend and fellow traveler Agatha Clegg ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thelma_Ritter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thelma Ritter}}), who is searching for a husband.\
Surviving an attack by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cheyenne"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cheyennes}}, Lilith and Cleve arrive at the mine, only to find that it is worthless. Cleve leaves. Lilith returns to work in a dance hall in a camp town, living out of a covered wagon. Morgan finds her and again proposes marriage unromantically. She tells him, "Not now, not ever."\
Later, Lilith is singing in the music salon of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Riverboat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 riverboat}}. By chance, Cleve is a passenger. When he hears Lilith's voice, he leaves the poker table (and a winning hand) to propose to her. He tells her of the opportunities waiting in the rapidly growing city of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/San_Francisco"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 San Francisco}}. She accepts his proposal.\
This section also was directed by Henry Hathaway.\
Linus Rawlings joins the Union army as a captain in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American Civil War}}. Despite Eve's wishes, their son Zeb (Peppard) eagerly enlists as well, looking for glory and an escape from farming. Corporal Peterson ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Andy_Devine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Andy Devine}}) assures them the conflict will not last very long. The bloody\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Shiloh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Shiloh}}\'a0shows Zeb that war is nothing like he imagined, and unknown to him, his father dies there. Zeb encounters a similarly disillusioned Confederate ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Russ_Tamblyn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Russ Tamblyn}}), who suggests deserting.\
By chance, they overhear a private conversation between Generals\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ulysses_S._Grant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ulysses S. Grant}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Morgan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Morgan}}) and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Tecumseh_Sherman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Tecumseh Sherman}}\'a0(Wayne). The rebel realizes he has the opportunity to rid the South of two of its greatest enemies and tries to shoot them, leaving Zeb no choice but to kill him with the bayonet from his shattered musket. Afterward, Zeb rejoins the army.\
When the war finally ends, Zeb returns home as a lieutenant, only to find his mother has died. She had lost the will to live after learning that Linus had been killed. Zeb gives his share of the family farm to his brother, who is content to be a farmer, and leaves in search of a more interesting life.\
This section was directed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Ford"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Ford}}.\
Following the daring riders from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pony_Express"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pony Express}}\'a0and the construction of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Telegraphy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 transcontinental telegraph line}}\'a0in the late 1860s, two ferociously competing railroad lines, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Central_Pacific_Railroad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Central Pacific Railroad}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Union_Pacific_Railroad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Union Pacific Railroad}}, one building westward and the other eastward, open up new territory to eager settlers.\
Zeb becomes a lieutenant in the U.S. cavalry, trying to maintain peace with the Indians with the help of grizzled buffalo hunter Jethro Stuart (Fonda), an old friend of Linus'.
