When ruthless railroad man Mike King (Widmark) violates a treaty by building on Indian territory, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arapaho"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arapahos}}\'a0retaliate by stampeding buffalo through his camp, killing many, including women and children. Disgusted, Zeb resigns and heads to Arizona.\
A subplot was cut featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hope_Lange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hope Lange}}\'a0as Stuart's daughter, Julie, who becomes involved in a love triangle with Zeb and King; she ultimately marries and abandons Zeb.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5][6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
This section was directed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Marshall_(director)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Marshall}}.\
In San Francisco, widowed Lilith auctions off her possessions (Cleve and she had made and spent several fortunes) to pay her debts. She travels to Arizona, inviting Zeb and his family to oversee her remaining asset, a ranch.\
Zeb (now a marshal), his wife Julie ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carolyn_Jones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Carolyn Jones}}), and their children meet Lilith at Gold City's train station. However, Zeb also runs into an old enemy there, outlaw Charlie Gant (Wallach). Zeb had killed Gant's brother in a gunfight. When Gant makes veiled threats against Zeb and his family, Zeb turns to his friend and Gold City's marshal, Lou Ramsey ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lee_J._Cobb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lee J. Cobb}}), but Gant is not wanted for anything in that territory, so Ramsey can do nothing.\
Zeb decides he has to act rather than wait for Gant to make good his threat someday. Suspecting Gant of planning to rob an unusually large gold shipment being transported by train, he prepares an ambush with Ramsey's reluctant help. Gant and his entire gang (one member played by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Dean_Stanton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Dean Stanton}}) are killed in the shootout and resulting train wreck. In the end, Lilith and the Rawlings family travel to their new home.\
This section also was directed by Henry Hathaway.\
A short epilogue shows modern Los Angeles and San Francisco in the early 1960s, including the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Four_Level_Interchange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 four-level downtown freeway interchange}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golden_Gate_Bridge"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Golden Gate Bridge}}.\
This section also was directed by Henry Hathaway.\
The film is shot in the style of a docudrama, beginning in the days leading up to D-Day. It concentrates on events on both sides of the channel, such as the Allies waiting for a break in the poor weather and anticipating the reaction of the Axis forces defending northern France. The film pays particular attention to Gen. Eisenhower's decision to go, as Supreme Commander of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/SHAEF"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SHAEF}}, after reviewing the initial reports of bad weather and reports about the divisions within the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oberkommando_des_Heeres"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German High Command}}\'a0as to where an invasion might happen or what their response should be.\
Numerous scenes document the early hours of June 6 when Allied airborne troops were sent in to take key locations inland from the beaches. The French resistance is also shown reacting to the news that an invasion has started.\'a0
\f1\i The Longest Day
\f0\i0 \'a0chronicles most of the important events surrounding D-Day, including the British glider missions to secure\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pegasus_Bridge"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pegasus Bridge}}, the counterattacks launched by American paratroopers scattered around\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sainte-M%C3%A8re-%C3%89glise"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sainte-M\'e8re-\'c9glise}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Operation_Jedburgh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 infiltration and sabotage work}}\'a0conducted by the French resistance and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Special_Operations_Executive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SOE}}\'a0agents, and the response by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wehrmacht"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wehrmacht}}\'a0to the invasion and the uncertainty of German commanders as to whether it was a feint in preparation for crossings at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pas_de_Calais"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pas de Calais}}\'a0(see\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Operation_Fortitude"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Operation Fortitude}}), where the senior German staff had always assumed that it would be.\
Set-piece scenes include the parachute drop into Sainte-M\'e8re-\'c9glise, the advance inshore from the Normandy beaches, the U.S.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ranger_Assault_Group"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ranger Assault Group}}'s assault on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pointe_du_Hoc"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pointe du Hoc}}, the attack on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ouistreham"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ouistreham}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Free_French_Forces"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Free French Forces}}, and the strafing of the beaches by two lone\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luftwaffe"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luftwaffe}}\'a0pilots. The film concludes with a montage showing various Allied units consolidating their beachheads before they advance inland to reach Germany by crossing France.\
After the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Pharsalus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Pharsalus}}\'a0in 48 BC,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Julius_Caesar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Julius Caesar}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rex_Harrison"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rex Harrison}}) goes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ptolemaic_Kingdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Egypt}}, under the pretext of being named the executor of the will of the young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pharaoh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pharaoh}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ptolemy_XIII_Theos_Philopator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ptolemy XIII}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Richard_O%27Sullivan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Richard O'Sullivan}}) and his sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cleopatra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cleopatra}}({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elizabeth_Taylor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elizabeth Taylor}})'s father.\
Cleopatra convinces Caesar to restore her throne from her younger brother. Caesar, in effective control of the kingdom, sentences\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pothinus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pothinus}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gregoire_Aslan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gregoire Aslan}}) to death for arranging an assassination attempt on Cleopatra, and banishes Ptolemy to the eastern desert, where he and his outnumbered army would face certain death against\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mithridates_III_of_Parthia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mithridates}}. Cleopatra is crowned\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ptolemaic_Kingdom#Final_years_of_the_empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Queen of Egypt}}, and begins to develop megalomaniacal dreams of ruling the world with Caesar, who in turn desires to become King of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rome}}. They marry, and when their son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caesarion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caesarion}}\'a0is born, Caesar accepts him publicly, which becomes the talk of Rome and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_Senate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Senate}}.\
After he is made\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roman_dictator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dictator}}\'a0for life, Caesar sends for Cleopatra. She arrives in Rome in a lavish procession and wins the adulation of the Roman people. The Senate grows increasingly discontented amid rumors that Caesar wishes to be made king, which is anathema to the Romans. On the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ides_of_March"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ides of March}}\'a0in 44 BC, a group of conspirators\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Assassination_of_Julius_Caesar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 assassinate Caesar}}\'a0and flee the city, starting a rebellion. An\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Second_Triumvirate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 alliance}}\'a0between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Augustus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Octavian}}, Caesar's adopted son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Antony"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Antony}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Richard_Burton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Richard Burton}}), Caesar's right-hand man and general as well as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marcus_Aemilius_Lepidus_(triumvir)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marcus Ameilius Lepidus}}\'a0put down the rebellion and split up the republic between themselves. Cleopatra is angered after Caesar's will recognizes Octavian instead of Caesarion as his official heir, and angrily returns to Egypt.\
While planning a campaign against\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parthian_Empire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Parthia}}\'a0in the east, Antony realizes he needs money and supplies, and cannot get enough from anywhere but Egypt. After refusing several times to leave Egypt, Cleopatra gives in and meets him in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tarsus,_Mersin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tarsus}}. The two begin a love affair, with Cleopatra assuring Anthony that he is much more than a pale reflection of Caesar.\
Octavian's removal of Lepidus forces Anthony to return to Rome, where he marries Octavian's sister,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Octavia_the_Younger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Octavia}}, to prevent conflict, much to Cleopatra's distraughtness and enragement. Anthony and Cleopatra reconcile and marry, with Anthony divorcing Octavia. Octavian, incensed, reads Anthony's will to the Roman senate, revealing that the latter wishes to be buried in Egypt. Rome turns against Anthony, and Octavian's call for war against Egypt receives a rapturous response.\
The war is decided at the naval\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Actium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Actium}}\'a0on September 2, 31 BC, where Octavian's fleet, under the command of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Agrippa,_Marcus_Vipsanius"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Agrippa}}, defeats the Antony-Egyptian fleet. Cleopatra assumes Antony is dead and orders the Egyptian forces home. Antony follows, leaving his fleet leaderless and soon defeated.\
Several months later, Cleopatra manages to convince Antony to retake command of his troops and fight Octavian's advancing army. However, Antony's soldiers abandon him during the night;\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rufio_(officer_of_Caesar)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rufio}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Martin_Landau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Martin Landau}}), the last man loyal to Antony, kills himself. Antony tries to goad Octavian into single combat, but is finally forced to flee into the city.\
When Antony returns to the palace,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Apollodorus_the_Sicilian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Apollodorus}}, not believing that Antony is worthy of his queen, convinces him that she is dead, whereupon Antony falls on his own sword. Apollodorus then confesses that he misled Antony and assists him to the tomb where Cleopatra and two servants have taken refuge. Antony dies in Cleopatra's arms.\
Octavian and his army march into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alexandria"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alexandria}}\'a0with Caesarion's dead body in a wagon. He discovers the dead body of Apollodorus, who had poisoned himself. Octavian receives word that Antony is dead and Cleopatra is holed up in a tomb. There he offers her his word that he will allow her to rule Egypt as a Roman province in return for her agreeing to accompany him to Rome. Cleopatra knows her son is dead and agrees to Octavian's terms, including a pledge not to harm herself.\
After Octavian departs, she orders her servants in coded language to assist with her suicide. Octavian realizes that she is going to kill herself and he and his guards burst into Cleopatra's chamber and find her dressed in gold, and dead, along with her servants, while an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asp_(reptile)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 asp}}\'a0crawls along the floor.\
Seeking to exact revenge on James Bond (007) for killing its agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Julius_No"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. No}}\'a0and destroying the organisation's assets in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caribbean"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caribbean}}, the international criminal organisation\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/SPECTRE"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SPECTRE}}\'a0begins training agents to kill Bond. Their star pupil is Donald "Red" Grant, an Irish assassin who proves his mettle by killing a Bond impostor in one minute and fifty-two seconds on a training course with a garrote wire concealed in his wristwatch.\
Meanwhile, the organisation's Chief Planner, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Czechoslovak_Socialist_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Czech}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chess_grandmaster"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chess grandmaster}}\'a0named Kronsteen (Number 5), devises a plan to play British and Soviet intelligence against each other to procure a Lektor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cryptography"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cryptographic}}\'a0device from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Soviet_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Soviets}}. SPECTRE's Chief Executive,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ernst_Stavro_Blofeld"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Number\'a01}}, puts\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rosa_Klebb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rosa Klebb}}\'a0(Number 3), a former Colonel of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/SMERSH"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SMERSH}}\'a0(the counter-intelligence branch of Soviet Intelligence) who has defected to SPECTRE in the West, in charge of the mission as Chief of Operations. Klebb chooses Grant to protect Bond until he acquires the Lektor and then to eliminate 007 and steal the cipher machine for SPECTRE. As part of the scheme, Klebb recruits the beautiful\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatiana_Romanova"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatiana Romanova}}, a cipher clerk at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USSR"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Soviet}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Consulate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 consulate}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Istanbul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Istanbul}}, who believes the ex-Colonel still to be working for SMERSH.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M}}\'a0informs Bond that Romanova has contacted their "Station 'T'" in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Turkey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Turkey}}, claiming to have fallen in love with Bond from his file photo. She offers to defect to the West, and will bring a top secret Lektor with her to sweeten the deal but only on the condition that Bond handle her case, personally. Prior to his departure, Bond is supplied by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Q_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Q}}\'a0with an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Attach%C3%A9_case"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 attach\'e9 case}}\'a0containing a concealed throwing knife, gold sovereigns, a special\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tear_gas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tear gas}}\'a0booby trap connected to the lock mechanism and ammunition for an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ArmaLite_AR-7"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ArmaLite AR-7}}\'a0folding sniper rifle with an infrared night scope.\
After travelling to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Istanbul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Istanbul}}, Bond heads into the city to meet with station head\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_James_Bond_allies_in_From_Russia_with_Love#Ali_Kerim_Bey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ali Kerim Bey}}, tailed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_Bulgaria"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bulgarian}}\'a0secret agents working for the Russians. They are in turn tailed by Grant, who kills one of them after Bond is taken back to his hotel, stealing their car and dumping it outside the Soviet Consulate in order to provoke hostilities between British and Soviet Intelligence. In response, the Soviets bomb Kerim's office with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Limpet_mine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 limpet mine}}; Kerim, however, is away from his desk for a tryst with his mistress. He and Bond then investigate the attack by spying on a Soviet consulate meeting through a periscope installed in the underground aqueducts beneath Istanbul. Thus, they learn that the Soviet agent Krilencu is responsible for the bombing. Kerim Bey declares it unwise to stay in the city under such circumstances and takes Bond to a rural\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Romani_people"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gypsy}}\'a0settlement. However, Krilencu learns of this and promptly attacks a Gypsy feast, where Bond and Kerim are honoured guests, with a band of hired Bulgarian fighters. Much to Bond's confusion, he is saved from an enemy fighter during the attack by a distant sniper shot from Grant. The following night, Bond and Kerim Bey track Krilencu down to his hideout, where Kerim Bey kills him with Bond's rifle.\
Upon returning to his hotel suite that night, Bond finds Romanova waiting for him in his bed and has sex with her; neither is aware that SPECTRE is filming them. The next day, Romanova heads off for a prearranged rendezvous at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hagia_Sophia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hagia Sophia}}\'a0to drop off the floor plans for the consulate, with Grant ensuring Bond receives the plans by killing the other Bulgarian tail who attempts to intercept the drop. Using the plans, Bond and Kerim Bey successfully steal the Lektor and, together with Romanova, escape with the device onto the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orient_Express"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Orient Express}}. On the train, Kerim Bey quickly notices a Soviet security officer named Benz tailing them, prompting him and Bond to subdue him. When Bond leaves Benz and Kerim Bey alone together, Grant kills them and makes it appear as though they killed each other, preventing Bond from leaving the train with Romanova to rendezvous with one of Kerim's men.\
At the railway station in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Belgrade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Belgrade}}, Bond passes on word of Kerim Bey's death to one of his sons, and asks for an agent from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Socialist_Federal_Republic_of_Yugoslavia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Station Y}}\'a0to meet him at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zagreb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zagreb}}. However, when the train arrives at the station, Grant intercepts Nash, sent from Station Y, killing the agent before posing as him. After drugging Romanova at dinner, Grant overpowers Bond before taunting him about SPECTRE's involvement in the theft. After disclosing that Romanova was unaware of what was truly going on, believing she was working for Russia, Grant reveals to Bond his plans to leave behind the film SPECTRE took of him and Romanova at the hotel, along with a forged blackmail letter, to make it appear that their deaths were the result of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Murder-suicide"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 murder-suicide}}, to scandalise the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Kingdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/British_intelligence_community"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intelligence community}}. Bond quickly convinces him to accept a bribe of gold sovereigns in exchange for a final cigarette, tricking Grant into setting off the booby trap in his attach\'e9 case. This distracts Grant enough for Bond to attack him in a brutal brawl. In the ensuing fight, Bond narrowly gains the upper hand, stabbing Grant with the case's concealed knife before strangling him with his own\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Garrotte"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 garrotte}}. Bond then drags the barely conscious Romanova from the train, which has been stopped by a SPECTRE accomplice, where he hijacks Grant's getaway truck and flees the scene with Romanova.\
Upon hearing the news of Grant's death, Number 1 calls Klebb and Kronsteen onto the carpet to explain what went wrong and remind them that SPECTRE does not tolerate failure. Kronsteen is executed by the henchman Morzeny with a kick from the poison-tipped switchblade in his shoe. Klebb, however, is given one last chance to make good on the mission and acquire the Lektor (which has already been promised to the Russians in a sell-back scheme).\
The next morning, Bond's stolen truck is intercepted along its escape route by a SPECTRE helicopter, but 007 destroys the attacking aircraft by shooting its co-pilot with his sniper rifle, causing the man to drop a live hand grenade in the cockpit. Thus, Bond and Romanova make it to Grant's escape boat on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dalmatia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dalmatian coast}}\'a0and steal that, too, only to be pursued by Morzeny, who leads a squadron of SPECTRE powerboats. Bond, however, escapes by dumping his own powerboat's fuel drums overboard and detonating them with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flare_gun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Very flare}}\'a0to engulf all the chase boats in a sea of flames.\
Eventually, he and Romanova reach a hotel in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Venice"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Venice}}, where they believe themselves to be safe. Klebb, however, disguised as a maid, makes one final attempt on Bond and the Lektor. Klebb tries to kick him with a poisoned switchblade shoe, but Romanova shoots her with her own dropped gun. With the mission accomplished, Bond and Romanova leave Venice on a romantic boat ride, in which course Bond throws Grant's blackmail film into the canal.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}, Professor Henry Higgins ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rex_Harrison"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rex Harrison}}), a scholar of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phonetics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 phonetics}}, believes that the accent and tone of one's voice determines a person's prospects in society ("Why Can't the English?"). At\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Covent_Garden"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Covent Garden}}\'a0one evening, he meets Colonel Hugh Pickering ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wilfrid_Hyde-White"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wilfrid Hyde-White}}), himself a phonetics expert who had come all the way from India to see him. Higgins boasts he could teach anyone to speak so well he could pass them off as a duke or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Duchess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 duchess}}\'a0at an embassy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ball_(dance)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ball}}, even the young woman with a strong\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cockney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cockney}}\'a0accent named Eliza Doolittle ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Audrey_Hepburn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Audrey Hepburn}}) who tries to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flower_seller"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sell them flowers}}. Eliza's ambition is to work in a flower shop, but her accent makes that impossible ("Wouldn't It Be Loverly"). The following morning, Eliza shows up at Higgins' home, seeking lessons. Pickering is intrigued and offers to cover all the attendant expenses if Higgins succeeds. Higgins agrees, and describes how women ruin lives ("I'm an Ordinary Man").\
Eliza's father, Alfred P. Doolittle ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stanley_Holloway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stanley Holloway}}), a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Waste_collector"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dustman}}, learns of his daughter's new residence ("With a Little Bit of Luck"). He shows up at Higgins' house three days later, ostensibly to protect his daughter's virtue, but in reality simply to extract some money from Higgins, and is bought off with \'a35. Higgins is impressed by the man's honesty, his natural gift for language, and especially his brazen lack of morals. Higgins recommends Alfred to a wealthy American who is interested in morality.\
Eliza endures Higgins' demanding teaching methods and treatment of her personally ("Just You Wait"). She makes little progress, but just as she, Higgins, and Pickering are about to give up, Eliza finally "gets it" ("The Rain in Spain"); she instantly begins to speak with an impeccable\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Received_Pronunciation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 upper class accent}}\'a0("I Could Have Danced All Night").\
As a trial run, Higgins takes her to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ascot_Racecourse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ascot Racecourse}}\'a0("Ascot Gavotte"), where she makes a good impression initially, only to shock everyone by a sudden lapse into vulgar Cockney while cheering on a horse. Higgins partly conceals a grin behind his hand. At Ascot, she meets Freddy Eynsford-Hill ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeremy_Brett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeremy Brett}}), a young, upper-class man who becomes infatuated with her ("On the Street Where You Live"). Higgins then takes Eliza to an embassy ball for the final test, where she dances with a foreign prince. Zoltan\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carpathian_Mountains"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Karpathy}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Theodore_Bikel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Theodore Bikel}}), a Hungarian phonetics expert trained by Higgins, converses briefly with Eliza, then certifies that she is not only Hungarian, but a princess.\
However, Eliza's hard work is barely acknowledged, with all the praise going to Higgins ("You Did It"). This and his callous treatment towards her afterwards, especially his indifference to her future, causes her to walk out on him, leaving him mystified by her ingratitude ("Just You Wait (Reprise)"). Outside, Freddy is still waiting ("On the Street Where You Live (Reprise)"), and greets Eliza, who is irritated by him as all he does is talk ("Show Me"). Eliza tries to return to her old life, but finds that she no longer fits in. She meets her father, who has been left a large fortune by the wealthy American to whom Higgins had recommended him, and is resigned to marrying Eliza's stepmother. Alfred feels that Higgins has ruined him, lamenting that he is now bound by "middle-class morality" ("Get Me to the Church On Time"). Eliza eventually ends up visiting Higgins' mother ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gladys_Cooper"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gladys Cooper}}), who is outraged at her son's callous behaviour.\
The next day, Higgins finds Eliza gone and searches for her ("A Hymn to Him"), eventually finding her at his mother's house. Higgins attempts to talk Eliza into coming back to him. He becomes angered when she announces that she is going to marry Freddy and become Karpathy's assistant ("Without You"). He makes his way home, stubbornly predicting that she will come crawling back. However, he comes to the unsettling realization that she has become an important part of his life ("I've Grown Accustomed to Her Face"). As he listens to a recording of Eliza's voice, she reappears in the doorway behind him, turning off the recording and saying in her old Cockney accent, "I washed my hands and face before I come, I did." Higgins looks surprised, then pleased, before asking where his slippers are.\
After destroying a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clandestine_chemistry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 drug laboratory}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Latin_America"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Latin America}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mi6"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MI6}}\'a0agent James Bond travels to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miami_Beach"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miami Beach}}\'a0for a vacation. He receives instructions from his superior,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M}}, via CIA agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Felix_Leiter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Felix Leiter}}\'a0to observe bullion dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Auric_Goldfinger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Auric Goldfinger}}\'a0at the hotel there. Bond sees Goldfinger cheating at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gin_rummy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gin rummy}}\'a0and stops him by distracting his employee, Jill Masterson, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blackmail"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blackmailing}}\'a0Goldfinger into losing. After Bond and Jill consummate their new relationship, Bond is knocked out by Goldfinger's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/North_Korea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Korean}}\'a0manservant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oddjob"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Oddjob}}. When Bond awakens, he finds Jill dead, covered in gold paint, having died from "skin suffocation."\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chancellor_of_the_exchequer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chancellor of the exchequer}}\'a0and M explain to Bond that gold prices vary across the world, allowing one to profit by selling bullion internationally, and his objective is determining how Goldfinger does it by smuggling. To help in his mission, Bond is given a modified\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aston_Martin_DB5"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aston Martin DB5}}\'a0and two radar trackers by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Q_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Q}}. Bond arranges to meet Goldfinger socially at his country club in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kent}}, and wins a high-stakes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 golf}}\'a0game against him with a recovered\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_gold"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nazi gold}}\'a0bar at stake. Aware of Bond\'92s ulterior motives, Goldfinger warns Bond not to interfere in his affairs, reinforcing the threat by having Oddjob demonstrate his steel-rimmed derby as a deadly weapon. Bond follows Goldfinger to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Switzerland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Switzerland}}, where Tilly, Jill's sister, attempts to avenge her sister by assassinating Goldfinger with a rifle and fails.\
Bond sneaks into Goldfinger's plant and discovers Goldfinger smuggles gold by melting it down and incorporating it into the bodywork of his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rolls-Royce_Phantom_III"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rolls-Royce Phantom III}}, which he takes with him whenever he travels. Bond also overhears Goldfinger talking to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chinese}}\'a0nuclear physicist Mr. Ling about "Operation Grand Slam." Leaving, Bond encounters Tilly as she tries to kill Goldfinger again, but trips an alarm in the process. Oddjob kills Tilly with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oddjob%27s_hat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his hat}}, and Bond is captured and tied to a cutting table underneath an industrial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Laser"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 laser}}, which begins to slice a large sheet of gold in half, with Bond lying over it. He then lies to Goldfinger that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Secret_Intelligence_Service"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MI6}}\'a0knows about Grand Slam, causing Goldfinger to spare Bond's life to mislead MI6 into believing Bond has things in hand.\
Bond is transported by Goldfinger's private jet, piloted by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pussy_Galore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pussy Galore}}, to his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stud_farm"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stud farm}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lexington,_Kentucky"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lexington,}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kentucky"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kentucky}}. Bond escapes and witnesses Goldfinger's meeting with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Mafia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American mafiosi}}, who have brought the materials he needs for Operation Grand Slam. Goldfinger reveals that his plan is to rob the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Bullion_Depository"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Bullion Depository}}\'a0at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fort_Knox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fort Knox}}\'a0by releasing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neurotoxin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Delta 9 nerve gas}}\'a0into the atmosphere. After Bond is recaptured by Pussy, Goldfinger has the mafiosi killed using the gas.\
Bond points out to Goldfinger that his plan to rob the depository will not work, as he will not have enough time to move the gold before the Americans intervene. Goldfinger hints he does not intend to steal the gold, and Bond deduces that Goldfinger will detonate a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dirty_bomb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dirty bomb}}\'a0inside the vault, designed to render the gold useless for 58 years. This will increase the value of Goldfinger's own gold and give the Chinese an advantage from the potential economic chaos. Goldfinger subtly threatens that should the Americans attempt to locate the bomb or interfere with his plan, he will simply have it detonated somewhere else of significance in the United States.\
Operation Grand Slam begins with Pussy Galore's Flying Circus spraying the gas over Fort Knox, seemingly killing all of the military and government personnel nearby including Felix. Goldfinger's private army breaks into Fort Knox and accesses the vault as Goldfinger arrives in a helicopter with the atomic device. In the vault, his henchman Kisch handcuffs Bond to the bomb. Unbeknownst to Goldfinger however, Bond has convinced Galore to alert the Americans and replace the gas with a harmless substance. The troops arise and attack, killing many of Goldfinger's men. Seeing this, Goldfinger locks the vault, takes off his coat, revealing a US Army colonel's uniform, and kills Mr. Ling and several troops, before escaping. Kisch realizes they are trapped and attempts to stop the bomb, but Oddjob throws him to his death. Bond frees himself with Kisch's handcuff keys, but the superhumanly strong Oddjob batters him before he can disarm the bomb. Eventually Bond manages to electrocute Oddjob, then forces the lock off the bomb using gold bullion bars from the vault, but ultimately is unable to disarm it. After finally killing all of Goldfinger's men, the troops open the vault and rush to disarm the bomb. An atomic specialist who accompanied Leiter arrives with seconds to spare, and simply turns off the device with the timer stopped on "0:07".\
Bond is invited to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/White_House"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 White House}}\'a0for lunch with the President. However, Goldfinger hijacks the plane carrying Bond there. In a struggle for Goldfinger's revolver, the gun fires, shooting out a window, creating an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Uncontrolled_decompression#Explosive_decompression"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 explosive decompression}}. Goldfinger is blown out of the cabin through the ruptured window. With the plane out of control, Bond rescues Galore and they parachute safely from the aircraft before it crashes into the ocean. A search helicopter passes, but Bond claims \'93this is no time to be rescued\'94 and draws the parachute over himself and Galore.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edwardian_era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edwardian}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}, 1910, Bert entertains a crowd as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/One-man_band"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 one-man band}}\'a0when he senses a change in the wind. Afterwards, he\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fourth_wall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 directly addresses the audience}}, and gives them a tour of Cherry Tree Lane, stopping outside the Banks family's home. George Banks returns home to learn from his wife, Winifred, that Katie Nanna has left their service after Jane and Michael ran away again. They are returned shortly after by Constable Jones, who reveals the children were chasing a lost kite. The children ask their father to help build a better kite, but he dismisses them. Taking it upon himself to hire a new nanny, Mr. Banks advertises for a stern, no-nonsense nanny. Instead, Jane and Michael present their own advertisement for a kinder, sweeter nanny. Mr. Banks rips up the letter, and throws the scraps in the fireplace, but the remains of the advertisement magically float up, and out into the air.\
The next day, a number of elderly, sour-faced nannies wait outside the Banks' home, but a strong gust of wind blows them away, and Jane and Michael witness a young nanny descending from the sky using her umbrella. Presenting herself to Mr. Banks,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mary_Poppins_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mary Poppins}}\'a0calmly produces the children's restored advertisement, and agrees with its requests, but promises the astonished banker she will be firm with his children. As Mr. Banks puzzles over the advertisement's return, Mary Poppins hires herself, and convinces him it was originally his idea. She meets the children, then helps them tidy their nursery through song, before heading out for a walk in the park.\
Outside, they meet Bert, working as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Street_painting"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 screever}}; Mary Poppins uses her magic to transport the group into one of his drawings. While the children ride on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carousel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 carousel}}, Mary Poppins and Bert go on a leisurely stroll. Mary Poppins later enchants the carousel horses, and participates in a horse race, which she wins. While being asked to describe her victory, Mary Poppins announces the nonsense word "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious}}". However, the outing is ruined when a thunderstorm dissolves Bert's drawings, returning the group to London.\
On another outing, the four meet Uncle Albert, who has floated up in the air due to his uncontrollable laughter; they join him for a tea party on the ceiling, telling jokes.\
Mr. Banks becomes annoyed by the household's cheery atmosphere, and threatens to fire Mary Poppins. Instead, Mary Poppins inverts his attempt by convincing him to take the children to the bank for a day. Mr. Banks takes Jane and Michael to the bank, where they meet Mr. Dawes Sr, and his son. Mr. Dawes aggressively attempts to have Michael invest his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Twopence_(British_pre-decimal_coin)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tuppence}}\'a0in the bank, snatching it from him. Michael demands it back, causing other customers to misinterpret, and all demand their own money back, causing a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bank_run"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bank run}}.\
Jane and Michael flee the bank, getting lost in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/East_End_of_London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 East End}}\'a0until they run into Bert, now working as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chimney_sweep"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chimney sweep}}, who escorts them home. The three and Mary Poppins venture onto the rooftops, where they have a song-and-dance number with other chimney sweeps, which spills out into the Banks' home. An incensed Mr. Banks returns, and receives a phone call from his employers. He speaks with Bert, who tells him he should spend more time with his children before they grow up. Jane and Michael give their father Michael's tuppence in the hope to make amends.\
Mr. Banks walks through London to the bank, where he is given a humiliating\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cashiering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cashiering}}, and is dismissed. Looking to the tuppence for words, he blurts out "Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious!", tells one of Uncle Albert's jokes, and happily heads home. Dawes mulls over the joke, but finally "gets" it, and floats up into the air, laughing.\
The next day, the wind changes, meaning Mary Poppins must leave. A happier Mr. Banks is found at home, having fixed his children's kite, and takes the family out to fly it. In the park, the Bankses meet Mr. Dawes Jr, who reveals his father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_from_laughter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 died laughing}}\'a0from the joke, and re-employs Mr. Banks as a junior partner. With her work done, Mary Poppins flies away, with Bert bidding her farewell, telling her not to stay away too long.\
In 1938, Maria is a free-spirited young Austrian woman studying to become a nun at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nonnberg_Abbey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nonnberg Abbey}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salzburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Salzburg}}. Her love of music and the mountains, her youthful enthusiasm and imagination, and her lack of discipline cause some concern among the nuns. The Mother Abbess, believing Maria would be happier outside the abbey, sends her to the villa of retired naval officer Captain Georg von Trapp to be governess to his seven children\'97Liesl, Friedrich, Louisa, Kurt, Brigitta, Marta, and Gretl. The Captain has been raising his children using strict military discipline following the death of his wife. Although the children misbehave at first, Maria responds with kindness and patience, and soon the children come to trust and respect her. Liesl, the oldest, is won over after Maria protects her from discovery when she is nearly caught sneaking back into the house after meeting with Rolfe, a messenger boy she is in love with.\
While the Captain is away in Vienna, Maria makes play clothes for the children and takes them around Salzburg and the surrounding mountains, and teaches them how to sing. When the Captain returns to the villa with Baroness Elsa Schraeder, a wealthy socialite, and their mutual friend, Max Detweiler, they are greeted by Maria and the children returning from a boat ride on the lake that concludes when their boat overturns. Displeased by his children's clothes and activities, and Maria's impassioned appeal that he get closer to his children, the Captain orders her to return to the abbey. Just then he hears singing coming from inside the house and is astonished to see his children singing for the Baroness. Filled with emotion, the Captain joins his children, singing for the first time in years. Afterwards, he apologizes to Maria and asks her to stay.\
Impressed by the children's singing, Max proposes he enter them in the upcoming\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salzburg_Festival"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Salzburg Festival}}\'a0but the suggestion is immediately rejected by the Captain as he is opposed to his children singing in public. He does agree, however, to organize a grand party at the villa. The night of the party, while guests in formal attire\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Waltz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 waltz}}\'a0in the ballroom, Maria and the children look on from the garden terrace. When the Captain notices Maria teaching Kurt the traditional\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/L%C3%A4ndler"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 L\'e4ndler}}\'a0folk dance, he cuts in and dances with Maria in a graceful performance, culminating in a close embrace. Confused about her feelings, Maria blushes and breaks away. Later, the Baroness, who noticed the Captain's attraction to Maria, hides her jealousy while convincing Maria that she must return to the abbey. Back at the abbey, when Mother Abbess learns that Maria has stayed in seclusion to avoid her feelings for the Captain, she encourages her to return to the villa to look for her life. After Maria returns to the villa, she learns about the Captain's engagement to the Baroness and agrees to stay until they find a replacement governess. The Captain's feelings for Maria, however, have not changed, and after breaking off his engagement the Captain marries Maria.\
While the Captain and Maria are on their honeymoon, Max enters the children in the Salzburg Festival against their father's wishes. When they learn that Austria has been annexed by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Third_Reich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Third Reich}}\'a0in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anschluss"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anschluss}}, the couple return to their home, where a telegram awaits informing the Captain that he must report to the German Naval base at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bremerhaven"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bremerhaven}}\'a0to accept a commission in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kriegsmarine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Navy}}. Strongly opposed to the Nazis and the\'a0
\f1\i Anschluss
\f0\i0 , the Captain tells his family they must leave Austria immediately for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Switzerland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Switzerland}}. Many of the Von Trapps' friends are prepared to accept the new regime, including Rolfe, whom Liesl is devastated to see has joined the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hitler_Youth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hitler Youth}}. That night, as the von Trapp family attempt to leave, they are stopped by a group of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sturmabteilung"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brownshirts}}\'a0waiting outside the villa. When questioned by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gauleiter"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gauleiter}}\'a0Hans Zeller, the Captain maintains they are headed to the Salzburg Festival to perform. Zeller insists on escorting them to the festival, after which his men will accompany the Captain to Bremerhaven.\
Later that night at the festival, during their final number, the von Trapp family slip away and seek shelter at the nearby abbey, where Mother Abbess hides them in the cemetery crypt. Brownshirts soon arrive and search the abbey, and the family is discovered by Rolfe. Upon seeing Liesl, he hesitates raising the alarm long enough to allow the family time to flee, and the family is able to escape using the caretaker's car. When the soldiers attempt to pursue, they discover their cars will not start as two nuns have removed parts of the engines. The next morning, after driving to the Swiss border, the von Trapp family make their way on foot across the frontier into Switzerland to safety and freedom.\
The film
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0consists of five main sections:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genesis_creation_narrative"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Creation}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adam_and_Eve"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Adam and Eve}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cain_and_Abel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cain and Abel}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Noah%27s_Ark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Noah's Ark}}, and the story of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abraham"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abraham}}. There are also a pair of shorter sections, one recounting the building of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tower_of_Babel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tower of Babel}}, and the other the destruction of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sodom_and_Gomorrah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sodom and Gomorrah}}. The sections vary greatly in tone. The story of Abraham is somber and reverential, while that of Noah repeatedly focuses on his love of all animals. Cats (including lions) are shown drinking milk and Noah's relationship with the animals is depicted as harmonious. It was originally conceived as the first in a series of films retelling the entire\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Old_Testament"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Old Testament}}, but these sequels were never made.\
In 1819, young Prince Keoki Kanakoa from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawaiian_Islands"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Islands of Hawaii}}\'a0makes an appeal at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yale_Divinity_School"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yale Divinity School}}\'a0for newly graduated ministers to return with him to Hawaii and convert the natives to Christianity. Reverend Abner Hale is among those who volunteer for the mission. Before being sent to Hawaii, the young ministers must marry \'97 a problem for Abner as he has zealously devoted himself to his studies and does not know any marriageable young women, partly because he has been raised in a strict, cold\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Calvinist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Calvinist}}\'a0household where romance or pleasure, even between a married couple, is considered sinful. The head of the school, Reverend Dr. Thorn, introduces Abner to his niece, Jerusha Bromley, a beautiful and pious New England girl who has been pining for Captain Rafer Hoxworth, a whaler who has been at sea for two years and has not written to her. Although Jerusha's parents are not enthused about her marrying the awkward Abner, her uncle persuades them to give him a chance, and also hides the package of letters from Hoxworth that appear at the Bromley home just as Abner arrives.\
Abner is stunned by Jerusha's beauty, and attracted to her despite his attempts to avoid what he considers sinful thoughts, but he completely lacks social graces and makes one embarrassing gaffe after another. Despite this, Jerusha encourages him, and he finally proposes and she accepts, with the understanding that they will both be going on mission to Hawaii. The Hales depart for Hawaii with the other missionaries and Keoki, and after a harrowing sea voyage during which all but Abner are very seasick and the ship almost wrecks going around\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cape_Horn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cape Horn}}\'a0in southern\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chile"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chile}}, they arrive in Keoki's hometown of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lahaina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lahaina}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maui"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maui}}, where they stop before most of the missionaries continue on to the main church at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Honolulu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Honolulu}}. The missionaries are horrified to see what they consider the islanders' sinful ways. Naked young girls swim out to meet the ships and have sexual relations with the sailors; monuments are dedicated to the traditional gods; and Keoki's father Kelolo is both the husband and the biological brother of Keoki's mother Malama Kanakoa, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ali%CA%BBi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ali\uc0\u699 i Nui}}\'a0(ruler) whom the natives consider a "sacred person". The Ali'i Nui must marry her brother to avoid polluting the bloodline of the ruling family, and Keoki is expected to also marry his sister Noelani when she succeeds Malama as Ali'i Nui. However, Keoki is willing to forego this in order to become what he truly wants to be, an ordained Christian minister.\
Malama takes a liking to Jerusha and demands that Jerusha teach her to write English, so she can communicate with the outside world. Malama agrees to learn about the Christian God, but only after she learns to write. When the other missionaries continue on to Honolulu, the Hales stay behind, living in an uncomfortable hut and building a church. Jerusha tries to change the villagers' tradition of killing unwanted or deformed babies, personally rescuing one baby who has a birthmark. Jerusha goes through a difficult labor to give birth to her own healthy son, tended only by the inexperienced Abner (who excludes the native midwives) and afterwards Abner confesses to her his great love for her, a love he normally feels is sinful and tries to suppress. Abner baptizes his first convert, a young Hawaiian girl named Iliki who works as a servant for the Hales. However, he makes excuses to defer ordaining Keoki as a minister; in reality, he and his superiors have no intentions of ordaining any natives. Keoki eventually realizes that he will never be permitted to become a minister, despite having studied for years, including at Yale. He becomes disillusioned with Christianity as a result.\
Malama, who is a kind, loving and intelligent woman underneath her imperious facade, agrees to learn about Christianity, but will not take the final step to convert because she will have to send away Kelolo, her beloved husband of many years who is also her brother. At the Hales' urging, she enacts a curfew for sailors and forbids girls from swimming out to the ships. The sailors in port riot in protest, led by Captain Hoxworth, who has made a stop on his long whaling voyage. In the midst of the melee, Hoxworth discovers that the love of his life, Jerusha, is in Lahaina and is now the wife of Reverend Hale, whom he already despises for inspiring Malama to enact the restrictions. The sailors partially torch the church, but the Hawaiians help the Hales put out the fire and then chase the sailors back to their ships. To console himself over Jerusha, Hoxworth entices Iliki to sail away with him, and knocks Abner overboard when he comes after her.\
Malama, on her deathbed, agrees to renounce Kelolo and is baptized a Christian right before she dies while saying a final goodbye to Kelolo. Upon the death of the Ali'i Nui, as predicted by the natives, a strong wind begins to blow, destroying the church building (which Abner refused to build in a way that the villagers suggested to let the wind pass through). Soon after her death, Abner hears drums and discovers Kelolo conducting a marriage ceremony for Keoki and Noelani, the new Ali'i Nui. Keoki, rejected as a minister, has turned back to the traditional gods. Keoki also reveals that while his mother Malama agreed to become a Christian in order to set an example for her people, whom she realized must become Christians for their own good as more and more white settlers arrive, she secretly asked that after she was buried in the Christian graveyard, her family move her bones to an undisclosed location where she can be with the old gods, and that Kelolo take her heart back to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bora_Bora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bora Bora}}, the land of their ancestors. Horrified and enraged, Abner curses the Kanakoa family and the other Hawaiians and tells them God will punish them for their sins.\
Noelani, pregnant by Keoki, gives birth to a horribly deformed baby who cannot be accepted as Ali'i Nui. Jerusha begs Abner to intercede to save the baby, whom she fears will be killed, but he refuses, saying it is God's punishment for Keoki's and Noelani's sin. Keoki drowns the baby in the ocean, causing a rift between Abner and Jerusha. Shortly afterwards, a sailor carries measles into the port of Lahaina. While this is a relatively minor childhood illness to the missionaries and sailors, the native Hawaiians have no resistance, develop high fevers and die in droves. Keoki dies in Abner's arms in a feverish delirium, renouncing God. Abner returns home wracked by sadness and guilt, feeling that he failed in his mission to save Keoki and the other natives from hell. Jerusha, who is worn out from overwork in the hot climate, giving birth to three children, and nursing the sick Hawaiians, tells him that she does not believe God would send loving people like the Hawaiians to hell even if they weren't Christians, and furthermore tells Abner he can help the Hawaiians by giving them what he has always had difficulty giving her - his love. Jerusha soon dies, mourned by Abner, her children, and Captain Hoxworth, who never got over losing her to Abner.\
After Jerusha's death, Abner becomes more loving towards the Hawaiians and works with them to try to prevent white settlers and plantation owners from taking their land. His position is at odds with the other ministers, who have recently voted that it is time for the churches to own land themselves and try to make money from it, something the ministers had avoided before. Abner is reassigned back to New England and his Lahaina church is given to another minister. But Abner refuses to leave Lahaina and says he will stay and continue to preach, in the street if necessary, and without any support from the church organization. He does agree to send the three Hale children back to New England to live with the Bromleys and receive a proper education. After bidding his children goodbye at the dock, Abner returns to his hut to find that a young Hawaiian man has arrived who wishes to be his assistant and help him, something the aging, frail Abner very much needs. He is overjoyed to see that the young man is the baby with the birthmark, now grown to an adult, whom Jerusha saved from being killed many years ago.\
The film centers on the volatile marriage of a middle-aged couple: George, an associate history professor at a small\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New England}}\'a0college, and Martha, the daughter of the university president. After they return home drunk from a party, Martha reveals she has invited a young married couple, whom she had met at the party, for a drink. The guests arrive \'96 Nick, a biology professor (whom Martha mistakenly believes to be a math professor), and his wife, Honey \'96 at 2:30 am. As the four drink, Martha and George engage in scathing verbal abuse in front of Nick and Honey. The younger couple is first embarrassed and later enmeshed.\
The wives briefly separate from the husbands, and upon their return, Honey reveals that Martha has told her about her and George's son, adding that she understands that the following day (Sunday) will mark his sixteenth birthday. George is visibly angry that Martha has divulged this information.\
Martha taunts George aggressively and he retaliates with his usual passive aggression. Martha tells an embarrassing story about how she humiliated him in front of her father. Martha's taunts continue, and George reacts violently by breaking a bottle. Nick and Honey become increasingly unsettled, and Honey, who has had too much brandy, and has just been whirled violently around the room by George while chanting "Who's afraid of Virginia Woolf?" (to the tune of "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Here_We_Go_Round_the_Mulberry_Bush"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Here We Go Round the Mulberry Bush}}"), runs to the bathroom to vomit.\
Martha goes to the kitchen to make coffee, and George and Nick go outside. The younger man confesses he was attracted to Honey more for her family's money than passion, and married her only because he mistakenly believed she was pregnant. George describes his own marriage as one of never-ending accommodation and adjustment, then admits he considers Nick a threat. George also tells a story about a boy he grew up with who had accidentally killed his mother and years later, his father, and ended up living out his days in a mental hospital. Nick admits he aims to charm and sleep his way to the top, and jokes that Martha would be a good place to start.\
When their guests propose leaving, George insists on driving them home, despite his inebriated state. They approach a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roadhouse_(facility)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 roadhouse}}, and Honey suggests they stop to dance. While Honey and George watch, Nick suggestively dances with Martha, who continues to mock and criticize George. George unplugs the jukebox and announces the game is over. In response, Martha alludes to the fact he may have murdered his parents like the protagonist in his unpublished,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Non-fiction_novel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 non-fiction novel}}, prompting George to attack Martha until Nick pulls him away from her. George tells the group about a second novel he allegedly has written about a young couple from the Midwest, a good-looking teacher and his timid wife, who marry because of her\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/False_pregnancy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hysterical pregnancy}}\'a0and money, then settle in a small college town. An embarrassed Honey realizes Nick indiscreetly told George about their past and runs from the room. Nick promises revenge on George, and then runs after Honey.\
In the parking lot, George tells his wife he cannot stand the way she constantly humiliates him, and she tauntingly accuses him of having married her for just that reason. Their rage erupts into a declaration of "total war". Martha drives off, retrieving Nick and Honey, leaving George to make his way back home on foot. When he arrives home, he discovers the car crashed on the drive and Honey half conscious on the back seat and sees Martha and Nick together through the bedroom window. Through Honey's drunken babbling, George begins to suspect that her pregnancy was in fact real, and that she secretly had an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abortion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 abortion}}. He then devises a plan to get back at Martha.\
When Martha accuses Nick of being sexually inadequate, he blames his lack of performance on all the liquor he has consumed. George then appears holding snapdragons, which he throws at Martha and Nick in another game. He mentions his and Martha's son, prompting her to reminisce about his birth and childhood and how he was nearly destroyed by his father. George accuses Martha of engaging in destructive and abusive behavior with the boy, who frequently ran away to escape her attention. George then announces he has received a telegram with bad news\'97their son has been killed in a car accident.\
As Martha begs George not to "kill" their son, Nick suddenly realizes the truth: Martha and George had never been able to have children, and filled the void with an imaginary son. By declaring their son dead, accordingly, George has "killed" him. George explains that their one mutually-agreed-upon rule was to never mention the "existence" of their son to anyone else, and that he "killed" him because Martha broke that rule by mentioning him to Honey.\
The young couple departs quietly, and George and Martha are left alone as the day begins to break outside. George starts singing the song "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?", and Martha responds, "I am, George, I am."\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mowgli"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mowgli}}, a young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orphan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 orphan}}\'a0boy, is found in a basket in the deep jungles of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/India"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 India}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bagheera"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bagheera}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_panther"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black panther}}\'a0who promptly takes him to Raksha, a mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indian_wolf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wolf}}\'a0who has just had cubs. She and her mate, Rama, raise him along with there own cubs and Mowgli soon becomes well acquainted with jungle life and plays with his wolf siblings.\
Ten years later, the wolf pack learns that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shere_Khan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shere Khan}}, a man-eating\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bengal_tiger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bengal tiger}}, has returned to the jungle. Pack leader Akela decides that Mowgli can no longer stay with the pack and must be deported from the jungle for his own safety. Bagheera volunteers to escort him to a "Man-Village." They leave that very night, but Mowgli is determined to stay in the jungle. He and Bagheera rest in a tree for the night, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kaa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kaa}}, a hungry\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indian_python"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indian python}}, tries to devour Mowgli, but Bagheera intervenes. The next morning, Mowgli tries to join the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indian_elephant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 elephant}}\'a0patrol led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hathi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Colonel Hathi}}\'a0and his wife Winifred. Bagheera finds Mowgli, but after a fight decides to leave Mowgli on his own. Mowgli soon meets up with the laid-back, fun-loving\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sloth_bear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sloth bear}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baloo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baloo}}, who promises to raise Mowgli himself and never take him back to the Man-Village.\
Shortly afterwards, a group of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bandar-log"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 monkeys}}\'a0kidnap Mowgli and take him to their leader,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/King_Louie"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Louie}}\'a0the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orangutan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 orangutan}}. King Louie offers to help Mowgli stay in the jungle if he will tell Louie how to make fire like other humans. However, since he was not raised by humans, Mowgli does not know how to make fire.
