In a last-ditch strategy, O'Halloran and Roberts blow up water tanks atop the Tower with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Plastic_explosive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 plastic explosives}}. Most of the partygoers survive as water rushes through the ruined building, extinguishing the flames.\
Jernigan gives Claiborne, who is heartbroken at Lisolette's death, her cat. Duncan, consoling his grieving daughter, promises that such a tragic debacle will never happen again. Roberts accepts O\'92Halloran\'92s offer of guidance on how to build a fire-safe skyscraper. O\'92Halloran drives away, exhausted.\
On the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_frontier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American frontier}}\'a0of 1874, a new railroad will soon be rerouted through Rock Ridge, in order to avoid running through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quicksand"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quicksand}}. The conniving attorney general\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hedy_Lamarr"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hedley Lamarr}}\'a0wants to force Rock Ridge's residents to abandon their town, and sends a gang of thugs, led by his flunky Taggart, to shoot the sheriff and trash the town. The townspeople demand that Governor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Le_Petomane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William J. Le Petomane}}\'a0appoint a new sheriff to protect them. Lamarr persuades the dim-witted Le Petomane to appoint Bart, a black railroad worker, who was about to be executed for assaulting a white foreman. A black sheriff, he reasons, will offend the townspeople, create chaos, and leave the town at his mercy.\
After an initial hostile reception (where Sheriff Bart has to take himself hostage to escape), he relies on his quick wits and the assistance of Jim, an alcoholic gunslinger known as the "Waco Kid", to overcome the townspeople's hostility. He subdues Mongo, an immensely strong, dim-witted, but philosophical henchman sent to kill him; when he visits the railroad work site and discovers their interest in the land, the Waco Kid outshoots Taggart and his thugs; finally, Bart outmaneuvers German seductress-for-hire Lili von Sht\'fcpp at her own game, with Lili falling in love with him. Lamarr, furious that his schemes have backfired, hatches a larger plan involving a recruited army of thugs, including common criminals,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ku Klux Klansmen}}, Nazis, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Methodism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Methodists}}.\
Three miles east of Rock Ridge, Bart introduces the white townspeople to the black, Chinese, and Irish railroad workers, who have agreed to help in exchange for acceptance by the community, and explains his plan to defeat Lamarr's army. They labor all night to build a perfect replica of their town, as a diversion; with no people in it, though, Bart realizes it will not fool the villains. While the townspeople construct replicas of themselves, Bart, Jim, and Mongo buy time by constructing the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_State_Thruway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gov. William J. Le Petomane Thruway}}", forcing the raiding party to turn back for "a shitload of dimes" to pay the toll. Once through the tollbooth, the raiders attack the fake town populated with dummies, which are booby-trapped with dynamite bombs. After Jim detonates the bombs with his sharpshooting, launching bad guys and horses skyward, the Rock Ridgers storm the villains.\
The resulting brawl between townsfolk, railroad workers, and Lamarr's thugs breaks the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fourth_wall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fourth wall}}, spilling onto a neighboring set, where director Buddy Bizarre is directing a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Busby_Berkeley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Busby Berkeley}}-style top-hat-and-tails musical number; then into the studio commissary for a food fight; and then out of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warner_Bros._Studios,_Burbank"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warner Bros. film lot}}\'a0into the streets of Burbank. Lamarr, realizing he has been beaten, hails a taxi and orders the driver to "drive me off this picture". He ducks into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grauman%27s_Chinese_Theatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grauman's Chinese Theatre}}, which is playing the premiere of\'a0
\f1\i Blazing Saddles
\f0\i0 . As he settles into his seat, he sees Bart arriving on horseback outside the theatre. Bart blocks Lamarr's escape, and then shoots him in the groin. Bart and Jim then go into Grauman's to watch the end of the film, in which Bart announces to the townspeople that he is moving on. Riding out of town, he finds Jim, and invites him along to "nowhere special". They ride off into the sunset on horseback, but stop at a chauffeured\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stretch_limousine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stretch limousine}}\'a0and continue outward in the vehicle.\
During a beach party at dusk on Amity Island,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New England}}, a young woman, Chrissie Watkins, goes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nude_swimming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skinny dipping}}\'a0in the ocean. While\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Treading_water"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 treading water}}, she is violently pulled under. The next day, her partial remains are found on shore. The medical examiner's ruling that the death was due to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark_attack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark attack}}\'a0leads police chief Martin Brody to close the beaches. Mayor Larry Vaughn overrules him, fearing that the town's summer economy will be ruined. The coroner now concurs with the mayor's theory that Chrissie was killed in a boating accident. Brody reluctantly accepts their conclusion until another fatal shark attack occurs shortly thereafter. A bounty is placed on the shark, prompting an amateur shark-hunting frenzy. Local professional shark hunter Quint offers his services for $10,000. Meanwhile, consulting oceanographer Matt Hooper examines Chrissie's remains, and confirms her death was caused by a shark\'97an unusually large one.\
When local fishermen catch a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tiger_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tiger shark}}, the mayor proclaims the beaches safe. Hooper disputes that it is the same predator, confirming this after no human remains are found inside it. Hooper and Brody find a half-sunken vessel while searching the night waters in Hooper's boat. Underwater, Hooper retrieves a sizable\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_white_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 great white shark}}'s tooth embedded in the submerged hull. He drops it in fright after encountering a partial corpse. Vaughn discounts Brody and Hooper's claims that a huge great white shark is responsible for the deaths, and refuses to close the beaches, allowing only added safety precautions. On the Fourth of July weekend, tourists pack the beaches. Following a juvenile prank in which the presence of a shark is simulated, the real shark enters a nearby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Estuary"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 estuary}}, killing a boater and causing Brody's oldest son, Michael, to go into shock. Brody then convinces Vaughn to hire Quint.\
Quint, Brody, and Hooper set out on Quint's boat, the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 , to hunt the shark. While Brody lays down a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chumming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chum}}\'a0line, Quint waits for an opportunity to hook the shark. Without warning, it appears behind the boat. Quint, estimating its length at 25 feet (7.6\'a0m) and weight at 3 tons, harpoons it with a line attached to a flotation barrel, but the shark pulls the barrel underwater and disappears.\
At nightfall, Quint and Hooper drunkenly exchange stories about their assorted scars and Quint reveals that he survived the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Indianapolis_(CA-35)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USS\'a0
\f1\i Indianapolis}}. The shark returns unexpectedly, ramming the boat's hull, and disabling the power. The men work through the night, repairing the engine. In the morning, Brody attempts to call the Coast Guard, but Quint, who has become obsessed with killing the shark without outside assistance, smashes the radio. After a long chase, Quint harpoons another barrel into the shark. The line is tied to the stern cleats, but the shark drags the boat backward, swamping the deck and flooding the engine compartment. Quint prepares to sever the line to prevent the transom from being pulled out but the cleats break off, keeping the barrels attached to the shark. Quint heads toward shore to draw the shark into shallower waters, but he intentionally pushes the damaged engine past the safety limits and the overtaxed engine fails.\
With the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 \'a0slowly sinking, the trio attempt a riskier approach. Hooper puts on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scuba_set"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scuba gear}}\'a0and enters the water in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark-proof_cage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark-proof cage}}, intending to lethally inject the shark with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Strychnine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 strychnine}}, using a hypodermic spear. The shark demolishes the cage before Hooper can inject it, but he manages to escape to the seabed. The shark then attacks the boat directly and devours Quint. Trapped on the sinking vessel, Brody jams a pressurized scuba tank into the shark's mouth, and, climbing the crow's nest, shoots the tank with a rifle. The resulting explosion obliterates the shark. Hooper surfaces, and he and Brody paddle back to Amity Island clinging to the remaining barrels.\
In late 1975, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heavyweight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 heavyweight}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boxing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 boxing}}\'a0world champion, Apollo Creed, announces plans to hold a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Title_bout"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 title bout}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Philadelphia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Philadelphia}}\'a0during the upcoming\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Bicentennial"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United States Bicentennial}}. However, he is informed five weeks from the fight date that his scheduled opponent is unable to compete due to an injured hand. With all other potential replacements booked up or otherwise unavailable, Creed decides to spice things up by giving a local contender a chance to challenge him. He settles in on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocky_Balboa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocky Balboa}}, an aspiring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Southpaw_stance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 southpaw}}\'a0boxer from an Italian neighborhood of Philadelphia, known by the nickname "The Italian Stallion".\
Rocky meets with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Promoter_(entertainment)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 promoter}}\'a0Miles Jergens, unexpectedly presuming Creed is seeking local sparring partners. Reluctant at first, Rocky eventually agrees to the fight which will pay him $150,000. After several weeks of training, using whatever he can find, including meat carcasses as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Punching_bag"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 punching bags}}, Rocky accepts an offer of assistance from gym proprietor Mickey "Mighty Mick" Goldmill, a respected trainer and former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bantamweight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bantamweight}}fighter from the 1920s, who always criticized Rocky for wasting his potential.\
Meanwhile, Rocky meets Adrian Pennino, who is working part-time at the J&M Tropical Fish\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pet_store"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pet store}}. He begins to build a romantic relationship with Adrian, culminating in a kiss. Adrian's brother, Paulie, becomes jealous of Rocky's success, but Rocky calms him by agreeing to advertise his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Meat_packing_industry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 meatpacking business}}\'a0before the upcoming fight. The night before the fight, Rocky begins to lose confidence after touring the arena. He confesses to Adrian that he does not expect to win, but wants to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_distance_(boxing)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 go the distance}}\'a0against Creed, which no other fighter has done, and prove himself to everyone.\
On\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Year%27s_Day"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Year's Day}}, the fight is held, with Creed making a dramatic entrance dressed as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Washington"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Washington}}\'a0and then\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Uncle_Sam"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Uncle Sam}}. Taking advantage of his overconfidence, Rocky knocks him down in the first round\'97the first time that Creed has ever been knocked down. Humiliated, Creed takes Rocky more seriously for the rest of the fight, though his ego never fully fades. The fight goes on for the full fifteen rounds, with both combatants sustaining various injuries, Rocky with a detached retina in his right eye and hits to the head, and Apollo with internal bleeding and a broken rib. As the fight progresses, Creed's superior skill is countered by Rocky's apparently unlimited ability to absorb punches, and his dogged refusal to go down. As the final round bell sounds, with both fighters locked in each other's arms, they promise to each other that there will be no rematch.\
After the fight, the sportscasters and the audience go wild. Jergens announces over the loudspeaker that the fight was "the greatest exhibition of guts and stamina in the history of the ring", and Rocky calls out repeatedly for Adrian, who runs down and comes into the ring as Paulie distracts arena security. As Jergens declares Creed the winner by virtue of a split decision (8:7, 7:8, 9:6), Adrian and Rocky embrace and profess their love to each other, not caring about the result of the fight.\
The galaxy is in the midst of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a civil war}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel}}\'a0spies have stolen plans to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}, a colossal\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space station}}\'a0capable of destroying an entire planet.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Leia}}, one of the Rebellion's leaders, has obtained the plans, but\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tantive_IV"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 her starship}}\'a0is captured by an Imperial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0under the command of the ruthless\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}. Before she is captured, Leia hides the plans in the memory of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)#Astromech_droids"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astromech droid}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who, along with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)#Protocol_droids"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 protocol droid}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}, flees in an escape pod to the desert planet below the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Starship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 starships}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}.\
The droids are captured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jawas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jawa}}\'a0traders, who sell them to moisture farmers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Owen_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Owen}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Beru_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Beru Lars}}\'a0and their nephew\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}. While cleaning\'a0R2-D2, Luke accidentally triggers a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holography"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 holographic}}\'a0recording of Leia, in which she requests help from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}. The next morning, Luke finds\'a0R2-D2\'a0missing, and encounters "Old Ben" Kenobi, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hermit}}\'a0who reveals himself as Obi-Wan. He tells Luke of his days as one of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Knights}}, former peacekeepers of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Republic}}\'a0who derived their power from an energy field called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0until being all but wiped out by the Empire. Contrary to what his uncle has told him, Luke learns that his father fought alongside Obi-Wan as a Jedi Knight until Vader, a former pupil of Obi-Wan's, turned to the dark side of the Force and murdered him. Obi-Wan presents Luke with his father's old weapon: a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}.\
R2-D2\'a0plays Leia's message for Obi-Wan, in which she begs him to take the Death Star plans to her home planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alderaan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alderaan}}\'a0and give them to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bail_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 her father}}\'a0for analysis. Obi-Wan invites Luke to accompany him to Alderaan and learn the ways of the Force. Luke declines, but changes his mind after discovering that Imperials have killed his aunt and uncle and destroyed their farm. Obi-Wan and Luke visit a cantina in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mos_Eisley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mos Eisley}}, where, after a brief confrontation, they meet smuggler\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wookiee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wookiee}}\'a0co-pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}. After negotiating a price, they join forces aboard Han's ship, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}.\
The group discovers that Alderaan has been destroyed by the Death Star's superlaser\'97a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Show_of_force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 show of force}}\'a0on order of the commanding officer,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grand_Moff_Tarkin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grand Moff Tarkin}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by the Death Star's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tractor_beam"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tractor beam}}, which Obi-Wan goes to disable. Luke discovers that Leia is imprisoned on the Death Star, and rescues her with the help of Han and Chewbacca in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swashbuckler#Movie"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 swashbuckling}}\'a0series of escapes. After Obi-Wan sacrifices himself in a lightsaber duel with Darth Vader to enable the heroes to escape, the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0escapes amid a fierce dogfight with Imperial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE starfighters}}. Using a tracking beacon placed aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , the Imperials follow the rebels to the hidden base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yavin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yavin 4}}.\
The Death Star plans reveal that it can be destroyed by triggering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chain_reaction"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chain reaction}}\'a0from an external exhaust port. Luke joins the Rebel fighter squadron, while Han collects his payment, intending to leave. In the ensuing battle, the Rebels suffer heavy losses after several unsuccessful runs. Vader leads a squadron of TIE fighters and prepares to attack Luke's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing}}, but Han returns and fires at the Imperial fighters, sending Vader spiraling away. Guided by Obi-Wan's spirit, Luke turns off his targeting computer and uses the Force to destroy the Death Star just before it can fire on the Rebel base. On Yavin 4, Leia awards Luke and Han with medals for their heroism.\
In the summer of 1958,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greaser_(subculture)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 greaser}}\'a0Danny Zuko and sweet Australian girl Sandy Olsson meet at the beach and fall in love. When the summer comes to an end, Sandy, whose family is returning to Australia, worries that they might never meet again, but Danny tells her that their love is "only the beginning." At the beginning of the new school year at Rydell High School ("Grease"), Danny reunites with his fellow gang members, the T-Birds, of whom his best friend Kenickie, along with Doody, Sonny, and Putzie are members. Meanwhile, unbeknownst to Danny, Sandy arrives at school, with her family's plans having changed, with her new friend Frenchy, a member of the Pink Ladies. Other Pink Ladies Rizzo, Marty, and Jan also arrive, excited to be seniors, as does Patty Simcox, a high-achieving cheerleader.\
At lunch, Frenchy introduces Sandy to the other Pink Ladies while Danny and the T-Birds make fun of practicing football players, including the handsome Tom Chisum. Each group asks Danny and Sandy, respectively, about their summers and they each independently describe their romance without using the other's name, with Sandy's description far more innocent than Danny's ("Summer Nights"). Headed back to class, Sandy reveals that it was Danny Zuko she met, and Rizzo teases that perhaps she'll meet him again.\
At a pep rally before a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_football"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 football}}\'a0game, Sandy and Patty perform as cheerleaders; there, Sandy and Tom flirt. Kenickie arrives with a used car he plans on rebuilding so he can race it at Thunder Road, a popular\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Street_racing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 street race}}spot; as he says this, Leo Balmudo, a rival greaser from the Scorpions, drives by in a menacing manner. Rizzo puts Sandy and Danny together, surprising both of them. Sandy is thrilled to see Danny, but he is obnoxious and indifferent, upsetting Sandy. Frenchy invites Sandy to a sleepover with the Pink Ladies to cheer her up.\
Rizzo and the other girls pressure Sandy into smoking a cigarette and having a drink of wine at the sleepover. Frenchy reveals that she plans to drop out of Rydell to go to beauty school and in an effort to prove herself, tries to pierce Sandy's ear, making Sandy sick. Rizzo makes fun of her innocent nature ("Look At Me, I'm Sandra Dee") and leaves when the T-Birds arrive in Kenickie's car. Rizzo tries to make Danny jealous by flirting with Kenickie, but Danny is unmoved and leaves. Kenickie leaves with Rizzo, stranding Putzie, Sonny, and Doody. Sandy laments over her feelings towards Danny, despite his earlier behavior ("Hopelessly Devoted to You").\
Kenickie and Rizzo, while in the midst of sex, are interrupted when Leo, along with his girlfriend Cha-Cha, deliberately crashes his own street racer into Kenickie's and insults Rizzo. At the same time, Kenickie's condom breaks.\
The next day, the T-Birds look over Kenickie's car, and although they are initially skeptical of its potential, Danny and Kenickie explain the modifications they could add to make it a hot-rodding sex machine ("Greased Lightnin'"). At the popular hangout The Frosty Palace, Danny, after brushing off an attempt by Patty to flirt with him, apologizes to Sandy for his behavior at the pep rally, but she rejects him having started dating Tom instead. Danny approaches Coach Calhoun about playing a sport. After picking fights with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jock_(subculture)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 jocks}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Basketball"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 basketball}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wrestling"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wrestling}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baseball"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 baseball}}, Calhoun suggests\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cross-country_running"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cross-country running}}; Danny proves to be a successful runner, which impresses Sandy and angers Tom.\
Danny takes Sandy to the Frosty Palace for a date; they are soon joined by the rest of the greasers, and Danny and Sandy quickly leave in discomfort. Putzie and Jan, in an awkward exchange, agree to pair off for the dance; Kenickie and Rizzo get into an argument and go their separate ways, while Sonny unsuccessfully tries to court Marty. After everyone else has left, Frenchy, whose hair has turned bright pink, tells a waitress she has dropped out of beauty school and is visited by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guardian_angel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 guardian angel}}\'a0who advises her to return to Rydell ("Beauty School Dropout").\
At the school dance, Leo and Cha-Cha show up as Rizzo's and Kenickie's respective dates. Vince Fontaine, who is hosting a live telecast of the dance, flirts with Marty. All of the students take part in a dance contest that descends into chaos ("Born to Hand Jive"). Danny and Sandy do well, but Sonny pulls Sandy off the dance floor, allowing Cha Cha to step in and win with Danny. During the last dance ("Blue Moon"), Sonny, Putzie, and Doody\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mooning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 moon}}\'a0the national TV audience.\
Danny apologizes to Sandy and tries to make it up to her by taking her to a drive-in movie theater. She's unmoved by his pleas for forgiveness until he asks her to wear his ring, which she gleefully accepts. Danny then tries to make out with her, causing Sandy to angrily throw his ring at him and run off in disgust, leaving Danny distraught ("Sandy"). Meanwhile, Rizzo admits she may be pregnant to Marty and asks her to keep it a secret, but the story gets back to Kenickie, and he tells Rizzo he doesn't run away from his mistakes. Rizzo tells Kenickie the baby isn't his, which both relieves and upsets him.\
The next day, the T-Birds have finished Kenickie's car and he is eager to race it against Leo's at Thunder Road. Sandy tells Rizzo she plans to watch the race and offers to help Rizzo despite the rumors about Rizzo's character that have been spread around school. She thanks Sandy and muses to herself about how her sins are not as bad as they could be ("There Are Worse Things I Could Do").\
The T-Birds, Pink Ladies, and Scorpions gather for the race, with the winner receiving the loser's car as a prize. Just before the race begins, Kenickie hits his head, and Danny takes the wheel. Despite Leo using bladed hub caps (in a sequence paying homage to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ben-Hur_(1959_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ben-Hur}}), Danny wins the race. Sandy watches from afar and concludes that she must change her approach to life if she wants to win over Danny, asking Frenchy for help ("Look At Me, I'm Sandra Dee (Reprise)").\
The gang celebrates graduation at a school carnival where Rizzo tells Kenickie she isn't pregnant and they reunite. Danny arrives wearing a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Letterman_(sports)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 letterman's}}\'a0sweater, to the other T-Birds' dismay. Sandy shocks everyone when she arrives with a new, wilder hairstyle and wearing a revealing black outfit and leather jacket. In song, Danny and Sandy reaffirm their commitment to each other ("You're the One That I Want"). As the film ends, the greasers promise to stay together after school ends ("We Go Together") and Danny and Sandy depart in a red hot rod, which takes flight as they wave goodbye to their friends.\
A Drax Industries Moonraker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_shuttle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space shuttle}}\'a0on loan to the United Kingdom is hijacked in midair.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M}}, head of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/MI6"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MI6}}, assigns James Bond, Agent 007, to investigate. En route to England, Bond is attacked by the Apollo jet crew and pushed out of the plane by the mercenary assassin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jaws_(James_Bond)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jaws}}. He survives by stealing a parachute from the pilot, whilst Jaws lands on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flying_trapeze"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 trapeze}}\'a0net within a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Circus_tent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 circus tent}}.\
At the Drax Industries shuttle-manufacturing complex in California, Bond meets the owner of the company, Hugo Drax, and his henchman Chang. Bond also meets Dr. Holly Goodhead, an astronaut, and he then survives an assassination attempt while inside a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/High-G_training"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 centrifuge chamber}}. Drax's personal pilot, Corinne Dufour, helps Bond find blueprints for a glass vial made in Venice; Drax discovers her involvement and has her killed by his pet dogs.\
Bond again encounters Goodhead in Venice where he is chased through the canals by Drax's henchmen. He discovers a secret biological laboratory, and learns that the glass vials are to hold a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nerve_gas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 nerve gas}}\'a0deadly to humans, but harmless to animals. Chang attacks Bond and is killed by getting hurled through the stained glass clockface of the Saint Mark's clocktower and landing on a grand piano; during the fight, Bond finds evidence that Drax is moving his operation to Rio de Janeiro. Rejoining Goodhead, he deduces that she is a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CIA}}\'a0agent spying on Drax. Bond has saved one of the vials he found earlier, as the only evidence of the now-empty laboratory; he gives it to M for analysis, who permits him to go to Rio de Janeiro under the pretence of being on leave.\
Bond survives attacks by Jaws, Chang's replacement, during\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rio_Carnival"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rio Carnival}}\'a0and on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sugarloaf_Cable_Car"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sugarloaf Cable Car}}. After Jaws' cable car crashes, he is rescued from the rubble by Dolly, and the two fall in love. Drax's forces capture Goodhead, but Bond escapes; he learns that the toxin comes from a rare orchid indigenous to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amazon_jungle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amazon jungle}}. Bond travels the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amazon_River"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amazon River}}\'a0and comes under attack from Drax's forces, before eventually locating his base. Captured by Jaws, Bond is taken to Drax and witnesses four Moonrakers lifting off. Drax explains that he stole the lent shuttle because another in his fleet had developed a fault during assembly. Bond and Goodhead escape and pose as pilots on\'a0
\f1\i Moonraker 6
\f0\i0 . The shuttles dock with Drax's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space station}}, hidden from radar by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cloaking_device"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cloaking device}}.\
Bond and Goodhead disable the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Radar_jamming_and_deception"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 radar jamming}}\'a0cloaking device; the United States sends a platoon of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marines}}\'a0aboard another shuttle to intercept the now-visible space station. Jaws captures Bond and Goodhead, to whom Drax reveals his plan to destroy human life by launching 50 globes that would dispense the nerve gas into Earth's atmosphere. Drax had transported several dozen genetically perfect young men and women of varying races to the space station in the shuttles. They would live there until Earth was safe again for human life; their descendants would be the seed for a "new master race". Bond persuades Jaws to switch his allegiance by getting Drax to admit that anyone not measuring up to his physical standards, including Dolly, would be exterminated. Jaws attacks Drax's guards, and a laser battle ensues between Drax's forces and Bond, Jaws, and the Marines. Drax's forces are defeated as the station is destroyed, while Bond shoots and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_exposure"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ejects Drax into space}}. Bond and Goodhead use Drax's laser-armed\'a0
\f1\i Moonraker 5
\f0\i0 \'a0to destroy the three launched globes and return to Earth.\
On New Year's Day in 1976, world heavyweight boxing champion\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocky"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Apollo Creed has successfully defended his title in a split decision}}\'a0against challenger\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocky_Balboa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocky Balboa}}. He and Rocky are taken to the same hospital. Apollo challenges Rocky to a rematch, but Rocky declines and retires from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Professional_boxing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 professional boxing}}. His girlfriend, Adrian, supports his choice, and so do his doctors, who reveal that he will require surgery for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Retinal_detachment"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 detached retina}}, a condition that could lead to permanent blindness. In a private moment, Rocky goes to see a recuperating Apollo, and wants a truthful response to his question of whether Apollo gave his all in the fight; Creed confirms that he did. After Rocky is released from the hospital, he enjoys the benefits of his life's changes: Rocky's new fame attracts an agent who sees Rocky as a potential endorsement and sponsorship goldmine, and his sudden wealth encourages him to propose to Adrian. She happily accepts, and they marry in a small ceremony. Soon after, Adrian reveals that she is pregnant.\
Meanwhile, fueled by hate mail, Apollo becomes obsessed with the idea that a rematch is the only way to prove that Rocky's performance was simply a fluke. Determined to rectify his boxing career's only blemish, Apollo ignores all pleas by his friends and family to forget the fight, and move on to other potential opponents, and instead demands his team do whatever necessary to goad Rocky out of retirement and have a rematch with him.\
Rocky, at first, seems unaffected by Apollo's smear campaign, but his inexperience with money causes him to run into financial problems. After several unsuccessful attempts to find employment, Rocky visits Mickey Goldmill, his trainer and manager, at his gym to talk about the possibility of returning to boxing. At first, Mickey declines, concerned about Rocky's health, but he soon accepts after Apollo publicly insults Rocky. Adrian confronts Rocky about the danger of returning to boxing and reminds him of the risk to his eyesight. Rocky argues that he knows nothing else, so this is the only way he can provide. Adrian, furious at Rocky for breaking his promise, refuses to support him.\
Rocky and Mickey begin training, but Rocky's mind is not fully set due to Adrian's disapproval. Adrian's brother, Paulie, confronts his sister about not supporting her husband, but she faints during the confrontation, and is rushed to the hospital, where she goes into labor. Despite being premature, the baby is healthy, but Adrian falls into a coma. Rocky blames himself for what happened, refusing to leave Adrian's bedside until she wakes up, and will not go to see his new baby until they can see it together. When Adrian comes out of her coma, she finds Rocky by her bedside, and the couple are shown their new baby, a boy, which they name Robert "Rocky Jr." Adrian gives her blessing to the rematch, and Rocky quickly gets into shape for the match.\
The night of the match arrives, and Apollo makes a public goal of beating Rocky in no more than two rounds to prove the first match going the full fifteen rounds was a fluke. Rocky, fighting right-handed to protect his eye instead of his natural\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Southpaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 southpaw}}, is knocked down twice by Creed and outclassed for much of the fight. As with their first fight, this match goes the full fifteen rounds, by which time Creed is well ahead on points and only needs to stay away from Balboa to win the fight by decision. However, Creed, not wanting the fight to end like it did the first time, ignores his trainer's pleas to stay back and attempts to beat Rocky by knockout. In the final round, Rocky switches back to his natural stance, and in dramatic fashion, unleashes a series of counter punches on Creed, turning the tide. Both men, exhausted, trade punches until they knock each other down. Apollo gets up on the ropes early while Rocky is on the canvas and has to make his way over. Rocky is able to will himself up on 9 while Apollo collapses from exhaustion, giving Rocky the win by knockout, making him the new heavyweight champion. Rocky then gives an impassioned speech to the crowd and holds the belt over his head with a message for his wife, who is watching the fight on TV: "Yo, Adrian, I did it!"\
Three years after the destruction of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}, led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Leia}}, has set up a new base on the ice planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hoth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hoth}}. The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Imperial}}\'a0fleet, led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}, continues to hunt for the new Rebel base by dispatching\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 probe droids}}\'a0across the galaxy.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}\'a0is captured by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wampa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wampa}}\'a0while investigating one such probe, but manages to escape from the wampa's lair with his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}. Before Luke succumbs to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hypothermia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hypothermic}}\'a0sleep, the Force ghost of his late mentor,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}, instructs him to go to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dagobah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dagobah}}\'a0to train under\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_Master"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Master}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0locates Luke and cuts open the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tauntaun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tauntaun}}\'a0he rode there on to keep his friend warm; they wait there until being rescued by a search party the next morning.\
Meanwhile, the probe alerts the Imperial fleet to the Rebels' location. The Empire launches a large-scale attack using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Walker_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 AT-AT walkers}}\'a0to capture the base, which forces the Rebels to retreat. Han and Leia escape with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}\'a0on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, but the ship's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace_(science_fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperdrive}}\'a0malfunctions. They hide in an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asteroid_belt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 asteroid field}}, where Han and Leia grow closer amidst tension and briefly kiss. Vader summons\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bounty_hunter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bounty hunters}}\'a0to assist in finding the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . Luke, meanwhile, escapes with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}\'a0in his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing fighter}}\'a0and crash-lands on the swamp planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dagobah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dagobah}}. He meets a diminutive creature who reveals himself to be Yoda; after conferring with Obi-Wan's spirit, Yoda reluctantly accepts Luke as his student.\
After evading the Imperial fleet, Han's group travels to the floating Cloud City on the gas planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bespin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bespin}}, which is run by Han's old friend,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lando_Calrissian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lando Calrissian}}. Unbeknownst to the group, the bounty hunter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boba_Fett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Boba Fett}}\'a0has tracked the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 ; shortly after their arrival, Lando hands the group over to Darth Vader. Vader plans to use the group as bait to lure out Luke, intending to capture him and take him to Emperor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Palpatine}}. Luke experiences a premonition of Han and Leia in pain and, against the wishes of Yoda and Obi-Wan, abandons his training to rescue them, promising to return and complete his training.\
Intending to hold Luke in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Suspended_animation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 suspended animation}}\'a0via carbon freezing, Vader selects Han to be frozen as a test subject. Han survives the process and is given to Fett, who plans to collect the bounty on Han from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jabba_the_Hutt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jabba the Hutt}}. Lando frees Leia and Chewbacca, but they are too late to stop Fett from departing with Han. They fight their way back to the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0and flee the city. Meanwhile, Luke arrives and engages Vader in a lightsaber duel that leads them over the city's central air shaft. Vader severs Luke's right hand, disarming him, and tempts him to join forces. Luke accuses Vader of murdering his father, but Vader reveals that\'a0
\f1\i he
\f0\i0 \'a0is Luke's father. Horrified, Luke drops into the air shaft and is ejected beneath the floating city, where he hangs on an antenna. He reaches out\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Telepathy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telepathically}}\'a0to Leia, who senses him and persuades Lando to turn back. After Luke is brought aboard, they are chased by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE fighters}}\'a0and Vader on his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}, but\'a0R2-D2\'a0reactivates the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 's hyperdrive, allowing them to escape.\
Rejoined with the Rebel fleet, Luke's severed hand is replaced with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prosthesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 robotic hand}}. Lando and Chewbacca take off in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0with hopes of saving Han.\
In 1936, American archaeologist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones}}\'a0braves an ancient booby-trapped temple in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peru"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peru}}\'a0and retrieves a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golden_Idol"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 golden idol}}. He is confronted by rival archaeologist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Indiana_Jones_characters#Ren%C3%A9_Belloq"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ren\'e9 Belloq}}\'a0and the indigenous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jibito"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hovito}}\'a0people. Surrounded and outnumbered, Jones surrenders the idol to Belloq and escapes aboard a waiting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Floatplane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 floatplane}}, where he uncomfortably shares his seat with the pilot's pet snake.\
Jones returns to his teaching position at Marshall College in the fictional town of Bedford,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Connecticut"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Connecticut}}, where he is interviewed by two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Military_Intelligence_Corps_(United_States_Army)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Army Intelligence}}\'a0agents. They inform Jones that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nazis}}\'a0are searching for his old mentor, Abner Ravenwood, under whom Jones studied at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/University_of_Chicago"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 University of Chicago}}. The Nazis know that Ravenwood is the leading expert on the ancient city of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tanis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tanis}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kingdom_of_Egypt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Egypt}}, and that he possesses the headpiece of an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_Egypt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ancient Egyptian}}\'a0artifact known as "the Staff of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ra}}". Jones deduces that the Nazis are searching for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ark_of_the_Covenant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ark of the Covenant}}\'a0\'97 the Nazis believe that if they acquire the Ark, their armies will become invincible. The Staff of Ra (used to project a beam of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sunlight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sunlight}}\'a0on a building in a diorama of the city) is the key to finding the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Well_of_Souls"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Well of Souls}}, a secret chamber in Tanis, Egypt, in which the Ark is buried.\
The agents authorize Jones to recover the Ark to prevent the Nazis from obtaining it. He travels to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kingdom_of_Nepal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nepal}}\'a0and discovers that Ravenwood has died, and the headpiece is in the possession of Ravenwood's daughter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marion_Ravenwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marion}}. Jones visits Marion at her\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tavern"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tavern}}, where she reveals her bitter feelings toward him from a previous romantic affair. She physically rebuffs his offer to buy the headpiece, and Jones leaves. Shortly after, a group of thugs arrive with their Nazi commander\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Indiana_Jones_characters#Arnold_Ernst_Toht"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arnold Toht}}, who had followed Jones on his flight leaving the United States. Toht threatens Marion to get the headpiece but Jones returns to the bar and fights the Nazis to save Marion. During the fight, the bar is set ablaze and the headpiece lands in the flames. Toht severely burns his hand trying to take the hot headpiece and flees the tavern screaming in agony. Jones and Marion escape with the headpiece, and Marion decides to accompany Jones in his search for the Ark so he can repay his debt to her.\
The pair travels to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cairo,_Egypt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cairo, Egypt}}, where they meet up with Jones' friend and skilled digger\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sallah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sallah}}. Sallah informs them that Belloq and the Nazis are digging for the Well of Souls with a replica of the headpiece (created from the scar on Toht's hand). They quickly realize the Nazi headpiece is incomplete and that the Nazis are digging in the wrong place. The Nazis kidnap Marion and it appears to Jones that she is killed in an exploding truck. After a confrontation with Belloq in a local bar, Jones and Sallah infiltrate the Nazi dig site and use their staff to correctly locate the Ark. Jones discovers Marion is alive when he finds her bound and gagged in a tent. He refuses to release her out of fear of alerting the Nazis. Jones, Sallah, and a small group of diggers unearth the Well of Souls and acquire the Ark. Belloq and Nazi officer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Indiana_Jones_characters#Colonel_Dietrich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Colonel Dietrich}}\'a0arrive and seize the Ark from Jones, throwing Marion into the Well of Souls with him before sealing it back up. Jones and Marion escape to a local airstrip, where Jones has a fistfight with a Nazi mechanic and destroys the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flying_wing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flying wing}}\'a0that was to transport the Ark to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Berlin,_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Berlin, Germany}}. The panicked Nazis remove the Ark in a truck and set off for Cairo, but Jones catches them and retakes it. He makes arrangements to take the Ark to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}\'a0aboard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tramp_trade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tramp steamer}}\'a0
\f1\i Bantu Wild
\f0\i0 .\
The next day, a Nazi\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U-boat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U-boat}}\'a0appears and intercepts the ship. Belloq and Dietrich seize the Ark and Marion but cannot locate Jones, who stows away aboard the U-boat and travels with them to an island in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aegean_Sea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aegean Sea}}. Once there, Belloq plans to test the power of the Ark before presenting it to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adolf_Hitler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hitler}}. Jones reveals himself and threatens to destroy the Ark with an anti-tank rocket, but Belloq calls his bluff and Jones surrenders rather than destroy such an important historical artifact and kill Marion in the process. The Nazis take Jones and Marion to an area where the Ark will be opened and tie them to a post to observe. Belloq, dressed as an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Israelite"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Israelite}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/High_priest_of_Israel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 kohen gadol}}, performs a ceremonial opening of the Ark and finds it full of sand. Spirits emerge from the Ark, destroying the equipment the Nazis are using to film the opening, and Jones tells Marion to close her eyes and not look. Belloq and the others look on in astonishment as the ghosts are suddenly revealed to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/angel_of_death"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 angels of death}}. A\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pillar_of_Fire_(theophany)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vortex of flame}}\'a0forms above the Ark and shoots bolts of fiery energy into the gathered Nazi soldiers, killing them all. Belloq, Toht and Dietrich all scream in terror as the Ark turns its fury on them: Dietrich's head shrivels up, Toht's face is melted off his skull and Belloq's head explodes. Flames then engulf the remains of the doomed assembly, save for Jones and Marion, and the pillar of fire rises into the sky. The Ark's lid is blasted high into the air before dropping back down onto the Ark and sealing it. Jones and Marion find their ropes burned off and embrace.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Washington,_D.C."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Washington, D.C.}}, the Army Intelligence agents inform Jones and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Indiana_Jones_characters#Marcus_Brody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marcus Brody}}\'a0that the Ark is someplace safe and will be studied by "top men". The Ark is then shown being stored in a giant government warehouse ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Area_51"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hangar 51}}) among countless similar crates.\
A group of alien botanists secretly visit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth}}\'a0under cover of night to gather plant specimens in a California forest. When government agents appear on the scene, the aliens flee in their spaceship, but in their haste, one of them is left behind. In a suburban neighborhood in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/San_Fernando_Valley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 San Fernando Valley}}, a ten-year-old boy named Elliott is spending time with his brother, Michael, and his friends. As he returns from picking up a pizza, he discovers that something is hiding in their tool shed. The alien promptly flees upon being discovered. Despite his family's disbelief, Elliott leaves\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reese%27s_Pieces"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reese's Pieces}}\'a0candy to lure the alien to his house. Before going to sleep, Elliott realizes it is imitating his movements. He feigns illness the next morning to stay home from school and play with it. Later that day, Michael and their five-year-old sister, Gertie, meet it. They decide to keep it hidden from their mother, Mary. When they ask it about its origin, it levitates several balls to represent its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Planetary_system"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 planetary system}}\'a0and then demonstrates its powers by reviving dead\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chrysanthemum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chrysanthemums}}.\
At school the next day, Elliott begins to experience a psychic connection with the alien, including exhibiting signs of intoxication (because it is at his home, drinking beer and watching\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_%26_Jerry"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom & Jerry}}), and he begins freeing all the frogs in his biology class. As the alien watches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Wayne"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Wayne}}\'a0kiss\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maureen_O%27Hara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maureen O'Hara}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Quiet_Man"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Quiet Man}}\'a0on television, Elliott then kisses a girl he likes in the same manner and he is sent to the principal's office.\
The alien learns to speak English by repeating what Gertie says as she watches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sesame_Street"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sesame Street}}\'a0and, at Elliott's urging, dubs itself "E.T." E.T. reads a comic strip where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buck_Rogers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buck Rogers}}, stranded, calls for help by building a makeshift communication device and is inspired to try it himself. E.T. receives Elliott's help in building a device to "phone home" by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Speak_%26_Spell_(toy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Speak & Spell}}\'a0toy. Michael notices that E.T.'s health is declining and that Elliott is referring to himself as "we".\
On\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Halloween"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Halloween}}, Michael and Elliott dress E.T. as a ghost so they can sneak him out of the house. That night, Elliott and E.T. head through the forest, where they make a successful call home. The next day, Elliott wakes up in the field, only to find E.T. gone. Elliott returns home to his distressed family. Michael searches for and finds E.T. dying next to a culvert. Michael takes E.T. home to Elliott, who is also dying. Mary becomes frightened when she discovers her son's illness and the dying alien, just as government agents invade the house. Scientists set up a hospital at the house, questioning Michael, Mary and Gertie while treating Elliott and E.T. Their connection disappears and E.T. then appears to die while Elliott recovers. A grief-stricken Elliott is left alone with the motionless E.T. when he notices a dead chrysanthemum, the plant E.T. had previously revived, coming back to life. E.T. reanimates and reveals that his people are returning. Elliott and Michael steal a van that E.T. had been loaded into and a chase ensues, with Michael's friends joining them as they attempt to evade the authorities by bicycles. Suddenly facing a police roadblock, they escape as E.T. uses\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychokinesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telekinesis}}\'a0to lift them into the air and toward the forest, like he had done for Elliott before.\
Standing near the spaceship, E.T.'s heart glows as he prepares to return home. Mary, Gertie, and "Keys", a friendly government agent, show up. E.T. says goodbye to Michael and Gertie, as she presents him with the chrysanthemum that he had revived. Before boarding the spaceship, he embraces Elliott and tells him "I'll be right here", pointing his glowing finger to Elliott's forehead. He then picks up the chrysanthemum, boards the spaceship, and it takes off, leaving a rainbow in the sky as everyone watches it leave.\
In an attempt to rescue\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0from crimelord\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jabba_the_Hutt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jabba the Hutt}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}\'a0are sent to Jabba's palace on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}\'a0in a trade bargain made by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}. Disguised as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bounty_hunter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bounty hunter}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Leia}}\'a0infiltrates the palace under the pretense of collecting the bounty on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}\'a0and unfreezes Han, but is caught and enslaved. Luke arrives soon afterward, but after a tense standoff, is sent through a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trapdoor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 trapdoor}}\'a0to do battle with Jabba's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rancor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rancor}}. Jabba sentences Luke and Han to death by being fed to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sarlacc"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sarlacc}}. Having hidden his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}\'a0inside\'a0R2-D2, Luke frees himself and battles Jabba's guards while Leia uses her chains to strangle Jabba. As the others rendezvous with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}, Luke returns to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dagobah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dagobah}}, where he finds that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}\'a0is dying. Yoda confirms that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}, once known as Anakin Skywalker, is Luke's father. The spirit of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}reveals that Leia is Luke's twin sister. The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_Master"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Masters}}\'a0tell Luke that he must face Vader again to defeat the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Empire}}\'a0and become a Jedi Knight.\
The Rebel Alliance learns that the Empire has been constructing a new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}\'a0under the supervision of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Emperor}}\'a0himself. As the station is protected by an energy shield, Han leads a strike team to destroy the shield generator on the forest moon of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Endor_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Endor}}; doing so would allow a squadron of starfighters to destroy the Death Star. Luke and Leia accompany the strike team to Endor in a stolen Imperial shuttle. Luke and his companions encounter a tribe of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ewok"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ewoks}}\'a0and, after an initial conflict, gain their trust. Later, Luke tells Leia that she is his sister, Vader is their father, and that he must confront him. Surrendering to Imperial troops, Luke is brought before Vader, and he tries to convince his father to return from the dark side of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}.\
Vader takes Luke to the Death Star to meet the Emperor, intent on turning him to the dark side. The Emperor reveals that the Death Star is operational and that the Rebel Fleet will fall into a trap. On Endor, Han's team is captured by Imperial forces, but a counterattack by the Ewoks allows the Rebels to infiltrate the shield generator. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lando_Calrissian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lando Calrissian}}\'a0leads the Rebel Fleet in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, only to find that the Death Star's shield is still active, and the Imperial fleet waiting for them. The Emperor tempts Luke to give in to his anger, and Luke engages Vader in a lightsaber duel. Vader senses that Luke has a sister, and threatens to turn her to the dark side. Enraged, Luke attacks and severs Vader's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prosthesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 prosthetic}}\'a0hand. The Emperor entreats Luke to kill Vader and take his place, but Luke refuses, declaring himself a Jedi as his father had been. Furious, the Emperor tortures Luke with Force lightning. Unwilling to let his son die, Vader throws the Emperor down a pit, but is mortally electrocuted in the process. At his last request, Luke removes the redeemed Anakin's mask before he dies in Luke's arms.\
After the strike team destroys the shield generator, Lando leads a group of Rebel fighters into the Death Star core and destroys its main reactor. As the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0flies out of the Death Star's superstructure and Luke escapes on a shuttle with his father's body, the station explodes. On Endor, Leia reveals to Han that Luke is her brother, and they kiss. Luke cremates Anakin's body on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pyre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pyre}}. As the defeat of the Empire is celebrated, Luke sees the spirits of Yoda,\'a0Obi-Wan, and Anakin watching over him.\
In 1935, Indiana Jones narrowly escapes the clutches of Lao Che, a crime boss in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghai"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shanghai}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912%E2%80%931949)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 China}}. With his 11-year-old Chinese sidekick Short Round and the nightclub singer Willie Scott in tow, Indy flees Shanghai on an airplane that, unbeknownst to them, is owned by Lao. While the three of them are asleep on the plane, the pilots dump the fuel and parachute out, leaving the plane to crash over the Himalayas. Indy, Shorty, and Willie discover this and narrowly manage to escape by jumping out of the plane on an inflatable raft, and then riding down the slopes into a raging river.
