They come to Mayapore, a village in northern India, whose impoverished villagers believe the three to have been sent by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shiva"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shiva}}\'a0to retrieve the sacred\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lingam"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sivalinga}}\'a0stone stolen from their shrine, as well as the community's missing children, from evil forces in the nearby Pankot Palace. During the journey to Pankot, Indy hypothesizes that the stone may be one of the five fabled Sankara stones that promise fortune and glory.\
The trio receive a warm welcome from the Prime Minister of Pankot Palace, Chattar Lal. The visitors are allowed to stay the night as guests, during which they attend a lavish but grotesque banquet given by the young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maharaja"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maharaja}}, Zalim Singh. Chattar Lal rebuffs Indy's questions about the villagers' claims and his theory that the ancient\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thuggee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thuggee}}\'a0cult is responsible for their troubles. Later that night, Indy is attacked by an assassin, leading Indy, Willie, and Shorty to believe that something is amiss. After Indy kills the assassin, they discover a series of tunnels hidden behind a statue in Willie's room and set out to explore them, overcoming a number of booby-traps along the way.\
The trio eventually reach an underground temple where the Thugs worship\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kali"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kali}}\'a0with human sacrifice. They watch as the Thugs chain one of their victims in a cage and slowly lower him into a ceremonial lava pit, burning him alive. They discover that the Thugs, led by their high priest Mola Ram, are in possession of three of the five Sankara stones, and have enslaved the children to mine for the last two. As Indy tries to retrieve the stones, he, Willie, and Shorty are captured and separated. Indy is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flagellation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 whipped}}\'a0and forced to drink a potion called the Blood of Kali, which places him in a trance-like state where he begins to mindlessly serve the Thugs. Willie, meanwhile, is kept as a human sacrifice, while Shorty is whipped and put to work in the mines alongside the children. Shorty breaks free and escapes back into the temple where he burns Indy with a torch, bringing him back to his senses. After fighting off the guards and defeating Chattar Lal, Indy stops Willie's cage and cranks it out of the pit just in time to save her from the fire, while Mola Ram escapes. Indy retrieves the Sankara stones, and the three return to the mines to free the children. As Indy fights a hulking overseer, the Maharaja\'97also under Mola Ram's control\'97tries to cripple him with a voodoo doll. Shorty knocks the doll away and burns him to break the trance, and a restored Indy escapes and leaves the overseer to die in a rock crusher.\
The trio escape from the temple in a mine cart, pursued by Thugs, while Mola Ram orders a water cistern dumped in an attempt to flood them out. After barely escaping the deluge, they are again cornered by Mola Ram and his henchmen on a rope bridge high above a crocodile-infested river. Indy cuts the rope bridge in half with one man's sword, leaving everyone to hang on for their lives. As he and Mola Ram struggle over the stones, he invokes the name of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shiva"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shiva}}, causing them to glow white-hot. Mola Ram burns his hand on the stones, causing him to lose his grip and fall to his death; Indy catches the last one safely and climbs up as a company of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/British_Indian_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 British Indian Army}}\'a0riflemen, summoned by the Maharaja, arrive and open fire on the Thuggee archers trying to shoot him. Indy, Willie, and Shorty return to Mayapore with the children and give the missing stone back to the villagers.\
In 1985\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hill_Valley_(Back_to_the_Future)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hill Valley, California}}, teenager\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marty_McFly"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marty McFly}}\'a0and his girlfriend,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jennifer_Parker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jennifer Parker}}, are chastised by the school principal for lateness. Marty auditions for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_the_Bands"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of the Bands}}, but is rejected for being too loud. At home, Marty's father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_McFly"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George}}\'a0is bullied by his supervisor,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biff_Tannen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Biff Tannen}}, while his mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lorraine_Baines_McFly"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lorraine}}\'a0is an overweight, depressed alcoholic. Lorraine recalls how she met George when her father hit him with his car.\
Marty is invited by his friend, eccentric inventor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Emmett_Brown"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Emmett Brown}}, to meet him in a parking lot in the early hours. Doc unveils a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DeLorean_time_machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 time machine built from a modified DeLorean}}\'a0and powered by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Plutonium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 plutonium}}\'a0stolen from terrorists. Preparing to demonstrate the time machine, Doc sets the date to November 5, 1955: the day he invented a time travel device. The terrorists arrive and shoot Doc. Marty escapes in the DeLorean, but inadvertently activates the time machine.\
Marty finds himself in 1955 without enough plutonium to return. He encounters the teenage George, who is bullied by his classmate Biff. After Marty saves George from an oncoming car, he is knocked unconscious and awakens to find himself tended to by Lorraine, who is infatuated with him.\
Marty tracks down Doc's younger self for help. With no plutonium, Doc explains that the only power source capable of generating the necessary 1.21\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gigawatts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gigawatts}}\'a0of electricity for the time machine is a bolt of lightning. Marty shows Doc a flyer from the future that recounts a lightning strike at the town's courthouse due the coming Saturday night. Doc instructs Marty to not leave his house or interact with anyone, as he could inadvertently\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Temporal_paradox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 alter the future}}; because of this, Doc refuses to heed warnings from Marty about his death in 1985. When they realize that he has prevented his parents from meeting, Doc warns Marty that he must find a way to introduce George to Lorraine or he will be erased from existence. Doc formulates a plan to harness the power of the lightning, while Marty sets about introducing his parents.\
After Lorraine asks Marty to the school dance, Marty concocts a plan: he will feign inappropriate advances on Lorraine, allowing George to "rescue" her. The plan goes awry when a drunken Biff attempts to force himself on Lorraine. George, enraged, knocks out Biff, and Lorraine follows him to the dance floor, where they kiss while Marty performs with the band.\
As the storm arrives, Marty returns to the clock tower and the lightning strikes, sending Marty back to 1985. Doc has survived the shooting, as he had listened to Marty's warnings and worn a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bullet-proof_vest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bullet-proof vest}}. Doc takes Marty home and departs to the future. Marty awakens the next morning to find that George is a successful author, Lorraine is fit and happy, and Biff is now an obsequious\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Auto_detailing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 auto valet}}. As Marty reunites with Jennifer, the DeLorean appears with Doc, insisting they accompany him to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Back_to_the_Future_Part_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 2015}}\'a0to resolve a problem with their future children. The trio board the DeLorean, which has been upgraded with hover technology, and warp to the future.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Naval_Aviator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United States Naval Aviator}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lieutenant_(navy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 LT}}\'a0Pete "Maverick" Mitchell and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Radar_Intercept_Officer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Radar Intercept Officer}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lieutenant_(junior_grade)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 LTJG}}\'a0Nick "Goose" Bradshaw fly the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grumman_F-14_Tomcat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 F-14A Tomcat}}\'a0aboard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Enterprise_(CVN-65)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USS\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 \'a0(CVN-65)}}. During an interception with two hostile\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_fictional_military_aircraft#MiG-28"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MiG-28}}\'a0aircraft (portrayed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Northrop_F-5"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Northrop F-5}}), Maverick gets missile lock on one, while the other hostile aircraft locks onto Maverick's wingman, Cougar. While Maverick drives off the remaining MiG-28, Cougar is too shaken to land, and Maverick, defying orders, shepherds him back to the carrier. Cougar gives up his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wings_of_Gold"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wings}}, citing his newborn child that he has never seen. Despite his dislike for Maverick's recklessness,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Commander,_Air_Group"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CAG}}\'a0"Stinger" sends him and Goose to attend Topgun
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 , the Naval Fighter Weapons School at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Naval_Air_Station_Miramar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Naval Air Station Miramar}}.\
At a bar the day before Topgun starts, Maverick, assisted by Goose, unsuccessfully approaches a woman. He learns the next day that she is Charlotte "Charlie" Blackwood, an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Astrophysics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astrophysicist}}\'a0and civilian Topgun instructor. She becomes interested in Maverick upon learning of his inverted maneuver with the MiG-28, which disproves US intelligence on the enemy aircraft's performance.\
During Maverick's first training sortie he defeats instructor LCDR Rick "Jester" Heatherly but through reckless flying breaks two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rules_of_engagement"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rules of engagement}}\'a0and is reprimanded by chief instructor CDR Mike "Viper" Metcalf. Maverick also becomes a rival to top student LT Tom "Iceman" Kazansky, who considers Maverick's flying "dangerous." Charlie also objects to Maverick's aggressive tactics but eventually admits that she admires his flying and omitted it from her reports to hide her feelings for him, and the two begin a romantic relationship.\
During a training sortie, Maverick abandons his wingman "Hollywood" to chase Viper, but is defeated when Viper maneuvers Maverick into a position from which his wingman Jester can shoot down Maverick from behind, demonstrating the value of teamwork over individual prowess.\
Maverick and Iceman, now direct competitors for the Topgun Trophy, chase an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Douglas_A-4_Skyhawk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 A-4}}\'a0in a later training engagement. Maverick pressures Iceman to break off his engagement so he can shoot it down, but Maverick's F-14 flies through the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wake_turbulence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 jet wash}}\'a0of Iceman's aircraft and suffers a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flameout"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flameout}}\'a0of both engines, going into an unrecoverable\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spin_(flight)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flat spin}}. Maverick and Goose\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ejection_seat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 eject}}, but Goose hits the jettisoned\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aircraft_canopy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 aircraft canopy}}\'a0head-first and is killed.\
Although the board of inquiry clears Maverick of responsibility for Goose's death, he is overcome by guilt and his flying skill diminishes. Charlie and others attempt to console him, but Maverick considers retiring. He seeks advice from Viper, who reveals that he served with Maverick's father Duke Mitchell on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Oriskany_(CV-34)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USS\'a0
\f1\i Oriskany}}\'a0and was in the air battle in which Mitchell was killed. Contrary to official reports which faulted Mitchell, Viper reveals classified information that proves Mitchell died heroically, and informs Maverick that he can succeed if he can regain his self-confidence. Maverick chooses to graduate, though Iceman wins the Top Gun Trophy.\
During the graduation party, Viper calls in the newly graduated aviators with the orders to deploy. Iceman, Hollywood, and Maverick are ordered to immediately return to\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 \'a0to deal with a "crisis situation", providing air support for the rescue of a stricken ship that has drifted into hostile waters.\
Maverick and Merlin (Cougar's former RIO) are assigned as back-up for F-14s flown by Iceman and Hollywood, despite Iceman's reservations over Maverick's state of mind. The subsequent hostile engagement with six MiGs sees Hollywood shot down; Maverick is scrambled alone due to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aircraft_catapult"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 catapult}}\'a0failure and nearly retreats after encountering circumstances similar to those that caused Goose's death. Upon finally rejoining Iceman, Maverick shoots down three MiGs, and Iceman one, forcing the other two to flee. Upon their triumphant return to\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 , Iceman and Maverick express newfound respect for each other.\
Offered any assignment he chooses, Maverick decides to return to Topgun as an instructor. At a bar in Miramar, Maverick and Charlie reunite.\
Dan Gallagher is a successful, happily married\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Manhattan}}\'a0lawyer whose work leads him to meet Alexandra "Alex" Forrest, an editor for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Publishing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 publishing company}}. While his wife, Beth, and daughter, Ellen, are out of town for the weekend, Dan has an affair with Alex. Though it was initially understood by both as just a fling, Alex starts clinging to him.\
Dan spends a second unplanned evening with Alex after she persistently asks him over. When Dan tries to leave, she cuts her wrists in a suicide attempt. He helps her bandage the cuts and then leaves. He thinks the affair is forgotten, but she shows up at various places to see him. She waits at his office one day to apologize and invites him to a performance of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Madame_Butterfly"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Madame Butterfly}}, but he politely turns her down. She then continues to call him until he tells his secretary that he will no longer take her calls. Alex then phones his home at all hours, claiming that she is pregnant and plans to keep the baby. Although he wants nothing to do with her, she argues that he must take responsibility. After he changes his home phone number, she shows up at his apartment (which is for sale) and meets Beth, feigning interest as a buyer. Later that night, Dan goes to Alex's apartment to confront her, which results in a scuffle. In response, she replies that she will not be ignored.\
Dan moves his family to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bedford_(town),_New_York"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bedford}}, but this does not deter Alex. She has a tape recording delivered to him filled with verbal abuse. She stalks him in a parking garage, pours acid on his car, and follows him home one night to spy on him, Beth, and Ellen from the bushes in their yard; the sight of their content family literally makes her sick to her stomach. Her obsession escalates further when Dan approaches the police to apply for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Restraining_order"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 restraining order}}\'a0against Alex (claiming that it is "for a client"). The lieutenant claims that he cannot violate her rights without\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Probable_cause"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 probable cause}}, and that the "client" has to own up to his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adultery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 adultery}}.\
At one point, while the Gallaghers are not home, Alex kills Ellen's pet rabbit, and puts it on their stove to boil. After this, Dan tells Beth of the affair and Alex's supposed pregnancy. Enraged, she demands that Dan leave. Before he goes, Dan calls Alex to tell her that Beth knows about the affair. Beth gets on the phone and warns Alex that she will kill her if she persists. Without Dan and Beth's knowledge, Alex picks up Ellen from school and takes her to an amusement park. Beth panics when she realizes that she does not know where Ellen is. She drives around frantically searching and rear-ends a car stopped at an intersection. Beth gets injured and is then hospitalized. Alex later takes Ellen home, asking her for a kiss on the cheek. Following Beth's release from the hospital, she forgives Dan and they return home.\
Dan barges into Alex's apartment and attacks her, choking her and coming close to strangling her. He stops himself, but as he does, she lunges at him with a kitchen knife. He overpowers her but decides to put the knife down and leave, while Alex is leaning against the kitchen counter, smiling. The police begin to search for her after Dan confronts them about having her arrested.\
Beth prepares a bath for herself when Alex suddenly appears, again with the kitchen knife. She starts to explain her resentment of Beth, nervously fidgeting (which causes Alex to cut her own leg) and then attacks Beth. Dan hears the screaming, rushes in, wrestles Alex into the bathtub, and seemingly drowns her. She suddenly emerges from the water, swinging the knife. Beth, who went searching for Dan's gun, shoots Alex in the chest, killing her. The final scene shows police cars outside the Gallaghers' house. As Dan finishes delivering his statement to the police, he walks inside, where Beth is waiting for him. They embrace and proceed to the living room as the camera focuses on a picture of them and Ellen.\
Charlie Babbitt is in the middle of importing four\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lamborghini"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lamborghinis}}\'a0to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Los_Angeles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Los Angeles}}\'a0for resale. He needs to deliver the vehicles to impatient buyers who have already made down payments in order to repay the loan he took out to buy the cars, but the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Environmental_Protection_Agency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 EPA}}\'a0is holding the cars at the port due to the cars failing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Emissions_regulations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 emissions regulations}}. Charlie directs an employee to lie to the buyers while he stalls his creditor.\
When Charlie learns that his estranged father has died, he and his girlfriend Susanna travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cincinnati,_Ohio"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cincinnati, Ohio}}, in order to settle the estate. He learns he is receiving the classic 1949\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buick_Roadmaster"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buick Roadmaster}}\'a0convertible which he and his father fought over, but the bulk of the $3 million estate is going to an unnamed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trustee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 trustee}}. Through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Social_engineering_(security)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 social engineering}}, he learns the money is being directed to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mental_institution"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mental institution}}, where he meets his older brother, Raymond Babbitt, of whom he was previously unaware.\
Raymond has\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Savant_syndrome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 savant syndrome}}\'a0and adheres to strict routines. He has\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eidetic_memory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 superb recall}}, but he shows little emotional expression except when in distress. Charlie spirits Raymond out of the mental institution and into a hotel for the night. Susanna becomes upset with the way Charlie treats his brother and leaves. Charlie asks Raymond's doctor, Dr. Gerald R. Bruner, for half the estate in exchange for Raymond's return, but he refuses. Charlie decides to attempt to gain custody of his brother in order to get control of the money.\
After Raymond refuses to fly back to Los Angeles, they set out on a cross-country road trip together. During the course of the journey, Charlie learns more about Raymond, including that he is a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mental_calculator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mental calculator}}\'a0with the ability to instantly count hundreds of objects at once, far beyond the normal range of human\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Subitizing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 subitizing}}\'a0abilities. He also learns that Raymond actually lived with the family when Charlie was young and he realizes that the comforting figure from his childhood, whom he falsely remembered as an imaginary friend named "Rain Man", was actually Raymond.\
They make slow progress because Raymond insists on sticking to his routines, which include watching\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joseph_Wapner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Judge Wapner}}\'a0on television every day and getting to bed by 11:00 PM. He also objects to traveling on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Interstate_Highway_System"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 interstate}}after they pass a bad accident.\
After the Lamborghinis are seized by his creditor, Charlie finds himself $80,000 in the hole and hatches a plan to return to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas_Strip"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas}}, which they passed the night before, and win money at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blackjack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blackjack}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Card_counting"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 counting cards}}. Though the casino bosses are skeptical that anyone can count cards with a six deck\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shoe_(cards)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shoe}}, after reviewing security footage they ask Charlie and Raymond to leave. Charlie has made enough to cover his debts and has reconciled with Susanna who rejoined them in Las Vegas.\
Back in Los Angeles, Charlie meets with Dr. Bruner, who offers him $250,000 to walk away from Raymond. Charlie refuses and says that he is no longer upset about what his father left him, but he wants to have a relationship with his brother. At a meeting with a court-appointed psychiatrist Raymond is shown to be unable to decide for himself what he wants. Charlie stops the questioning and tells Raymond he is happy to have him as his brother.\
Charlie takes Raymond to the train station where he boards an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amtrak"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amtrak}}\'a0train with Dr. Bruner to return to the mental institution. Charlie promises Raymond that he will visit in two weeks.\
In 1912, thirteen-year-old\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry "Indiana" Jones, Jr}}\'a0is horseback riding with his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boy_Scouts_of_America"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Boy Scout}}\'a0troop at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arches_National_Park"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arches National Park}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Utah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Utah}}. While scouting caves, Indy discovers a group of grave robbers who have found a golden\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crucifix"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crucifix}}\'a0belonging to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Francisco_V%C3%A1squez_de_Coronado"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coronado}}\'a0and steals it from them, hoping to donate it to a museum. The men give chase through a passing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Circus_train"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 circus train}}, leaving Indy with a bloody cut across his chin from a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bullwhip"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bullwhip}}\'a0and a new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ophidiophobia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 phobia of snakes}}. Indy escapes, but the local sheriff makes him return the cross to the robbers, who immediately turn it over to a mysterious benefactor wearing a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Panama_Hat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Panama Hat}}. Impressed with Indy's bravery, the leader of the robbers gives Indy his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fedora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fedora}}, and tells him that he may have lost this battle, but that he does not have to like it.\
In 1938, Indy battles "Panama Hat" and his henchmen on a ship off the coast of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Estado_Novo_(Portugal)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Portugal}}. A violent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gale}}\'a0ensues, and Indy escapes overboard just before the ship explodes. He recovers the cross and donates it to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marcus_Brody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marcus Brody}}'s museum. Later, Indy is introduced to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Walter_Donovan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Walter Donovan}}, who informs him that his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Henry_Jones,_Sr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry Jones, Sr.}}, has vanished while searching for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holy_Grail"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Holy Grail}}, using an incomplete inscription from a stone tablet as his guide. Indy receives Henry's Grail diary via mail from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Venice"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Venice}}. Realizing that he would not have sent the diary unless he was in trouble, Indy and Marcus travel to Venice, where they meet Henry's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Federal_State_of_Austria"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Austrian}}\'a0colleague Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elsa_Schneider"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elsa Schneider}}. Beneath the library where Henry was last seen, Indy and Elsa discover a set of half-flooded catacombs that house the tomb of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Crusade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Crusade}}\'a0knight, which contains a complete version of the inscription that Henry had used, revealing the location of the Grail. They flee when the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Petroleum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 petroleum}}-saturated waters of the catacombs are set aflame by the Brotherhood of the Cruciform Sword, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Secret_society"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 secret society}}\'a0that protects the Grail from evildoers. Indy and Elsa capture one of the Brotherhood,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_characters_in_the_Indiana_Jones_series#Kazim"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kazim}}, who tells Indy where Henry is being held after Indy explains that his only goal is to find Henry, not the Grail. Marcus reveals a map drawn by Henry of the route to the Grail, which begins in Alexandretta. Indy removes the map from the diary, gives it to Marcus for safekeeping, and sends him to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/%C4%B0skenderun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 \uc0\u304 skenderun}}, the city built on the ruins of Alexandretta, to rendezvous with their old friend\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sallah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sallah}}.\
Indy and Elsa head to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nazi}}-controlled castle where Henry is being held. Indy finds Henry, but learns that both Elsa and Donovan are actually working with the Nazis and are using the Joneses to find the Grail for them. Meanwhile, Marcus is captured in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hatay_State"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hatay}}, while waiting with Sallah. After escaping from the castle, Henry tells Indy that the Grail is guarded by three\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Booby_trap"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 booby traps}}\'a0and his diary contains the clues needed to pass them safely. They recover the diary from Elsa at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_book_burnings"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 book burning}}\'a0rally in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Berlin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Berlin}}, briefly coming face-to-face with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adolf_Hitler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hitler}}. They board a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zeppelin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zeppelin}}\'a0to leave Germany, but the Nazis discover the Joneses are aboard and they escape in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parasite_aircraft"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 parasite}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biplane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 biplane}}. They crash while engaging in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dogfight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dogfight}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luftwaffe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luftwaffe}}\'a0fighters.\
The two meet up with Sallah in Hatay, where they learn of Marcus' abduction. The Nazis are already moving toward the Grail's location, using the map possessed by Marcus. In exchange for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rolls-Royce_Phantom_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rolls-Royce}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sultan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sultan}}\'a0of Hatay has given the Nazis full access to his equipment for the expedition, including a large tank. Indy, Henry, and Sallah find the Nazi expedition, which is ambushed by the Brotherhood. During the battle, Henry is captured by SS Colonel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_characters_in_the_Indiana_Jones_series#Vogel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ernst Vogel}}\'a0while attempting to rescue Marcus from the tank; Kazim and his comrades are killed. Indy pursues the tank on horseback and, with the aid of Sallah, saves Henry and Marcus. He is caught up in a fight with Vogel, and barely escapes before the tank goes over a cliff, sending Vogel to his death.\
Indy, Henry, Marcus, and Sallah catch up with the surviving Nazis, led by Donovan and Elsa, who have found the temple where the Holy Grail is kept but are unable to pass through the three protective booby traps. Donovan shoots and mortally wounds Henry in order to force Indy to risk his life in the traps to find the Grail and use its healing power to save him. Using the information in the diary and followed by Donovan and Elsa, Indy safely overcomes the traps and reaches the Grail's chamber, which is guarded by a knight. He has been kept alive for 700 years by the power of the Grail, which is hidden among dozens of false grails; only the true Grail brings life, while a false one claims it. Elsa purposefully selects a golden chalice studded with emeralds for Donovan, who ages into dust after drinking from it, proving it to be false. Indy selects a simple wooden cup, and the knight tells him that he has "chosen wisely," but warns that the Holy Grail cannot be taken beyond the temple's entrance. Indy fills the Grail with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holy_water"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 holy water}}\'a0and gives it to Henry, healing him instantly. Disregarding the knight's warning, Elsa takes the Grail and attempts to leave with it. The temple begins to collapse and after the Grail drops into a chasm, Elsa falls to her death trying to recover it. Indy nearly suffers the same fate before Henry persuades him to leave it. The Joneses, Marcus, and Sallah escape the temple and ride off into the sunset.\
Sam Wheat, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Banker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 banker}}, and his girlfriend Molly Jensen, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pottery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 potter}}, renovate and move into an apartment in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Manhattan}}\'a0with the help of Sam's friend and co-worker Carl Bruner. One afternoon, Sam confides in Carl his discovery of unusually high balances in obscure bank accounts. He decides to investigate the matter himself, declining Carl's offer of assistance. That night, Sam and Molly are attacked by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robbery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mugger}}\'a0who shoots and kills Sam in a scuffle before stealing his wallet. Sam sees Molly crying over his body and discovers he is now a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ghost"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ghost}}, invisible and unable to interact with the mortal world.\
Molly remains distraught in the days after Sam's death, as Sam remains close to her. Carl comes over and suggests Molly take a walk with him and Sam cannot bring himself to follow. Moments later, the mugger enters the apartment in search of something. When Molly returns, Sam scares their cat into attacking the thug, who flees. Sam follows the mugger to his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brooklyn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brooklyn}}\'a0apartment and learns that the man, Willie Lopez, was sent by an unknown party.\
After leaving Willie's residence, Sam happens upon the parlor of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 psychic}}\'a0Oda Mae Brown, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charlatan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 charlatan}}\'a0pretending to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mediumship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 commune with spirits of the dead}}\'a0who is shocked to discover her true psychic gift when she can hear Sam speaking. Sam persuades her to warn Molly that she is in danger. To allay Molly's skepticism, Oda Mae relays information that only Sam could know. Molly gives Willie's address to Carl; she then goes to the police, who have no file for Willie but they show her Oda Mae's lengthy one as a forger and con artist.\
Meanwhile, Sam follows Carl and is devastated to learn he and Willie are working together. Carl is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Money_laundering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 laundering money}}\'a0for drug dealers and he had Willie rob Sam to get his apartment key, which Carl uses to obtain Sam's book of passwords and transfer the money into a single account under the fictitious "Rita Miller".\
Sam learns from a violent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poltergeist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 poltergeist}}\'a0haunting the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City_Subway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 subway system}}\'a0how to manipulate objects with his mind. Sam then persuades Oda Mae to help him thwart Carl. Before Carl can transfer the money for his clients, Oda Mae impersonates Rita Miller, closes the account, and reluctantly gives the $4 million cashier's check to charity. As Carl desperately searches for the money, Sam reveals his presence by typing his name on the computer keyboard. Carl goes to Molly, who reveals she spotted Oda Mae closing an account at the bank. Carl and Willie go to Oda Mae's place but Sam warns her and her sisters to take shelter. When Willie arrives, Sam tosses objects at him, who flees into the street in a fit of panic and is killed by an oncoming car. Shadowy creatures emerge from the darkness to drag Willie's ghost down to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hell}}.\
Sam and Oda Mae return to the apartment where\'97by levitating a penny into Molly's hand\'97he convinces Molly that Oda Mae is telling the truth about him. Oda Mae allows Sam to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spirit_possession"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 possess her body}}\'a0so he and Molly can share a slow dance. Carl breaks into the apartment but Sam is too exhausted from the possession to fight Carl. The women run onto the fire escape, to a loft under construction, but Carl catches Oda Mae and holds her at gunpoint, demanding the check. A recovered Sam pushes Carl off her so Carl takes Molly hostage, pleading with Sam for the check. Sam disarms Carl and attacks him again. Carl tries to escape through a window and tosses a suspended hook at Sam, but the hook swings back, shatters the window and it slides down, fatally impaling and killing Carl with a glass shard. The shadowy creatures return to claim Carl's ghost for Hell.\
Sam asks if the women are all right. Miraculously, Molly can now hear him. A heavenly light shines in the room, illuminating Sam's presence. Realizing that it is time for him to go with his task now completed, he and Molly share a tearful goodbye and one final kiss. Sam thanks Oda Mae for her help and then walks into the light and onward to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heaven"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heaven}}.\
In 1995,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Connor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Connor}}\'a0is living in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Los_Angeles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Los Angeles}}\'a0with foster parents. His mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sarah_Connor_(Terminator)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sarah Connor}}\'a0had been preparing him throughout his childhood for his future role as the Human Resistance leader against\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Skynet_(Terminator)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Skynet}}\'a0\'96 the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_intelligence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artificial intelligence}}\'a0that will be given control of the United States' nuclear missiles and initiate a nuclear holocaust called "Judgment Day" on August 29, 1997 \'96 but was arrested and imprisoned at a mental hospital after attempting to bomb a computer factory. In 2029, Skynet sends a new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Terminator_(character_concept)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Terminator}}, designated as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T-1000"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T-1000}}, back in time to kill John. The T-1000 is an advanced prototype made out of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mimetic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mimetic}}\'a0poly-alloy (referred to as "liquid metal") that gives it the ability to take on the shape and appearance of almost anything it touches, and to transform its arms into blades and other shapes at will. The T-1000 arrives under a freeway, kills a policeman and assumes his identity. Meanwhile, the future John Connor has sent back a reprogrammed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Terminator_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T-800 (Model 101) Terminator}}\'a0to protect his young self.\
The Terminator and the T-1000 converge on John in a shopping mall, and a chase ensues after which John and the Terminator escape together on a motorcycle. Fearing that the T-1000 will kill Sarah in order to get to him, John orders the Terminator to help free her, after discovering that the Terminator must follow his orders. They encounter Sarah as she is escaping from the hospital, although she is initially reluctant to trust the T-800. After the trio escapes from the T-1000 in a police car, the Terminator informs John and Sarah about Skynet's history. In addition, it would create machines that will hunt and kill the remnants of humanity.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [a]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Sarah learns that the man most directly responsible for Skynet's creation is Miles Bennett Dyson, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cyberdyne_Systems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cyberdyne Systems}}\'a0engineer working on a revolutionary new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_neural_network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 neural net}}\'a0processor that will form the basis for Skynet.\
Sarah gathers weapons from an old friend and plans to flee with John to Mexico, but after having a nightmare about Judgment Day, she instead sets out to kill Dyson in order to prevent Judgment Day from occurring. Finding him at his home, she wounds him but finds herself unable to kill him in front of his family. John and the Terminator arrive and inform Dyson of the future consequences of his work. They learn that much of his research has been\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reverse_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reverse engineered}}\'a0from the damaged CPU and the right arm of the previous Terminator who attacked Sarah back in 1984. Convincing him that these items and his designs must be destroyed, they break into the Cyberdyne building, retrieve the CPU and the arm, and set explosives to destroy Dyson's lab. The police arrive and Dyson is fatally shot, but he rigs an improvised\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dead_man%27s_switch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dead man's switch}}\'a0that detonates the explosives when he dies. The T-1000 relentlessly pursues the surviving trio, eventually cornering them in a steel mill.\
The T-1000 and the T-800 engage in physical combat and the more advanced model seriously damages and shuts down the T-800. However, unbeknownst to the T-1000, the T-800 brings itself back online using emergency power. The T-1000 nearly kills John and Sarah but the T-800 takes it by surprise and blasts it into a vat of molten steel with an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M79_grenade_launcher"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M79 grenade launcher}}, destroying it. John tosses the arm and CPU of the original Terminator into the vat as well. As Sarah expresses relief that the ordeal is over, the Terminator explains that to ensure that it is not used for reverse engineering it must also be destroyed. It asks Sarah to assist in lowering it into the vat of molten steel, since it is unable to "self-terminate". Although John begs the Terminator to reconsider, it bids them farewell and hugs a tearful John before it is lowered into the vat, giving a final thumbs-up as it disappears into the molten steel. John and Sarah drive down a highway and Sarah says in a voice over, \'93The unknown future rolls toward us. I face it for the first time with a sense of hope. Because if a machine, a Terminator, can learn the value of human life, maybe we can too."\
In the fictional city of Agrabah (which Disney places near the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jordan_River"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jordan River}}),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jafar_(Disney)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jafar}}, the Grand vizier of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Disney%27s_Aladdin_characters#The_Sultan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sultan}}, and his parrot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iago_(Disney)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Iago}}, seek the lamp hidden within the Cave of Wonders, but are told that only a "diamond in the rough" may enter. Jafar identifies a street urchin named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aladdin_(Disney_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aladdin}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Jasmine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Jasmine}}, who refuses to marry a suitor, temporarily leaves the palace and meets Aladdin and his pet monkey,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Disney%27s_Aladdin_characters#Abu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abu}}. Aladdin and Jasmine become friends and eventually fall in love. When the palace guards capture Aladdin on Jafar's orders, Jasmine confronts Jafar to demand Aladdin's release, only for Jafar to lie to her that Aladdin has been executed.\
Disguised as an old man, Jafar frees Aladdin and Abu from prison, and sends them to the cave, ordering them to retrieve the lamp. There, Aladdin finds a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magic_carpet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 magic carpet}}\'a0and obtains the lamp. Unaware to touch nothing but the lamp, Abu grabs a red jewel, and the cave collapses. Aladdin hands over the lamp to Jafar, who throws both Aladdin and Abu back down into the cave, though not before Abu manages to steal the lamp back. Trapped, Aladdin rubs the lamp and meets the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genie_(Disney)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Genie}}, who lives inside of it. The Genie tells Aladdin that he will grant him three wishes. Aladdin tricks the Genie into freeing themselves from the cave without using a wish, and he uses his first to become "Prince Ali Ababwa" in order to woo Jasmine.\
At Iago's suggestion, Jafar plots to become Sultan by marrying Jasmine. When Aladdin greets Jafar and the Sultan at the palace, Jasmine becomes angry at them. Refusing to tell Jasmine the truth, Aladdin takes Jasmine on a flight on the magic carpet. When she deduces his identity, he convinces her that he dresses as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peasant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 peasant}}\'a0to escape the stresses of royal life. After sending Jasmine home, Aladdin is tied up, gagged and thrown into the sea by Jafar, but he is rescued from drowning by the Genie with his second wish. Jafar tries to hypnotize the Sultan into agreeing to his marriage to Jasmine, but Aladdin intervenes, exposing his evil plot in the process; however, Jafar spots the lamp and thus discovers Aladdin's true identity. He flees to his lair, and orders Iago to retrieve the lamp from Aladdin.\
Fearing that he will lose Jasmine if the truth is revealed, Aladdin refuses to free the Genie in order to maintain his charade. Iago steals the lamp, and Jafar becomes the Genie's new master. He uses his first two wishes to usurp the Sultan, and become the world's most powerful sorcerer, exposing Aladdin's identity and exiling him, Abu, and the carpet to a frozen wasteland. However, they escape, and return to the palace, where Jafar tries to use his final wish to make Jasmine fall in love with him, but the Genie cannot grant the wish as it is beyond his power. Upon noticing Aladdin, Jasmine pretends the wish has been granted to distract Jafar, and Aladdin attempts to retrieve the lamp. Jafar notices Aladdin, traps Jasmine inside an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hourglass"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hourglass}}, and overpowers Aladdin and his friends with his magic. After Aladdin rescues Jasmine out of the hourglass, he tricks Jafar into using his last wish to become an all-powerful genie; now bound to his new lamp, Jafar ends up trapped inside it, taking Iago with him.\
With the palace and kingdom returned to normal, the Genie transports Jafar's lamp to the Cave of Wonders, and advises Aladdin use his third wish to regain his royal title so the law will allow him to stay with Jasmine. Realizing that he has to be himself, Aladdin decides to keep his promise and frees the Genie. Realizing Aladdin and Jasmine's love, the Sultan changes the law to allow Jasmine to marry whom she chooses. The Genie leaves to explore the world, while Aladdin and Jasmine start their new life together.\
Industrialist John Hammond and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bioengineering}}\'a0company, InGen, have created a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Animal_theme_park"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 theme park}}\'a0featuring cloned dinosaurs and prehistoric plants, called Jurassic Park, on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isla_Nublar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Nublar}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Costa_Rica"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Costa Rican}}\'a0island. After a dinosaur handler is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}, the park's investors, represented by lawyer Donald Gennaro, demand that experts visit the park and certify it is safe. To perform the inspection, Gennaro invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mathematician"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mathematician}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chaos_theory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chaos theorist}}\'a0Ian Malcolm, while Hammond invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleontologist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleontologist}}\'a0Dr. Alan Grant and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleobotanist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleobotanist}}\'a0Dr. Ellie Sattler. Upon arrival, the group is shocked to see a live\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}, in addition to two more with a herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parasaurolophus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Parasaurolophus}}.\
At the park's visitor center, the group learns the cloning was accomplished by extracting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_DNA"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dinosaur DNA}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mosquito"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mosquitoes}}\'a0preserved in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 amber}}. DNA from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 frogs}}\'a0was used to fill in gaps in the dinosaurs'\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genome}}. To prevent breeding, all the dinosaurs were made female. Malcolm scoffs at the idea, saying it will inevitably break down. The group witnesses the hatching of a baby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}\'a0and visits the raptor enclosure. At lunch, the group debates the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethics_of_cloning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ethics of cloning}}\'a0and the creation of the park. Malcolm gives a harsh warning about the implications of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genetic_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genetic engineering}}.\
The group is joined by Hammond's grandchildren, Tim and Lex, for a tour of the park, while Hammond oversees the tour from the park's control room. The tour does not go as planned. Most of the dinosaurs fail to appear and the group encounters a sick\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Triceratops"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Triceratops}}. It is cut short as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tropical_cyclone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tropical storm}}\'a0approaches Isla Nublar. Most park employees leave for the mainland on a boat, while the visitors return to their electric tour vehicles. Sattler stays behind with the park's veterinarian to study the\'a0
\f1\i Triceratops
\f0\i0 .\
Jurassic Park's lead computer programmer, Dennis Nedry, has been bribed by Dodgson, a man working for Hammond's corporate rival, to steal fertilized dinosaur\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Embryo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 embryos}}. Nedry deactivates the park's security system to gain access to the embryo storage room and puts the stolen embryos inside a canister disguised as a shaving cream bottle. The power goes out, stalling the tour vehicles. Most of the park's electric fences are deactivated, allowing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tyrannosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tyrannosaurus rex}}\'a0to escape and attack the group. Grant and Hammond's grandchildren survive. The\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0injures Malcolm and devours Gennaro. While taking the embryos to the island's dock, Nedry becomes lost in the rain, crashes his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeep_Wrangler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeep Wrangler}}, and is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dilophosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dilophosaurus}}.\
Sattler helps the park's game warden, Robert Muldoon, search for survivors. They find only Malcolm before the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0returns. Grant, Tim, and Lex take shelter in a treetop. They later discover broken dinosaur egg shells. Grant concludes the dinosaurs have been breeding. This occurred because their frog DNA\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/African_bullfrog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 West African bullfrogs}}\'a0can change their sex in a single-sex environment, allowing the dinosaurs to do so as well, proving Malcolm right.\
Unable to decipher Nedry's code to reactivate the security system, Hammond and the park's chief engineer Ray Arnold reboot the park's system. The group shuts down the park's grid and retreats to an emergency bunker, while Arnold heads to a maintenance shed to complete the rebooting process. When Arnold fails to return, Sattler and Muldoon head to the shed. They discover the shutdown has deactivated the remaining fences and released the\'a0
\f1\i Velociraptors
\f0\i0 . Muldoon distracts the raptors, while Sattler goes to turn the power back on, before being attacked by a raptor and discovering Arnold's severed arm. Muldoon is caught off guard and killed by the other two raptors.\
After encountering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}\'a0and narrowly escaping the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0during a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gallimimus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gallimimus}}\'a0stampede, Grant, Tim, and Lex reach the visitor center. Grant heads out to look for Sattler, leaving Tim (who was injured while scaling one of the fences) and Lex inside. They are pursued by the raptors in an industrial kitchen but escape and join Grant and Sattler. Lex restores full power from the control room, allowing them to call Hammond, who in turn calls for help. Grant, Tim, Lex, and Sattler are cornered by the raptors, but they escape when the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0suddenly appears and kills the raptors. Hammond arrives in a jeep with Malcolm, and the survivors board a helicopter to leave the island.\
In the Pride Lands of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Africa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Africa}}, a pride of lions rule over the animal kingdom from Pride Rock. King Mufasa's and Queen Sarabi's newborn son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Simba"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simba}}\'a0(whose name is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swahili_language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Swahili}}\'a0for lion
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 ), is presented to the gathering animals by Rafiki the baboon (with the colorful facial marking of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mandrill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mandrill}})
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0who serves as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shamanism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shaman}}\'a0and advisor. Mufasa shows Simba the Pride Lands and explains to him the responsibilities of kingship and the "circle of life", which connects all living things. Mufasa's younger brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scar_(The_Lion_King)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scar}}, covets the throne and plots to eliminate both Mufasa and Simba, so he may become king. He tricks Simba and his best friend Nala\'97to whom Simba is betrothed\'97into exploring a forbidden\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elephants%27_graveyard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 elephants' graveyard}}, where they are attacked by three\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spotted_hyena"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 spotted hyenas}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_characters_in_The_Lion_King#Shenzi,_Banzai_and_Ed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shenzi, Banzai, and Ed}}, who are in league with Scar. Mufasa is alerted about the incident by his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Majordomo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 majordomo}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hornbill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hornbill}}\'a0Zazu, and rescues the cubs. Though upset with Simba, Mufasa forgives him and explains that the great kings of the past watch over them from the night sky, from which he will one day watch over Simba.\
Scar sets a trap for his brother and nephew, luring Simba into a gorge and having the hyenas drive a large herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wildebeest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wildebeest}}\'a0into a stampede that will trample him. He informs Mufasa of Simba's peril, knowing that king will rush to save his son. Mufasa saves Simba but ends up hanging perilously from the gorge's edge. Scar refuses to help Mufasa, instead sending him falling to his death. He then convinces Simba that the tragedy was Simba's own fault and advises him to leave the kingdom. He then orders the hyenas to kill the cub, but Simba escapes. Scar tells the pride that both Mufasa and Simba were killed in the stampede and steps forward as the new king, allowing his three hyena minions and the rest of their large pack to live in the Pride Lands.\
Simba collapses in a desert and is rescued by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Timon_and_Pumbaa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Timon and Pumbaa}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Meerkat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 meerkat}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Common_warthog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 warthog}}, who are fellow outcasts. Simba grows up in the jungle with his two new friends, living a carefree life under the motto "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hakuna_matata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hakuna matata}}" ("no worries" in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swahili_language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Swahili}}). Now a young adult, Simba rescues Timon and Pumbaa from a hungry lioness, who turns out to be Nala. She and Simba reunite and fall in love, and she urges him to return home, telling him the Pride Lands have become a drought-stricken wasteland under Scar's reign. Feeling guilty over his father's death, Simba refuses and storms off. He encounters Rafiki, who tells him that Mufasa's spirit lives on in Simba. Simba is visited by the ghost of Mufasa in the night sky, who tells him he must take his rightful place as king. Realizing that he can no longer run from his past, Simba decides to return to the Pride Lands.\
Aided by his friends, Simba sneaks past the hyenas at Pride Rock and confronts Scar, who had just struck Sarabi. Scar taunts Simba over his role in Mufasa's death and backs him to the edge of the rock, where he reveals to him that he murdered Mufasa. Enraged, Simba pins Scar to the ground and forces him to reveal the truth to the rest of the pride. Timon, Pumbaa, Rafiki, Zazu, and the lionesses fend off the hyenas while Scar, attempting to escape, is cornered by Simba at the top of Pride Rock. Scar begs for mercy and attempts to blame the hyenas for his actions; Simba spares his life, but orders him to leave the Pride Lands forever. Scar attacks his nephew, but Simba manages to toss him from the top of the rock. Scar survives the fall, but is attacked and killed by the hyenas, who overheard his attempt to betray them. Afterwards, Simba takes over the kingship as rain begins to fall.\
Later, with Pride Rock restored to its usual state, Rafiki presents Simba and Nala's newborn cub to the assembled animals, continuing the circle of life.\
In a world where toys are living things but pretend to be lifeless when humans are present, a group of toys, owned by a boy named Andy Davis, are caught off-guard when Andy's birthday party is moved up a week, as his family (including his mother and infant sister Molly) is preparing to move the following week. Andy's toys \'96 including Bo Peep the shepherdess, Mr. Potato Head, Rex the dinosaur, Hamm the piggy bank and Slinky Dog \'96 fear they will be replaced by new toys from the birthday. A pull-string cowboy doll named Sheriff Woody \'96 the toys' leader and Andy's favorite toy \'96 sends out\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Army_men"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 army men}}, led by Sergeant, to spy on the party and report the gift results to the others via\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baby_monitor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 baby monitors}}. The toys are relieved when the party appears to end with none of them being replaced by new toys, but then Andy receives a surprise gift \'96 a Buzz Lightyear action figure, who thinks he is a real space ranger.\
Buzz impresses the other toys with his various features, and Andy begins to favor him, making Woody feel abandoned. As Andy prepares for a family outing at Pizza Planet, his mother allows him to bring one toy. Fearing Andy will choose Buzz, Woody attempts to trap him behind a desk, but ends up accidentally knocking him out of a window. The other toys, except Bo Peep and Slinky, rebel against Woody, believing he did harm to Buzz out of jealousy. Before they can exact revenge, Andy takes Woody and leaves for Pizza Planet. When the family stops for gas, Woody finds that Buzz has hitched a ride on their van. They have a fight, only to find the family has left without them. They manage to make their way to the restaurant by stowing away on a pizza delivery truck. Buzz, still thinking he is a real space ranger, despite Woody's attempts to convince him otherwise, gets them stuck in a crane game, where they are won by Andy's toy-abusing neighbor, a boy named Sid Phillips.\
Woody attempts to escape from Sid's house, but Buzz, finally realizing he is a toy after watching a Buzz Lightyear TV ad and trying and failing to fly out a window, sinks into despondency. Sid plans to launch Buzz on a fireworks rocket, but his plans are delayed by a thunderstorm. Woody tells Buzz about the joy he can bring to Andy as a toy, restoring his confidence. The next day, Woody and Sid's mutant creature toys rescue Buzz just as Sid is about to launch the rocket and scare Sid into no longer abusing toys, and he runs into his house screaming in horror. Woody and Buzz leave just as Andy and his family drive away toward their new home.\
The duo tries to make it to the moving truck, but Sid's dog, Scud, sees them and gives chase. Buzz gets left behind while saving Woody from Scud, and Woody tries rescuing him with Andy's radio-controlled car (RC). Thinking that Woody is trying to eliminate RC as well, the other toys attack and toss him off the truck. Having evaded Scud, Buzz and RC retrieve Woody and continue to chase the truck. Upon seeing Woody and Buzz together on RC, the other toys realize their mistake and try to help them get back aboard, but RC's batteries become depleted, stranding them. Woody ignites the rocket on Buzz's back and manages to throw RC into the truck before they soar into the air. Buzz opens his wings to free himself from the rocket before it explodes, gliding with Woody to land safely into a box in the van, right next to Andy.\
On Christmas Day, at their new house, Woody and Buzz stage another reconnaissance mission to prepare for the new toy arrivals. One of the toys is Mrs. Potato Head, much to Mr. Potato Head's delight. As Woody jokingly asks what might be worse than Buzz, they discover Andy's new gift is a puppy, and the two share a worried smile.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bonwit_Teller"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bonwit Teller}}\'a0department store is destroyed by a bomb during the morning commute. The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City_Police_Department"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City Police Department}}\'a0gets a call from "Simon", the terrorist, ordering that suspended police officer Lt.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_McClane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John McClane}}\'a0be dropped in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harlem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harlem}}\'a0wearing only his underwear and a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sandwich_board"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sandwich board}}\'a0with "I Hate Niggers" written on it, and threatening to detonate another bomb if they do not comply. After locating a hung-over McClane, the NYPD complies. McClane is saved from an angry group of black men by Zeus Carver, a nearby locksmith and shop owner, and they take a cab to NYPD headquarters. While at headquarters, the NYPD is briefed by explosives expert Charlie, who introduces them to the binary liquids Simon is using to create his powerful explosives, and they learn that four thousand pounds had been recently stolen. Simon calls again and demands that both McClane and Carver follow his continuing instructions.\
Simon sends the two on a series of children's riddles, which ultimately require them to reach the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wall_Street_(IRT_Broadway_%E2%80%93_Seventh_Avenue_Line)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wall Street subway station}}\'a090 blocks south within 30 minutes to stop a bomb planted on a Brooklyn-bound\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/3_(New_York_City_Subway_service)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 3 train}}. McClane boards the subway while Carver drives to the stop. Though Carver answers Simon's call and McClane locates the bomb, Simon detonates it immediately after McClane throws it off the train in the station, derailing the train and damaging the subway station. As McClane and Carver regroup with the police, they are met by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 FBI}}\'a0agents, who reveal Simon is "Peter Krieg", a former Colonel in the East German\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Volksarmee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 People's Army}}\'a0and a mercenary-for-hire. However, Krieg's real name is Simon Peter Gruber, the brother of Hans Gruber -- whom McClane had killed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Die_Hard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 years earlier in Los Angeles}}.\
Simon then calls the police, knowing the FBI is there, to inform them that he has placed a bomb in a NYC public school that is rigged with a radio detonator triggered by the use of the FBI and police bands.
