Shortly after, a formal dance event known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yule_Ball"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yule Ball}}\'a0takes place; Harry's crush\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cho_Chang"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cho Chang}}\'a0attends with Cedric, and Hermione attends with Viktor, making Ron jealous. The second task involves the champions diving underwater to rescue their mates. Harry finishes third, but is promoted to second behind Cedric due to his "moral fibre", after saving Fleur's sister Gabrielle as well as Ron. Afterwards, Harry discovers the corpse of Crouch Sr. in the forest. Later, while waiting for Dumbledore in his office, Harry discovers a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pensieve"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pensieve}}, which holds Dumbledore's memories. Harry witnesses a trial in which\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Igor_Karkaroff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Igor Karkaroff}}\'a0confesses to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ministry_of_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ministry of Magic}}\'a0names of other Death Eaters after Voldemort's defeat. When he names\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Severus_Snape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Severus Snape}}\'a0as one, Dumbledore vouches for Snape's innocence; Snape turned spy against Voldemort before the latter's downfall. After Karkaroff names Barty Crouch Jr., a devastated Crouch Sr. imprisons his son in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Azkaban"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Azkaban}}. Exiting the Pensieve, Harry realizes that Crouch Jr. is the man he saw in his dream.\
For the final task, the champions must reach the Triwizard Cup, located in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hedge_maze"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hedge maze}}. After Fleur and Viktor are incapacitated, Harry and Cedric reach the cup together. The two claim a draw and together grab the cup, which turns out to be a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Portkey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Portkey}}\'a0and transports them to a graveyard where Pettigrew and Voldemort are waiting. Pettigrew kills Cedric with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avada_Kedavra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Killing Curse}}\'a0and performs a ritual that rejuvenates Voldemort, who then summons the Death Eaters. Voldemort releases Harry and challenges him to a duel to prove he is the better wizard. A vulnerable Harry tries the Expelliarmus charm to block Voldemort's attempted Killing Curse. The beams from their wands entwine and Voldemort's wand disgorges the last spells it performed. The spirits of the people he murdered are seen in the graveyard: first Cedric, then Frank Bryce, then Bertha Jorkins, and finally\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lily_and_James_Potter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry's parents}}. This distracts Voldemort and his Death Eaters, allowing Harry to use the Portkey and escape with Cedric's body.\
Harry tells Dumbledore that Voldemort returned and killed Cedric. Moody takes Harry back to his office to interrogate him about Voldemort, but inadvertently blows his cover by asking Harry whether there were "others in the graveyard", despite Harry not mentioning a graveyard. Moody reveals that he submitted Harry's name to the Goblet of Fire and manipulated Harry throughout the tournament to ensure he would win. Moody attempts to attack Harry, but Dumbledore, Snape, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minerva McGonagall}}\'a0intervene and subdue him. The teachers force Moody to drink\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Potions_in_Harry_Potter#Veritaserum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Veritaserum}}, and he reveals that the real Moody is imprisoned in a magical trunk as his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Polyjuice Potion}}\'a0wears off. He is revealed as Crouch Jr. and returned to Azkaban.\
Dumbledore reveals to the students that Voldemort killed Cedric, although the Ministry of Magic opposes the revelation. Later, Dumbledore visits Harry in his dormitory, apologizing to him for the dangers he endured. Harry reveals that he saw his parents in the graveyard; Dumbledore names this effect as "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Priori_Incantatem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Priori Incantatem}}". Soon after Hogwarts, Durmstrang, and Beauxbatons bid farewell to each other.\
The wedding of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Will_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Will Turner}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elizabeth_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elizabeth Swann}}\'a0is halted when Lord\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cutler_Beckett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cutler Beckett}}, chairman of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/East_India_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 East India Trading Company}}, arrives with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arrest_warrant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 arrest warrants}}\'a0for them, and also for Commodore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Norrington"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Norrington}}, who allowed Captain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Sparrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jack Sparrow}}\'a0to escape. Norrington has resigned and disappeared after losing the Navy's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flagship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flagship}}, HMS\'a0
\f1\i Dauntless
\f0\i0 , in a hurricane while pursuing Jack. Meanwhile, Jack is visited by Will's father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bootstrap_Bill_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bootstrap Bill Turner}}, aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Pearl"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Pearl}}. Bootstrap is now a crewman on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flying_Dutchman_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Flying Dutchman}}, captained by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones}}. Jack previously bartered a deal with Jones to raise the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0from the depths; now Jack must join Jones' crew or be dragged to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Davy_Jones'_Locker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones' Locker}}\'a0by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kraken_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kraken}}. Beckett, meanwhile, promises to free Elizabeth if Will brings him Jack's magic compass which points to whatever the holder wants most.\
Will finds Jack and the crew on an island and frees them from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cannibalism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cannibals}}. Shortly after,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_characters#Governor_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Governor Swann}}\'a0frees Elizabeth from jail, but he is then captured. Elizabeth bargains with Beckett to find the compass. Disguised as a cabin boy aboard a Scottish merchant vessel, she makes her way to Tortuga where she later finds Jack and also a drunken Norrington. After escaping the cannibals, Jack and the crew visit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/voodoo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 voodoo}}\'a0priestess\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tia_Dalma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tia Dalma}}, who reveals Jones' weakness is his heart, which is locked within the Dead Man's Chest. Jack must find it and the key that opens it. Locating the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , Will makes a deal with Jack to find the key to the chest in return for Jack's compass. Jack tricks Will, who is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghaiing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shanghaied}}\'a0into service aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 . Jones agrees to release Jack from their bargain in exchange for one hundred souls. Will meets his father aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0and learns that Jones possesses the key to the chest. They play a game of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Liar%27s_Dice"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Liar's Dice}}\'a0against Jones to try and win the key, but they lose. Despite this, Will escapes with the key and is taken aboard the same ship Elizabeth was on. Jones sends the Kraken after him, sinking the ship, but Will escapes.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Tortuga"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tortuga}}, Jack hires a new crew, including Elizabeth and Norrington. With Elizabeth's use of Jack's compass, they are able to locate the chest. All parties arrive on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_locations_in_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean#Isla_Cruces"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Cruces}}, where the chest is buried, but a three-way sword fight breaks out between Jack, Will, and Norrington, who all want the heart for their respective goals: Jack wants to call off the Kraken; Will wants to rescue his father; and Norrington wants to regain his life as a Navy officer. In the chaos, Norrington secretly steals the heart and runs off, pretending to lure away the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 's crew. Jones attacks the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0with the Kraken, which kills most of the crew and destroys all but one of the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 's lifeboats, but Jack, who briefly flees the battle, returns and wounds the Kraken with a net full of gunpowder and rum.\
Jack orders the survivors to abandon ship, but Elizabeth, realizing the Kraken only wants Jack, tricks him and chains him to the mast so that the crew can escape. The Kraken drags Jack and the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0to Davy Jones' Locker. Jones opens the chest to discover his heart is gone. In Port Royal, Norrington gives Beckett the heart and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Letters_of_Marque"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Letters of Marque}}\'a0meant for Jack, allowing him back into the navy as well as allowing Beckett to gain control of Davy Jones and the seas. The\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 's crew take shelter with Tia Dalma, where they all agree to rescue Jack. Tia Dalma introduces the captain who will guide them: the resurrected\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hector_Barbossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hector Barbossa}}.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the cannibalistic tribe now worships the prison dog in replacement of Jack.\
In order to control the oceans, Lord\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cutler_Beckett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cutler Beckett}}\'a0executes anyone associated with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Piracy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 piracy}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Port_Royal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Port Royal}}\'a0by ordering\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones}}\'a0to destroy all pirate ships in the seas. Condemned prisoners sing "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hoist_the_Colours"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hoist the Colours}}" to compel the nine Pirate Lords to convene at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shipwreck_Cove"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shipwreck Cove}}\'a0to hold the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brethren_Court"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brethren Court}}. Because\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Sparrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Jack Sparrow}}, Pirate Lord of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caribbean_Sea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caribbean Sea}}, never named a successor before being dragged to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones_locker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones locker}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Barbossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Barbossa}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Will_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Will Turner}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elizabeth_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elizabeth Swann}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tia_Dalma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tia Dalma}}, and the crew of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Pearl"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Pearl}}\'a0plot to rescue Jack. Traveling to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Singapore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Singapore}}, the crew meet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Sao_Feng"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Sao Feng}}\'a0(Pirate Lord of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/South_China_Sea"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 South China Sea}}), who owns navigational charts to the Locker. Beckett's soldiers invade, but the crew escape. Will secretly promises to give Jack to Feng in return for the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 , which he will use to rescue his father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bootstrap_Bill_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bootstrap Bill Turner}}\'a0from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Flying_Dutchman_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Flying Dutchman}}.\
The crew travels to the Locker and rescues Jack. The crew encounters many dead souls, including Elizabeth's father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Weatherby_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Governor Swann}}, who was executed by Beckett. Tia Dalma reveals that the Goddess Calypso charged Davy Jones with the job to guide the souls of those who died at sea to the next world. Once every ten years he could come ashore to be with the woman he loved. But he corrupted his purpose and was cursed to become a monster. The soul of Governor Swann reveals that the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0must always have a captain.\
Returning to the living world, the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0stops at an island for fresh water, where the crew find the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kraken_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kraken}}\'a0lying dead on the beach, having been killed by Jones under orders from Beckett. They are then attacked by Sao Feng and Beckett's men. Through a complex series of deals, Elizabeth is handed over to Feng, who believes she is the goddess\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Calypso_(mythology)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Calypso}}, while the rest of the crew make for Shipwreck Cove aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 . Jack throws Will off the ship as part of the plan to seize control of the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 . Sao Feng tells Elizabeth that the first Brethren Court bound Calypso in human form after she betrayed her lover, Davy Jones. He plans to release her to defeat Beckett. Davy Jones attacks Feng's ship, the\'a0
\f1\i Empress
\f0\i0 , mortally wounding Feng in the process. Feng appoints Elizabeth his successor as Pirate Lord before dying. Elizabeth and the crew are locked in the brig of the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , where she finds a partially insane Bootstrap Bill Turner. In a moment of clarity, Bootstrap reveals that whoever kills Davy Jones must take his place, bound to serve the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0forever. He reiterates that "the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0must always have a captain."\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Norrington"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Admiral Norrington}}\'a0frees Elizabeth and her new crew from the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , but is killed by Bootstrap Bill.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0arrives at Shipwreck Cove, where Barbossa attempts to persuade the Brethren Court to release Calypso. Davy Jones visits Tia Dalma in the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 's brig, revealing she is Calypso. Jack's father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_characters#Captain_Teague"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Teague}}, Keeper of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pirate_Code"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pirate Code}}, informs the Court that only an elected Pirate King can decide on going into battle. A vote is taken. To avoid a stalemate, Jack casts his vote for Elizabeth, making her King.\
The Brethren Court and Beckett's fleets emerge for war. On a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sandbank"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sandbank}}, Elizabeth, Jack, Barbossa, Beckett, Jones, and Will\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 parley}}, trading Will for Jack. Barbossa steals Jack's piece of eight, all of which are owned by the Pirate Lords and required to free Calypso. Barbossa frees Calypso, but when Will reveals it was Jones who betrayed her and made it possible for the first Court to imprison her, Calypso vanishes and summons an enormous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Whirlpool"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 maelstrom}}.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0and the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0battle in the maelstrom. Elizabeth and Will are wed by Barbossa. On board the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , Jones and Jack engage in a duel for control of Davy Jones' heart. Jones stabs Will, mortally wounding him. Jack gives up his chance for immortality and instead helps Will stab the heart, killing Jones, whose body falls into the maelstrom. Jack and Elizabeth escape the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0as it is sucked into the maelstrom.\
As Beckett's ship, the\'a0
\f1\i Endeavour
\f0\i0 , approaches to destroy the\'a0
\f1\i Pearl
\f0\i0 , the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 \'a0rises from the sea, now captained by Will; the crew has been freed from Jones' curse. Together, the two pirate ships destroy the\'a0
\f1\i Endeavour
\f0\i0 . A stunned Beckett goes down with his ship while his navy retreats. With Will now forever bound to escort souls lost at sea to the next world, he and Elizabeth bid farewell to each other on the beach of an abandoned island. Will departs on the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 , leaving Elizabeth pregnant and with the chest containing his heart.\
Jack and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joshamee_Gibbs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joshamee Gibbs}}\'a0discover Barbossa has stolen the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0again, but Jack planned ahead and stole Sao Feng's navigational charts. He departs from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tortuga_(Haiti)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tortuga}}\'a0alone to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pirates_of_the_Caribbean:_On_Stranger_Tides"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 track down the mythical Fountain of Youth}}.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, set ten years later, Elizabeth and her son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_characters#Henry_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry}}\'a0watch from a sea cliff as Will returns aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Dutchman
\f0\i0 .\
A gang of criminals rob a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gotham_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gotham City}}\'a0mob bank, murdering each other for a higher share of the money until only the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Joker_(The_Dark_Knight)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joker}}\'a0remains, who escapes with the money.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman}}, District Attorney\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harvey_Dent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harvey Dent}}\'a0and Lieutenant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Gordon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Gordon}}\'a0form an alliance to rid Gotham City of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Organized_crime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 organized crime}}. Bruce Wayne believes that with Dent as Gotham's protector, he can retire from being Batman and lead a normal life with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rachel_Dawes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rachel Dawes}}\'a0\'96 even though she and Dent are dating.\
Mob bosses\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sal_Maroni"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sal Maroni}}, Gambol, and the Chechen hold a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Videoconferencing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 video-conference}}\'a0with their corrupt accountant, Lau, who has taken their funds for safekeeping and fled to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}. The Joker interrupts the meeting to warn them that Batman is unhindered by the law, and offers to kill him in exchange for half of their money. The mob bosses disagree, and a bounty is placed on the Joker by Gambol. The Joker finds and kills Gambol, taking over his gang. The mob ultimately decides to take the Joker up on his offer. Batman finds Lau in Hong Kong and brings him back to Gotham to testify, allowing Dent to apprehend the entire mob. The Joker threatens to keep killing people unless Batman reveals his identity, and starts by murdering Police Commissioner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gillian_B._Loeb"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gillian B. Loeb}}\'a0and the judge presiding over the mob trial. The Joker also tries to kill Mayor Anthony Garcia, but Gordon sacrifices himself to stop the assassination. Dent kidnaps one of Joker\'92s henchmen and threatens him with a seemingly deadly game of heads-or-tails using Dent's lucky coin, which is revealed to be heads on both sides. Dent learns that Rachel is Joker's next target.\
Bruce decides to reveal his secret identity to prevent more deaths. Before he can, however, Dent falsely announces that\'a0
\f1\i he
\f0\i0 \'a0is Batman. Dent is taken into protective custody, but the Joker appears and attacks the convoy. Batman comes to Dent's rescue and Gordon, who faked his death, apprehends the Joker, securing a promotion to Commissioner. Rachel and Dent are escorted away by detectives on Maroni's payroll; Gordon later learns that they never arrived home. Batman interrogates the Joker, who reveals that they have been trapped in separate locations rigged with explosives and that Batman must choose one to save. Batman races to save Rachel, while Gordon attempts to rescue Dent. Batman arrives at the building, but realizes that the Joker sent him to Dent's location instead. Both buildings explode, killing Rachel and disfiguring half of Dent's face. The Joker escapes with Lau, who leads him to the Mob's funds. The Joker burns the money before killing Lau and the Chechen.\
Coleman Reese, an accountant at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wayne_Enterprises"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wayne Enterprises}}, deduces that Bruce is Batman and threatens to publicize the information. Not wanting Reese's revelation to interfere with his plans, the Joker threatens to destroy a hospital unless Reese is killed within an hour. All hospitals are evacuated and Gordon travels to secure Reese. The Joker, disguised as a hospital nurse, discovers Dent's ward and hands him a gun, convincing him to seek revenge for Rachel's death. The Joker then destroys the hospital and escapes with a busload of hostages. Dent goes on a killing spree, deciding the fates of people he holds responsible for Rachel's death by flipping his lucky coin, which was disfigured on one face by the explosion. Dent eventually apprehends Gordon's family, believing Gordon's love for his family parallels his love for Rachel.\
After announcing that Gotham City will be subject to his rule by nightfall, the Joker rigs two evacuating ferries with explosives; one containing civilians and the other containing prisoners. The passengers have been supplied with a trigger to the other boat's explosives, and the Joker announces through an intercom that he will blow both ferries if one of them has not been destroyed by midnight. Batman finds the Joker by using a sonar device that spies on the entire city, with the reluctant help of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lucius_Fox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lucius Fox}}. Both the civilians and the prisoners refuse to kill each other, while Batman apprehends the Joker after a brief fight. Before the police arrive to take the Joker into custody, he gloats that Gotham's citizens will lose hope once Dent's rampage becomes public knowledge.\
Gordon and Batman arrive at the building where Rachel perished and find Dent threatening to kill Gordon's family. Dent again flips his coin and shoots Batman, spares himself, and aims to kill Gordon's son while claiming that Gordon's negligence is responsible for Rachel's death. Before he can flip his coin for the boy, Batman, who was wearing body armor, tackles Dent off the building to his death. Batman persuades Gordon to let him take responsibility for the killing spree to preserve Dent's heroic image. As the police launch a manhunt for Batman, Gordon destroys the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bat-signal"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bat-signal}}, Fox watches as the sonar device self-destructs, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alfred}}\'a0burns a letter from Rachel saying she plans to marry Dent. Batman flees from the police, taking Dent's place for Two-Face's crimes.\
In 2154, humans have depleted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth}}'s natural resources, leading to a severe energy crisis. The Resources Development Administration (RDA for short) mines for a valuable mineral \'97\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unobtainium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 unobtanium}}\'a0\'97 on Pandora, a densely forested\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Habitable_moon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 habitable moon}}\'a0orbiting the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gas_giant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gas giant}}\'a0Polyphemus in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alpha_Centauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alpha Centauri}}\'a0star system.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Pandora, whose atmosphere is poisonous to humans, is inhabited by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Na%CA%BCvi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Na'vi}}, a species of 10-foot tall (3.0\'a0m), blue-skinned,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wisdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sapient}}\'a0humanoids
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0that live in harmony with nature and worship a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mother_goddess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mother goddess}}\'a0named Eywa.\
To explore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandora's biosphere}}, scientists use Na'vi-human hybrids called "avatars", operated by genetically matched humans; Jake Sully, a paraplegic former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Marine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marine}}, replaces his deceased identical twin brother as an operator of one. Dr. Grace Augustine, head of the Avatar Program, considers Sully an inadequate replacement but accepts his assignment as a bodyguard. While protecting the avatars of Grace and fellow scientist Dr. Norm Spellman as they collect biological data, Jake's avatar is attacked by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 thanator}}\'a0and flees into the forest, where he is rescued by Neytiri, a female Na'vi. Witnessing an auspicious sign, she takes him to her clan, whereupon Neytiri's mother Mo'at, the clan's spiritual leader, orders her daughter to initiate Jake into their society.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Colonel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Colonel}}\'a0Miles Quaritch, head of RDA's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Private_military_company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 private security force}}, promises Jake that the company will restore his legs if he gathers information about the Na'vi and the clan's gathering place, a giant tree called Hometree,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 which stands above the richest deposit of unobtanium in the area. When Grace learns of this, she transfers herself, Jake, and Norm to an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/outpost"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 outpost}}. Over the following three months, Jake grows to sympathize with the natives. After Jake is initiated into the tribe, he and Neytiri choose each other as mates, and soon afterward, Jake reveals his change of allegiance when he attempts to disable a bulldozer that threatens to destroy a sacred Na'vi site. When Quaritch shows a video recording of Jake's attack on the bulldozer to Administrator Parker Selfridge,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [37]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and another in which Jake admits that the Na'vi will never abandon Hometree, Selfridge orders Hometree destroyed.\
Despite Grace's argument that destroying Hometree could damage the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_neural_network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 biological neural network}}\'a0native to Pandora, Selfridge gives Jake and Grace one hour to convince the Na'vi to evacuate before commencing the attack. While trying to warn the Na'vi, Jake confesses to being a spy, and the Na'vi take him and Grace captive. Seeing this, Quaritch's men destroy Hometree, killing Neytiri's father (the clan chief) and many others. Mo'at frees Jake and Grace, but they are detached from their avatars and imprisoned by Quaritch's forces. Pilot Trudy Chac\'f3n, disgusted by Quaritch's brutality, frees Jake and Grace and airlifts them to Grace's outpost, but during the escape Quaritch fires at them, hitting Grace.\
To regain the Na'vi's trust, Jake connects his mind to that of Toruk, a dragon-like predator feared and honored by the Na'vi. Jake finds the refugees at the sacred\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fictional_universe_in_Avatar#The_Tree_of_Souls"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tree of Souls}}\'a0and pleads with Mo'at to heal Grace. The clan attempts to transfer Grace from her human body into her avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls, but she dies before the process can be completed. Supported by the new chief Tsu'tey, Jake speaks to unite the clan and tells them to gather all of the clans to battle against the RDA. Noticing the impending gathering, Quaritch organizes a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Preemptive_war"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pre-emptive strike}}\'a0against the Tree of Souls, believing that its destruction will demoralize the natives. On the eve of battle, Jake prays to Eywa, via a neural connection with the Tree of Souls, to intercede on behalf of the Na'vi.\
During the subsequent battle, the Na'vi suffer heavy casualties, including Tsu'tey and Trudy; but are rescued when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Characters_and_wildlife_in_Avatar#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandoran wildlife}}\'a0unexpectedly join the attack and overwhelm the humans, which Neytiri interprets as Eywa's answer to Jake's prayer. Jake destroys a makeshift bomber before it can reach the Tree of Souls; Quaritch, wearing an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mecha"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 AMP suit}}, escapes from his own damaged aircraft and breaks open the avatar link unit containing Jake's human body, exposing it to Pandora's poisonous atmosphere. Quaritch prepares to slit the throat of Jake's avatar, but Neytiri kills Quaritch and saves Jake from suffocation.\
With the exceptions of Jake, Norm and a select few others, all humans are expelled from Pandora and sent back to Earth, after which Jake is permanently transferred into his avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls.\
17-year-old Andy is headed to college, and his toys have not been played with for years. Most of his toys are gone except for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sheriff_Woody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Woody}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buzz_Lightyear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buzz Lightyear}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jessie_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jessie}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bullseye_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bullseye}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rex_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rex}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Slinky_Dog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Slinky}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hamm_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hamm}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mr._Potato_Head_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mr.}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mrs._Potato_Head_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mrs. Potato Head}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Squeeze_Toy_Aliens"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aliens}}, and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sarge_and_the_Bucket_O_Soldiers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 army men}}. He intends to take Woody with him and puts the other toys in a trash bag to be stored in the attic, except for the army men, who leave. Andy's mother mistakenly throws the bag out. The toys escape and climb into her car, into the donation box with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Molly_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Molly}}'s old\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Barbie_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Barbie}}\'a0doll, bound for Sunnyside Daycare. Woody follows but is unable to convince them Andy meant to keep them before Andy's mother donates them.\
Andy's toys are welcomed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lots-O%27-Huggin%27_Bear"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lots-O'-Huggin' Bear}}\'a0("Lotso") and the other toys at Sunnyside. Except Woody, Andy's toys are delighted to learn that Sunnyside never runs out of children to play with, and Barbie is enamored of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ken_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ken}}. Woody attempts to return home, but is found by Sunnyside student Bonnie, who brings him home and plays with him and her other toys, which are well-treated. Bonnie's toy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chuckles_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chuckles}}\'a0explains that he, Lotso, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Big_Baby_(Toy_Story)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Big Baby}}\'a0once had a beloved owner named Daisy, but were lost during a family trip. They made it home, where Lotso found he had been replaced. Lotso's personality changed; he lied to Big Baby, saying Daisy had replaced all of them. When they found Sunnyside, Lotso took over it, turning it into a toy prison, and Chuckles only escaped because Bonnie took him home for repair.\
At Sunnyside, Andy's toys are horrified at the toddlers' rough play. Buzz asks Lotso to move the toys to the older children's room, but Lotso turns on Buzz and restores him to original factory setting, erasing his memory. Mrs. Potato Head, through an eye she lost in Andy's room, sees Andy searching for them. They realize Woody was telling the truth and try to leave. Andy's toys are imprisoned by Lotso's henchmen who rely on "new recruits" to save themselves from the preschoolers' abuse.\
Woody returns to Sunnyside and learns from a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chatter_Telephone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chatter Telephone}}\'a0that the only way out is through the trash. Andy's toys accidentally reset Buzz to Spanish mode instead of his old persona. Spanish Buzz promptly allies himself with Woody and falls in love with Jessie. The toys reach a dumpster, but are cornered by Lotso's gang. As a garbage truck approaches, Woody reveals Lotso's deception to Big Baby, who throws Lotso into the dumpster. As the toys try to leave, Lotso's henchmen retreat and Lotso drags Woody into the dumpster as the truck collects the trash. The rest of the toys fall into the truck while trying to rescue him, except Barbie, Ken and Big Baby. A falling television lands on Buzz, restoring his memory and personality. The truck brings the toys to a landfill, where the Aliens are swept away by spotting an industrial claw and the other toys are deposited on a conveyor belt that leads to an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Incineration"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 incinerator}}. Woody and Buzz help Lotso reach an emergency stop button, only for Lotso to abandon them and escape. The toys resign themselves to their fate and prepare to die, but are rescued by the Aliens operating the claw. Lotso is found by a garbage truck driver, who ties him to his truck's radiator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grille_(motor_vehicle)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 grille}}\'a0and drives away. Woody and the other toys board another garbage truck back to Andy's house.\
Woody leaves a note for Andy, who, thinking the note is from his mother, donates the toys to Bonnie. To Andy's surprise, Woody is at the bottom of the donation box and Bonnie recognizes him. Though hesitant at first, Andy passes Woody on to Bonnie, and they play together before he leaves. Woody and the other toys witness Andy's departure as they begin their new lives with Bonnie.\
In the credits scene, Barbie, Ken, and Big Baby have made vast improvements to Sunnyside and maintain contact with the other toys through letters. After parachuting in, the army men are welcomed to Sunnyside.\
After burying\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dobby_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dobby}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Potter_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Potter}}\'a0asks the goblin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Griphook"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Griphook}}\'a0to help him,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ron_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ron Weasley}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermione_Granger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hermione Granger}}\'a0break into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bellatrix Lestrange}}'s vault at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gringotts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gringotts}}\'a0bank, suspecting a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Horcrux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Horcrux}}\'a0may be there. Griphook agrees in exchange for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sword_of_Gryffindor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sword of Gryffindor}}. Wandmaker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ollivander"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ollivander}}\'a0tells Harry that two wands taken from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Malfoy_Manor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Malfoy Manor}}\'a0belonged to Bellatrix and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Draco_Malfoy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Draco Malfoy}}, though Malfoy's has changed its allegiance to Harry.\
In the vault, Harry discovers the Horcrux is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helga_Hufflepuff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helga Hufflepuff}}'s cup. He retrieves it, but Griphook snatches the sword and abandons the trio, leaving them cornered by security. The three release the dragon guardian and flee on its back. Harry sees a vision of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lord_Voldemort"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lord Voldemort}}\'a0killing goblins including Griphook, and learns Voldemort is aware of the theft. Harry also realises there is a Horcrux at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogwarts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogwarts}}\'a0somehow connected to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rowena_Ravenclaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rowena Ravenclaw}}. The trio\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Apparate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 apparate}}\'a0into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogsmeade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogsmeade}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aberforth Dumbledore}}\'a0reluctantly instructs the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Portrait_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 portrait}}\'a0of his deceased younger sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ariana}}\'a0to fetch\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neville_Longbottom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Neville Longbottom}}, who leads the trio through a secret passageway into Hogwarts.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Severus_Snape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Severus Snape}}\'a0hears of Harry's return and warns staff and students of punishment for aiding Harry. Harry confronts Snape, who flees after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Minerva McGonagall}}\'a0challenges him to a duel. McGonagall gathers the Hogwarts community for battle. At\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luna_Lovegood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luna Lovegood}}'s insistence Harry speaks to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helena_Ravenclaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helena Ravenclaw}}'s ghost, who reveals that Voldemort performed "dark magic" on her mother's diadem, located in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Room_of_Requirement"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Room of Requirement}}. In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chamber of Secrets}}, Hermione destroys the Horcrux cup with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Basilisk_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Basilisk}}\'a0fang. In the Room of Requirement, Draco,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blaise_Zabini"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blaise Zabini}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gregory_Goyle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gregory Goyle}}\'a0attack Harry, but Ron and Hermione intervene. Goyle casts a Fiendfyre curse; unable to control it, he is burned to death while Harry and his friends save Malfoy and Zabini. Harry stabs the diadem with the Basilisk fang and Ron kicks it into the Room of Requirement to be destroyed. As Voldemort's army attacks, Harry, seeing into Voldemort's mind, realises that Voldemort's snake\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nagini_(Harry_Potter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nagini}}\'a0is the final Horcrux. After entering the boathouse, the trio witness Voldemort telling Snape that the Elder Wand cannot serve Voldemort until Snape dies; he then orders Nagini to kill Snape. Before dying, Snape tells Harry to take his memories to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pensieve"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pensieve}}. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fred_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fred Weasley}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Remus_Lupin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Remus Lupin}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nymphadora Tonks}}\'a0are killed in the chaos at Hogwarts.\
Harry learns from Snape's memories that while Snape despised Harry's late father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Potter_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James}}, who bullied him, he loved his late mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lily_Potter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lily}}. Following her death, Snape worked with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Albus Dumbledore}}\'a0to protect Harry from Voldemort due to his love for Lily. Harry also learns that Dumbledore was dying and wished for Snape to kill him, and that the Patronus doe he saw in the woods that led him to the sword was conjured by Snape. Harry discovers that he himself became a Horcrux when Voldemort originally failed to kill him; he must die to destroy the piece of Voldemort's soul within him. Harry surrenders himself to Voldemort in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogwarts#Forbidden_Forest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Forbidden Forest}}. Voldemort casts the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avada_Kedavra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Killing Curse}}\'a0upon Harry, who finds himself in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Limbo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 limbo}}. Dumbledore's spirit meets him and explains that the part of Voldemort within Harry was killed by Voldemort's curse. Harry returns to his body, determined to defeat Voldemort.\
Voldemort announces Harry's apparent death to everyone at Hogwarts and demands their surrender. As Neville gives a defiant response and draws the sword from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sorting_Hat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sorting Hat}}, Harry reveals he is still alive; the Malfoys and many\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Eaters"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Eaters}}\'a0abandon Voldemort. While Harry confronts Voldemort in a duel throughout the castle,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Molly_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Molly Weasley}}\'a0kills Bellatrix in the Great Hall and Neville decapitates Nagini, making Voldemort mortal. Harry and Voldemort's fight ends with Voldemort's own Killing Curse rebounding and obliterating him. After the battle, Harry explains to Ron and Hermione that the Elder Wand recognised him as its true master after he disarmed Draco, who had earlier disarmed its previous owner, Dumbledore. Harry destroys the Elder Wand rather than claim it.\
Nineteen years later, Harry,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ginny_Weasley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ginny Weasley}}, Ron, Hermione, and Draco proudly watch their own children leave for Hogwarts at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London_King%27s_Cross_railway_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King's Cross station}}.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgardian}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0encounters the Other, the leader of an extraterrestrial race known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chitauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chitauri}}. In exchange for retrieving the Tesseract,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0a powerful energy source of unknown potential, the Other promises Loki an army with which he can subjugate Earth.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, director of the espionage agency\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}, and his lieutenant Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0arrive at a remote research facility during an evacuation, where physicist Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0is leading a research team experimenting on the Tesseract. Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0explains that the object has begun radiating an unusual form of energy. The Tesseract suddenly activates and opens a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormhole}}, allowing Loki to reach Earth. Loki takes the Tesseract and uses his scepter to enslave Selvig and a few other agents, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}, to aid him in his getaway.\
In response to the attack, Fury reactivates the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers Initiative}}". Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}\'a0is sent to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kolkata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Calcutta}}\'a0to recruit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Bruce Banner}}\'a0to trace the Tesseract through its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamma_ray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gamma radiation}}\'a0emissions. Coulson visits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0to have him review Selvig's research, and Fury approaches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0with an assignment to retrieve the Tesseract.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stuttgart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stuttgart}}, Barton steals\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iridium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iridium}}\'a0needed to stabilize the Tesseract's power while Loki causes a distraction, leading to a brief confrontation with Rogers, Stark, and Romanoff that ends with Loki's surrender. While Loki is being escorted to S.H.I.E.L.D.,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, his adoptive brother, arrives and frees him, hoping to convince him to abandon his plan and return to Asgard. After a confrontation with Stark and Rogers, Thor agrees to take Loki to S.H.I.E.L.D.'s flying aircraft carrier, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarrier}}. Upon arrival, Loki is imprisoned while Banner and Stark attempt to locate the Tesseract.\
The Avengers become divided, both over how to approach Loki and the revelation that S.H.I.E.L.D. plans to harness the Tesseract to develop weapons as a deterrent against hostile extraterrestrials. As the group argues, Barton and Loki's other possessed agents attack the Helicarrier, disabling one of its engines in flight and causing Banner to transform into the Hulk. Stark and Rogers work to restart the damaged engine, and Thor attempts to stop the Hulk's rampage. Romanoff reluctantly fights Barton, and knocks him unconscious, breaking Loki's mind control. Loki escapes after killing Coulson and ejecting Thor from the airship, while the Hulk falls to the ground after attacking a S.H.I.E.L.D. fighter jet. Fury uses Coulson's death to motivate the Avengers into working as a team. Stark and Rogers realize that for Loki, simply defeating them will not be enough; he needs to overpower them publicly to validate himself as ruler of Earth. Loki uses the Tesseract, in conjunction with a device Selvig built, to open a wormhole above\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark Tower}}\'a0to the Chitauri fleet in space, launching his invasion.\
Rogers, Stark, Romanoff, Barton, and Thor rally in defense of New York City, the wormhole's location. Banner arrives and transforms into the Hulk, and together the Avengers battle the Chitauri while evacuating civilians. The Hulk finds Loki and beats him into submission. Romanoff makes her way to the wormhole generator, where Selvig, freed from Loki's mind control, reveals that Loki's scepter can be used to shut down the generator. Meanwhile, Fury's superiors from the World Security Council attempt to end the invasion by launching a nuclear missile at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Midtown Manhattan}}. Stark intercepts the missile and takes it through the wormhole toward the Chitauri fleet. The missile detonates, destroying the Chitauri mothership and disabling their forces on Earth. Stark's suit runs out of power, and he falls back through the wormhole just as Romanoff closes it. Stark goes into freefall, but the Hulk saves him from crashing into the ground. In the aftermath, Thor returns Loki and the Tesseract to Asgard, while Fury expresses confidence that the Avengers will return if and when they are needed.\
In a mid-credits scene, the Other confers with his master
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0about the failed attack on Earth. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the Avengers eat in silence at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shawarma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shawarma}}\'a0restaurant.\
Princess\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elsa_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elsa}}\'a0of Arendelle possesses paranormal powers that allows her to control and create ice and snow, often using it to play with her younger sister,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anna_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anna}}. After Elsa accidentally injures Anna with her magic, their parents, the King and Queen, take both siblings to a colony of trolls led by Grand Pabbie. He heals Anna, but alters her memories to remove traces of Elsa's magic, warning Elsa that she must learn to control her powers. The King and Queen isolate both sisters within the castle. Elsa shuts Anna out, causing a rift between them. Unable to control it, Elsa can only suppress her power, causing her to become more insecure. When the sisters are teenagers, their parents die at sea during a storm.\
When Elsa turns 21, she is to be crowned queen of Arendelle. She is terrified that the kingdom's citizens might find out about her powers and fear her. The castle gates open to the public and visiting dignitaries for the first time in years. Among them is the scheming Duke of Weselton and the dashing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hans_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Prince Hans}}\'a0of the Southern Isles, the latter of whom Anna falls in love with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Love_at_first_sight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 at first sight}}. Elsa's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coronation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 coronation}}\'a0happens without a hitch, but she still remains distant from Anna. When Hans proposes to Anna, Elsa objects, accidentally unleashing her powers before the court; the Duke brands her a monster. Elsa flees to the North Mountain, where she builds a palace of ice in which to live a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hermit}}\'a0life. In the process, however, her suppressed magic engulfs Arendelle in an eternal winter.\
Anna ventures out to find Elsa and end the winter, leaving Hans in command. She gets lost, collecting supplies at Wandering Oaken's shop. She meets an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iceman_(occupation)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ice harvester}}\'a0named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kristoff_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kristoff}}\'a0and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reindeer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reindeer}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sven_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sven}}, convincing them to take her to the mountains. An attack by wolves leads to Kristoff's sleigh being destroyed. On foot, they meet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Olaf_(Frozen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Olaf}}, a cheerful\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Snowman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 snowman}}\'a0brought to life unknowingly by Elsa, who offers to lead them to her. When Anna's horse returns to Arendelle, Hans sets out to find Anna and Elsa, accompanied by the Duke's minions, who have secret orders to kill Elsa.\
Reaching the ice palace, Anna meets Elsa, but when she reveals what has become of Arendelle, Elsa becomes upset, saying that she cannot undo it, and accidentally freezes Anna's heart. She then makes a giant snow monster named Marshmallow, who chases Anna, Kristoff, and Olaf away. Anna's hair begins turning white, so Kristoff takes her to meet the trolls, his adoptive family. Grand Pabbie reveals that Anna will freeze solid unless "an act of true love" reverses the spell. Kristoff races Anna back home so Hans can give her true love's kiss. Hans and his men reach Elsa's palace, defeating Marshmallow and capturing Elsa. Anna is delivered to Hans but, rather than kissing her, Hans instead reveals that he has actually been plotting to seize the throne of Arendelle by eliminating both sisters. Hans locks Anna in a room to die, and then manipulates the dignitaries into believing that Elsa killed her. He orders the queen's execution, only to discover she has escaped her detention cell.\
Olaf frees Anna, and they venture into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blizzard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blizzard}}\'a0outside to meet Kristoff, whom Olaf reveals is in love with her. Hans confronts Elsa outside, claiming that she killed Anna, causing Elsa to break down. Anna spots Hans about to kill Elsa; she leaps in the way and freezes solid, stopping Hans. Devastated, Elsa hugs and mourns over her sister, who\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thaw_(weather)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 thaws}}\'a0out, her heroism constituting "an act of true love". Realizing that love is the key to controlling her magic, Elsa ends the winter and gives Olaf his own snow flurry to survive the warmer climate. Both Hans and the Duke are arrested and exiled from the kingdom. Anna gives Kristoff a new sleigh, and the two kiss. Both sisters are reunited and Elsa promises never to lock the castle gates again.\
Sixty-five million years ago, an alien race known as the \'93Creators\'94 used devices called Seeds to terraform Planet Earth, covering it with an alloy called Transformium. In the present day,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Geologist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 geologist}}\'a0Darcy Tyril excavates the Transformium for K.S.I. Industries, which uses it to build man-made Transformer drones.\
Five years after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers:_Dark_of_the_Moon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Battle of Chicago}}, humans have begun to view the Transformers as a threat, leading the U.S. government to terminate all human-Autobot joint programs. Although the public believes the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Autobots"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Autobots}}\'a0have been granted sanctuary, they are being hunted by a rogue\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CIA"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CIA}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_ops"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black ops}}\'a0division known as Cemetery Wind, led by opportunistic government official Harold Attinger, who believes all Transformers should be exterminated regardless of their faction. They are aided by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lockdown_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lockdown}}, a Cybertronian\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bounty_hunter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bounty hunter}}\'a0working for the Creators, promising to give Attinger a Seed if his division manages to capture\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Optimus_Prime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Optimus Prime}}. Cemetery Wind locates\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ratchet_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ratchet}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mexico_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mexico City}}\'a0and Lockdown kills him when he refuses to give up the whereabouts of Optimus Prime.\
Optimus, damaged in Mexico City and disguised as a rundown semi-truck, is discovered in an abandoned theater by Cade Yeager, a financially struggling Texan inventor, and brings him back to his farm. While his teenage daughter Tessa and business partner Lucas Flannery encourage him to turn Optimus over to the authorities after realizing what he really is, Cade instead fixes Optimus, hoping to understand his technology and unexpectedly revives him. Still skeptical of Optimus, Lucas calls Cemetery Wind, who attacks and destroys the farm, but Optimus and Tessa's boyfriend, Irish\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rally_car"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rally car}}\'a0driver Shane Dyson, come to the family's aid. While on the run from Cemetery Wind and Lockdown, Lucas is killed by one of Lockdown's grenades. Escaping into the desert, they take refuge in an abandoned gas station. Later, Optimus scans a passing truck and turns into a Western Star 5700 Phantom Custom truck with the original red and blue paint with flames, and summons the surviving Autobots \'96\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bumblebee_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bumblebee}}, who has assumed an alternate form,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hound_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hound}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drift_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drift}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crosshairs_(Transformers)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Crosshairs}}\'a0\'96 who have come to distrust humans due to Cemetery Wind constantly hunting them down. Using a CIA drone which he stole during the home invasion, Cade discovers K.S.I.'s involvement in the attacks on the Autobots. Optimus vows to personally kill Attinger for his actions against his brethren.\
Infiltrating K.S.I.'s headquarters in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chicago"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chicago}}, Cade discovers the remains of Autobots and Decepticons are being melted down to make the drones. Joshua Joyce, the ambitious company CEO, is in league with Attinger to revolutionize global defenses and improve human society using the Seed. He has captured Brains and used him and data from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Megatron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Megatron}}'s head to create the drones and prototype Transformer soldiers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galvatron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galvatron}}\'a0and Stinger. In a fit of rage, the Autobots storm the building, during which Bumblebee regains his original form by scanning a passing car, where they rescue Brains and destroy the laboratory, but they soon leave after Joshua announces that they are no longer needed. Attinger forces Joshua to deploy Galvatron and Stinger to attack the Autobots. During the battle, Galvatron's behavior becomes slightly erratic when it starts destroying vehicles, and when it fights Optimus it speaks to him. Lockdown then arrives and abducts Optimus while Galvatron and Stinger retreat; Tessa is inadvertently captured alongside Optimus in the midst of the chaos, leaving Cade and Shane devastated.\
While Lockdown's large prison spacecraft hovers over Chicago to hand over the Seed, Cade, Shane, and the Autobots use the opportunity to sneak on board and rescue Optimus and Tessa, hijacking a smaller ship containing a group of Autobots called the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dinobots"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dinobots}}, just before Lockdown leaves Earth. The Autobots reveal to Cade that "Galvatron" is in fact Megatron, who gave K.S.I. the data to build the Transformer drones so he could transfer his consciousness into the Galvatron drone, after they had unknowingly revived him. What's more, Galvatron is plotting to use the Seed and the K.S.I. drones to conquer the world by detonating the Seed in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}, as K.S.I. has brought it there to use it in the remote Mongolian desert to create vast amounts of usable Transformium. Cade informs Joshua of Megatron's presence, causing him to have a change of heart and agreeing to hand over the Seed with help from Darcy and his Chinese business associate Su Yueming. Meanwhile, Lockdown discovers Optimus' escape with the Dinobots, and returns to Earth to retrieve them. Optimus decides for the Autobots to no longer help the humans because of how they revived Megatron, but Cade explains to Optimus why he shouldn't lose faith in them. At the K.S.I. facility, during a disagreement between Joshua and Attinger over the Seed, Galvatron reactivates himself and promptly takes control of the K.S.I. drones, and a battle follows in Hong Kong's streets between Cade's group, the Autobots, Cemetery Wind, Galvatron, and his drones. During the fight, Optimus gains the alliance of the Dinobots, who become essential to the Autobots' victory while Bumblebee kills Stinger.\
Lockdown returns to capture Optimus and the Dinobots, using a large\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magnet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 magnet}}\'a0in his ship that picks up and drops metal objects, causing destruction to the city. After disabling the magnet, Optimus fights Lockdown at an abandoned factory. In the ensuing duel, Optimus kills Attinger (who still angrily deems all Cybertronians aside from Lockdown as a threat) to save Cade, and avenging the deaths of his fellow Autobots, but this allows Lockdown to pin Optimus down by impaling his chest with his own sword. Cade, Bumblebee, Tessa, and Shane fight Lockdown, with Cade ending up fighting him one-on-one while Tessa and Shane use a tow truck to free Optimus, who kills Lockdown by cutting him in half before using one of his grenades to finish off the remaining drones. Galvatron retreats, vowing to return.\
As Lockdown's ship leaves Earth, Optimus tells the Autobots to protect the Yeagers (with Joshua offering to help the Yeagers build a new home) and lets the Dinobots go, before flying away into space with the Seed to hide it away, sending a message to the Creators that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers:_The_Last_Knight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 he is coming for them}}.\
