Thirty years after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Civil War}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0has risen from the fallen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}\'a0and seeks to eliminate the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}. The Resistance, backed by the Republic and led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Leia Organa}}, opposes them while Leia searches for her brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}.\
On the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jakku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jakku}}, Resistance pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0receives a map to Luke's location from Lor San Tekka.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stormtrooper_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stormtroopers}}\'a0commanded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}\'a0destroy the village and capture Poe, while Kylo kills San Tekka. Poe's droid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}\'a0escapes with the map and encounters a scavenger,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}, near a junkyard settlement. Kylo tortures Poe using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0and learns of\'a0BB-8. Stormtrooper\'a0FN-2187, unwilling to kill for the First Order, frees Poe, and they escape in a stolen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE fighter}}; Poe names\'a0FN-2187\'a0"{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}}". As they turn back to Jakku to retrieve\'a0BB-8, they are shot down by a First Order\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0and crash-land. Finn survives and assumes that Poe died in the crash. He encounters Rey and\'a0BB-8, but the First Order tracks them and launches an airstrike. Finn, Rey, and\'a0BB-8\'a0flee the planet in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, which they steal from a junkyard.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by a larger ship piloted by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}, looking to reclaim their former vessel. The group is attacked by gangs seeking to settle debts with Han, and flee in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . At the First Order's Starkiller Base, a planet converted into a superweapon that harnesses star energy,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0allows\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Hux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Hux}}\'a0to use the weapon for the first time. Snoke questions Kylo's ability to deal with emotions relating to his father, Han Solo, who Kylo says means nothing to him.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0crew determines BB-8's map is incomplete. Han explains that Luke attempted to rebuild the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Order}}\'a0but exiled himself when an apprentice turned to the dark side, destroyed the temple, and slaughtered the other apprentices. The crew travels to the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Takodana"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Takodana}}\'a0and meets with cantina owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maz_Kanata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maz Kanata}}, who offers assistance getting\'a0BB-8\'a0to the Resistance. Rey is drawn to a secluded vault and finds the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}\'a0that once belonged to Luke and his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}. She experiences disturbing visions and flees into the woods. Maz gives Finn the lightsaber for safekeeping.\
Starkiller Base destroys a few planets including the Republic capital and a portion of its fleet. The First Order attacks Takodana in search of\'a0BB-8. Han, Chewbacca, and Finn are saved by Resistance\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing fighters}}\'a0led by Poe, who is revealed to have survived the crash on Jakku. Leia arrives at Takodana with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}\'a0and reunites with Han and Chewbacca. Meanwhile, Kylo captures Rey and takes her to Starkiller Base, but she resists his mind-reading attempts. Discovering she can use the Force, Rey escapes by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_mind_trick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi mind trick}}\'a0on a nearby guard.\
At the Resistance base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%27Qar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 D'Qar}}, BB-8 finds\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who has been inactive since Luke's disappearance. As Starkiller Base prepares to fire on D'Qar, the Resistance devises a plan to destroy it by attacking a critical facility. Using the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , Han, Chewbacca, and Finn infiltrate the facility, find Rey, and plant explosives. Han confronts Kylo, calling him by his birth name, Ben, and implores him to abandon the dark side. Kylo refuses and kills Han, enraging Chewbacca, who shoots Kylo and sets off the explosives, allowing the Resistance to attack and destroy the base.\
The injured Kylo pursues Finn and Rey to the surface. Kylo defeats Finn in a lightsaber duel, leaving him wounded. Rey takes the lightsaber and uses the Force to defeat Kylo before they are separated by a fissure as the planet begins to disintegrate. Snoke orders Hux to evacuate and bring Kylo to him to complete his training. Rey and Chewbacca escape with the unconscious Finn in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . On D'Qar, Leia, Chewbacca, and Rey mourn Han's death.\'a0R2-D2\'a0awakens and reveals the rest of the map, which Rey follows to the oceanic planet Ahch-To. She finds Luke and presents him with the lightsaber.\
In 1991, the brainwashed super-soldier\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James "Bucky" Barnes}}\'a0is dispatched from a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}\'a0base in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Siberia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Siberia}}\'a0to intercept an automobile carrying a case of super-soldier serum. In the present day, approximately one year after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ultron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ultron}}'s defeat in the nation of Sokovia at the hands of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlet_Witch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}\'a0stop\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crossbones_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brock Rumlow}}\'a0from stealing a biological weapon from a lab in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lagos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lagos}}. Rumlow blows himself up, attempting to kill Rogers. Maximoff telekinetically contains the explosion and throws it upward, damaging a nearby building and accidentally killing several\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakandan}}\'a0humanitarian workers.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Secretary of State}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thunderbolt_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thaddeus Ross}}\'a0informs the Avengers that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Nations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Nations}}\'a0(UN) is preparing to pass the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Registration_acts_(comics)#Marvel_Cinematic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sokovia Accords}}, which will establish a UN panel to oversee and control the team. The Avengers are divided:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0supports oversight because of his role in Ultron's creation and Sokovia's devastation, while Rogers has more faith in his own judgment than that of a government. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helmut_Zemo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helmut Zemo}}\'a0tracks down and kills Barnes' old Hydra handler, stealing a book containing the trigger words that activate Barnes' brainwashing. At a conference in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vienna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vienna}}\'a0where the Accords are to be ratified, a bomb kills King\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Chaka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Chaka}}\'a0of Wakanda. Security footage indicates the bomber is Barnes, whom T'Chaka's son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}, vows to kill. Informed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sharon_Carter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sharon Carter}}\'a0of Barnes' whereabouts and the authorities' intentions to kill him, Rogers decides to try to bring in Barnes\'97his childhood friend and war comrade\'97himself. Rogers and Wilson track Barnes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucharest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucharest}}\'a0and attempt to protect him from T'Challa and the authorities, but all four, including T'Challa, are apprehended.\
Impersonating a psychiatrist sent to interview Barnes, Zemo recites the words to make Barnes obey him. He questions Barnes, then sends him on a rampage to cover his own escape. Rogers stops Barnes and sneaks him away. When Barnes regains his senses, he explains that Zemo is the real Vienna bomber and wanted the location of the Siberian Hydra base, where other brainwashed "Winter Soldiers" are kept in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Suspended_animation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cryogenic stasis}}. Unwilling to wait for authorization to apprehend Zemo, Rogers and Wilson go rogue, and recruit Maximoff,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ant-Man_(Scott_Lang)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scott Lang}}\'a0to their cause. With Ross's permission, Stark assembles a team composed of Romanoff, T'Challa,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0to capture the renegades. Stark's team intercepts Rogers' group at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leipzig/Halle_Airport"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leipzig/Halle Airport}}, where they fight until Romanoff allows Rogers and Barnes to escape. The rest of Rogers' team is captured and detained at the Raft prison, while Rhodes is partially paralyzed after being inadvertently shot down by Vision, and Romanoff goes into exile.\
Stark discovers evidence that Barnes was framed by Zemo and convinces Wilson to give him Rogers' destination. Without informing Ross, Stark goes to the Siberian Hydra facility and strikes a truce with Rogers and Barnes, unaware that they were secretly followed by T'Challa. They find that the other super-soldiers have been killed by Zemo, who then shows them footage that reveals that the automobile Barnes had intercepted in 1991 contained Stark's parents, whom Barnes subsequently killed. Enraged that Rogers kept this from him, Stark turns on them both, leading to an intense fight, in which Stark destroys Barnes' robotic arm, and Rogers disables\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor_in_other_media#Live_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark's armor}}. He departs with Barnes, leaving\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his shield}}\'a0behind. Satisfied that he has avenged his family's deaths in Sokovia from the Avengers' actions by successfully fracturing them, Zemo attempts suicide, but he is stopped by T'Challa and taken to the authorities.\
In the aftermath, Stark provides Rhodes with exoskeletal leg braces that allow him to walk again, while Rogers breaks his allies out of the Raft. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mid-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, Barnes, granted asylum in Wakanda, chooses to return to cryogenic sleep until a cure for his brainwashing is found. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Parker explores the features of the web shooters built for him by Stark.\
Following the battle of Starkiller Base, General\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leia Organa}}\'a0leads\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Resistance_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Resistance}}\'a0forces to flee D'Qar when a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0fleet arrives.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0leads a costly counterattack that destroys a First Order dreadnought, but after the Resistance escapes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace_(science_fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperspace}}, the First Order tracks them and attacks the Resistance convoy.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}, Leia's son, hesitates to fire on the lead Resistance ship after sensing his mother's presence, but his wingmen destroy the bridge, killing most of the Resistance leadership and incapacitating Leia, who survives by using the Force. Disapproving of new leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vice_Admiral_Holdo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vice Admiral Holdo}}'s passive strategy, Poe helps\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}, and mechanic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rose_Tico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rose Tico}}\'a0embark on a secret mission to disable the First Order's tracking device.\
Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}\'a0arrives on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ahch-To"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ahch-To}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}\'a0aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}\'a0to recruit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}\'a0to the Resistance. Disillusioned by his failure to train Kylo as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi}}, and under self-imposed exile from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}, Luke refuses to help \'96 even after he learns of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}'s death at Kylo's hands \'96 and believes the Jedi should go extinct. Unbeknownst to Luke, Rey and Kylo communicate through the Force, puzzling the two enemies. As Rey and Kylo learn about each other, both have visions of themselves as future partners.\
R2-D2 persuades Luke to train Rey. After Kylo tells Rey what happened between him and Luke that caused him to choose the dark side, Luke confesses that he momentarily contemplated killing Kylo upon sensing that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0was corrupting him, causing Kylo to destroy Luke's new Jedi Order in retaliation. Convinced that Kylo can be redeemed, Rey leaves Ahch-To without Luke. Luke prepares to burn the Ahch-To Jedi temple and library, but hesitates.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}'s ghost appears and destroys the temple by summoning a bolt of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightning}}, claiming Rey has all she needs to learn, and encourages Luke to learn from his failure.\
Holdo reveals her plan to discreetly evacuate the remaining Resistance members using small transports. Believing her actions cowardly and risky, Poe leads a mutiny. Finn, Rose, and BB-8 travel to the Canto Bight casino and acquire the help of the hacker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DJ_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DJ}}. They infiltrate Snoke's ship, where all but BB-8 are captured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Phasma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Phasma}}. Meanwhile, Rey lands on the ship, and Kylo brings her to Snoke, who says he facilitated the mental connection between her and Kylo as part of a plan to destroy Luke. Ordered to kill Rey, Kylo instead kills Snoke and defeats Snoke's guards alongside Rey. Rey believes that Kylo has returned to the light side of the Force, but he instead invites her to rule the galaxy with him. Refusing, she fights Kylo for possession of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}'s lightsaber, which splits in two.\
Leia recovers and stuns Poe, allowing the evacuation to begin. Holdo remains on the ship to mislead Snoke's fleet as the others flee to an abandoned\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}\'a0base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crait"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Crait}}. DJ reveals the Resistance's plan to the First Order, and the evacuation transports are slowly destroyed. Holdo sacrifices herself by ramming Snoke's fleet at lightspeed; Rey escapes in the chaos, while Kylo declares himself Supreme Leader. BB-8 frees Finn and Rose, who escape after defeating Phasma, and join the survivors on Crait. When the First Order arrives, Poe, Finn, and Rose attack with old speeders. Rey and Chewbacca draw the TIE fighters away with the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , while Rose stops Finn from completing a suicide run against the enemy siege cannon, which subsequently penetrates the Resistance fortress.\
Luke appears and confronts the First Order to enable surviving Resistance members to escape. Kylo orders the First Order's forces to fire on Luke, to no effect. He then engages Luke in a lightsaber duel; upon striking Luke, Kylo realizes he has been fighting a Force projection of him. Rey uses the Force to help the Resistance escape on the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . Luke, exhausted, becomes one with the Force and dies peacefully on Ahch-To. Rey and Leia sense his death, and Leia tells surviving rebels that the Resistance has all it needs to rise again. At Canto Bight, one of the children who helped Finn and Rose escape grabs a broom with the Force and gazes into space.\
Having acquired the Power Stone, one of the six\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}, from the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Xandar#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Xandar}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0and his lieutenants\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ebony_Maw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ebony Maw}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Dwarf_(comics)#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cull Obsidian}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Proxima_Midnight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Proxima Midnight}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Corvus_Glaive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Corvus Glaive}}\'97intercept a spaceship carrying the last survivors of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0As they extract the Space Stone from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cosmic_Cube"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tesseract}}, Thanos subdues\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, overpowers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, and kills\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}. The latter of which sends the Hulk to Earth using the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st#Adaptations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st}}\'a0before being killed. Thanos departs with his lieutenants and obliterates the ship.\
Hulk crash-lands at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sanctum_Sanctorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sanctum Sanctorum}}\'a0in New York City, reverting to Bruce Banner. He warns\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Strange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Strange}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wong_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wong}}\'a0about Thanos' plan to kill half of all life in the universe; in response, Strange recruits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}. Maw and Obsidian arrive to retrieve the Time Stone from Strange, drawing the attention of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}. Maw captures Strange, but fails to take the Time Stone due to an enchantment. Stark and Parker pursue Maw's spaceship, Banner contacts\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}, and Wong stays behind to guard the Sanctum.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edinburgh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edinburgh}}, Midnight and Glaive ambush\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlet_Witch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}\'a0in order to retrieve the Mind Stone in Vision's forehead. Rogers,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}\'a0rescue them and take shelter with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0and Banner at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'a0Facility. Vision offers to sacrifice himself by having Maximoff destroy the Mind Stone to keep Thanos from retrieving it, but Maximoff refuses. Rogers suggests they travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakanda}}, which he believes has the resources to remove the stone without destroying Vision.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(2008_team)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Guardians of the Galaxy}}\'a0respond to a distress call from the Asgardian ship and rescue Thor, who surmises Thanos seeks the Reality Stone, which is in the possession of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Collector_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Collector}}\'a0on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knowhere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knowhere}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocket_Raccoon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocket}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Groot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Groot}}accompany Thor to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nidavellir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nidavellir}}, where they and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eitri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eitri}}\'a0create Stormbreaker, a battle-axe capable of killing Thanos. On Knowhere,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star-Lord"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Quill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gamora}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drax}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mantis}}\'a0find Thanos with the Reality Stone already in his possession. Thanos kidnaps Gamora, his adopted daughter, who reveals the location of the Soul Stone to save her captive adopted sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nebula_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nebula}}\'a0from torture. Thanos and Gamora travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_planets_in_Marvel_Comics#Vormir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vormir}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, keeper of the Soul Stone, informs him the stone can only be retrieved by sacrificing someone he loves. Thanos reluctantly kills Gamora, earning the stone.\
Nebula escapes captivity and asks the remaining Guardians to meet her on Thanos' destroyed homeworld,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Titan_(Marvel_Comics_location)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Titan}}. Stark and Parker kill Maw and rescue Strange. Landing on Titan, they meet Quill, Drax, and Mantis. The group forms a plan to remove Thanos' Infinity Gauntlet after Strange uses the Time Stone to view millions of possible futures, seeing only one in which Thanos loses. Thanos arrives, revealing his plans to be necessary to ensure the survival of a universe threatened by overpopulation. The group subdues him until Nebula deduces that Thanos has killed Gamora. Enraged, Quill attacks him, allowing Thanos to break the group's hold and overpower them. Stark is seriously wounded by Thanos, but is spared after Strange surrenders the Time Stone.\
In Wakanda, Rogers reunites with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0before Thanos' army invades. The Avengers, alongside\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}\'a0and the Wakandan forces, mount a defense while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shuri}}\'a0works to extract the Mind Stone from Vision. Banner, unable to transform into the Hulk, fights in Stark's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulkbuster_armor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulkbuster armor}}. Thor, Rocket, and Groot arrive to reinforce the Avengers; Midnight, Obsidian, and Glaive are killed and their army is routed. Despite Maximoff's attempt to destroy the Mind Stone, Thanos arrives and reverts time to remove it from Vision's head, killing him.\
Thor severely wounds Thanos, but Thanos activates the completed Infinity Gauntlet and teleports away. Half of all life across the universe disintegrates, including Barnes, T'Challa, Groot, Maximoff, Wilson, Mantis, Drax, Quill, Strange, and Parker, as well as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, although Fury is able to transmit a signal first.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Stark and Nebula remain on Titan while Banner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Man-Ape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M'Baku}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Okoye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Okoye}}, Rhodes, Rocket, Rogers, Romanoff, and Thor are left on the Wakandan battlefield. Meanwhile, Thanos watches a sunrise on another planet.\
In the near future, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sun}}\'a0ages and is about to turn into a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_giant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 red giant}}, pushing the nations of the world to consolidate into the United Earth Government, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_government"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 world government}}, and initiate a project to move Earth out of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Solar_System"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Solar System}}\'a0to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alpha_Centauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alpha Centauri}}\'a0system, in order to preserve\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Human_civilization"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 human civilization}}. Huge thrusters running on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fusion_power"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fusion power}}\'a0are built across the planet to propel it. Human population is reduced severely due to catastrophic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tide"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tides}}\'a0that occur after the planetary engines stop\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth%27s_rotation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth's rotation}}, and later as the planet moves away from the Sun, much of the surface is frozen due to lowered temperatures, forcing humans to live in vast\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Underground_city"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 underground cities}}built adjacent to the engines.\
At the beginning of the film, Liu Peiqiang ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wu_Jing_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wu Jing}}), a Chinese astronaut, promises to his son Liu Qi ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Qu_Chuxiao"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Qu Chuxiao}}) of his eventual return before his mission to a space station that helps Earth navigate as it moves out of the Solar system, and hands guardianship of his son over to his father-in-law Han Zi'ang ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ng_Man-tat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ng Man-tat}}).\
Several years later, Liu Peiqiang's mission is about to end and he will soon return to Earth. To celebrate\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chinese_New_Year"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chinese New Year}}, an adult Liu Qi brings adopted sister Han Duoduo ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zhao_Jinmai"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zhao Jinmai}}) on a trip to the surface in a truck they steal using Han Zi'ang's clearance as a trucker. They are arrested, and meet Tim ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mike_Sui"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mike Sui}}) as well as Han Zi'ang who unsuccessfully tries to get them released.\
As Earth passes by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jupiter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jupiter}}, it is captured by Jupiter's gravity, causing devastating\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earthquake"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 earthquakes}}\'a0that disable many thrusters across the globe. The four escape amidst the chaos and attempt to make their way out using the stolen truck, but the truck is requisitioned for a rescue mission by the military; they are to transport an engine component to the damaged thruster in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hangzhou"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hangzhou}}, supervised by soldiers led by Wang Lei (Li Guangjie). In the remnants of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghai"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shanghai}}, they lose their vehicle, and while transporting the component up the ruins of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanghai_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a skyscraper}}\'a0Han Zi'ang is killed. With news that the Hangzhou thruster was fully compromised and the city was completely destroyed, the group temporarily despair. They however find a new vehicle where the on-board engineer, Li Yiyi (Zhang Yichi), convinces them to transport an engine component to repair a larger planetary engine in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sulawesi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sulawesi}}.\
In space, Liu Peiqiang discovers that MOSS, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_intelligence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artificial intelligence}}\'a0commanding the space station, has directed it to escape rather than to assist the humans on Earth. He breaks out of forced hibernation and attempts to stop the spacecraft along with Russian\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cosmonaut"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cosmonaut}}\'a0Makarov, who is killed by the spacecraft's automated security measures. Liu Peiqiang arrives in the control room, but his clearances were revoked due to his undisciplinary acts and he can do little to override the escape process.\
Liu Qi's group arrive at Sulawesi to find that the engine was already fully restored. Globally, most of the planetary thrusters have been repaired as well. However, Earth has moved past Jupiter's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roche_limit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roche limit}}\'a0and will be destroyed anyway, with the restored thrust unable to propel it away. The group despairs on learning this, but Liu Qi, inspired by recollection of his father's explanation of the thrusters' mechanics as a child, proposes to ignite Jupiter's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydrogen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hydrogen}}-abundant atmosphere to blow Earth away. Li Yiyi proposes to concentrate the Sulawesi engine's power to fire a beam high enough to ignite Jupiter. The group overcome various challenges, such as renewed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aftershock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 aftershock}}\'a0tremors that injure several members, and are able to mostly reconfigure the engine to carry out the plan, however they are not able to push the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Firing_pin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 firing pin}}\'a0of the engine to ignite it.\
Liu Peiqiang, learning of this, is able to persuade the United Earth Goverment to use its communication channels to call assistance for the party at Sulawesi, even though MOSS reveals that the solution being attempted has no chance of success based on probability calculations. Other rescue and repair parties arrive and the engine is fired up, but it falls short of being able to ignite the hydrogen. Liu Peiqiang decides to use the space station's engine itself to ignite Jupiter's hydrogen; after disabling MOSS using a fire started with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vodka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vodka}}\'a0that Makarov smuggled on-board, he pilots the spacecraft into the cloud between Jupiter and Earth, sacrificing himself as the ignition succeeds. Earth is saved from destruction, and continues to move towards the destination star system.\
As the film ends, Liu Qi recounts and envisions the stages of Earth's migration, a process to take 2,500 years and still bound with uncertainty, in a hopeful tone.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0has been published since December 16, 1905,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [1][2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0when it was launched by Sime Silverman as a weekly periodical covering theater and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vaudeville"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vaudeville}}\'a0with its headquarters in New York City.\
Sime was fired by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Morning_Telegraph"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Morning Telegraph}}\'a0in 1905 for panning an act which had taken out an advert for $50,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and said that it looked like he would have to start his own paper in order to be able to tell the truth. With a loan of $1,500 from his father-in-law, he launched\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0as publisher and editor.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In addition to Sime's former employer\'a0
\f1\i The Morning Telegraph
\f0\i0 , other major competitors on launch were\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_New_York_Clipper"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The New York Clipper}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_Dramatic_Mirror"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York Dramatic Mirror}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The original cover design, which is very similar to the current design, was sketched by Edgar M. Miller, a scenic painter, who refused payment.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The front cover contained pictures of the original editorial staff, who were Alfred Greason, Epes W Sargeant (Chicot or Chic) and Joshua Lowe, as well as Sime.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The first issue contained a review by Sime's son Sidne, also known as Skigie (based on the childish lisping of his name) who was claimed to be the youngest critic in the world at seven years old.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1922, Sime acquired\'a0
\f1\i The New York Clipper
\f0\i0 \'a0which had been reporting on the stage and other entertainment since 1853 and folded it two years later, merging some of its features into\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Also in 1922, Sime launched the\'a0
\f1\i Times Square Daily
\f0\i0 , which he referred to as "the world's worst daily" and soon scrapped.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0During that period,\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0staffers worked on all three papers.\
After the launch of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Hollywood_Reporter"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Hollywood Reporter}}\'a0in 1930, which\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0sued for alleged plagiarism in 1932,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Sime launched\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0in 1933, based in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hollywood,_Los_Angeles,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hollywood}}, with Arthur Ungar as the editor. It replaced\'a0
\f1\i Variety Bulletin
\f0\i0 \'a0that was issued in Hollywood on Fridays.\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0was initially published every day other than Sunday but mostly on Monday to Friday.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Ungar was editor until 1950, followed by Joe Schoenfeld (1950-1959) and then Thomas M. Pryor (1959-1988), who was succeeded by his son Pete.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11][12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The\'a0
\f1\i Daily
\f0\i0 \'a0and the\'a0
\f1\i Weekly
\f0\i0 \'a0were initially run as virtually independent newspapers, with the\'a0
\f1\i Daily
\f0\i0 \'a0concentrating mostly on Hollywood news and the\'a0
\f1\i Weekly
\f0\i0 \'a0on U.S. and International coverage.\
Sime Silverman had passed on the editorship of the\'a0
\f1\i Weekly Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abel_Green"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abel Green}}\'a0as his replacement in 1931; he remained as publisher until his death in 1933 soon after launching\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 . Green remained as editor from 1931 until his death in 1973.\
Sime's son Sidne succeeded him as publisher of both publications. Following his death from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tuberculosis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tuberculosis}}\'a0in 1950, his only son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Syd_Silverman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Syd Silverman}}, was the sole heir to what was then Variety Inc. Young Syd's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Legal_guardian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 legal guardian}}Harold Erichs oversaw Variety Inc. until 1956. After that date Syd Silverman managed the company as publisher of both the\'a0
\f1\i Weekly Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0in New York and the\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0in Hollywood, until the sale of both papers in 1987 to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cahners_Publishing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cahners Publishing}}\'a0for $64 million.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He remained as publisher until 1990 when he was succeeded on\'a0
\f1\i Weekly Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0by Gerard A. Byrne and on\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0by Sime's great grandson, Michael Silverman. Syd became chairman of both publications.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1953,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Army_Archerd"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Army Archerd}}'s "Just for Variety" column appeared on page two of\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0and swiftly became popular in Hollywood. Archerd broke countless exclusive stories, reporting from film sets, announcing pending deals, giving news of star-related hospitalizations, marriages, and births. The column appeared daily for 52 years until September 1, 2005.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [15]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
On December 7, 1988, the editor, Roger Watkins, proposed and oversaw the transition to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Color_print"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 four-color print}}. Upon its launch, the new-look\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0measured one inch shorter with a washed-out color on the front. The old front-page box advertisement was replaced by a strip advertisement, along with the first photos published in\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0since Sime gave up using them in the old format in 1920: they depicted Sime, Abel and Syd.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
For twenty years from 1989 its editor-in-chief was\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Bart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Bart}}, originally only of the weekly New York edition, with Michael Silverman (Syd's son) running the\'a0
\f1\i Daily
\f0\i0 \'a0in Hollywood. Bart had worked previously at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paramount_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paramount Pictures}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_New_York_Times"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The New York Times}}. In April 2009, Bart moved to the position of "vice president and editorial director", characterized online as "Boffo No More: Bart Up and Out at Variety". From mid 2009 to 2013, Timothy M. Gray oversaw the publication as Editor-in-Chief,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0after over 30 years of various reporter and editor positions in the newsroom.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In October 2012,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reed_Business_Information"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reed Business Information}}, the periodical's owner, (formerly known as Reed-Elsevier, which had been parent to Cahner's Corp. in the United States) sold the publication to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/PMC_(company)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Penske Media Corporation}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [19][20]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0PMC is the owner of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Deadline_Hollywood"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Deadline Hollywood}}, which since the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/2007%E2%80%932008_Writers_Guild_of_America_strike"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 2007\'962008 Writers Guild of America strike}}\'a0has been considered\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 's largest competitor in online showbiz news. In October 2012, Jay Penske, Chairman and CEO of PMC, announced that the website's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paywall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paywall}}\'a0would come down, the print publication would stay, and he would invest more into Variety's digital platform in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Town_hall_meeting"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 townhall}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [21]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In March 2013,\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jay_Penske"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jay Penske}}\'a0appointed three co-editors to oversee different parts of the publication's industry coverage; Claudia Eller as Editor, Film; Cynthia Littleton as Editor, TV, and Andrew Wallenstein as Editor, Digital.\
The decision was also made to stop printing\'a0
\f1\i Daily Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0with the last printed edition published on March 19, 2013 with the headline "Variety Ankles Daily Pub Hubbub".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [22][23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In October 2014, Eller and Wallenstein were upped to Co-Editors in Chief, with Littleton continuing to oversee the trade's television coverage. In June 2014, Penske Media Corporation (PMC) entered into an agreement with Reuters to syndicate news from\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0Latino-Powered by Univision to distribute leading entertainment news to the international news agency's global readership. This dissemination comes in the form of columns, news stories, images, video, and data-focused products. In July 2015,\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0was awarded a Los Angeles Area Emmy Award by the Television Academy in the Best Entertainment Program category for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Variety_Studio:_Actors_on_Actors"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Variety Studio: Actors on Actors}}, a series of one-hour specials that take viewers inside Hollywood films and television programs through conversations with acclaimed actors.\
A significant portion of the publication's advertising revenue comes during the film-award season leading up to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Academy_Awards"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Academy Awards}}. During this "Awards Season", large numbers of colorful, full-page "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/For_Your_Consideration_(advertising)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 For Your Consideration}}" advertisements inflate the size of\'a0
\f1\i Variety
\f0\i0 \'a0to double or triple its usual page count. These advertisements are the studios' attempt to reach other Hollywood professionals who will be voting on the many awards given out in the early part of the year, including the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Academy_Awards"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Academy Awards}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golden_Globes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Golden Globes}}\'a0and various guild award honors.
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \
A sexually frustrated woman,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Linda_Lovelace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Linda Lovelace}}\'a0(Linda Boreman), asks her friend Helen (Dolly Sharp) for advice on how to achieve an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Orgasm"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 orgasm}}. After a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sex_party_(group_sex)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sex party}}\'a0provides no help, Helen recommends that Linda visit a psychiatrist, Dr. Young ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Reems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Reems}}). The doctor discovers that Linda's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clitoris"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 clitoris}}\'a0is located in her throat, and after he helps her to develop her\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oral_sex"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 oral sex}}\'a0skills, the infatuated Linda asks him to marry her. He informs her that she can settle for a job as his therapist, performing her particular oral technique\'97thereafter known as "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Deep-throating"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 deep throat}}"\'97on various men, until she finds the one to marry. Meanwhile, the doctor documents her exploits while repeatedly having sex with his nurse ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carol_Connors_(actress)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Carol Connors}}). Linda finally meets a man who can make her happy, agreeing to marry him. The movie ends with the line "The End. And Deep Throat to you all."\
The film follows two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/juxtaposed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 juxtaposed}}\'a0families. One is the Northern Stonemans:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abolitionism_in_the_United_States"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 abolitionist}}\'a0U.S. Representative Austin Stoneman (based on the Reconstruction-era Representative\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thaddeus_Stevens"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thaddeus Stevens}}),
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13][14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0his daughter, and two sons. The other is the Southern Camerons: Dr. Cameron, his wife, their three sons and two daughters. Phil, the elder Stoneman son, falls in love with Margaret Cameron, during the brothers' visit to the Cameron estate in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/South_Carolina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 South Carolina}}, representing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Old_South"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Old South}}. Meanwhile, young Ben Cameron idolizes a picture of Elsie Stoneman. During the Civil War, the young men from both families enlist in their respective armies for the war. The younger Stoneman and two of the Cameron brothers are killed in the war. Meanwhile, the Cameron women are rescued by Confederate soldiers who rout a black militia, after an attack on the Cameron home. Ben Cameron leads a heroic charge at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Siege_of_Petersburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Siege of Petersburg}}, earning the nickname of "the Little Colonel", but he is also wounded and captured. He is then taken to a Union hospital in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Washington,_D.C."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Washington, D.C.}}\
During his stay at the hospital, he is told that he will be hanged. Also at the hospital, he meets Elsie Stoneman, whose picture he has been carrying; she is working there as a nurse. Elsie takes Cameron's mother, who had traveled to Washington to tend her son, to see\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abraham_Lincoln"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abraham Lincoln}}, and Mrs. Cameron persuades the President to pardon Ben. When\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Assassination_of_Abraham_Lincoln"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lincoln is assassinated}}\'a0at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ford%27s_Theatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ford's Theatre}}, his conciliatory postwar policy expires with him. In the wake of the president's death, Austin Stoneman and other\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Radical_Republican"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Radical Republicans}}\'a0are determined to punish the South, employing harsh measures that Griffith depicts as having been typical of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reconstruction_Era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reconstruction Era}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [15]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Stoneman and his prot\'e9g\'e9 Silas Lynch, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychopath"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 psychopathic}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mulatto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mulatto}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0head to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/South_Carolina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 South Carolina}}\'a0to observe the implementation of Reconstruction policies firsthand. During the election, in which Lynch is elected lieutenant governor, blacks are observed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ballot_box_stuffing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stuffing the ballot boxes}}, while many whites are denied the vote. The newly elected, mostly black members of the South Carolina legislature are shown at their desks displaying inappropriate behavior, such as one member taking off his shoe and putting his feet up on his desk, and others drinking liquor and feasting on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fried_chicken#Racial_stereotype"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fried chicken}}.\
Meanwhile, inspired by observing white children pretending to be ghosts to scare black children, Ben fights back by forming the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ku Klux Klan}}. As a result, Elsie, out of loyalty to her father, breaks off her relationship with Ben. Later, Flora Cameron goes off alone into the woods to fetch water and is followed by Gus, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Freedman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 freedman}}\'a0and soldier who is now a captain. He confronts Flora and tells her that he desires to get married. Frightened, she flees into the forest, pursued by Gus. Trapped on a precipice, Flora warns Gus she will jump if he comes any closer. When he does, she leaps to her death. Having run through the forest looking for her, Ben has seen her jump; he holds her as she dies, then carries her body back to the Cameron home. In response, the Klan hunts down Gus, tries him, finds him guilty, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lynching"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lynches}}\'a0him.\
Lynch then orders a crackdown on the Klan after discovering Gus's murder. He also secures the passing of legislation allowing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Interracial_marriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mixed-race marriages}}. Dr. Cameron is arrested for possessing Ben's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan_regalia_and_insignia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Klan regalia}}, now considered a crime punishable by death. He is rescued by Phil Stoneman and a few of his black servants. Together with Margaret Cameron, they flee. When their wagon breaks down, they make their way through the woods to a small hut that is home to two sympathetic former Union soldiers who agree to hide them. An\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intertitle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intertitle}}\'a0states, "The former enemies of North and South are united again in defense of their\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aryan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aryan}}\'a0birthright."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Congressman Stoneman leaves to avoid being connected with Lt. Gov. Lynch's crackdown. Elsie, learning of Dr. Cameron's arrest, goes to Lynch to plead for his release. Lynch, who had been lusting after Elsie, tries to force her to marry him, which causes her to faint. Stoneman returns, causing Elsie to be placed in another room. At first, Stoneman is happy when Lynch tells him he wants to marry a white woman, but is then angered when Lynch tells him that it is Stoneman's daughter. Undercover Klansmen spies go to get help when they discover Elsie's plight after she breaks a window and cries out for help. Elsie falls unconscious again, and revives while gagged and being bound. The Klan, gathered together and with Ben leading them, rides in to gain control of the town. When news about Elsie reaches Ben, he and others go to her rescue. Elsie frees her mouth and screams for help. Lynch is captured. Victorious, the Klansmen celebrate in the streets. Meanwhile, Lynch's militia surrounds and attacks the hut where the Camerons are hiding. The Klansmen, with Ben at their head, race in to save them just in time. The next election day, blacks find a line of mounted and armed Klansmen just outside their homes, and are intimidated into not voting.\
The film concludes with a double wedding as Margaret Cameron marries Phil Stoneman and Elsie Stoneman marries Ben Cameron. The masses are shown oppressed by a giant warlike figure who gradually fades away. The scene shifts to another group finding peace under the image of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jesus_in_Christianity"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jesus Christ}}. The penultimate title is: "Dare we dream of a golden day when the bestial War shall rule no more. But instead \'97 the gentle Prince in the Hall of Brotherly Love in the City of Peace."\
On the eve of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American Civil War}}\'a0in 1861,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlett_O%27Hara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scarlett O'Hara}}\'a0lives at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tara_(plantation)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tara}}, her family's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cotton_plantation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cotton plantation}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Georgia_(U.S._state)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Georgia}}, with her parents and two sisters and their many slaves. Scarlett learns that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ashley_Wilkes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ashley Wilkes}}\'97whom she secretly loves\'97is to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cousin_marriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 married to his cousin}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Melanie_Hamilton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Melanie Hamilton}}, and the engagement is to be announced the next day at a barbecue at Ashley's home, the nearby plantation\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Twelve_Oaks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Twelve Oaks}}.\
At the Twelve Oaks party, Scarlett privately declares her feelings to Ashley, but he rebuffs her by responding that he and Melanie are more compatible. Scarlett is incensed when she discovers another guest,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rhett_Butler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rhett Butler}}, has overheard their conversation. The barbecue is disrupted by the declaration of war and the men rush to enlist. As Scarlett watches Ashley kiss Melanie goodbye, Melanie's younger brother Charles proposes to her. Although she does not love him, Scarlett consents and they are married before he leaves to fight.\
Scarlett is widowed when Charles dies from a bout of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pneumonia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pneumonia}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Measles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 measles}}\'a0while serving in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Confederate_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Confederate Army}}. Scarlett's mother sends her to the Hamilton home in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Atlanta"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Atlanta}}\'a0to cheer her up, although the O'Haras' outspoken house slave Mammy tells Scarlett she knows she is going there only to wait for Ashley's return. Scarlett, who should not attend a party while in mourning, attends a charity bazaar in Atlanta with Melanie where she meets Rhett again, now a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blockade_runner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blockade runner}}\'a0for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Confederate_States_of_America"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Confederacy}}. Celebrating a Confederate victory and to raise money for the Confederate war effort, gentlemen are invited to bid for ladies to dance with them. Rhett makes an inordinately large bid for Scarlett and, to the disapproval of the guests, she agrees to dance with him.\
The tide of war turns against the Confederacy after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Gettysburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Gettysburg}}\'a0in which many of the men of Scarlett's town are killed. Scarlett makes another unsuccessful appeal to Ashley while he is visiting on Christmas\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Furlough"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 furlough}}, although they do share a private and passionate kiss in the parlor on Christmas Day, just before he returns to war.\
Eight months later, as the city is besieged by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Union_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Union Army}}\'a0in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Atlanta_Campaign"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Atlanta Campaign}}, Scarlett and her young house slave Prissy must deliver Melanie's baby without medical assistance after she goes into premature labor. Afterwards, Scarlett calls upon Rhett to take her home to Tara with Melanie, her baby, and Prissy; he collects them in a horse and wagon, but once out of the city chooses to go off to fight, leaving Scarlett and the group to make their own way back to Tara. Upon her return home, Scarlett finds Tara deserted, except for her father, her sisters, and two former slaves: Mammy and Pork. Scarlett learns that her mother has just died of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Typhoid_fever"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 typhoid fever}}and her father has become incompetent. With Tara pillaged by Union troops and the fields untended, Scarlett vows she will do anything for the survival of her family and herself.\
As the O'Haras work in the cotton fields, Scarlett's father is killed after he is thrown from his horse in an attempt to chase away a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scalawag"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scalawag}}\'a0from his land. With the defeat of the Confederacy, Ashley also returns, but finds he is of little help at Tara. When Scarlett begs him to run away with her, he confesses his desire for her and kisses her passionately, but says he cannot leave Melanie. Unable to pay the taxes on Tara implemented by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reconstruction_Era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reconstructionists}}, Scarlett dupes her younger sister Suellen's fianc\'e9, the middle-aged and wealthy mill owner Frank Kennedy, into marrying her, by saying Suellen got tired of waiting and married another suitor.\
Frank, Ashley, Rhett and several other accomplices make a night raid on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanty_town"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shanty town}}\'a0after Scarlett is attacked while driving through it alone, resulting in Frank's death. With Frank's funeral barely over, Rhett proposes to Scarlett and she accepts. They have a daughter whom Rhett names Bonnie Blue, but Scarlett, still pining for Ashley and chagrined at the perceived ruin of her figure, lets Rhett know that she wants no more children and that they will no longer share a bed.\
One day at Frank's mill, Scarlett and Ashley are seen embracing by Ashley's sister, India, and harboring an intense dislike of Scarlett she eagerly spreads rumors. Later that evening, Rhett, having heard the rumors, forces Scarlett to attend a birthday party for Ashley. Incapable of believing anything bad of her, Melanie stands by Scarlett's side so that all know that she believes the gossip to be false. After returning home from the party, Scarlett finds Rhett downstairs drunk, and they argue about Ashley.
