Rhett kisses Scarlett against her will, stating his intent to have sex with her that night, and carries the struggling Scarlett to the bedroom. The next day, Rhett apologizes for his behavior and offers Scarlett a divorce, which she rejects, saying that it would be a disgrace. When Rhett returns from an extended trip to London, Scarlett informs him that she is pregnant, but an argument ensues which results in her falling down a flight of stairs and suffering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miscarriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 miscarriage}}. As she is recovering, tragedy strikes when Bonnie dies while attempting to jump a fence with her pony.\
Scarlett and Rhett visit Melanie, who has suffered complications arising from a new pregnancy, on her deathbed. As Scarlett consoles Ashley, Rhett prepares to leave Atlanta. Having realized that it was he she truly loved all along, and not Ashley, Scarlett pleads with Rhett to stay, but Rhett rebuffs her and walks away into the morning fog, leaving her in tears on the staircase, vowing to one day win back his love.\
In 1938, Maria is a free-spirited young Austrian woman studying to become a nun at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nonnberg_Abbey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nonnberg Abbey}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salzburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Salzburg}}. Her love of music and the mountains, her youthful enthusiasm and imagination, and her lack of discipline cause some concern among the nuns. The Mother Abbess, believing Maria would be happier outside the abbey, sends her to the villa of retired naval officer Captain Georg von Trapp to be governess to his seven children\'97Liesl, Friedrich, Louisa, Kurt, Brigitta, Marta, and Gretl. The Captain has been raising his children using strict military discipline following the death of his wife. Although the children misbehave at first, Maria responds with kindness and patience, and soon the children come to trust and respect her. Liesl, the oldest, is won over after Maria protects her from discovery when she is nearly caught sneaking back into the house after meeting with Rolfe, a messenger boy she is in love with.\
While the Captain is away in Vienna, Maria makes play clothes for the children and takes them around Salzburg and the surrounding mountains, and teaches them how to sing. When the Captain returns to the villa with Baroness Elsa Schraeder, a wealthy socialite, and their mutual friend, Max Detweiler, they are greeted by Maria and the children returning from a boat ride on the lake that concludes when their boat overturns. Displeased by his children's clothes and activities, and Maria's impassioned appeal that he get closer to his children, the Captain orders her to return to the abbey. Just then he hears singing coming from inside the house and is astonished to see his children singing for the Baroness. Filled with emotion, the Captain joins his children, singing for the first time in years. Afterwards, he apologizes to Maria and asks her to stay.\
Impressed by the children's singing, Max proposes he enter them in the upcoming\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salzburg_Festival"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Salzburg Festival}}\'a0but the suggestion is immediately rejected by the Captain as he is opposed to his children singing in public. He does agree, however, to organize a grand party at the villa. The night of the party, while guests in formal attire\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Waltz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 waltz}}\'a0in the ballroom, Maria and the children look on from the garden terrace. When the Captain notices Maria teaching Kurt the traditional\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/L%C3%A4ndler"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 L\'e4ndler}}\'a0folk dance, he cuts in and dances with Maria in a graceful performance, culminating in a close embrace. Confused about her feelings, Maria blushes and breaks away. Later, the Baroness, who noticed the Captain's attraction to Maria, hides her jealousy while convincing Maria that she must return to the abbey. Back at the abbey, when Mother Abbess learns that Maria has stayed in seclusion to avoid her feelings for the Captain, she encourages her to return to the villa to look for her life. After Maria returns to the villa, she learns about the Captain's engagement to the Baroness and agrees to stay until they find a replacement governess. The Captain's feelings for Maria, however, have not changed, and after breaking off his engagement the Captain marries Maria.\
While the Captain and Maria are on their honeymoon, Max enters the children in the Salzburg Festival against their father's wishes. When they learn that Austria has been annexed by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Third_Reich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Third Reich}}\'a0in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anschluss"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anschluss}}, the couple return to their home, where a telegram awaits informing the Captain that he must report to the German Naval base at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bremerhaven"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bremerhaven}}\'a0to accept a commission in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kriegsmarine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Navy}}. Strongly opposed to the Nazis and the\'a0
\f1\i Anschluss
\f0\i0 , the Captain tells his family they must leave Austria immediately for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Switzerland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Switzerland}}. Many of the Von Trapps' friends are prepared to accept the new regime, including Rolfe, whom Liesl is devastated to see has joined the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hitler_Youth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hitler Youth}}. That night, as the von Trapp family attempt to leave, they are stopped by a group of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sturmabteilung"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brownshirts}}\'a0waiting outside the villa. When questioned by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gauleiter"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gauleiter}}\'a0Hans Zeller, the Captain maintains they are headed to the Salzburg Festival to perform. Zeller insists on escorting them to the festival, after which his men will accompany the Captain to Bremerhaven.\
Later that night at the festival, during their final number, the von Trapp family slip away and seek shelter at the nearby abbey, where Mother Abbess hides them in the cemetery crypt. Brownshirts soon arrive and search the abbey, and the family is discovered by Rolfe. Upon seeing Liesl, he hesitates raising the alarm long enough to allow the family time to flee, and the family is able to escape using the caretaker's car. When the soldiers attempt to pursue, they discover their cars will not start as two nuns have removed parts of the engines. The next morning, after driving to the Swiss border, the von Trapp family make their way on foot across the frontier into Switzerland to safety and freedom.\
On the eve of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American Civil War}}\'a0in 1861,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlett_O%27Hara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scarlett O'Hara}}\'a0lives at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tara_(plantation)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tara}}, her family's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cotton_plantation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cotton plantation}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Georgia_(U.S._state)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Georgia}}, with her parents and two sisters and their many slaves. Scarlett learns that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ashley_Wilkes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ashley Wilkes}}\'97whom she secretly loves\'97is to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cousin_marriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 married to his cousin}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Melanie_Hamilton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Melanie Hamilton}}, and the engagement is to be announced the next day at a barbecue at Ashley's home, the nearby plantation\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Twelve_Oaks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Twelve Oaks}}.\
At the Twelve Oaks party, Scarlett privately declares her feelings to Ashley, but he rebuffs her by responding that he and Melanie are more compatible. Scarlett is incensed when she discovers another guest,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rhett_Butler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rhett Butler}}, has overheard their conversation. The barbecue is disrupted by the declaration of war and the men rush to enlist. As Scarlett watches Ashley kiss Melanie goodbye, Melanie's younger brother Charles proposes to her. Although she does not love him, Scarlett consents and they are married before he leaves to fight.\
Scarlett is widowed when Charles dies from a bout of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pneumonia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pneumonia}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Measles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 measles}}\'a0while serving in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Confederate_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Confederate Army}}. Scarlett's mother sends her to the Hamilton home in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Atlanta"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Atlanta}}\'a0to cheer her up, although the O'Haras' outspoken house slave Mammy tells Scarlett she knows she is going there only to wait for Ashley's return. Scarlett, who should not attend a party while in mourning, attends a charity bazaar in Atlanta with Melanie where she meets Rhett again, now a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blockade_runner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blockade runner}}\'a0for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Confederate_States_of_America"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Confederacy}}. Celebrating a Confederate victory and to raise money for the Confederate war effort, gentlemen are invited to bid for ladies to dance with them. Rhett makes an inordinately large bid for Scarlett and, to the disapproval of the guests, she agrees to dance with him.\
The tide of war turns against the Confederacy after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_of_Gettysburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Battle of Gettysburg}}\'a0in which many of the men of Scarlett's town are killed. Scarlett makes another unsuccessful appeal to Ashley while he is visiting on Christmas\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Furlough"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 furlough}}, although they do share a private and passionate kiss in the parlor on Christmas Day, just before he returns to war.\
Eight months later, as the city is besieged by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Union_Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Union Army}}\'a0in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Atlanta_Campaign"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Atlanta Campaign}}, Scarlett and her young house slave Prissy must deliver Melanie's baby without medical assistance after she goes into premature labor. Afterwards, Scarlett calls upon Rhett to take her home to Tara with Melanie, her baby, and Prissy; he collects them in a horse and wagon, but once out of the city chooses to go off to fight, leaving Scarlett and the group to make their own way back to Tara. Upon her return home, Scarlett finds Tara deserted, except for her father, her sisters, and two former slaves: Mammy and Pork. Scarlett learns that her mother has just died of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Typhoid_fever"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 typhoid fever}}and her father has become incompetent. With Tara pillaged by Union troops and the fields untended, Scarlett vows she will do anything for the survival of her family and herself.\
As the O'Haras work in the cotton fields, Scarlett's father is killed after he is thrown from his horse in an attempt to chase away a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scalawag"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scalawag}}\'a0from his land. With the defeat of the Confederacy, Ashley also returns, but finds he is of little help at Tara. When Scarlett begs him to run away with her, he confesses his desire for her and kisses her passionately, but says he cannot leave Melanie. Unable to pay the taxes on Tara implemented by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reconstruction_Era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reconstructionists}}, Scarlett dupes her younger sister Suellen's fianc\'e9, the middle-aged and wealthy mill owner Frank Kennedy, into marrying her, by saying Suellen got tired of waiting and married another suitor.\
Frank, Ashley, Rhett and several other accomplices make a night raid on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shanty_town"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shanty town}}\'a0after Scarlett is attacked while driving through it alone, resulting in Frank's death. With Frank's funeral barely over, Rhett proposes to Scarlett and she accepts. They have a daughter whom Rhett names Bonnie Blue, but Scarlett, still pining for Ashley and chagrined at the perceived ruin of her figure, lets Rhett know that she wants no more children and that they will no longer share a bed.\
One day at Frank's mill, Scarlett and Ashley are seen embracing by Ashley's sister, India, and harboring an intense dislike of Scarlett she eagerly spreads rumors. Later that evening, Rhett, having heard the rumors, forces Scarlett to attend a birthday party for Ashley. Incapable of believing anything bad of her, Melanie stands by Scarlett's side so that all know that she believes the gossip to be false. After returning home from the party, Scarlett finds Rhett downstairs drunk, and they argue about Ashley. Rhett kisses Scarlett against her will, stating his intent to have sex with her that night, and carries the struggling Scarlett to the bedroom. The next day, Rhett apologizes for his behavior and offers Scarlett a divorce, which she rejects, saying that it would be a disgrace. When Rhett returns from an extended trip to London, Scarlett informs him that she is pregnant, but an argument ensues which results in her falling down a flight of stairs and suffering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miscarriage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 miscarriage}}. As she is recovering, tragedy strikes when Bonnie dies while attempting to jump a fence with her pony.\
Scarlett and Rhett visit Melanie, who has suffered complications arising from a new pregnancy, on her deathbed. As Scarlett consoles Ashley, Rhett prepares to leave Atlanta. Having realized that it was he she truly loved all along, and not Ashley, Scarlett pleads with Rhett to stay, but Rhett rebuffs her and walks away into the morning fog, leaving her in tears on the staircase, vowing to one day win back his love.\
In 1945, at his daughter Connie's wedding,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Don_(honorific)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Don}}\'a0Vito Corleone hears requests in his role as head of a New York crime family. His youngest son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Michael_Corleone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Michael}}, who was a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marine}}\'a0during\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}, introduces his girlfriend,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kay_Adams-Corleone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kay Adams}}, to his family at the reception. Johnny Fontane, a famous singer and Vito's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Godparent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 godson}}, seeks Vito's help in securing a movie role; Vito dispatches his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Consigliere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 consigliere}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Hagen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Hagen}}, to Los Angeles to persuade studio head Jack Woltz to give Johnny the part. Woltz refuses until he wakes up in bed with the severed head of his prized\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stud_(animal)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 stallion}}.\
Shortly before Christmas, drug baron Virgil "The Turk" Sollozzo, backed by the Tattaglia crime family, asks Vito for investment in his narcotics business and protection through his political connections. Wary of involvement in a dangerous new trade that risks alienating political insiders, Vito declines. Suspicious, Vito sends his enforcer,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luca_Brasi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luca Brasi}}, to spy on them. Brasi is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Garrote"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 garroted}}\'a0during his first meeting with Bruno Tattaglia and Sollozzo. Later Sollozzo has Vito gunned down in the street, then kidnaps Hagen. With Corleone first-born\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonny_Corleone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonny}}\'a0in command, Sollozzo pressures Hagen to persuade Sonny to accept Sollozzo's deal, then releases him. The family receives fish wrapped in Brasi's bullet-proof vest, indicating that Luca "sleeps with the fishes." Vito survives, and at the hospital Michael thwarts another attempt on his father; Michael's jaw is broken by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/NYPD"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 NYPD}}Captain Marc McCluskey, Sollozzo's unauthorized bodyguard. Sonny retaliates with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Contract_killing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hit}}\'a0on Bruno Tattaglia. Michael plots to murder Sollozzo and McCluskey: on the deception of settling the dispute, Michael arranges to meet them in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Bronx"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bronx}}\'a0restaurant. There, retrieving a planted handgun, he kills both men.\
Despite a clampdown by the authorities, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Five_Families_(The_Godfather)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Five Families}}\'a0erupt in open warfare and Vito fears for his sons' safety. Michael takes refuge in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sicily"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sicily}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fredo_Corleone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fredo}}\'a0is sheltered by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Moe_Greene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Moe Greene}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas_metropolitan_area"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas}}. Sonny attacks Carlo on the street for abusing Connie and threatens to kill him if it happens again. When it does, Sonny speeds to their home, but is ambushed at a highway toll booth and riddled with submachine gun fire. While in Sicily, Michael meets and marries Apollonia Vitelli, but a car bomb intended for him takes her life.\
Devastated by Sonny's death and realizing that the Tattaglias are controlled by the now-dominant Don\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Emilio_Barzini"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Emilio Barzini}}, Vito attempts to end the feud. He assures the Five Families that he will withdraw his opposition to their heroin business and forgo avenging Sonny's murder. His safety guaranteed, Michael returns home to enter the family business and marry Kay, promising her that the business will be legitimate within five years. Kay gives birth to two children by the early 1950s, and with his father at the end of his career and his brother too weak, Michael takes the family reins. He insists Hagen relocate to Las Vegas and relinquish his role to Vito because Tom is not a "wartime consigliere"; Vito agrees Tom should "have no part in what will happen" in the coming battles with rival families. Michael travels to Las Vegas to buy out Greene's stake in the family's casinos. Michael is dismayed to see that Fredo has fallen under Greene's sway.\
In 1955, Vito suffers a fatal\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Myocardial_infarction"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 heart attack}}. At the funeral,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salvatore_Tessio"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tessio}}, a Corleone\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caporegime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 capo}}, asks Michael to meet with Don Barzini, signalling the betrayal that Vito had forewarned. The meeting is set for the same day as the christening of Connie's baby. While Michael stands at the altar as the child's godfather, Corleone assassins murder the other New York dons and Moe Greene. Tessio is executed for his treachery and Michael extracts Carlo's confession to his complicity in setting up Sonny's murder for Barzini. A Corleone capo,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Clemenza"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clemenza}}, garrotes Carlo with a wire. Connie accuses Michael of the murder, telling Kay that Michael ordered all the killings. Kay is relieved when Michael finally denies it, but when the capos arrive, they address her husband as Don Corleone and she watches as they close the door on her.\
During a beach party at dusk on Amity Island,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_England"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New England}}, a young woman, Chrissie Watkins, goes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nude_swimming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skinny dipping}}\'a0in the ocean. While\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Treading_water"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 treading water}}, she is violently pulled under. The next day, her partial remains are found on shore. The medical examiner's ruling that the death was due to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark_attack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark attack}}\'a0leads police chief Martin Brody to close the beaches. Mayor Larry Vaughn overrules him, fearing that the town's summer economy will be ruined. The coroner now concurs with the mayor's theory that Chrissie was killed in a boating accident. Brody reluctantly accepts their conclusion until another fatal shark attack occurs shortly thereafter. A bounty is placed on the shark, prompting an amateur shark-hunting frenzy. Local professional shark hunter Quint offers his services for $10,000. Meanwhile, consulting oceanographer Matt Hooper examines Chrissie's remains, and confirms her death was caused by a shark\'97an unusually large one.\
When local fishermen catch a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tiger_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tiger shark}}, the mayor proclaims the beaches safe. Hooper disputes that it is the same predator, confirming this after no human remains are found inside it. Hooper and Brody find a half-sunken vessel while searching the night waters in Hooper's boat. Underwater, Hooper retrieves a sizable\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Great_white_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 great white shark}}'s tooth embedded in the submerged hull. He drops it in fright after encountering a partial corpse. Vaughn discounts Brody and Hooper's claims that a huge great white shark is responsible for the deaths, and refuses to close the beaches, allowing only added safety precautions. On the Fourth of July weekend, tourists pack the beaches. Following a juvenile prank in which the presence of a shark is simulated, the real shark enters a nearby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Estuary"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 estuary}}, killing a boater and causing Brody's oldest son, Michael, to go into shock. Brody then convinces Vaughn to hire Quint.\
Quint, Brody, and Hooper set out on Quint's boat, the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 , to hunt the shark. While Brody lays down a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chumming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chum}}\'a0line, Quint waits for an opportunity to hook the shark. Without warning, it appears behind the boat. Quint, estimating its length at 25 feet (7.6\'a0m) and weight at 3 tons, harpoons it with a line attached to a flotation barrel, but the shark pulls the barrel underwater and disappears.\
At nightfall, Quint and Hooper drunkenly exchange stories about their assorted scars and Quint reveals that he survived the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Indianapolis_(CA-35)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USS\'a0
\f1\i Indianapolis}}. The shark returns unexpectedly, ramming the boat's hull, and disabling the power. The men work through the night, repairing the engine. In the morning, Brody attempts to call the Coast Guard, but Quint, who has become obsessed with killing the shark without outside assistance, smashes the radio. After a long chase, Quint harpoons another barrel into the shark. The line is tied to the stern cleats, but the shark drags the boat backward, swamping the deck and flooding the engine compartment. Quint prepares to sever the line to prevent the transom from being pulled out but the cleats break off, keeping the barrels attached to the shark. Quint heads toward shore to draw the shark into shallower waters, but he intentionally pushes the damaged engine past the safety limits and the overtaxed engine fails.\
With the\'a0
\f1\i Orca
\f0\i0 \'a0slowly sinking, the trio attempt a riskier approach. Hooper puts on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scuba_set"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scuba gear}}\'a0and enters the water in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shark-proof_cage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shark-proof cage}}, intending to lethally inject the shark with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Strychnine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 strychnine}}, using a hypodermic spear. The shark demolishes the cage before Hooper can inject it, but he manages to escape to the seabed. The shark then attacks the boat directly and devours Quint. Trapped on the sinking vessel, Brody jams a pressurized scuba tank into the shark's mouth, and, climbing the crow's nest, shoots the tank with a rifle. The resulting explosion obliterates the shark. Hooper surfaces, and he and Brody paddle back to Amity Island clinging to the remaining barrels.\
The galaxy is in the midst of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a civil war}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel}}\'a0spies have stolen plans to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}, a colossal\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_station"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space station}}\'a0capable of destroying an entire planet.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Princess Leia}}, one of the Rebellion's leaders, has obtained the plans, but\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tantive_IV"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 her starship}}\'a0is captured by an Imperial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0under the command of the ruthless\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}. Before she is captured, Leia hides the plans in the memory of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)#Astromech_droids"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astromech droid}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who, along with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(Star_Wars)#Protocol_droids"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 protocol droid}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}, flees in an escape pod to the desert planet below the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Starship"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 starships}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}.\
The droids are captured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jawas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jawa}}\'a0traders, who sell them to moisture farmers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Owen_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Owen}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Beru_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Beru Lars}}\'a0and their nephew\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}. While cleaning\'a0R2-D2, Luke accidentally triggers a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holography"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 holographic}}\'a0recording of Leia, in which she requests help from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}. The next morning, Luke finds\'a0R2-D2\'a0missing, and encounters "Old Ben" Kenobi, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hermit"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hermit}}\'a0who reveals himself as Obi-Wan. He tells Luke of his days as one of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Knights}}, former peacekeepers of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Republic}}\'a0who derived their power from an energy field called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0until being all but wiped out by the Empire. Contrary to what his uncle has told him, Luke learns that his father fought alongside Obi-Wan as a Jedi Knight until Vader, a former pupil of Obi-Wan's, turned to the dark side of the Force and murdered him. Obi-Wan presents Luke with his father's old weapon: a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}.\
R2-D2\'a0plays Leia's message for Obi-Wan, in which she begs him to take the Death Star plans to her home planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alderaan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alderaan}}\'a0and give them to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bail_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 her father}}\'a0for analysis. Obi-Wan invites Luke to accompany him to Alderaan and learn the ways of the Force. Luke declines, but changes his mind after discovering that Imperials have killed his aunt and uncle and destroyed their farm. Obi-Wan and Luke visit a cantina in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mos_Eisley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mos Eisley}}, where, after a brief confrontation, they meet smuggler\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wookiee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wookiee}}\'a0co-pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}. After negotiating a price, they join forces aboard Han's ship, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}.\
The group discovers that Alderaan has been destroyed by the Death Star's superlaser\'97a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Show_of_force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 show of force}}\'a0on order of the commanding officer,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grand_Moff_Tarkin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grand Moff Tarkin}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by the Death Star's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tractor_beam"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tractor beam}}, which Obi-Wan goes to disable. Luke discovers that Leia is imprisoned on the Death Star, and rescues her with the help of Han and Chewbacca in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Swashbuckler#Movie"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 swashbuckling}}\'a0series of escapes. After Obi-Wan sacrifices himself in a lightsaber duel with Darth Vader to enable the heroes to escape, the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0escapes amid a fierce dogfight with Imperial\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE starfighters}}. Using a tracking beacon placed aboard the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , the Imperials follow the rebels to the hidden base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yavin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yavin 4}}.\
The Death Star plans reveal that it can be destroyed by triggering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chain_reaction"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chain reaction}}\'a0from an external exhaust port. Luke joins the Rebel fighter squadron, while Han collects his payment, intending to leave. In the ensuing battle, the Rebels suffer heavy losses after several unsuccessful runs. Vader leads a squadron of TIE fighters and prepares to attack Luke's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing}}, but Han returns and fires at the Imperial fighters, sending Vader spiraling away. Guided by Obi-Wan's spirit, Luke turns off his targeting computer and uses the Force to destroy the Death Star just before it can fire on the Rebel base. On Yavin 4, Leia awards Luke and Han with medals for their heroism.\
A group of alien botanists secretly visit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth}}\'a0under cover of night to gather plant specimens in a California forest. When government agents appear on the scene, the aliens flee in their spaceship, but in their haste, one of them is left behind. In a suburban neighborhood in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/San_Fernando_Valley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 San Fernando Valley}}, a ten-year-old boy named Elliott is spending time with his brother, Michael, and his friends. As he returns from picking up a pizza, he discovers that something is hiding in their tool shed. The alien promptly flees upon being discovered. Despite his family's disbelief, Elliott leaves\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reese%27s_Pieces"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Reese's Pieces}}\'a0candy to lure the alien to his house. Before going to sleep, Elliott realizes it is imitating his movements. He feigns illness the next morning to stay home from school and play with it. Later that day, Michael and their five-year-old sister, Gertie, meet it. They decide to keep it hidden from their mother, Mary. When they ask it about its origin, it levitates several balls to represent its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Planetary_system"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 planetary system}}\'a0and then demonstrates its powers by reviving dead\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chrysanthemum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chrysanthemums}}.\
At school the next day, Elliott begins to experience a psychic connection with the alien, including exhibiting signs of intoxication (because it is at his home, drinking beer and watching\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_%26_Jerry"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom & Jerry}}), and he begins freeing all the frogs in his biology class. As the alien watches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Wayne"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Wayne}}\'a0kiss\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maureen_O%27Hara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maureen O'Hara}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Quiet_Man"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Quiet Man}}\'a0on television, Elliott then kisses a girl he likes in the same manner and he is sent to the principal's office.\
The alien learns to speak English by repeating what Gertie says as she watches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sesame_Street"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sesame Street}}\'a0and, at Elliott's urging, dubs itself "E.T." E.T. reads a comic strip where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buck_Rogers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buck Rogers}}, stranded, calls for help by building a makeshift communication device and is inspired to try it himself. E.T. receives Elliott's help in building a device to "phone home" by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Speak_%26_Spell_(toy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Speak & Spell}}\'a0toy. Michael notices that E.T.'s health is declining and that Elliott is referring to himself as "we".\
On\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Halloween"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Halloween}}, Michael and Elliott dress E.T. as a ghost so they can sneak him out of the house. That night, Elliott and E.T. head through the forest, where they make a successful call home. The next day, Elliott wakes up in the field, only to find E.T. gone. Elliott returns home to his distressed family. Michael searches for and finds E.T. dying next to a culvert. Michael takes E.T. home to Elliott, who is also dying. Mary becomes frightened when she discovers her son's illness and the dying alien, just as government agents invade the house. Scientists set up a hospital at the house, questioning Michael, Mary and Gertie while treating Elliott and E.T. Their connection disappears and E.T. then appears to die while Elliott recovers. A grief-stricken Elliott is left alone with the motionless E.T. when he notices a dead chrysanthemum, the plant E.T. had previously revived, coming back to life. E.T. reanimates and reveals that his people are returning. Elliott and Michael steal a van that E.T. had been loaded into and a chase ensues, with Michael's friends joining them as they attempt to evade the authorities by bicycles. Suddenly facing a police roadblock, they escape as E.T. uses\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychokinesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telekinesis}}\'a0to lift them into the air and toward the forest, like he had done for Elliott before.\
Standing near the spaceship, E.T.'s heart glows as he prepares to return home. Mary, Gertie, and "Keys", a friendly government agent, show up. E.T. says goodbye to Michael and Gertie, as she presents him with the chrysanthemum that he had revived. Before boarding the spaceship, he embraces Elliott and tells him "I'll be right here", pointing his glowing finger to Elliott's forehead. He then picks up the chrysanthemum, boards the spaceship, and it takes off, leaving a rainbow in the sky as everyone watches it leave.\
Industrialist John Hammond and his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bioengineering}}\'a0company, InGen, have created a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Animal_theme_park"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 theme park}}\'a0featuring cloned dinosaurs and prehistoric plants, called Jurassic Park, on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isla_Nublar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Nublar}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Costa_Rica"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Costa Rican}}\'a0island. After a dinosaur handler is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}, the park's investors, represented by lawyer Donald Gennaro, demand that experts visit the park and certify it is safe. To perform the inspection, Gennaro invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mathematician"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mathematician}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chaos_theory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chaos theorist}}\'a0Ian Malcolm, while Hammond invites\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleontologist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleontologist}}\'a0Dr. Alan Grant and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paleobotanist"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paleobotanist}}\'a0Dr. Ellie Sattler. Upon arrival, the group is shocked to see a live\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}, in addition to two more with a herd of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parasaurolophus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Parasaurolophus}}.\
At the park's visitor center, the group learns the cloning was accomplished by extracting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_DNA"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dinosaur DNA}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mosquito"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mosquitoes}}\'a0preserved in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 amber}}. DNA from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 frogs}}\'a0was used to fill in gaps in the dinosaurs'\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genome"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genome}}. To prevent breeding, all the dinosaurs were made female. Malcolm scoffs at the idea, saying it will inevitably break down. The group witnesses the hatching of a baby\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Velociraptor"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Velociraptor}}\'a0and visits the raptor enclosure. At lunch, the group debates the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ethics_of_cloning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ethics of cloning}}\'a0and the creation of the park. Malcolm gives a harsh warning about the implications of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Genetic_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 genetic engineering}}.\
The group is joined by Hammond's grandchildren, Tim and Lex, for a tour of the park, while Hammond oversees the tour from the park's control room. The tour does not go as planned. Most of the dinosaurs fail to appear and the group encounters a sick\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Triceratops"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Triceratops}}. It is cut short as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tropical_cyclone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tropical storm}}\'a0approaches Isla Nublar. Most park employees leave for the mainland on a boat, while the visitors return to their electric tour vehicles. Sattler stays behind with the park's veterinarian to study the\'a0
\f1\i Triceratops
\f0\i0 .\
Jurassic Park's lead computer programmer, Dennis Nedry, has been bribed by Dodgson, a man working for Hammond's corporate rival, to steal fertilized dinosaur\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Embryo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 embryos}}. Nedry deactivates the park's security system to gain access to the embryo storage room and puts the stolen embryos inside a canister disguised as a shaving cream bottle. The power goes out, stalling the tour vehicles. Most of the park's electric fences are deactivated, allowing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tyrannosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tyrannosaurus rex}}\'a0to escape and attack the group. Grant and Hammond's grandchildren survive. The\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0injures Malcolm and devours Gennaro. While taking the embryos to the island's dock, Nedry becomes lost in the rain, crashes his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeep_Wrangler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeep Wrangler}}, and is killed by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dilophosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dilophosaurus}}.\
Sattler helps the park's game warden, Robert Muldoon, search for survivors. They find only Malcolm before the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0returns. Grant, Tim, and Lex take shelter in a treetop. They later discover broken dinosaur egg shells. Grant concludes the dinosaurs have been breeding. This occurred because their frog DNA\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/African_bullfrog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 West African bullfrogs}}\'a0can change their sex in a single-sex environment, allowing the dinosaurs to do so as well, proving Malcolm right.\
Unable to decipher Nedry's code to reactivate the security system, Hammond and the park's chief engineer Ray Arnold reboot the park's system. The group shuts down the park's grid and retreats to an emergency bunker, while Arnold heads to a maintenance shed to complete the rebooting process. When Arnold fails to return, Sattler and Muldoon head to the shed. They discover the shutdown has deactivated the remaining fences and released the\'a0
\f1\i Velociraptors
\f0\i0 . Muldoon distracts the raptors, while Sattler goes to turn the power back on, before being attacked by a raptor and discovering Arnold's severed arm. Muldoon is caught off guard and killed by the other two raptors.\
After encountering a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brachiosaurus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brachiosaurus}}\'a0and narrowly escaping the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0during a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gallimimus"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gallimimus}}\'a0stampede, Grant, Tim, and Lex reach the visitor center. Grant heads out to look for Sattler, leaving Tim (who was injured while scaling one of the fences) and Lex inside. They are pursued by the raptors in an industrial kitchen but escape and join Grant and Sattler. Lex restores full power from the control room, allowing them to call Hammond, who in turn calls for help. Grant, Tim, Lex, and Sattler are cornered by the raptors, but they escape when the\'a0
\f1\i Tyrannosaurus
\f0\i0 \'a0suddenly appears and kills the raptors. Hammond arrives in a jeep with Malcolm, and the survivors board a helicopter to leave the island.\
In 1996, treasure hunter Brock Lovett and his team aboard the research vessel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Akademik_Mstislav_Keldysh"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Akademik Mstislav Keldysh}}\'a0search the wreck of RMS\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 \'a0for a necklace with a rare diamond, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heart_of_the_Ocean"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heart of the Ocean}}. They recover a safe containing a drawing of a young woman wearing only the necklace dated April 14, 1912, the day the ship struck the iceberg.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [Note 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Rose Dawson Calvert, the woman in the drawing, is brought aboard\'a0
\f1\i Keldysh
\f0\i0 \'a0and tells Lovett of her experiences aboard\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 .\
In 1912\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Southampton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Southampton}}, 17-year-old first-class passenger Rose DeWitt Bukater, her fianc\'e9 Cal Hockley, and her mother Ruth board the luxurious\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 . Ruth emphasizes that Rose's marriage will resolve their family's financial problems and retain their high-class persona. Distraught over the engagement, Rose considers suicide by jumping from the stern; Jack Dawson, a penniless artist, intervenes and discourages her. Discovered with Jack, Rose tells a concerned Cal that she was peering over the edge and Jack saved her from falling. When Cal becomes indifferent, she suggests to him that Jack deserves a reward. He invites Jack to dine with them in first class the following night. Jack and Rose develop a tentative friendship, despite Cal and Ruth being wary of him. Following dinner, Rose secretly joins Jack at a party in third class.\
Aware of Cal and Ruth's disapproval, Rose rebuffs Jack's advances, but realizes she prefers him over Cal. After rendezvousing on the bow at sunset, Rose takes Jack to her state room; at her request, Jack sketches Rose posing nude wearing Cal's engagement present, the Heart of the Ocean necklace. They evade Cal's bodyguard, Mr. Lovejoy, and have sex in an automobile inside the cargo hold. On the forward deck, they witness a collision with an iceberg and overhear the officers and designer discussing its seriousness.\
Cal discovers Jack's sketch of Rose and an insulting note from her in his safe along with the necklace. When Jack and Rose attempt to inform Cal of the collision, Lovejoy slips the necklace into Jack's pocket and he and Cal accuse him of theft. Jack is arrested, taken to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Master-at-arms"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 master-at-arms}}' office, and handcuffed to a pipe. Cal puts the necklace in his own coat pocket.\
With the ship sinking, Rose flees Cal and her mother, who has boarded a lifeboat, and frees Jack. On the boat deck, Cal and Jack encourage her to board a lifeboat; Cal claims he can get himself and Jack off safely. After Rose boards one, Cal tells Jack the arrangement is only for himself. As her boat lowers, Rose decides that she cannot leave Jack and jumps back on board. Cal takes his bodyguard's pistol and chases Rose and Jack into the flooding first-class dining saloon. After using up his ammunition, Cal realizes he gave his coat and consequently the necklace to Rose. He later boards a collapsible lifeboat by carrying a lost child.\
After braving several obstacles, Jack and Rose return to the boat deck. The lifeboats have departed and passengers are falling to their deaths as the stern rises out of the water. The ship breaks in half, lifting the stern into the air. Jack and Rose ride it into the ocean and he helps her onto a wooden panel buoyant enough for only one person. He assures her that she will die an old woman, warm in her bed. Jack dies of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hypothermia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hypothermia}}
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but Rose is saved.\
With Rose hiding from Cal en route, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/RMS_Carpathia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 RMS\'a0
\f1\i Carpathia}}\'a0takes the survivors to New York City where Rose gives her name as Rose Dawson. Rose says she later read that Cal committed suicide after losing all his money in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wall_Street_Crash_of_1929"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wall Street Crash of 1929}}.\
Back in the present, Lovett decides to abandon his search after hearing Rose's story. Alone on the stern of\'a0
\f1\i Keldysh
\f0\i0 , Rose takes out the Heart of the Ocean\'a0\'96 in her possession all along\'a0\'96 and drops it into the sea over the wreck site. While she is seemingly asleep or has died in her bed,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0photos on her dresser depict a life of freedom and adventure inspired by the life she wanted to live with Jack. A young Rose reunites with Jack at the\'a0
\f1\i Titanic
\f0\i0 's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grand_Staircase_of_the_RMS_Titanic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grand Staircase}}, applauded by those who died on the ship.\
In 2154, humans have depleted\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Earth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Earth}}'s natural resources, leading to a severe energy crisis. The Resources Development Administration (RDA for short) mines for a valuable mineral \'97\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unobtainium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 unobtanium}}\'a0\'97 on Pandora, a densely forested\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Habitable_moon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 habitable moon}}\'a0orbiting the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gas_giant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gas giant}}\'a0Polyphemus in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alpha_Centauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alpha Centauri}}\'a0star system.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Pandora, whose atmosphere is poisonous to humans, is inhabited by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Na%CA%BCvi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Na'vi}}, a species of 10-foot tall (3.0\'a0m), blue-skinned,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wisdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sapient}}\'a0humanoids
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0that live in harmony with nature and worship a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mother_goddess"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mother goddess}}\'a0named Eywa.\
To explore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandora's biosphere}}, scientists use Na'vi-human hybrids called "avatars", operated by genetically matched humans; Jake Sully, a paraplegic former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Marine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marine}}, replaces his deceased identical twin brother as an operator of one. Dr. Grace Augustine, head of the Avatar Program, considers Sully an inadequate replacement but accepts his assignment as a bodyguard. While protecting the avatars of Grace and fellow scientist Dr. Norm Spellman as they collect biological data, Jake's avatar is attacked by a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pandoran_biosphere#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 thanator}}\'a0and flees into the forest, where he is rescued by Neytiri, a female Na'vi. Witnessing an auspicious sign, she takes him to her clan, whereupon Neytiri's mother Mo'at, the clan's spiritual leader, orders her daughter to initiate Jake into their society.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Colonel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Colonel}}\'a0Miles Quaritch, head of RDA's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Private_military_company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 private security force}}, promises Jake that the company will restore his legs if he gathers information about the Na'vi and the clan's gathering place, a giant tree called Hometree,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 which stands above the richest deposit of unobtanium in the area. When Grace learns of this, she transfers herself, Jake, and Norm to an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/outpost"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 outpost}}. Over the following three months, Jake grows to sympathize with the natives. After Jake is initiated into the tribe, he and Neytiri choose each other as mates, and soon afterward, Jake reveals his change of allegiance when he attempts to disable a bulldozer that threatens to destroy a sacred Na'vi site. When Quaritch shows a video recording of Jake's attack on the bulldozer to Administrator Parker Selfridge,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [37]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and another in which Jake admits that the Na'vi will never abandon Hometree, Selfridge orders Hometree destroyed.\
Despite Grace's argument that destroying Hometree could damage the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Biological_neural_network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 biological neural network}}\'a0native to Pandora, Selfridge gives Jake and Grace one hour to convince the Na'vi to evacuate before commencing the attack. While trying to warn the Na'vi, Jake confesses to being a spy, and the Na'vi take him and Grace captive. Seeing this, Quaritch's men destroy Hometree, killing Neytiri's father (the clan chief) and many others. Mo'at frees Jake and Grace, but they are detached from their avatars and imprisoned by Quaritch's forces. Pilot Trudy Chac\'f3n, disgusted by Quaritch's brutality, frees Jake and Grace and airlifts them to Grace's outpost, but during the escape Quaritch fires at them, hitting Grace.\
To regain the Na'vi's trust, Jake connects his mind to that of Toruk, a dragon-like predator feared and honored by the Na'vi. Jake finds the refugees at the sacred\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fictional_universe_in_Avatar#The_Tree_of_Souls"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tree of Souls}}\'a0and pleads with Mo'at to heal Grace. The clan attempts to transfer Grace from her human body into her avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls, but she dies before the process can be completed. Supported by the new chief Tsu'tey, Jake speaks to unite the clan and tells them to gather all of the clans to battle against the RDA. Noticing the impending gathering, Quaritch organizes a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Preemptive_war"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 pre-emptive strike}}\'a0against the Tree of Souls, believing that its destruction will demoralize the natives. On the eve of battle, Jake prays to Eywa, via a neural connection with the Tree of Souls, to intercede on behalf of the Na'vi.\
During the subsequent battle, the Na'vi suffer heavy casualties, including Tsu'tey and Trudy; but are rescued when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Characters_and_wildlife_in_Avatar#Fauna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pandoran wildlife}}\'a0unexpectedly join the attack and overwhelm the humans, which Neytiri interprets as Eywa's answer to Jake's prayer. Jake destroys a makeshift bomber before it can reach the Tree of Souls; Quaritch, wearing an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mecha"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 AMP suit}}, escapes from his own damaged aircraft and breaks open the avatar link unit containing Jake's human body, exposing it to Pandora's poisonous atmosphere. Quaritch prepares to slit the throat of Jake's avatar, but Neytiri kills Quaritch and saves Jake from suffocation.\
With the exceptions of Jake, Norm and a select few others, all humans are expelled from Pandora and sent back to Earth, after which Jake is permanently transferred into his avatar with the aid of the Tree of Souls.\
In 1954 the American\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CBS"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CBS}}\'a0television network paid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ian_Fleming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ian Fleming}}\'a0$1,000
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0($9,330 in 2018 dollars
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 ) for the rights to turn his first novel,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Casino_Royale_(novel)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Casino Royale}}, into a one-hour television adventure
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0as part of the dramatic anthology series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Climax!"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Climax Mystery Theater}}, which ran between October 1954 and June 1958.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0It was adapted for the screen by Anthony Ellis and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charles_Bennett_(screenwriter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charles Bennett}}; Bennett was well known for his collaborations with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alfred_Hitchcock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alfred Hitchcock}}, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_39_Steps_(1935_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The 39 Steps}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sabotage_(1936_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sabotage}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Due to the restriction of a one-hour play, the adapted version lost many of the details found in the book, although it retained its violence, particularly in Act III.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The hour-long "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Casino_Royale_(Climax!)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Casino Royale}}" episode, which starred American actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Barry_Nelson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Barry Nelson}}\'a0as Bond and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Lorre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Lorre}}\'a0as the villain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Le_Chiffre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Le Chiffre}}, aired on 21 October 1954 as a live production.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise depicts the adventures of characters "A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Many species of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_creatures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 aliens}}\'a0(often\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Humanoid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 humanoid}}) co-exist with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(robot)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 droids}}\'a0who may assist them in their daily routines, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spaceflight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space travel}}\'a0between planets is common due to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace#Star_Wars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperspace}}\'a0technology.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5][6][7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The rises and falls of different governments are chronicled throughout the saga: the democratic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Republic}}\'a0is corrupted and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coup_d%27%C3%A9tat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 overthrown}}\'a0by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which is fought by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}. The Rebellion later gives rise to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}\'a0and rebuilds society,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but the remnants of the Empire reform as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0and attempt to destroy the Republic.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Heroes of the former rebellion lead the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Resistance_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Resistance}}\'a0against the oppressive dictatorship.\
A mystical power known as "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}" is described in the original film as "an energy field created by all living things ... [that] binds the galaxy together."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Those whom "the Force is strong with" have quick reflexes; through training and meditation, they are able to perform various\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Superpower_(ability)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 superpowers}}\'a0(such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychokinesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telekinesis}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Precognition"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 precognition}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Telepathy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telepathy}}, and manipulation of physical energy).
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The Force is wielded by two major\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Military_order_(religious_society)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 knighthood orders}}\'a0at conflict with each other: the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi}}, who act on the light side of the Force through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Detachment_(philosophy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 non-attachment}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arbitration"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 arbitration}}, and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sith}}, who use the dark side through fear and aggression. The latter's members are intended to be limited to two: a master and their apprentice.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The first film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raiders_of_the_Lost_Ark"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raiders of the Lost Ark}}\'a0(1981) is set in 1936.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harrison_Ford"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harrison Ford}}) is hired by government agents to locate the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ark_of_the_Covenant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ark of the Covenant}}\'a0before the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nazis}}. The Nazis have\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ahnenerbe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 teams searching for religious artifacts}}, including the Ark, which is rumored to make an army that carries the Ark before it invincible.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The Nazis are being helped by Indiana's nemesis Ren\'e9 Belloq ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paul_Freeman_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paul Freeman}}). With the help of his old flame\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marion_Ravenwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marion Ravenwood}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Karen_Allen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Karen Allen}}) and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sallah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sallah}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Rhys-Davies"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Rhys-Davies}}), Indiana manages to recover the Ark in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Egypt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Egypt}}. The Nazis steal the Ark and capture Indiana and Marion. Belloq and the Nazis perform a ceremony to open the Ark, but when they do so, they are all killed gruesomely by the Ark's wrath. Indiana and Marion, who survived by closing their eyes, manage to get the Ark to the United States, where it is stored in a secret government warehouse.\
The second film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones_and_the_Temple_of_Doom"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom}}\'a0(1984) is set in 1935, a year before\'a0
\f1\i Raiders of the Lost Ark
\f0\i0 . Indiana escapes Chinese gangsters with the help of singer/actress Willie Scott ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kate_Capshaw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kate Capshaw}}) and his twelve-year-old sidekick\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Short_Round"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Short Round}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jonathan_Ke_Quan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jonathan Ke Quan}}). The trio crash-land in India, where they come across a village whose children have been kidnapped.
