The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thuggee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thuggee}}\'a0led by Mola Ram ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amrish_Puri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amrish Puri}}) has also taken the holy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sankara_Stones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sankara Stones}}, which they will use to take over the world. Indiana manages to overcome Mola Ram's evil power, rescues the children and returns the stones to their rightful place, overcoming his own mercenary nature. The film has been noted as an outlier in the franchise, as it does not feature Indy's university or any antagonistic political entity, and is less focused on archaeology, being presented as a dark movie with gross-out elements,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Human_sacrifice"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 human sacrifice}}\'a0and torture.\
The third film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones_and_the_Last_Crusade"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade}}\'a0(1989) opens in 1912 with a thirteen-year-old Indiana ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/River_Phoenix"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 River Phoenix}}) attempting to recover an ornamental cross belonging to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Francisco_V%C3%A1squez_de_Coronado"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Francisco V\'e1squez de Coronado}}, a task which he finally completes in 1938. Indiana and his friend Marcus Brody ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Denholm_Elliott"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Denholm Elliott}}) are assigned by American businessman Walter Donovan ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Julian_Glover"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Julian Glover}}) to find the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holy_Grail"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Holy Grail}}. They are teamed up with Dr. Elsa Schneider ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alison_Doody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alison Doody}}), following on from where Indiana's estranged father Henry ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sean_Connery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sean Connery}}) left off before he disappeared. It transpires that Donovan and Elsa are in league with the Nazis, who captured Henry Jones in order to get Indiana to help them find the Grail. However, Indiana recovers his father's diary filled with his research, and manages to rescue him before finding the location of the Grail. Both Donovan and Elsa fall to the temptation of the Grail, while Indiana and Henry realize that their relationship with each other is more important than finding the relic.\
The fourth film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones_and_the_Kingdom_of_the_Crystal_Skull"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull}}\'a0(2008) is set in 1957: nineteen years after\'a0
\f1\i The Last Crusade
\f0\i0 , thus acknowledging the real-life passing of years between films. Indiana is having a quiet life teaching before being thrust into a new adventure. He races against agents of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Soviet_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Soviet Union}}, led by Irina Spalko ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cate_Blanchett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cate Blanchett}}) for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crystal_skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crystal skull}}. His journey takes him across\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nevada"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nevada}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Connecticut"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Connecticut}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peru"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peru}}, and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amazon_rainforest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amazon rainforest}}\'a0in Brazil. Indiana is faced with betrayal by one of his best friends, Mac ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ray_Winstone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ray Winstone}}), is introduced to a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greaser_(subculture)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 greaser}}\'a0named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mutt_Williams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mutt Williams}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shia_LaBeouf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shia LaBeouf}}), who turns out to be his son (his real name revealed to be Henry Jones III), and is reunited with, and eventually marries, Marion Ravenwood, who was introduced in the first movie.\
During 1973,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Lucas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Lucas}}\'a0wrote\'a0
\f1\i The Adventures of Indiana Smith
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Like\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars}}, it was an opportunity to create a modern version of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Movie_serial"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 movie serials}}\'a0of the 1930s and 1940s.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Lucas discussed the concept with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Philip_Kaufman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Philip Kaufman}}, who worked with him for several weeks and decided upon the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ark_of_the_Covenant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ark of the Covenant}}\'a0as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Plot_device#The_MacGuffin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MacGuffin}}. The project was stalled when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clint_Eastwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Eastwood}}\'a0hired Kaufman to write\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Outlaw_Josey_Wales"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Outlaw Josey Wales}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In May 1977, Lucas was in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maui"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maui}}, trying to escape the enormous success of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars}}. His friend and colleague\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steven_Spielberg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steven Spielberg}}\'a0was also there, on vacation from work on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Close_Encounters_of_the_Third_Kind"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Close Encounters of the Third Kind}}. Spielberg told Lucas he was interested in making a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Bond_(film_series)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Bond film}}, but Lucas told him of an idea "better than James Bond", outlining the plot of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raiders_of_the_Lost_Ark"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raiders of the Lost Ark}}. Spielberg loved it, calling it "a James Bond film without the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_James_Bond_gadgets"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hardware}}",
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0though he had the character's surname changed to Jones.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Spielberg and Lucas made a deal with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paramount_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paramount Pictures}}\'a0for five Indiana Jones films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Spielberg and Lucas aimed to make\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones_and_the_Temple_of_Doom"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom}}\'a0much darker, because of their personal moods following their respective break-ups and divorces. Lucas made the film a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prequel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 prequel}}\'a0as he did not want the Nazis to be the villains again. He had ideas regarding the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Monkey_King"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Monkey King}}\'a0and a haunted castle, but eventually created the Sankara Stones.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Willard_Huyck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Willard Huyck}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gloria_Katz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gloria Katz}}\'a0to write the script as he knew of their interest in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Culture_of_India"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indian culture}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The major scenes that were dropped from\'a0
\f1\i Raiders of the Lost Ark
\f0\i0 \'a0were included in this film: an escape using a giant rolling gong as a shield, a fall out of a plane in a raft, and a mine cart chase.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0For the third film, Spielberg revisited the Monkey King and haunted castle concepts, before Lucas suggested the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Holy_Grail"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Holy Grail}}. Spielberg had previously rejected this as too ethereal, but then devised a father-son story and decided that "The Grail that everybody seeks could be a metaphor for a son seeking reconciliation with a father and a father seeking reconciliation with a son."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Following the 1989 release of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indiana_Jones_and_the_Last_Crusade"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade}}, Lucas let the series end as he felt he could not think of a good plot device to drive the next installment, and chose instead to produce\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Young_Indiana_Jones_Chronicles"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles}}, which explored the character in his early years. Ford played Indiana in one episode, narrating his adventures in 1920\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chicago"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chicago}}. When Lucas shot Ford's role in December 1992, he realized that the scene opened up the possibility of a film with an older Indiana set in the 1950s. The film could reflect a science fiction\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/B_movies_(Transition_in_the_1950s)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 1950s B-movie}}, with aliens as the plot device.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Ford disliked the new angle, telling Lucas: "No way am I being in a Steve Spielberg movie like that."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Spielberg himself, who depicted aliens in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Close_Encounters_of_the_Third_Kind"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Close Encounters of the Third Kind}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/E.T._the_Extra-Terrestrial"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial}}, resisted it. Lucas devised a story, which Jeb Stuart turned into a script from October 1993 to May 1994.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Lucas wanted Indiana to get married, which would allow\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Henry_Jones_Sr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry Jones Sr.}}\'a0to return, expressing concern over whether his son is happy with what he has accomplished. After learning that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joseph_Stalin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joseph Stalin}}\'a0was interested in psychic warfare, Lucas decided to have Russians as the villains and the aliens to have psychic powers.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Following Stuart's next draft, Lucas hired\'a0
\f1\i Last Crusade
\f0\i0 \'a0writer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeffrey_Boam"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeffrey Boam}}\'a0to write the next three versions, the last of which was completed in March 1996. Three months later,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Independence_Day_(1996_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Independence Day}}\'a0was released, and Spielberg told Lucas he would not make another alien invasion film (or at least not until\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_of_the_Worlds_(2005_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 War of the Worlds}}\'a0in 2005). Lucas decided to focus on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_prequels"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0prequels}}\'a0instead.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 2000, Spielberg's son asked when the next\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0film would be released, which made him interested in reviving the project.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The same year, Ford, Lucas, Spielberg,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Marshall_(producer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Marshall}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kathleen_Kennedy_(producer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kathleen Kennedy}}\'a0met during the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Film_Institute"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 American Film Institute}}'s tribute to Ford, and decided they wanted to enjoy the experience of making an Indiana Jones film again. Spielberg also found returning to the series a respite from his many dark films during this period.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [15]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Spielberg and Lucas discussed the central idea of a B-movie involving aliens, and Lucas suggested using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crystal_skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crystal skulls}}\'a0to ground the idea. Lucas found these artifacts as fascinating as the Ark,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and had intended to feature them for a\'a0
\f1\i Young Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0episode before the show's cancellation.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/M._Night_Shyamalan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M. Night Shyamalan}}\'a0was hired to write for an intended 2002 shoot,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but he was overwhelmed by the task, and claimed it was difficult to get Ford, Spielberg, and Lucas to focus.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Gaghan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Gaghan}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Stoppard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Stoppard}}\'a0were also approached.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Darabont"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Darabont}}, who wrote various\'a0
\f1\i Young Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0episodes, was hired to write in May 2002.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0His script, titled\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones and the City of Gods
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0was set in the 1950s, with ex-Nazis pursuing Jones.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [19]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 Spielberg conceived the idea because of real-life figures such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Juan_Per%C3%B3n"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Juan Per\'f3n}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Argentina"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Argentina}}, who allegedly protected Nazi war criminals.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Darabont claimed Spielberg loved the script, but Lucas had issues with it, and decided to take over writing himself.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Lucas and Spielberg acknowledged that the 1950s setting could not ignore the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cold_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cold War}}, and the Russians were more plausible villains. Spielberg decided he could not satirize the Nazis after directing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Schindler%27s_List"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Schindler's List}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [20]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0while Ford felt "We plum[b] wore the Nazis out."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Darabont's main contribution was reintroducing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marion_Ravenwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marion Ravenwood}}\'a0as Indiana's love interest, but he gave them a 13-year-old daughter, which Spielberg decided was too similar to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Lost_World:_Jurassic_Park"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Lost World: Jurassic Park}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeff_Nathanson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeff Nathanson}}\'a0met with Spielberg and Lucas in August 2004, and turned in the next drafts in October and November 2005, titled\'a0
\f1\i The Atomic Ants
\f0\i0 .\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/David_Koepp"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 David Koepp}}\'a0continued on from there, giving his script the subtitle\'a0
\f1\i Destroyer of Worlds
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0based on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Oppenheimer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Oppenheimer}}\'a0quote. It was changed to\'a0
\f1\i Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
\f0\i0 , as Spielberg found this a more inviting title which actually named the plot device.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [21]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Koepp wanted to depict the character of Mutt as a nerd, but Lucas refused, explaining he had to resemble\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marlon_Brando"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marlon Brando}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Wild_One"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Wild One}}; "he needs to be what Indiana Jones' father thought of [him]\'a0\'96 the curse returns in the form of his own son\'a0\'96 he's everything a father can't stand".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Koepp collaborated with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lawrence_Kasdan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lawrence Kasdan}}\'a0on the film's "love dialogue".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [22]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The introduction of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mutt_Williams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mutt Williams}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shia_LaBeouf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shia LaBeouf}}) in\'a0
\f1\i Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
\f0\i0 \'a0led to speculation that LaBeouf will take over the franchise from Ford.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In an interview with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/IGN"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 IGN}}, "Spielberg indicated that LaBeouf has to make multiple\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Transformers}}\'a0movies before he can move over and take on the fedora and bullwhip of Indiana Jones."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [24]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The actor himself said, "Am I into it? Who wouldn't be? I don't think that's reality. It's a fun rumor."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [25]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Ford said he would return for a fifth film if it does not take another twenty years to develop,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0while Spielberg responded it would happen "only if you [the audience] want more".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In an interview with\'a0
\f1\i Time
\f0\i0 , when asked about passing the fedora to LaBeouf in the next film, Ford said, "What are you talking about? It's mine. I would love to do another Indiana Jones movie. George Lucas is working on an idea now. Shia can get his own hat. I earned that hat."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
At the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/2008_Cannes_Film_Festival"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 2008 Cannes Film Festival}}, Lucas made a further suggestion that there would be a fifth film, revealing an idea "to make Shia LaBeouf the lead character next time and have Harrison Ford come back like\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sean_Connery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sean Connery}}\'a0did in the last movie." At the time\'a0
\f1\i Last Crusade
\f0\i0 \'a0was filmed, Connery was only 58 years old. Lucas also said that age need not be a factor, as Ford was "65 and did everything in this movie. The old chemistry is there, and it's not like he's an old man. He's incredibly agile; he looks even better than he did 20 years ago, if you ask me."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In August 2008, Lucas was researching potential plot devices, and stated Spielberg was open to the idea of the fifth film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He also changed his mind about continuing the series with a spin-off, joking "Indiana Jones is Indiana Jones. Harrison Ford is Indiana Jones. If it was Mutt Williams it would be\'a0
\f1\i Mutt Williams and the Search for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elvis_Presley"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elvis}}
\f0\i0 \'a0or something."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Two months later, Ford stated that he would not return if the fifth film was an animated film like\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Clone_Wars_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Clone Wars}}, because "I'd hate to see it reduced in any way from the movies that we have done and the way we have done them." He also called Lucas' concept for the fifth film "crazy but great".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
When asked how being married to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marion_Ravenwood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marion Ravenwood}}\'a0and having a son would affect the character in a fifth film, Ford only replied: "He's seen something. Remember those are the only witnesses to what he's seen. That's kind of interesting."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In January 2010, Ford said, "I think it would be interesting to advance the understanding of the character, as we always have had that ambition throughout the series. I think it would be interesting to deepen the relationship between he and his son and play on that relationship... It's full of opportunity. The series is full of opportunity."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [34]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The possibility of\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones 5
\f0\i0 \'a0continued to be discussed through 2009 and 2010. Reports speculated in June 2009 that the next installment would start filming in 2011 with a plot involving the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bermuda_Triangle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bermuda Triangle}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 although these rumors were later described as "completely false" by Frank Marshall on his Twitter page.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Speaking to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BBC"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BBC}}\'a0journalist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lizo_Mzimba"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lizo Mzimba}}\'a0in June 2009, LaBeouf confirmed that "Steven [Spielberg] just said that he cracked the story on it [the fifth film], I think they're gearing that up."

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [38]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In November 2010, Ford said that he and Spielberg were waiting for Lucas to present an idea to them.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [39]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In March 2011, the Deadbolt website interviewed Karen Allen and asked her about the fifth film's status. "What I know is that there's a story that they like", said Allen, "which is a huge step forward. I heard this about six months ago, that they have a story that they like and they're working on it."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In July 2012,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Marshall_(producer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Marshall}}\'a0indicated that the film was unlikely to be announced in the near future, saying: "I don't know if it's definitely not happening, but it's not up and running... It's not on until there is a writer on the project. There is no writer on Indy."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In October 2012,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Walt_Disney_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Walt Disney Company}}\'a0acquired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lucasfilm"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lucasfilm}}, thereby granting Disney ownership rights to the\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intellectual_property"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intellectual property}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42][43]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0However,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paramount_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paramount Pictures}}\'a0continued to own\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Film_distribution"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 distribution rights}}\'a0for the film series.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [44][45]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0On December 6, 2013,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Walt_Disney_Studios_(division)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Walt Disney Studios}}\'a0purchased the remaining distribution and marketing rights to future\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0films, while Paramount will retain the distribution rights to the first four films, and will receive "financial participation" from any additional films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [46][47][48]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Although a new film installment was not announced with the deal, Disney CEO\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bob_Iger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bob Iger}}\'a0has expressed an interest in monetizing the franchise across Disney's various company divisions.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [49]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Studio chairman\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alan_F._Horn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alan Horn}}\'a0has said that a fifth\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0film would not be ready for at least two to three years.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [50]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In a May 2015 interview with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vanity_Fair_(magazine)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vanity Fair}}, Kathleen Kennedy confirmed plans for a fifth film, stating another film "will one day be made inside this company. When it will happen, I'm not quite sure. We haven't started working on a script yet, but we are talking about it."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [51]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In October 2015, Spielberg told\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yahoo!_Movies"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yahoo! Movies}}\'a0Ford will likely reprise his role in the fifth\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [52]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
On March 15, 2016, Walt Disney Studios announced that the fifth film would be released on July 19, 2019, with Ford reprising his role, Spielberg directing, Koepp writing and Kennedy and Marshall acting as producers. George Lucas was initially not going to be involved with the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [53][54]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0However, during a press event for Disney's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_BFG_(2016_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The BFG}}, Spielberg confirmed that Lucas will be returning as executive producer, stating "I would never make an\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0film without George Lucas. That'd be insane."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [55]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marshall has stated that the film would be a continuation of the events following\'a0
\f1\i Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [56]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0On June 9, 2016, Spielberg confirmed that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Williams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Williams}}\'a0will be returning to compose the score.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [57]
