\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [59]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0On September 4, 2017, Koepp revealed that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mutt_Williams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mutt Williams}}\'a0character played by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shia_LaBeouf"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shia LaBeouf}}\'a0will not return in the movie.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [60]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Both Spielberg and Iger discussed the fifth film, with Spielberg stating that Indiana Jones would not be killed off. However, Iger said the future of the franchise with Ford is unknown, but that the fifth film "won\'92t be just a one-off.\'94
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [61]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
On January 19, 2018,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Deadline_Hollywood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Deadline Hollywood}}\'a0reported that Spielberg is eyeing the fifth\'a0
\f1\i Indiana Jones
\f0\i0 \'a0film as his next project following the release of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ready_Player_One_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ready Player One}}, which was released in March 2018.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [62]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0According to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Variety_(magazine)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Variety}}, the film will begin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Principal_photography"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 principal photography}}\'a0at the start of 2019.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [63]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0On March 19, 2018, it was confirmed by Spielberg that filming would begin in April 2019 in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Kingdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Kingdom}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [64]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In July 2018, Disney pushed the film's release date later to July 9, 2021.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) is a small-time boxer who seems to be going nowhere in life, as he works day-in and day-out as a collector for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loan_shark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 loan shark}}\'a0and fights in sleazy clubs for low pay rewards, for which Rocky is mocked and told that he's nothing but a 'bum,' especially by gym trainer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mickey_Goldmill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mickey Goldmill}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Burgess_Meredith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Burgess Meredith}}). At the same time, Rocky successfully courts Adrian Pennino ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Talia_Shire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Talia Shire}}), a painfully shy woman with an alcoholic brother, Paulie ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Burt_Young"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Burt Young}}). But when the world\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heavyweight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 heavyweight}}\'a0champion boxer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Apollo_Creed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Apollo Creed}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Carl_Weathers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Carl Weathers}}) chooses Rocky at random as his opponent in a title fight, Rocky realizes he now has the chance to prove that he's not worthless. With Adrian's support and Mickey becoming his trainer and manager, Rocky fights for his self-respect.\
Soon after proving himself, even with a split decision loss to Apollo Creed, Rocky expects the good life to follow. He marries Adrian and begins spending the money he earned from the match. But after he fails at both endorsements and a series of low wage jobs, Rocky realizes the only way he can survive is to begin boxing again. Creed on the other hand, faces criticism from fans to overcome the fight. As a result, he publicly taunts Rocky into a rematch, for which Rocky trains once again with Mickey. In the fifteenth round, Rocky knocks Creed to the ground, falling to the canvas himself in the process. Both fighters struggle to get to their feet, but only Rocky is successful. For the first time, Rocky is declared the World Heavyweight Champion; even Apollo shows respect for him as he regains his support from fans for doing a fair fight.\
After winning the heavyweight title, Rocky takes advantage of his newfound wealth and fame, appearing in multiple advertisements and television programs, and relishing his new celebrity status. After defending the title multiple times, he is prepared to retire, but the number one contender,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clubber_Lang"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James "Clubber" Lang}}\'a0(played by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mr._T"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mr. T}}), challenges Rocky publicly. Rocky, after dealing with Mickey's heart attack before the fight, is overpowered by the stronger, hungrier Lang and is knocked out in the second round. Mickey passes away after the fight, and former rival Apollo Creed steps in, training Rocky to fight in Creed's old style (in his old Los Angeles gym) and to use more guile and skill. In the rematch, Rocky outboxes Lang, tiring the stronger fighter out and eventually knocking him out in the third round. After the fight, Apollo calls in his "favor" for training Rocky, which is a one-on-one match between the two of them with no cameras, no media, just man vs. man in the gym. The film ends as they each throw their first punch.\
After winning back his title from Clubber Lang, Rocky continues to live the good life, now that he and Apollo are good friends. However, a new fighter from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Soviet_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USSR}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ivan_Drago"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ivan Drago}}\'a0(played by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dolph_Lundgren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dolph Lundgren}}), has emerged and challenges Rocky to an exhibition match. Apollo fights instead, and the beating he takes from Drago ends with Apollo dying in Rocky's arms in the ring as Drago coldly watches. To avenge Apollo, Rocky challenges Drago to a match, which is to be held on Christmas Day in Moscow. In a montage replete with symbolism, Rocky is shown training in a remote cabin in Siberia with the help of Creed's old trainer Duke, his brother-in-law Paulie, and eventually Adrian, doing exercises such as chopping wood, lifting rocks, running in the snow and climbing a mountain, while Drago is seen in an advanced training facility running on treadmills, utilizing weightlifting machines and injecting steroids to boost his strength. During the fight, Rocky takes the worst beating of his life but refuses to fall. He eventually wins over the foreign crowd with his display of courage and determination, and he knocks Drago out with seconds left in the final round.\
In the aftermath of his fight with Ivan Drago, Rocky Balboa is diagnosed with brain damage and is forced to retire from the ring. Additionally, the Balboa fortune is all gone due to an unscrupulous accountant. Rocky's family returns to their old neighborhood and Adrian returns to the pet store she used to work at, while (in a subplot) Rocky (Robert) Jr. (played by Sylvester Stallone's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sage_Stallone"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 real son Sage}}) deals with bullying at his school and Rocky re-opens Mickey's old gym. While training other boxers, Rocky meets a young, hungry boxer named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tommy_Gunn_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tommy Gunn}}\'a0(played by real-life fighter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tommy_Morrison"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tommy Morrison}}) and begins training him which results in a strained relationship with Robert. Unfortunately, as Tommy begins his rise to fame under Rocky's wing, a sleazy fight promoter named George Washington Duke convinces Tommy that Rocky is holding him back and Tommy leaves Rocky for Duke. After Tommy wins the heavyweight title, he makes a short speech thanking Duke, and is met with jeers and the familiar chant of "Rocky" from the crowd. Seething from this insult, as well as being called by publicists as "Rocky's robot" and being told that he's "no Rocky Balboa," Tommy decides to seek out his former mentor for a final showdown. Rocky starts to walk away from the public challenge, but Paulie decides to let Tommy have a piece of his mind about how Tommy has treated Rocky, and Tommy proceeds to punch Paulie. Rocky then challenges Tommy outside and the two proceed in a violent bare-knuckle street brawl, which Rocky wins. Rocky then proceeds to punch Duke for harassing him. In the end, Rocky and Robert reconcile as they run up the steps as father and son.\
In\'a0
\f1\i Rocky Balboa
\f0\i0 , sixteen years have passed since his final fight with his former prot\'e9g\'e9, Tommy "The Machine" Gunn. Long retired, Rocky Balboa still staggers around an ever-changing world; his son is grown and distant, Paulie is working back at the meat plant, and Rocky's wife Adrian has died. Rocky has opened a restaurant named after his wife, which he stocks with mementos of his prime as he tells his old fight stories to customers. But when a computer simulated fight on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ESPN"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ESPN}}\'a0depicting a bout between a young Rocky Balboa and the current champion,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mason_Dixon_(Rocky_Balboa_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mason Dixon}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Antonio_Tarver"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Antonio Tarver}}) reignites interest in the faded boxer, Rocky discovers he has not lost his fighting spirit and considers an opportunity to prove himself in the ring again. Rocky almost wins the fight but loses in a split decision just like the first film (in an alternate ending Rocky won). Rocky is last seen visiting his wife's grave saying, "Yo Adrian, we did it."\
Adonis "Donnie" Johnson ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Michael_B._Jordan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Michael B. Jordan}}), the illegitimate son of the late former heavyweight champion Apollo Creed, tracks down Rocky Balboa at Adrian's and asks Rocky to become his trainer. Rocky is reluctant, but eventually agrees. When word gets out that Donnie is Creed's illegitimate son, the handlers of world light heavyweight champion "Pretty" Ricky Conlan, who is forced into retirement by an impending prison term, offer to make Donnie the latter's final challenger\'97provided that he change his name to Adonis Creed. Donnie balks at first, wanting to forge his own legacy. However, he eventually agrees. While helping Donnie train, Rocky learns he has\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Non-Hodgkin%27s_lymphoma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 non-Hodgkin's lymphoma}}. He is initially unwilling to undergo\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chemotherapy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 chemotherapy}}\'a0because it wasn't enough to save Adrian from ovarian cancer. Donnie persuades Rocky to seek treatment and continues training while Rocky recovers. In a battle reminiscent of Apollo and Rocky's first fight, Donnie fights Conlan in Conlan's hometown of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Liverpool"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Liverpool}}\'a0and surprises almost everyone by going the distance and pushing Conlan to his limit. Conlan wins by split decision, but Donnie wins the respect of Conlan and the crowd, with Conlan calling Donnie the future of the light heavyweight division. Returning to Philadelphia, Donnie and a recovering Rocky both make their way up\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocky_Steps"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Philadelphia Museum steps}}\'a0and look at the skyline.\
Three years after losing the fight to "Pretty" Ricky Conlan, Adonis Johnson Creed wins the World Heavyweight Championship and proposes to his girlfriend, Bianca Taylor ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tessa_Thompson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tessa Thompson}}). Meanwhile, three decades since the death of Apollo Creed and his loss to Rocky Balboa, Ivan Drago is training his son, Viktor Drago (Florian Munteanu), to reclaim their honor by having Viktor publicly challenge Adonis for the World Heavyweight Title. Rocky is reluctant to train Adonis, fearing Adonis will meet the same fate as his father, but Adonis accepts the challenge without him and is badly injured during the fight. Because of Viktor's disqualification, Adonis retains the title. Viktor demands a rematch, while he is being promoted by his father's supporters who originally abandoned Drago, including Drago's ex-wife, Ludmilla ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Brigette_Nielsen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brigette Nielsen}}). Viktor is subjected to vicious training sessions in preparation for the rematch. Rocky comes to Adonis' aid and decides to train him in the Southern California desert, with a different tactic for Adonis to take in Viktor's powerful punches. The rematch is set in Moscow, and Adonis is able to take Viktor's powerful punches, while leaving Viktor exhausted. Viktor's supporters and his mother leave during the fight with doubt that Viktor will win. Drago seeing his son taking Adonis\'92 punches without fighting back, throws in the towel and assures his son that he is more important to him and that he will not abandon him like he was. While Rocky later reunites with his son, Robert ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Milo_Ventimiglia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Milo Ventimiglia}}) and meets his grandson, Adonis brings Bianca and their newborn baby girl to his late father's grave, making peace with his late father and honoring his legacy.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f2\b \cf2 International Genetic Technologies, Inc.
\f0\b0 \'a0(
\f2\b InGen
\f0\b0 ) is a fictional company based in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palo_Alto,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Palo Alto}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California}}\'a0and has one location in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Europe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Europe}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [nb 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Nevertheless, most of InGen's research took place on the fictional islands of Isla Sorna and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isla_Nublar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isla Nublar}}, near Costa Rica.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [nb 1][nb 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0While the first novel indicated InGen was just one of any number of small 1980s genetic engineering start-ups, the events of the novel and film revealed to a select group that InGen had discovered a method of cloning\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dinosaur"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dinosaurs}}\'a0and other animals (including a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quagga"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quagga}}) using blood extracted from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mosquito"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mosquitoes}}\'a0trapped in amber during various periods in time, ranging from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mesozoic_era"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mesozoic era}}\'a0to the 1800s.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [nb 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0
\f1\i Beacham's Encyclopedia of Popular Fiction
\f0\i0 \'a0describes InGen as comparable to another "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Evil_corporation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sleazy organization}}".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Other sources reference the company's receiving the baby\'a0
\f1\i T. rex
\f0\i0 \'a0as an allusion to other exploitative entrepreneurs depicted in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/King_Kong_(1933_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Kong}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Ken Gelder describes InGen as "resolutely secretive, just like the firm in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Grisham"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grisham}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Firm_(novel)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 novel}}".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0creator Gene Roddenberry first suggested the idea of a\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0feature in 1969.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0When the original television series was canceled, he lobbied to continue the franchise through a film. The success of the series in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Broadcast_syndication"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 syndication}}\'a0convinced the studio to begin work on a feature film in 1975.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A series of writers attempted to craft a suitably epic screenplay, but the attempts did not satisfy Paramount, so the studio scrapped the project in 1977. Paramount instead planned on returning the franchise to its roots with a new television series,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_Phase_II"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek: Phase II}}. The massive worldwide box office success of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars}}\'a0in mid-1977 sent Hollywood studios to their vaults in search of similar sci-fi properties that could be adapted or re-launched to the big screen. When Columbia's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Close_Encounters_of_the_Third_Kind"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Close Encounters of the Third Kind}}\'a0had a huge opening in late December 1977, Paramount was convinced that science fiction films other than\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars}}\'a0could do well at the box office, and production of\'a0
\f1\i Phase II
\f0\i0 \'a0was cancelled in favor of making a\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0film.
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Principal_photography"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Principal photography}}\'a0for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_The_Motion_Picture"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek: The Motion Picture}}\'a0commenced August 7, 1978
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Wise"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Wise}}\'a0helming the feature. The production encountered difficulties and slipped behind schedule,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with effects team\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Abel_and_Associates"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Abel and Associates}}
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0proving unable to handle the film's large amount of effects work.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Douglas_Trumbull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Douglas Trumbull}}\'a0was hired and given a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blank_check"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blank check}}\'a0to complete the effects work in time and location;
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0the final cut of the film was completed just in time for the film's premiere. The film introduced an upgrade to the technology and starship designs, making for a dramatic visual departure from the original series. Many of the set elements created for\'a0
\f1\i Phase II
\f0\i0 \'a0were adapted and enhanced for use in the first feature films. It received mixed reviews from critics; while it grossed $139 million the price tag had climbed to about $35 million due to costly effects work and delays.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 The Motion Picture
\f0\i0 's gross was considered disappointing, but it was enough for Paramount to back a sequel with a reduced budget. After Roddenberry pitched a film in which the crew of the\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 \'a0goes back in time to ensure the assassination of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_F._Kennedy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John F. Kennedy}}, he was "kicked upstairs" to a ceremonial role while Paramount brought in television producer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harve_Bennett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harve Bennett}}\'a0to craft a better\'97and cheaper\'97film than the first.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0After watching all the television episodes, Bennett decided that the character of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Khan_Noonien_Singh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Khan Noonien Singh}}\'a0was the perfect villain for the new film. Director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nicholas_Meyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nicholas Meyer}}\'a0finished a complete screenplay in just twelve days, and did everything possible within budget to give\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_II:_The_Wrath_of_Khan"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Wrath of Khan}}\'a0a nautical, swashbuckling feel,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which he described as "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Horatio_Hornblower"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Horatio Hornblower}}\'a0in outer space."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Upon release, the reception of\'a0
\f1\i The Wrath of Khan
\f0\i0 \'a0was highly positive;
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Entertainment_Weekly"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Entertainment Weekly}}'s Mark Bernadin called\'a0
\f1\i The Wrath of Khan
\f0\i0 , "the film that, by most accounts, saved\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0as we know it".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Meyer declined to return for the next film, so directing duties were given to cast member\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leonard_Nimoy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leonard Nimoy}}\'a0for the third film. Paramount gave Bennett the green light to write\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_III:_The_Search_for_Spock"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek III}}\'a0the day after\'a0
\f1\i The Wrath of Khan
\f0\i0 opened.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The producer penned a resurrection story for Spock that built on threads from the previous film and the original series episode "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Amok_Time"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Amok Time}}".
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0Nimoy remained director for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_IV:_The_Voyage_Home"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the next film}}\'a0in the series. Nimoy and Bennett wanted a film with a lighter tone that did not have a classic antagonist. They decided on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Time_travel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 time travel}}\'a0story with the\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 \'a0crew returning to their past to retrieve something to save their present\'97eventually,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Humpback_whale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 humpback whales}}. After having been dissatisfied with the script written by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Daniel_Petrie_Jr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Daniel Petrie Jr.}}, Paramount hired Meyer to rewrite the screenplay with Bennett's help. Meyer drew upon his own time travel story\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Time_After_Time_(1979_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Time After Time}}\'a0for elements
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Avoid_weasel_words"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 which?}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0of the screenplay.
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0Star\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Shatner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Shatner}}\'a0was promised his turn as director for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_V:_The_Final_Frontier"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek V}}, and Nicholas Meyer returned as director/co-writer for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_VI:_The_Undiscovered_Country"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek VI}}.\
Both the sixth and seventh films acted as transitions between the films featuring the original cast and those with the\'a0
\f1\i Next Generation
\f0\i0 \'a0cast, with the sixth focusing on the original cast and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_Generations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the seventh}}\'a0focusing on the\'a0
\f1\i TNG
\f0\i0 cast. The\'a0
\f1\i Next Generation
\f0\i0 \'a0cast made four films over a period of eight years, with the last two performing only moderately well (
\f1\i Insurrection
\f0\i0 ) and disappointingly (
\f1\i Nemesis
\f0\i0 ) at the box office.\
After the poor reception of\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek: Nemesis
\f0\i0 \'a0and the cancellation of the television series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_Enterprise"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek: Enterprise}}, the franchise's executive producer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rick_Berman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rick Berman}}\'a0and screenwriter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Jendresen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Jendresen}}\'a0began developing a new film,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0entitled\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek: The Beginning
\f0\i0 , which would take place after\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 \'a0but before\'a0
\f1\i The Original Series
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J._J._Abrams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J. J. Abrams}}, the producer of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cloverfield"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cloverfield}}\'a0and creator of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lost_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lost}}, was a huge fan of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars}}\'a0as a child and confessed that the\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise felt "disconnected" for him.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [15]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In February 2007, Abrams accepted Paramount's offer to direct the new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek}}\'a0film, having been previously attached as producer.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roberto_Orci"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roberto Orci}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alex_Kurtzman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alex Kurtzman}}\'a0wrote a screenplay that impressed Abrams, featuring new actors portraying younger versions of the original series' cast. The\'a0
\f1\i Enterprise
\f0\i0 , its interior, and the original uniforms were redesigned. While the film was ready for a December 2008 release, Paramount chose to move the film's opening to May 8, 2009.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The film earned over $350 million worldwide (from a solid $75.2 million opening weekend, higher than\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_First_Contact"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek: First Contact}}\'a0(1996)), and surpassed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_IV:_The_Voyage_Home"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home}}\'a0as the highest-grossing film in the franchise. A sequel,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_Into_Darkness"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek Into Darkness}}, was greenlighted even before the first one opened, and Paramount released the film on May 17, 2013.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A third film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_Beyond"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek Beyond}}, was directed by Justin Lin and produced by Abrams. It was released on July 22, 2016, also to critical acclaim.\
This revival of the franchise is often considered to be, and referred to as, a "reboot", but it is technically a continuation of the franchise (Nimoy reprises his role of Spock from the previous films) that establishes an alternate reality from the previous films. This route was taken, over a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 traditional reboot}}, to free the new films from the restrictions of established continuity without completely discarding it, which the writers felt would have been "disrespectful". This new reality was informally referred to by several names, including the "Abramsverse", "JJ Trek" and "NuTrek", before it was named the "Kelvin Timeline" (versus the "Prime Timeline" of the original series and films) by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Michael_Okuda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Michael}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Denise_Okuda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Denise Okuda}}\'a0for use in official\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0reference guides and encyclopedias. The name Kelvin comes from the USS\'a0
\f1\i Kelvin
\f0\i0 , a starship involved in the event that creates the new reality in\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0(2009). Abrams named the starship after his grandfather Henry Kelvin, whom he also pays tribute to in\'a0
\f1\i Into Darkness
\f0\i0 \'a0with the Kelvin Memorial Archive.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [19][20]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Fans commonly considered the films to follow a "curse" that even-numbered films were better than the odd-numbered installments.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [21][22]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0This is partially borne out by review aggregator statistics. For example, prior to the release of the 13th film the odd-numbered entries averaged 57% on the review aggregation website\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rotten Tomatoes}}\'a0while the even-numbered entries averaged 79%.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0However, this perceived difference in quality is not reflected in box-office performance with the odd and even numbered entries having a virtually identical attendance in the United States and Canada on average.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [24]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The tenth film,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_Nemesis"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nemesis}}, was considered the even film that defied the curse.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [21][25][26]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Its failure and the subsequent success of\'a0
\f1\i Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0(2009) were considered to have broken the trend.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [27][28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The curse has been mentioned often in popular culture. One of the best known examples
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29][30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0occurred in a 1999 episode of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Channel_4"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Channel 4}}\'a0sitcom\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spaced"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spaced}}, where it was referenced by Tim Bisley, played by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Simon_Pegg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simon Pegg}}; Pegg, quite conscious of the irony,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0played\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scotty_(Star_Trek)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scotty}}\'a0in the eleventh and subsequent films.\
Crossovers often occur in an official capacity in order for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intellectual_property"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intellectual property}}\'a0rights holders to reap the financial reward of combining two or more popular, established properties. In other cases, the crossover can serve to introduce a new concept derivative of an older one.\
Crossovers generally occur between properties owned by a single holder, but they can, more rarely, involve properties from different holders, provided that the inherent legal obstacles can be overcome. They may also involve using characters that have passed into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Public_domain"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 public domain}}\'a0with those concurrently under\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Copyright"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 copyright protection}}.\
A crossover story may try to explain its own reason for the crossover, such as characters being neighbors (notable examples being the casts from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Golden_Girls"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Golden Girls}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Empty_Nest_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Empty Nest}}) or meeting via\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dimensional_rift"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dimensional rift}}\'a0or similar phenomenon (a common explanation for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Science_fiction"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 science fiction}}\'a0properties that have different owners). Some crossovers are not explained at all. Others are absurd or simply impossible within the fictional setting, and have to be ignored by the series' respective\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Continuity_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 continuities}}. Still others intentionally make the relations between two or more fictional universes confusing, as with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Simpsons"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Simpsons}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Futurama"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Futurama}}, where each show is fiction in the other.\
Crossovers of multiple characters owned by one company or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Publishing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 published}}\'a0by one\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Publisher"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 publisher}}, have been used to set an established continuity, where characters can frequently meet within one setting. This is especially true of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Comic_book_publisher"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 comic book publishers}}, as different characters in various\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marvel}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DC_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DC}}\'a0or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valiant_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Valiant}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Comic_book"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 comic books}}\'a0frequently interact with one another since they live in a "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shared_universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shared universe}}". For example, in the Marvel Comics universe,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spider-Man}}\'a0has frequent dealings with another Marvel hero,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Daredevil_(Marvel_Comics_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Daredevil}}, just as in the DC Comics Universe, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Flash_(Barry_Allen)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Flash}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Green_Lantern_(Hal_Jordan)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Green Lantern}}\'a0often collaborate. In comic book terminology, these "guest star" roles are common enough that they are generally not considered crossovers; rather, this short-term collaboration to fight crime is called a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Team-up"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 team-up}}. A crossover in comic book terms only occurs when a story spans more than one title.
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub This has led to "crossover events", in which major occurrences are shown as affecting most or all of the stories in the shared universe.\
The earliest such crossover event was\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gardner_Fox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gardner Fox}}'s\'a0
\f1\i Zatanna's Search
\f0\i0 , which took place in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkman"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hawkman}}\'a0#4 (October/November 1964),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Detective_Comics"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Detective Comics}}\'a0#336 (February 1965),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Atom"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Atom}}\'a0#19 (June/July 1965),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Green_Lantern"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Green Lantern}}#42 (January 1966),\'a0
\f1\i Detective Comics
\f0\i0 \'a0#355 (September 1966), and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justice_League_of_America"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Justice League of America}}\'a0#51 (February 1967). This story dealt with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zatanna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zatanna}}\'a0attempting to reconnect with her father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zatara"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zatara}}, and seeking the aid of Hawkman, Batman,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robin}}, the Atom, Green Lantern, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elongated_Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elongated Man}}\'a0along the way.\
The first major crossover event was spearheaded by the Marvel Editor-in-Chief at the time,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Shooter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Shooter}}. As a way to further toy sales he devised the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Secret_Wars"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Secret Wars}}\'a0crossover, which brought all the major Marvel heroes into a 12-issue miniseries to battle a common threat. After the threat was dealt with, they all returned to their regular titles.\'a0
\f1\i Secret Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0was hailed as both a critical and commercial success, largely because the events of the crossover had lasting effects on the characters (such as the introduction of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spider-Man}}'s black suit which would later become the villain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Venom_(Marvel_Comics_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Venom}}).\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Shooter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Shooter}}\'a0later perfected his crossover technique at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valiant_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Valiant Comics}}\'a0with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Unity_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Unity}}\'a0event.\'a0
\f1\i Unity
\f0\i0 \'a0brought all the Valiant characters together to defeat\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mothergod"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mothergod}}, but was told within the existing Valiant Comics titles (and two bookend special issues). Readers were not obliged to buy all 18 chapters as the story was coherent when reading just one title, but far more layered when all were read. Like\'a0
\f1\i Secret Wars
\f0\i0 , the\'a0
\f1\i Unity
\f0\i0 \'a0crossover had lasting effects on the Valiant universe; most notably the introduction of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Turok"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Turok}}, the birth of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magnus,_Robot_Fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Magnus, Robot Fighter}}\'a0and the death of a major Valiant hero.\

\f1\i Aliens Versus Predator
\f0\i0 \'a0comic book franchise was a success that continued into many video games, two movies and even an\'a0
\f1\i Aliens Versus Predator Versus The Terminator
\f0\i0 \'a0comic.\
The comic crossovers from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raj_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raj Comics}}\'a0are very famous in India, in which the super heroes meet to fight a common enemy. Many of these crossovers have occurred between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nagraj"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nagraj}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Super_Commando_Dhruva"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Super Commando Dhruva}}. In\'a0
\f1\i Kohram
\f0\i0 , all the heroes in Raj Universe meet to finish\'a0
\f1\i Haru
\f0\i0 , an extremely powerful enemy.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Webcomics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Webcomics}}\'a0creators sometimes produce crossovers; one of the first was a two-week sequence between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Christopher_Baldwin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Christopher Baldwin}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruno_(webcomic)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bruno}}\'a0and Peter Zale's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helen,_Sweetheart_of_the_Internet"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helen, Sweetheart of the Internet}}\'a0in 1998.

\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 2013, Archie Comics released a 12-part crossover of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Capcom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Capcom}}\'a0character\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mega_Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mega Man}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sega"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sega}}\'a0character\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonic the Hedgehog}}\'a0called "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Worlds_Collide_(Archie_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Worlds Collide}}". Taking place in issues of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonic the Hedgehog}}
\f1\i ,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonic Universe}}
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mega_Man_(Archie_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mega Man}}\'a0comic series from Archie, the crossover involved\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dr._Eggman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Eggman}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dr._Wily"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Wily}}\'a0forming an alliance to take over both their universes and destroy their respective nemeses. Sonic and Mega Man were briefly tricked into fighting each other, but later joined forces and teamed up with other heroes to battle the doctors' forces, which included virtually every Robot Master introduced in the\'a0
\f1\i Mega Man
\f0\i0 \'a0games. The popularity of this crossover and the books involved led to a second crossover in 2015 entitled "Worlds Unite", which not only reunited Sonic and Mega Man but also featured comics-exclusive characters from both of their books, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mega_Man_X"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mega Man X}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonic_Boom_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonic Boom}}\'a0spinoff franchises and various other SEGA and Capcom franchises. This crossover was enabled by the conclusion of the first crossover, which saw a reboot to the Sonic books as their universe was drastically rewritten. Aftereffects of this included the Genesis Portals, gateways connecting worlds that would be exploited by\'a0
\f1\i Mega Man X
\f0\i0 \'a0villain Sigma and his minions, forcing a reunion between Sonic and Mega Man and an alliance between heroes of the various franchises involved. "Worlds Unite" spans not only the three series featured in the first crossover, but also includes the\'a0
\f1\i Sonic Boom
\f0\i0 \'a0comic series, which entered publication between the two crossovers.\
There are also\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intercompany_crossover"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intercompany crossovers}}, where characters owned by two different companies meet, such as those from DC and Marvel.\
Cartoon crossovers are not uncommon, and most of them \'96 like comics or live-action TV shows \'96 will often feature characters owned by the same company or network. One example is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cartoon_Network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cartoon Network}}'s\'a0
\f1\i The Grim Adventures of the Kids Next Door
\f0\i0 . It features five crossovers \'96\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ed,_Edd_n_Eddy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ed, Edd n Eddy}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Codename:_Kids_Next_Door"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Codename: Kids Next Door}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Grim_Adventures_of_Billy_and_Mandy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy}}, a reference to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Powerpuff_Girls"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Powerpuff Girls}}\'a0and a quote from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scooby-Doo"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scooby-Doo}}, which are all licensed Cartoon Network series. The cast of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ben_10:_Ultimate_Alien"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ben 10: Ultimate Alien}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Generator_Rex"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Generator Rex}}\'a0team up in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ben_10/Generator_Rex:_Heroes_United"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ben 10/Generator Rex: Heroes United}}. Similarly, characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Uncle_Grandpa"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Uncle Grandpa}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steven_Universe"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steven Universe}}appeared in a crossover episode "Say Uncle". The same occurred with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Powerpuff_Girls_(2016_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Powerpuff Girls}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Teen_Titans_Go!_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Teen Titans Go!}}\'a0in an episode called "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TTG_v_PPG"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TTG v PPG}}".\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/OK_K.O.!_Let%27s_Be_Heroes"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes}}\'a0did a crossover episode called "Crossover Nexus" to celebrate 25 years of Cartoon Network where the lead character joined forces with Ben 10, Garnet from Steven Universe and Raven from Teen Titans. \f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kim Possible}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Recess_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jimmy Timmy Power Hour}}\'a0trilogy is another example, in which Jimmy Neutron and Timmy Turner switch universes. The Disney TV series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hercules_(1998_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hercules}}, based on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hercules_(1997_film)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 1997 film of the same name}}, had an episode titled "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hercules_and_the_Arabian_Night"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hercules and the Arabian Night}}" that had a crossover between the characters of the TV series and film and with the characters of the Disney film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aladdin_(1992_Disney_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aladdin}}, in which Hades and Jafar each try to get rid of each other's enemies (Hades would try to defeat Aladdin while Jafar would try to defeat Hercules). Another crossover is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rugrats_Go_Wild"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rugrats Go Wild}}\'a0in which the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rugrats"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rugrats}}\'a0are stranded on an island where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Wild_Thornberrys"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Wild Thornberrys}}\'a0were at the time. In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dexter%27s_Laboratory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dexter's Laboratory}}\'a0"Dial M for Monkey" "Huntor" who tries to hunt Monkey is himself hunted; "Huntor" later makes a cameo crossover in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samurai_Jack"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samurai Jack}}'s "Jack vs Mad Jack." During the 1970s and 1980s, crossovers were particularly common among the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hanna-Barbera"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hanna-Barbera}}\'a0properties. \f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The New Scooby-Doo Movies}}, which featured appearances by characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harlem_Globetrotters_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harlem Globetrotters}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Josie_and_the_Pussycats_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Josie and the Pussycats}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jeannie_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jeannie}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Speed_Buggy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Speed Buggy}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Adventures_of_Batman"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman and Robin}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Addams_Family_(1973_animated_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Addams Family}}. Later, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hanna-Barbera_Superstars_10"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hanna-Barbera Superstars 10}}\'a0set of movies involved several crossovers, including such combinations as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Jetsons_Meet_the_Flintstones"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Jetsons Meet the Flintstones}}. This was taken to an extreme in the 1977\'9679 series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Laff-A-Lympics"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Laff-A-Lympics}}
\f1\i ,
\f0\i0 \'a0which was essentially a gathering of the Hanna-Barbera characters for a regular series.\
Crossovers are not necessarily composed of characters under common ownership. Two of the most notable cartoon crossovers consisted of characters from different companies. Disney's movie\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Who_Framed_Roger_Rabbit"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Who Framed Roger Rabbit}}had characters from various companies, most notably Disney and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warner_Bros."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warner Bros.}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Daffy_Duck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Daffy Duck}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Donald_Duck"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Donald Duck}}\'a0made a simultaneous appearance in one scene, in which the two of them exchanged blows during a piano duet. Later in the movie,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mickey_Mouse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mickey Mouse}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bugs_Bunny"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bugs Bunny}}\'a0were shown parachuting together (to keep things from getting too iffy legally, Mickey and Bugs' lines were written so that each of them said exactly the same number of words in the movie).
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0The film also includes cameos of characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Metro%E2%80%93Goldwyn%E2%80%93Mayer_cartoon_studio"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MGM}}. The end of the movie features all the cartoons from all of the animation companies joining together in song, to be concluded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Porky_Pig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Porky Pig}}\'a0stuttering his famous "That's All, Folks!" line as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tinker_Bell#Disney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tinker Bell}}\'a0ends the scene with a magical fade-out.\
On February 27, 1998, Fox Kids show,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Power_Rangers_in_Space"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Power Rangers in Space}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ninja_Turtles:_The_Next_Mutation"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ninja Turtles: The Next Mutation}}, had their crossover with the episode "Shell Shocked".\
On October 4, 1997, The 2 Kids WB shows,\'a0
\f1\i Superman: The Animated Series
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i The New Batman Adventures
\f0\i0 , had their first crossover with the TV movie\'a0
\f1\i World's Finest
\f0\i0 , which was also released on DVD.\
Another cartoon crossover would occur in 1990,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cartoon_All-Stars_to_the_Rescue"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cartoon All-Stars to the Rescue}}. This cartoon featured popular characters from children's Saturday morning cartoons, banding together to promote an anti-drug message.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ABC}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CBS"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CBS}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fox}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/NBC"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 NBC}}\'a0aired this half-hour special one Saturday morning with characters from all their networks, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Huey,_Dewey,_and_Louie"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Huey, Dewey, and Louie}}\'a0(from Disney's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DuckTales"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DuckTales}}),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Winnie_the_Pooh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Winnie the Pooh}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tigger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tigger}}, Slimer (from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Real_Ghostbusters"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Real Ghostbusters}}\'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Extreme Ghostbusters
\f0\i0 ), Michelangelo (from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(1987_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles}}), Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alvin_and_the_Chipmunks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alvin and the Chipmunks}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Smurfs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Smurfs}}, ALF (from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ALF:_The_Animated_Series"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his short-lived cartoon spinoff}}),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Garfield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Garfield}}, and the trio of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kermit_the_Frog"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baby Kermit}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miss_Piggy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baby Piggy}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gonzo_the_Great"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baby Gonzo}}\'a0(from Jim Henson's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Muppet_Babies"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Muppet Babies}}). Animation companies granted unlimited, royalty-free use of their cartoon characters for this project, a feat that has been unequalled before or since then. This cartoon was also introduced by then-{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/President_of_the_United_States"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 President}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_H._W._Bush"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George H. W. Bush}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Barbara_Bush"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Barbara Bush}}, and would be distributed to schools and video stores free of charge nationwide.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Manga"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Manga}}\'a0artist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leiji_Matsumoto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leiji Matsumoto}}\'a0has been known to cross over the characters of his various stories and characters such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Harlock"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Harlock}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galaxy_Express_999"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galaxy Express 999}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Queen_Millennia"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Queen Millennia}}, all of which were originally written as separate, self-contained stories. In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maetel_Legend"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maetel Legend}}, Queen Promethium is revealed to be having been Yukino Yaoi, the protagonist from\'a0
\f1\i Queen Millennia
\f0\i0 . Matsumoto has also created various crossovers with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Space_Battleship_Yamato"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Space Battleship Yamato}}, an anime on which he served as director, although the rights to Yamato are actually owned by Yoshinobu Nishizaki.\
The adult parody-oriented series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drawn_Together"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drawn Together}}\'a0features many crossovers; while some are regular cameos, such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Griffin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lois_Griffin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lois Griffin}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Family_Guy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Family Guy}}, others involve a personality twist, such as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Murder"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 homicidal}}\'a0version of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bambi_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bambi}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bambi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the eponymous film}}\'a0or the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Homosexuality"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gay}}\'a0version of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elmer_Fudd"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elmer Fudd}}\'a0from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Looney_Tunes"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Looney Tunes}}\'a0franchise.\
The Disney/Marvel crossover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phineas_and_Ferb:_Mission_Marvel"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phineas and Ferb: Mission Marvel}}\'a0features the Marvel heroes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spider-Man}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Iron Man}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, the Marvel villains\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Whiplash_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Whiplash}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/MODOK"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MODOK}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Venom_(Marvel_Comics_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Venom}}, and characters from\'a0
\f1\i Phineas and Ferb
\f0\i0 , where the storyline involves Phineas and Ferb trying to restore power to the Marvel heroes, whose powers were taken away by Doofenshmirtz.\
During its 26th season,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Simpsons"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Simpsons}}\'a0has crossovers with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Family_Guy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Family Guy}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Futurama"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Futurama}}. In the hour-long\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Family_Guy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Family Guy}}\'a0season 13 premiere "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Simpsons_Guy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Simpsons Guy}}", the Griffins meet the Simpson family,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0who meet the Planet Express crew in the\'a0
\f1\i Simpsons
\f0\i0 \'a0episode "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Simpsorama"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simpsorama}}".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Disney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Disney}}\'a0series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/House_of_Mouse"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 House of Mouse}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mickey_Mouse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mickey Mouse}}\'a0and friends host a nightclub featuring cameos by other Disney characters.\
Webtoons (animated shows from the internet) can also have crossovers with different webtoons, franchises, YouTubers and more. Some examples are when Kate from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TomSka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TomSka}}'s\'a0
\f1\i Crash Zoom
\f0\i0 \'a0series makes an appearance in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eddsworld"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eddsworld}}\'a0as a trick or treater who possesses Matt and Edd in the episode, "Trick or Threat". In addition to this a couple of characters from\'a0
\f1\i Eddsworld
\f0\i0 \'a0make appearances in some\'a0
\f1\i Crash Zoom
\f0\i0 \'a0episodes such as "Orcs and Dorks". Another example is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Battle"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Battle}}\'a0which is a show where two guys (Whiz and Boomstick) put two characters from different franchises together to battle each other. These characters range from television, movie, video game, or comic franchises. Shows like\'a0
\f1\i One Minute Melee
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i Cartoon Fight Club
\f0\i0 , and\'a0
\f1\i Death Battle Exhibitions
\f0\i0 \'a0(the spinoff series) have a similar format to\'a0
\f1\i Death Battle
\f0\i0 .\
