{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Konami"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Konami}}\'a0made the first crossover video game featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Simon_Belmont"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Simon Belmont}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Castlevania"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Castlevania}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal}}\'a0Picture's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/King_Kong"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Kong}}\'a0and Mikey from the Warner Bros. Movie\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Goonies"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Goonies}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Konami_Wai_Wai_World"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Konami Wai Wai World}}\'a0for the Famicom in 1988.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_King_of_Fighters"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The King of Fighters}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_vs._Capcom_(series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marvel vs. Capcom}}, and many other franchises from third-party developers such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Capcom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Capcom}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/SNK_Playmore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 SNK}}\'a0bring these licenses together.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/2.5D"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 2.5D}}\'a0fighting game series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Super_Smash_Bros._(series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Super Smash Bros.}}\'a0brings various\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nintendo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nintendo}}\'a0characters together and allows players to fight against each other as these characters in arenas. The third game in the series,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Super_Smash_Bros._Brawl"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Neon Genesis Evangelion}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/GaoGaiGar"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 GaoGaiGar}}.\
More recently, there has been a collaboration between Capcom and Namco, which results in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Street_Fighter_X_Tekken"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tekken X Street Fighter}}.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warriors_Orochi"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samurai Warriors}}\'a0series. The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warriors_Orochi_3"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 third installment}}\'a0of this series included a number of playable characters from other\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Koei_Tecmo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Koei Tecmo}}\'a0properties, such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ninja_Gaiden"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ninja Gaiden}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dead_or_Alive_(franchise)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dead or Alive}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zill_O%27ll"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zill O'll}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sophitia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sophitia Alexandra}}\'a0from Bandai Namco's\'a0
\f1\i Soul
\f0\i0 \'a0series.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warriors_All-Stars"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warriors All-Stars}}\'a0similarly crossed-over a number of characters from Koei Tecmo series.\
The Disney film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wreck-It_Ralph"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wreck-It Ralph}}\'a0features many video game character\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearances}}.\
Perhaps one of the most notable video game crossovers is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lego_Dimensions"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lego Dimensions}}, which makes use of over 30 different franchises, including DC Comics,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Doctor_Who"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Doctor Who}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Lego_Movie"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Lego Movie}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Lord of the Rings}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonic the Hedgehog}}, and more.\
The first film crossover in a series of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Studios"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Studios}}\'a0monster films was\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frankenstein_Meets_the_Wolf_Man"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man}}, in 1943. In 2003,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Freddy_vs._Jason"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Freddy vs. Jason}}\'a0was released by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Line_Cinema"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Line Cinema}}. In 2004,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/20th_Century_Fox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 20th Century Fox}}\'a0released\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alien_vs._Predator_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alien vs. Predator}}\'a0along with the sequel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aliens_vs._Predator:_Requiem"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aliens vs. Predator: Requiem}}\'a0in 2007. One year later, both\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dollman_vs._Demonic_Toys"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dollman vs. Demonic Toys}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Puppet_Master_vs_Demonic_Toys"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Puppet Master vs Demonic Toys}}\'a0were released by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/20th_Century_Fox"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 20th Century Fox}}\'a0and Terry Kelley Studios. In 2015,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sony"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sony}}\'a0released\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lake_Placid_vs._Anaconda"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lake Placid vs. Anaconda}}.\
After the comics publishing house\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marvel Comics}}\'a0ventured into\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_Studios#Production"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 movie production}}, they set of to produce solitary films with popular superheroes from the Avengers team, with characters from upcoming films making cameo appearances in films starring another superhero, while it all lead to the crossover movie\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Avengers_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Avengers}}\'a0(2012). The same process was repeated for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers:_Age_of_Ultron"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers: Age of Ultron}}\'a0(2015) and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers: Infinity War}}\'a0(2018) and all the movies together form the crossover film series referred to as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Marvel Cinematic Universe}}. Inspired by Marvel's success,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warner_Bros."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warner Bros.}}, who hold movie rights for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DC_Comics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DC Comics}}' heroes, announced the production of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batman_v_Superman:_Dawn_of_Justice"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice}}\'a0(2016) and further plans to develop the cinematic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DC_Extended_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DC Extended Universe}}, while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paramount_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paramount Pictures}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hasbro_Studios"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Allspark Pictures}}\'a0announced plans to create a cinematic universe on the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Transformers"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Transformers}}\'a0film series.\
There have been numerous crossovers in Japanese cinema. The boom of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kaiju"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 kaiju}}\'a0films saw a lot of crossovers produced at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toho_Studios"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toho Studios}}, with some of the monsters forming teams in numerous movies, much like the Marvel movie franchise.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Godzilla"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Godzilla}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mothra"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mothra}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rodan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rodan}}\'a0(Radon) each first appeared in standalone films before being set against each other or even teaming up against stronger enemies. Their first encounter was in 1964, first in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mothra_vs._Godzilla"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mothra vs. Godzilla}}\'a0and a few months later of all three in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ghidorah,_the_Three-Headed_Monster"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster}}. In 1962\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toho_Studios"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toho}}\'a0released\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/King_Kong_vs._Godzilla"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King Kong vs. Godzilla}}. The long running\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zatoichi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zatoichi}}\'a0series sees\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shintaro_Katsu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shintaro Katsu}}'s blind master swordsman face of with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toshiro_Mifune"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toshiro Mifune}}\'a0in his iconic role in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zatoichi_Meets_Yojimbo"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zatoichi Meets Yojimbo}}\'a0(1970) and also features a unique cross-Asian project\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zatoichi_and_the_One-Armed_Swordsman"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zatoichi and the One-Armed Swordsman}}\'a0(1971). This coproduction sees\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jimmy_Wang_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jimmy Wang}}\'a0reprise his famous part of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/One-Armed_Swordsman"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 One-Armed Swordsman}}\'a0while featuring two different endings for both the Japanese and Hong Kong audiences.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Literature"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 literature}}, some authors also engage in crossovers by including characters from different novels they have written in one.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kim_Newman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kim Newman}}\'a0is another author who frequently uses this device, as does\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_King"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen King}}. The works of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Branch_Cabell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Branch Cabell}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J.D._Salinger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.D. Salinger}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Faulkner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Faulkner}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Margaret_Laurence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Margaret Laurence}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thomas_Pynchon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thomas Pynchon}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kurt_Vonnegut"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kurt Vonnegut}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mordecai_Richler"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mordecai Richler}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edgar_Rice_Burroughs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edgar Rice Burroughs}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Heinlein"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Heinlein}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Isaac_Asimov"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Isaac Asimov}}\'a0also cross over with each other, linking different characters and settings together over a number of different works. Author\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rick_Riordan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rick Riordan}}\'a0publishes multiple book series featuring gods of ancient civilizations in the modern day, which have had two crossovers and three references to other series. The first popular crossover in literature was the 1885 Mark Twain novel,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adventures_of_Huckleberry_Finn"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn}}, which had an important guest appearance by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Sawyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Sawyer}}.\
Brazilian writer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Monteiro_Lobato"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Monteiro Lobato}}\'a0also created solid and imaginative crossovers, using elements and characters from Brazilian folklore such as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cuca_(folklore)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cuca}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Saci_(Brazilian_folklore)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Saci}}, from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greek_mythology"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greek mythology}}, from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arabian_Nights"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arabian Nights}}, from fairy tales such as Grimm's "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Snow_White"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Snow White}}", Western literature such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Pan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Pan}}, cartoons such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Popeye"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Popeye}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Felix_the_Cat"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Felix the Cat}}, and Western films.\
It is also common for authors to 'crossover' characters who have passed into the public domain, and thus do not require copyright or royalty payments for their use in other works.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_League_of_Extraordinary_Gentlemen"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alan_Moore"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alan Moore}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kevin_O%27Neill_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kevin O'Neill}}\'a0is another example of this, as all of the main characters and most of the secondary / background characters are fictional characters whose copyright has expired, and all are characters of different authors and creators brought together within one massive extended universe. Many of the works of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Philip_Jos%C3%A9_Farmer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Philip Jos\'e9 Farmer}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wold_Newton_family"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wold Newton family}}\'a0sequences (which has also been explored and developed by other authors) also utilize and interweave numerous otherwise unrelated fictional characters into a rich family history by speculating familial connections between them (such as a blood-relationship between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sherlock Holmes}}and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tarzan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tarzan}}).\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Roger_Zelazny"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Roger Zelazny}}'s novel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/A_Night_in_the_Lonesome_October"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 A Night in the Lonesome October}}\'a0combines Sherlock Holmes, Doctor Frankenstein, Jack the Ripper, and the Cthulhu Mythos, although he never specifically identifies them as such ("The Count", "The Good Doctor", "Jack", etc.).\
Occasionally, authors will include into crossovers classic fictional characters whose copyright is still held by the original authors (or at least their estates), but who are nevertheless considered iconic or 'mythic' enough to be recognised from a few character traits or descriptions without being directly named (thus not requiring royalties payments to be made to the copyright holder). A prominent example occurs within\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_League_of_Extraordinary_Gentlemen,_Volume_One"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen, Volume One}}, wherein a character who is clearly intended in appearance and description by other characters to be Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fu_Manchu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fu Manchu}}\'a0appears as a significant villain; however, as this character was not in the public domain at the time of writing and the rights still held by the estate of his creator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sax_Rohmer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sax Rohmer}}, he is not directly named as such in the work and is only referred to as 'the Devil Doctor'. Something similar occurs in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_League_of_Extraordinary_Gentlemen:_Black_Dossier"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen: Black Dossier}}, wherein a character named "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_The_League_of_Extraordinary_Gentlemen_characters#Jimmy_Bond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jimmy}}" is clearly intended to be\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ian_Fleming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ian Fleming}}'s character\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_Bond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Bond}}, though here he is satirized as being an inept and unfavorable antagonist, likely to parody\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sean_Connery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sean Connery}}'s appearance in the 2003\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_League_of_Extraordinary_Gentlemen_(film)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 film adaptation}}. Another example in\'a0
\f1\i The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
\f0\i0 \'a0is when a character is named to be the Anti-Christ, yet, despite never being named, is shown to be an evil\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harry_Potter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harry Potter}}.\
The TV show\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Once_Upon_a_Time_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Once Upon a Time}}\'a0is set in a world in which all\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fairy_tales"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fairy tales}}\'a0coexist, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Snow_White"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Snow White}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Little_Red_Riding_Hood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Little Red Riding Hood}}, and even\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alice_in_Wonderland"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alice in Wonderland}}. (As a production of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Walt_Disney_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Walt Disney Company}}, copyrighted elements from that company's productions have appeared in\'a0
\f1\i Once Upon a Time
\f0\i0 .) The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shrek_(film_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shrek}}\'a0film series is built on the same concept, and even includes references to then-copyrighted elements like\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Pan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Pan}}\'a0(often in the form of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Satire"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 satire}}).\
One of the earlier instances of crossovers in TV productions outside the US is the episode\'a0
\f1\i Unter Br\'fcdern
\f0\i0 \'a0(1990), which was produced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Westdeutscher_Rundfunk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 WDR}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Deutscher_Fernsehfunk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DFF}}\'a0as a crossover between the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/West_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 West German}}\'a0crime series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatort"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatort}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/East_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 East German}}\'a0crime series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Polizeiruf_110"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Polizeiruf 110}}. Their respective popular heroes\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Horst_Schimanski"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Horst Schimanski}}\'a0and Peter Fuchs join forces to solve a case in the turmoil of the time after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Berlin_Wall#The_fall"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fall of the Berlin Wall}}. The episode was produced during the short transition period between the fall of the Berlin Wall and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_reunification"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reunification of Germany}}.\
Crossovers involving principals can also occur when the characters have no prior relationship, but are related by time period, locale or profession. The\'a0
\f1\i Law and Order
\f0\i0 \'a0series, for example, afford a commonality of setting and profession which lends itself to crossovers, both within the franchise and in a wider universe.\'a0
\f1\i Law & Order: SVU
\f0\i0 \'a0has crossed over several times with\'a0
\f1\i Chicago P.D.
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Chicago Fire
\f0\i0 , as well as sharing a common character with\'a0
\f1\i Homicide: Life on the Street
\f0\i0 .\'a0
\f1\i NCIS
\f0\i0 \'a0has crossed over with\'a0
\f1\i NCIS: Los Angeles
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i NCIS: New Orleans
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i JAG
\f0\i0 , while\'a0
\f1\i NCIS: Los Angeles
\f0\i0 \'a0has crossed over with both\'a0
\f1\i Scorpion
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Hawaii Five-0
\f0\i0 . Following the cancellation of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ABC}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Soap_opera"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 soap opera}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/One_Life_to_Live"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 One Life to Live}}\'a0and its high rated finale, several characters crossed over into the network's remaining soap opera\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Hospital"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Hospital}}, remaining in the same timeline as their former show.\
The\'a0
\f1\i CSI
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise is another common example of the crossover phenomena, with the original series crossing over with\'a0
\f1\i CSI: Miami
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i CSI: Cyber
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i CSI: NY
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Without a Trace
\f0\i0 .\'a0
\f1\i CSI: NY
\f0\i0 \'a0crossed over with fellow CBS series\'a0
\f1\i Cold Case
\f0\i0 , and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ted_Danson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ted Danson}}\'a0appeared as a regular on both\'a0
\f1\i CSI
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Cyber
\f0\i0 . Similarly,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Family_Guy"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Family Guy}}\'a0has crossed over with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Simpsons"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Simpsons}}, while\'a0
\f1\i The Simpsons
\f0\i0 \'a0has crossed over with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_X-Files"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The X-Files}}.\'a0
\f1\i The X-Files
\f0\i0 \'a0has in turn crossed over with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Homicide:_Life_on_the_Street"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Homicide: Life on the Street}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Lone_Gunmen"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Lone Gunmen}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cops_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cops}}. A proposed crossover with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_West_Wing"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The West Wing}}\'a0was planned, but was never produced.\
There was also an ongoing use of crossover characters between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Beverly_Hillbillies"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Beverly Hillbillies}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Green_Acres"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Green Acres}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Petticoat_Junction"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Petticoat Junction}}.\
Though most common on shows of the same\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Production_company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 production company}}\'a0(see, for example, "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hurricane_Saturday"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hurricane Saturday}}"), crossovers have also occurred because shows share the same distributor or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Television_network"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 television network}}. A notable example of this kind of link is that between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Murder,_She_Wrote"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Murder, She Wrote}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Magnum,_P.I."}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Magnum, P.I.}}\'a0These shows were made by different companies, but owned by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Studios"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Studios}}\'a0and broadcast on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CBS"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CBS}}. Another case is that of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mad_About_You"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mad About You}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Friends"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Friends}}, which share the character of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Friends_characters#Ursula_Pamela_Buffay"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ursula Buffay}}. Neither show shares any production or distribution commonality, but rather an actress ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lisa_Kudrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lisa Kudrow}}), a setting ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}}) and a schedule (
\f1\i Friends
\f0\i0 initially followed\'a0
\f1\i Mad About You
\f0\i0 \'a0on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/NBC"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 NBC}}'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Must_See_TV"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thursday night schedule}}).\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 Mad About You
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Friends
\f0\i0 \'a0share another type of "network crossover". On rare occasions, networks have chosen to theme an entire night's programming around a crossover "event". In one case, a New York City\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Power_outage"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blackout}}caused by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paul_Reiser"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paul Reiser}}'s character on\'a0
\f1\i Mad About You
\f0\i0 \'a0was experienced by the characters on\'a0
\f1\i Friends
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Madman_of_the_People"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Madman of the People}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Such "event nights" can also be linked by a single character's quest across multiple shows on the same evening.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ABC}}\'a0attempted this kind of "event night" crossover with its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TGIF_(ABC)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Friday night programming}}\'a0during the 1997 season. There, they proposed that the title character of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sabrina_the_Teenage_Witch_(1996_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sabrina the Teenage Witch}}\'a0should chase her cat,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Salem_Saberhagen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Salem}}, through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boy_Meets_World"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Boy Meets World}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/You_Wish_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 You Wish}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Teen_Angel_(1997_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Teen Angel}}\'a0because it had run away with a "time ball" that was displacing each show through time.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
ABC also attempted a "crossover" when four of its sitcoms ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grace_Under_Fire"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grace Under Fire}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ellen_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ellen}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Drew_Carey_Show"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Drew Carey Show}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coach_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coach}}) all went to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas}}\'a0during the 1996\'961997 season.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dan_Schneider_(TV_producer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dan Schneider}}\'a0used the show he was producing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zoey_101"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zoey 101}}\'a0to promote his new show\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ICarly"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iCarly}}\'a0by making characters from\'a0
\f1\i Zoey 101
\f0\i0 \'a0go to\'a0
\f1\i ICarly.com
\f0\i0 \'a0or use the song "Leave It All To Me", the iCarly theme song, as a ringtone. A\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Henry_Danger"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry Danger}}\'a0comic book and Gibby's wax head is seen in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Game_Shakers"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Game Shakers}}\'a0episode "Lost Jacket, Falling Pigeons", the subway station's lost and found.\
On other occasions, crossovers between established shows can occur without a network or production commonality, but simply because there is some narrative rationale for the crossover. The appearance of detective\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_Munch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John Munch}}\'a0(from NBC's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Homicide:_Life_on_the_Street"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Homicide: Life on the Street}}) on Fox's\'a0
\f1\i The X-Files
\f0\i0 \'a0happened merely because the episode revolved around a crime scene in Baltimore, a logical place for characters on\'a0
\f1\i The X-Files
\f0\i0 \'a0to have encountered Munch. Munch would also appear on the TV series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Law_%26_Order"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Law & Order}}\'a0on NBC in which it had one episode which began on that series in New York City and concluded in Baltimore on\'a0
\f1\i Homicide: Life on the Street
\f0\i0 . Later, when\'a0
\f1\i Homicide
\f0\i0 \'a0went off the air in 1999, Detective Munch ends up leaving Baltimore to move to New York, and becoming a permanent character (as New York City Detective Munch) on NBC's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Law_%26_Order:_Special_Victims_Unit"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Law & Order: Special Victims Unit}}\'a0until October 2013.\
A two-part crossover episode between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CSI:_Crime_Scene_Investigation"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CSI: Crime Scene Investigation}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Without_a_Trace"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Without a Trace}}\'a0aired on November 8, 2007. The first hour was on\'a0
\f1\i CSI
\f0\i0 \'a0and the second hour was on\'a0
\f1\i Without a Trace
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0While both series are on the same network in the United States, spreading two parts of a story across two different shows can cause problems in international markets where they have been separately sold to different broadcasters. For example, in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Kingdom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Kingdom}},\'a0
\f1\i Without a Trace
\f0\i0 \'a0was shown on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Channel_4"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Channel 4}}\'a0and\'a0
\f1\i CSI
\f0\i0 \'a0on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Channel_5_(UK)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Channel 5}}, meaning the two companies had to come to a special agreement to show both episodes.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Another\'a0
\f1\i CSI
\f0\i0 \'a0crossover occurred in 2009 when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raymond_Langston"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raymond Langston}}\'a0from\'a0
\f1\i CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
\f0\i0 \'a0appeared both in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CSI:_Miami"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CSI: Miami}}
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CSI:_NY"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CSI: NY}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0traveling to Miami and New York to track a human trafficking and organ harvesting ring.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ER_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ER}}\'a0had a crossover with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Third_Watch"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Third Watch}}\'a0which corresponded with a peak in viewership for the latter show, with 17.2 million viewers.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 2013, the Canadian crime drama series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Republic_of_Doyle"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Republic of Doyle}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Murdoch_Mysteries"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Murdoch Mysteries}}\'a0produced a crossover,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which was complicated by the shows' incompatible historical settings;\'a0
\f1\i Murdoch Mysteries
\f0\i0 \'a0is a historical series set in the 1890s, while\'a0
\f1\i Republic of Doyle
\f0\i0 \'a0is set in the present day. The problem was solved by having the actors cross over as\'a0
\f1\i relatives
\f0\i0 \'a0of their primary characters;\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Allan_Hawco"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Allan Hawco}}\'a0appeared on the November 25, 2013 episode of\'a0
\f1\i Murdoch Mysteries
\f0\i0 \'a0as Jacob Doyle, a 19th-century ancestor of his regular character Jake Doyle, while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yannick_Bisson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yannick Bisson}}\'a0appeared on a January 2014 episode of\'a0
\f1\i Republic of Doyle
\f0\i0 \'a0as Bill Murdoch, a 21st-century descendant of his regular character William Murdoch.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Disney Channel's\'a0
\f1\i Suite Life
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise has featured three crossovers: In 2006,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/That%27s_So_Suite_Life_of_Hannah_Montana"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 That's So Suite Life of Hannah Montana}}\'a0featured characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hannah_Montana"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hannah Montana}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/That%27s_So_Raven"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 That's So Raven}}\'a0taking a vacation at the Tipton Hotel (the main setting of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Suite_Life_of_Zack_%26_Cody"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Suite Life of Zack & Cody}});\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hannah_Montana_(character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hannah Montana}}/{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miley_Stewart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miley Stewart}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miley_Cyrus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miley Cyrus}}) also eats cake off Zack, which recurs in the 2009 crossover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wizards_on_Deck_with_Hannah_Montana"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana}}, in which characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wizards_of_Waverly_Place"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wizards of Waverly Place}}\'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Hannah Montana
\f0\i0 \'a0come on aboard the S.S. Tipton. In 2015 a crossover between two Disney XD shows\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lab_Rats:_Bionic_Island"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lab Rats: Bionic Island}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mighty_Med"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mighty Med}}\'a0crossed over in the special "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lab_Rats_vs._Mighty_Med"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lab Rats vs. Mighty Med}}".\
Another type of crossover involves characters from an off the air series resurfacing in a newer series. This occurred in a 2010 episode of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nickelodeon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nickelodeon}}\'a0sitcom\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/ICarly"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iCarly}}; the episode "iStart a Fan War" featured recurring characters from two Nickelodeon series:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drake_%26_Josh"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drake & Josh}}\'a0characters Eric Blonowitz, Craig Ramirez, Gavin Mitchell, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zoey_101"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zoey 101}}\'a0character Stacey Dillsen. A crossover between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Victorious"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Victorious}}\'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Drake & Josh
\f0\i0 \'a0also occurred, with Helen DuBois, portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yvette_Nicole_Brown"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yvette Nicole Brown}}\'a0making an appearance. An episode titled "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/IParty_with_Victorious"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iParty with Victorious}}" was a crossover between\'a0
\f1\i iCarly
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Victorious
\f0\i0 . This means all 4 shows exist in the same universe. However, in\'a0
\f1\i Who Did It to Trina
\f0\i0 , Tori referred to\'a0
\f1\i Drake and Josh
\f0\i0 \'a0as a TV show, making it seem as if the previous appearance was an actor of a character from a show within a show. Also in multiple episodes from\'a0
\f1\i iCarly
\f0\i0 and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sam_%26_Cat"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam & Cat}}\'a0(a crossover/spin-off of\'a0
\f1\i iCarly
\f0\i0 \'a0And\'a0
\f1\i Victorious
\f0\i0 ) one can see\'a0
\f1\i Drake and Josh
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Zoey 101
\f0\i0 \'a0in TV guides, when the characters are watching TV. Carly and Spencer were heard watching it in the\'a0
\f1\i iCarly
\f0\i0 \'a0episode\'a0
\f1\i iGet Pranky
\f0\i0 \'a0and Carly is seen looking at it briefly in\'a0
\f1\i iToe Fat Cakes
\f0\i0 \'a0and you can see the character Megan from\'a0
\f1\i Drake and Josh
\f0\i0 \'a0(also portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miranda_Cosgrove"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miranda Cosgrove}}) and Sam is seen changing the channel to it in\'a0
\f1\i #FavoriteShow
\f0\i0 \'a0an episode from\'a0
\f1\i Sam & Cat
\f0\i0 , making the universe between each of the shows confusing. However, these were probably all non-canonical references.\
In 2014,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Thundermans"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Thundermans}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Haunted_Hathaways"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Haunted Hathaways}}\'a0did a crossover, called "The Haunted Thundermans". In 2016,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Henry_Danger"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Henry Danger}}\'a0and\'a0
\f1\i The Thundermans
\f0\i0 \'a0did a crossover, called "Danger & Thunder". In 2017,\'a0
\f1\i Henry Danger
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Game Shakers
\f0\i0 \'a0did a crossover, called "Danger Games", which was then followed by a crossover episode, called "Babe Loves Danger", that aired in 2018. In 2017,\'a0
\f1\i Game Shakers
\f0\i0 \'a0did a crossover with\'a0
\f1\i iCarly
\f0\i0 , called "Game Shippers".\
The main characters of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aaahh!!!_Real_Monsters"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aaahh!!! Real Monsters}}\'a0make a crossover appearance in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rugrats"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rugrats}}\'a0episode, "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ghost_Story_(Rugrats)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ghost Story}}". This is because both shows were created/produced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klasky_Csupo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Klasky Csupo}}\'a0and distributed also by Nickelodeon
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub .\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chile"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chile}}, children's programs and characters from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/El_Mundo_del_Profesor_Rossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 El Mundo del Profesor Rossa}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spanish_Language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spanish}}\'a0for\'a0
\f1\i The World of Professor Rossa
\f0\i0 ) and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cachureos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cachureos}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spanish_Language"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chilean Spanish}}\'a0for\'a0
\f1\i odds and ends
\f0\i0 ) conducted a crossover between them for a few minutes in their emissions of Saturday 18 (Mundo del Profesor Rossa) and Sunday 19 (Cachureos) of April 1998 due the debut of the latter program on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Canal_13_(Chile)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Canal 13}}, after several years of broadcast on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Televisi%C3%B3n_Nacional_de_Chile"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TVN}}\'a0and even have competed with each other for the child audience.\
Crossovers can take the form of a promotional\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearance}}, used to draw attention to another work of fiction, with little rational explanation in the context of the hosting show's narrative. When not clearly presented as parody, this is frequently scorned by fans as blatant commercialism. A notable example of this is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Simpsons"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Simpsons}}\'a0episode\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/A_Star_Is_Burns"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 A Star Is Burns}}, in which the character of Jay Sherman (from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Critic"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Critic}}) appeared. It originally aired on March 5, 1995 on FOX right before\'a0
\f1\i The Critic
\f0\i0 \'a0began its second season, its first season having aired on ABC. This episode was largely condemned by fans of\'a0
\f1\i The Simpsons
\f0\i0 \'a0as existing to promote\'a0
\f1\i The Critic
\f0\i0 , an animated series considered inferior by comparison. Even\'a0
\f1\i Simpsons
\f0\i0 \'a0creator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Matt_Groening"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Matt Groening}}\'a0objected, preferring to remove his name from the credits of that particular episode in protest.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The character Dan Tanna (played by Robert Urich) from the detective series\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vega$"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vega$}}\'a0appeared in an episode of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charlie%27s_Angels"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charlie's Angels}}\'a0("Angels in Vegas") one week prior to the debut of\'a0
\f1\i Vega$
\f0\i0 . However, it is not considered a spin-off because Dan Tanna was introduced in the pilot that was aired as an\'a0
\f1\i ABC TV Movie of the Week
\f0\i0 \'a0on the evening of Tuesday, April 25, 1978. The crossover was simply used to reintroduce the Dan Tanna character and to promote the debut of\'a0
\f1\i Vega$
\f0\i0 \'a0as an ongoing series. Additionally, the cast of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Love_Boat"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Love Boat}}\'a0appeared in the fourth season premier of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Charlie%27s_Angels"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Charlie's Angels}}\'a0("Love Boat Angels").\
In 2010, as a nod to the 50th anniversary of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coronation_Street"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coronation Street}}, characters in fellow established TV soap\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/EastEnders"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 EastEnders}}\'a0made reference to watching the special anniversary episode.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0EastEnders had celebrated its own 25th anniversary earlier in the same year.\
The two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/CBS_Daytime"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CBS Daytime}}\'a0game shows ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Price_Is_Right_(U.S._game_show)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Price Is Right}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Let%27s_Make_a_Deal"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Let's Make a Deal}}) are used for promotional cameos from other CBS properties. Promotional cameos from the two daytime dramas, primetime shows (including primetime airings), and sports properties are common.\'a0
\f1\i Price
\f0\i0 \'a0has been used to promote anniversaries of CBS daytime dramas, the\'a0
\f1\i NCIS
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise, the three reality shows, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/NFL_on_CBS"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CBS Sports' coverage of the NFL}}.\
In its simplest and most common form, a television crossover involves a starring character on a parent show appearing on a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spin-off_(media)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 spin-off}}\'a0or vice versa because of established character relationships. An obvious example of this type of crossover occurred when\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cliff_Huxtable"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cliff Huxtable}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Cosby_Show"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Cosby Show}}\'a0visited his daughter,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Denise_Huxtable"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Denise}}, on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/A_Different_World_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 A Different World}}. Another example of this is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Bionic_Woman"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Bionic Woman}}, which was a spin-off from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Six_Million_Dollar_Man"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Six Million Dollar Man}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jaime_Sommers_(The_Bionic_Woman)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jaime Sommers}}\'a0was a tennis pro who was nearly killed in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parachuting"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skydiving}}\'a0accident, but her life was saved by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oscar_Goldman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Oscar Goldman}}\'a0({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Richard_Anderson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Richard Anderson}}) and Dr. Rudy Wells ({\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Martin_E._Brooks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Martin E. Brooks}}) who surgically implanted her with bionic parts similar to those of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Austin_(fictional_character)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Austin}}. Steve Austin and Jaimie Sommers often crossovered, while the characters Oscar Goldman and Rudy Wells appeared regularly in both shows. Another example would be the appearances made by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Buffy_the_Vampire_Slayer_(TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Buffy the Vampire Slayer}}\'a0characters to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Angel_(1999_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Angel}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Los_Angeles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Los Angeles}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sunnydale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sunnydale}}; in a striking example, "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fool_for_Love_(Buffy_the_Vampire_Slayer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fool for Love}}" and "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darla_(Angel_episode)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darla}}", shown on the same night, contain overlapping flashbacks as remembered by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spike_(vampire)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spike}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darla_(vampire)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darla}}\'a0respectively. There is also\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frasier"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frasier}}, which features characters from the first show,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cheers"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cheers}}. Similarly,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dallas_(1978_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dallas}}\'a0characters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J._R._Ewing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J. R. Ewing}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bobby_Ewing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bobby Ewing}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lucy_Ewing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lucy Ewing}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kristin_Shepard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kristin Shepard}}\'a0all appeared in its spin-off\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knots_Landing"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knots Landing}}\'a0while\'a0
\f1\i Knots Landing
\f0\i0 \'a0characters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gary_Ewing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gary Ewing}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valene_Ewing"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Valene Ewing}}\'a0each made several appearances on\'a0
\f1\i Dallas
\f0\i0 \'a0after\'a0
\f1\i Knots Landing
\f0\i0 \'a0premiered.\
More complex multi-production franchises can utilize crossovers of characters to serve as a device in establishing continuity in a shared fictional universe. This crossover is common in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek_crossovers"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek
\f0\i0 \'a0universe}}, where minor guest stars from one series have appeared as featured guest stars later ones. A good example of this crossover is that of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klingon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Klingons}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kor_(Star_Trek)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kor}}\'a0(from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_The_Original_Series"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Original Series}}\'a0episode "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Errand_of_Mercy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Errand of Mercy}}"),\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Koloth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Koloth}}\'a0(from "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Trouble_With_Tribbles"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Trouble With Tribbles}}") and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kang_(Star_Trek)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kang}}\'a0(from "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Day_of_the_Dove"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Day of the Dove}}"). After the passage of about a century of narrative time, the three onetime adversaries of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_T._Kirk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Kirk}}\'a0appeared together in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Trek:_Deep_Space_Nine"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Trek: Deep Space Nine}}\'a0episode, "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blood_Oath_(DS9_episode)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blood Oath}}" \'96 as the Klingons and Federation had become allies in the century between, the former villains are now portrayed as heroes. Another Klingon,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arne_Darvin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arne Darvin}}, appeared as a secondary character in "The Trouble with Tribbles", but was the principal villain of DS9's "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trials_and_Tribble-ations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Trials and Tribble-ations}}". Intended as a celebration of the franchise's 30th anniversary, "Trials and Tribble-ations" was actually a crossover in and of itself; using then brand-new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chroma_key"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 bluescreen}}\'a0techniques, the episode places the DS9 cast (after hijacking the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Defiant"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Defiant}}, Darvin had gone back in time hoping to kill Kirk and become a hero to the Klingons, and it's up to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Benjamin_Sisko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sisko}}\'a0and his comrades to stop Darvin and preserve the timeline) inside the TOS episode, interacting with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/James_T._Kirk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James T. Kirk}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spock}}\'a0and the rest of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USS_Enterprise_(NCC-1701)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Enterprise}}\'a0crew.\
The distinction between "spin-off" and "crossover" is sometimes narrow. The two terms can become especially conflated if two shows are linked by a guest star with a single appearance. There is debate, for instance over whether\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Out_of_the_Blue_(1979_TV_series)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Out of the Blue}}\'a0is a spin-off of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Happy_Days"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Happy Days}}, or whether the star of\'a0
\f1\i Out of the Blue
\f0\i0 \'a0merely crossed over into\'a0
\f1\i Happy Days
\f0\i0 .\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mako:_Island_of_Secrets"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mako Mermaids}}, a spinoff of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/H2O:_Just_Add_Water"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 H2O: Just Add Water}}, featured a guest appearance by Rikki Chadwick, a main character from the former series, in its final two episodes, thus confirming that the spin off-acts as a sequel rather than a prequel or alternative storyline as many fans suspected.\
Often, the problems of bringing together two shows with different narrative ambitions make the writing of a crossover burdensome. Such difficulties are encountered by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Situation_comedies"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 situation comedies}}\'a0that wish to crossover with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Television_drama"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dramatic television}}\'a0programs. The satirical crossover\'97ranging in length from a cameo to a full\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sketch_comedy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 comedy sketch}}\'a0or episode\'97is an extremely popular way of circumventing this problem. By various means, such crossovers typically avoid outcry from fans by being obvious\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Parody"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 parody}}\'a0or\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Homage_(arts)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 homage}}. However, on rare occasion, the humor of such crossovers can be used by one show make a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Narrative"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 narrative}}\'a0point by capitalizing on the audience's experience of the other program.\
Such\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tongue-in-cheek"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 tongue-in-cheek}}\'a0crossovers typically fall into one of several broad categories.\
Sometimes, crossovers occur even when there was no explicit intent to create them. Viewer interpretation can play into the size and complexity of crossovers. These sorts of crossovers involve no creation of additional material, but merely result from inferences drawn about existing filmed episodes. Usually they are a product of narrative ambiguity. Perhaps the best example of this was caused by the unusual ending to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/St._Elsewhere"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 St. Elsewhere}}. One interpretation of the ending scene of the final episode has been that the entire run of the program was a figment of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Autism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 autistic}}\'a0character Tommy Westphall's imagination. This leads itself to a broad interpretation of the events of that series. Because the show had direct crossovers with twelve different programmes, and each one of these twelve had numerous\'a0
\f1\i other
\f0\i0 \'a0crossovers, linkages can be found from\'a0
\f1\i Elsewhere
\f0\i0 \'a0to 280 other shows, comprising what has been called "the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tommy_Westphall_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tommy Westphall Universe}}".
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 citation needed}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \
Eighteen months after the battle between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Superman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Superman}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Zod"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Zod}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Metropolis_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Metropolis}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Superman has become a controversial figure. Billionaire Bruce Wayne, who has operated in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gotham_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gotham City}}\'a0as the vigilante\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Batman}}\'a0for twenty years, sees Superman as an extraterrestrial threat to humanity. After learning of Batman's form of justice,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clark_Kent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clark Kent}}\'a0(Superman's civilian identity) seeks to expose him via\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Daily_Planet"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Daily Planet}}\'a0articles. Wayne learns that Russian weapon trafficker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/KGBeast"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anatoli Knyazev}}\'a0has been contacting\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/LexCorp"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 LexCorp}}\'a0mogul\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lex_Luthor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lex Luthor}}. Meanwhile, Luthor unsuccessfully tries to persuade Senator June Finch to allow him to import\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kryptonite"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 kryptonite}}\'a0retrieved from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Indian_Ocean"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Indian Ocean}}\'a0following Zod's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Terraforming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 terraforming}}\'a0attempt, claiming he wants to maintain it as a "deterrent" against future Kryptonian and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Metahuman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 metahuman}}\'a0threats. He instead makes alternative plans with Finch's subordinate and gains access to Zod's body and the Kryptonian scout ship.\
Bruce attends a gala at LexCorp to steal encrypted data from the company's mainframe, but has it taken from him by an antiquities dealer named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wonder_Woman"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Diana Prince}}; she eventually returns it to Bruce when she is unable to access the information.
