While decrypting the drive, Bruce dreams of a post-apocalyptic world where he leads a group of rebels against an evil Superman. He is awakened from his dream by an unidentified person, appearing through a portal, who warns him of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lois_Lane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lois Lane}}'s crucial role in the future, and urges him to find "the others" before vanishing.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Upon fully decrypting the drive, Wayne discovers Luthor's files on several metahuman individuals across the globe. One of them is Prince herself, who is shown in a photo taken during\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_I"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War I}}. Wayne admits to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alfred Pennyworth}}\'a0that he plans to steal the kryptonite to weaponize it, should it become necessary to fight Superman.\
At a Congressional hearing, as Finch questions Superman on the validity of his actions, a bomb smuggled by Luthor goes off and kills everyone present but Superman. Believing he should have detected the bomb, and frustrated by his failure to save them, Superman goes into self-imposed exile. Batman breaks into LexCorp and steals the kryptonite. In preparation to battle Superman, he builds a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Powered_exoskeleton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 powered exoskeleton}}, creates a kryptonite\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grenade_launcher"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 grenade launcher}}, and a kryptonite-tipped spear. Meanwhile, Luthor enters the Kryptonian ship and accesses a vast technology database accumulated from over 100,000 worlds.\
To bring Superman out of exile, Luthor kidnaps Lois and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jonathan_and_Martha_Kent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Martha Kent}}, Clark's adoptive mother. He reveals to Superman that he manipulated Superman and Batman by fueling their distrust for each other. Luthor demands that Superman kill Batman in exchange for Martha's life. Superman tries to explain the situation to Batman, but instead Batman attacks Superman and eventually subdues him with the aid of a kryptonite gas. Before Batman can kill Superman with the spear, Superman urges Batman to "save Martha", whose name is also shared with Batman's mother, confusing him long enough for Lois to arrive and explain what Superman meant. Realizing how far he has fallen and unwilling to let an innocent die, Batman rescues Martha, while Superman confronts Luthor on the scout ship.\
Luthor executes his backup plan, unleashing a genetically engineered monster with DNA from both Zod's body and his own blood.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Diana Prince arrives unexpectedly; revealing her metahuman nature, she joins forces with Batman and Superman to eliminate the creature. When they are all outmatched, Superman realizes its vulnerability to kryptonite, and retrieves the spear to kill it. In the creature's last moments, it kills Superman, himself weakened by exposure to kryptonite.\
Luthor is arrested and Batman confronts him in prison, warning Luthor that he will always be watching him. Luthor gloats that Superman's death has made the world vulnerable to powerful alien threats. A memorial is held for Superman in Metropolis. Clark is also declared dead, with various friends and family members including Bruce Wayne and Diana Prince attending his funeral in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Smallville_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Smallville}}. Martha gives an envelope to Lois, which contains an engagement ring from Clark. After the funeral, Bruce expresses his regrets to Diana about how he failed Superman. He reveals to her that he plans to form a team of metahumans, starting with those from Luthor's files, to help protect the world in Superman's absence. After they leave, the dirt atop Clark's coffin levitates.\
Fiction in some\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mass_media"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 media}}, such as most\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Television_programs"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 television programs}}\'a0and many\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Comic_book"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 comic book}}\'a0titles, is understood
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Unsupported_attributions"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 by whom?}}]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0to require the contribution of multiple authors and does not by itself create a shared universe and is considered a collaborative art form. Incidental appearances, such as that of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%27Artagnan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 d'Artagnan}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cyrano_de_Bergerac_(play)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cyrano de Bergerac}}, are considered literary\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearances}}. More substantial interaction between characters from different sources is often marketed as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fictional_crossover"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 crossover}}. While crossovers occur in a shared universe, not all crossovers are intended to merge their settings'\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Back-stories"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 back-stories}}\'a0and are instead used for marketing, parody, or to explore\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alternate_history"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 "what-if" scenarios}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6][7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
It can become difficult for writers contributing to a shared universe to maintain consistency and avoid contradicting details in earlier works, especially when a shared universe grows to be very large. The version deemed "official" by the author or company controlling the setting is known as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Canon_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 canon}}. Not all shared universes have a controlling entity capable of or interested in determining canonicity, and not all fans agree with these determinations when they occur.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fanon_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fanon}}\'a0may instead find some degree of consensus within the setting's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fandom"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 fandom}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Some writers, in an effort to ensure that a canon can be established and to keep details of the setting believable, employ tools to correct contradictions and errors that result from multiple contributors working over a long period of time. One such tool is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Retcon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 retconning}}, short for "retroactive continuity", which resolves errors in continuity that came about through previously-written conflicting material.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Readers may also object when a story or series is integrated into a shared universe, feeling it "requir[es] one hero's fans to buy other heroes' titles".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Blacksmith\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Will_Turner"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Will Turner}}\'a0teams up with eccentric pirate\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jack_Sparrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Jack Sparrow}}\'a0to save Turner's love,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elizabeth_Swann"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elizabeth Swann}}, from cursed pirates led by Jack's mutinous former first mate,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hector_Barbossa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hector Barbossa}}. Jack wants revenge against Barbossa, who left him stranded on an island before stealing his ship, the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 , along with 882 pieces of cursed Aztec Gold.\
Lord\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cutler_Beckett"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cutler Beckett}}\'a0of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/East_India_Company"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 East India Trading Company}}\'a0arrests Will and Elizabeth for aiding Captain Jack Sparrow in the previous film. Beckett offers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clemency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 clemency}}\'a0if Will agrees to search for Jack's compass in a bid to find the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dead_Man%27s_Chest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dead Man's Chest}}\'97and inside, the heart of villainous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones_(Pirates_of_the_Caribbean)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones}}\'97which would give Beckett control of the seas. However, Jack wants the Chest to escape from an unpaid debt with Jones, who made Jack captain of the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0for 13 years in exchange for 100 years of service aboard Jones' ship, the\'a0
\f1\i Flying Dutchman
\f0\i0 .\
Lord Beckett gains power over Davy Jones and, with the help of the\'a0
\f1\i Flying Dutchman
\f0\i0 , he is now executing his plans to extinguish piracy forever. To stand against the East India Trading Co., Will, Elizabeth, Barbossa, and the crew of the\'a0
\f1\i Black Pearl
\f0\i0 \'a0set out to rescue Captain Jack Sparrow from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Davy_Jones%27_Locker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Davy Jones' Locker}}. As one of the Nine Pirate Lords, Jack is needed in order to release an ancient goddess with the power to defeat Beckett's forces.\
Captain Jack Sparrow is on a quest to find the fabled\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fountain_of_Youth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fountain of Youth}}\'a0and crosses paths with a former lover, Angelica. She forces Jack aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Queen_Anne%27s_Revenge"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Queen Anne's Revenge}}, a ship captained by the infamous pirate\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blackbeard"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Blackbeard}}, Angelica's father. Both are also in search of the Fountain: Angelica to save her father's soul, Blackbeard to escape a prophecy of his demise at the hands of a one-legged man. Joining the hunt is former pirate captain Barbossa, now a privateer in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_II_of_Great_Britain"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 King George II}}'s Navy, who is in a race against the Spanish for the Fountain of Youth.\
A group of ghostly Spanish Royal Navy soldiers led by Jack Sparrow's old nemesis, Captain Armando Salazar, escape from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bermuda_Triangle"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Devil's Triangle}}, with the goal of killing every pirate at sea, including him. To survive, Jack seeks out the legendary\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trident_of_Poseidon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Trident of Poseidon}}, a powerful artifact whose owner can control the seas and break curses.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Shortly before the release of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pirates_of_the_Caribbean:_On_Stranger_Tides"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 On Stranger Tides}}, it was reported that Disney was planning to shoot the fifth and the sixth films back-to-back,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0although it was later revealed that only the fifth film was in development. On March 4, 2017, director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joachim_R%C3%B8nning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joachim R\'f8nning}}\'a0stated that\'a0
\f1\i Dead Men
\f0\i0 \'a0was only the beginning of the final adventure, implying that it would not be the last film of the franchise and that a sixth film could be released.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In September 2017, producer Jerry Bruckheimer indicated that another\'a0
\f1\i Pirates of the Caribbean
\f0\i0 \'a0sequel is still possible if\'a0
\f1\i Dead Men Tell No Tales
\f0\i0 \'a0does well in its home release.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In October 2017,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kaya_Scodelario"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kaya Scodelario}}\'a0said that she was contracted to return for a sixth film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Shortly after, it was announced that R\'f8nning is being eyed to direct the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In October 2018, it was reported that Disney is planning on restarting the franchise with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rhett_Reese"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rhett Reese}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paul_Wernick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Paul Wernick}}\'a0writing the script and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jerry_Bruckheimer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jerry Bruckheimer}}\'a0returning as producer. It is unknown if the film will be a complete or soft reboot of the franchise as Disney has not yet made any official announcements.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In December 2018,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Walt_Disney_Studios_(division)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Walt Disney Studios}}\'a0President of Production,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sean_Bailey"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sean Bailey}}\'a0confirmed that the character of Jack Sparrow will not be present, explaining, "We want to bring in a new energy and vitality. I love the [
\f1\i Pirates
\f0\i0 ] movies, but part of the reason Paul and Rhett are so interesting is that we want to give it a kick in the pants. And that's what I've tasked them with."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0However, on February 2019, it has been reported that Reese and Wernick had left the project and development on the potential reboot of the series is unknown.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0

\f1\i \cf2 Finding Nemo
\f0\i0 \'a0is the fifth\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pixar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pixar}}\'a0film. The film tells the story of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clownfish"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 clownfish}}\'a0named Nemo (voiced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alexander_Gould"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alexander Gould}}) who gets abducted, his over-protective father Marlin (voiced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Albert_Brooks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Albert Brooks}}) who, along with a regal tang named Dory (voiced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ellen_DeGeneres"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ellen DeGeneres}}), searches for him all the way to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sydney_Harbour"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sydney Harbour}}. Along the way, Marlin learns to take risks and let little Nemo take care of himself.\

\f1\i Finding Dory
\f0\i0 \'a0is the seventeenth\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pixar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pixar}}\'a0film. The film focuses on the amnesiac character\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dory"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dory}}, (voiced by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ellen_DeGeneres"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ellen DeGeneres}}) who travels to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 California}}\'a0to find her long-lost parents, Jenny and Charlie, as well as exploring the idea of her being reunited with her family.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0It takes place one year after\'a0
\f1\i Finding Nemo
\f0\i0 \'a0and is set off the coast of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Morro_Bay,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Morro Bay, California}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [2][3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Andrew_Stanton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Andrew Stanton}}\'a0commented in June 2016 about the possibility of a third\'a0
\f1\i Finding Nemo
\f0\i0 \'a0film, stating:\
As of February 2019, there has been no further word on the future of the franchise.\
Billionaire industrialist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0builds himself a suit of armor after he is taken captive by a terrorist organization. Free from his captors, he decides to upgrade and don his armor in order to hunt down weapons that were sold under the table.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In April 2006, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Favreau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Favreau}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with the writing teams of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Art_Marcum_and_Matt_Holloway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Art Marcum and Matt Holloway}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Fergus_and_Hawk_Ostby"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Fergus and Hawk Ostby}}\'a0writing competing scripts.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4][17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Favreau consolidated both into one script, which was then polished by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_August"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John August}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Downey,_Jr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Downey, Jr.}}\'a0was cast in the title role in September 2006, after growing out a goatee and working out to convince the filmmakers he was right for the part.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Principal_photography"}}{\fldrslt 
\fs24 \nosupersub Principal photography}}
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0began on March 12, 2007,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [19]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with the first few weeks spent on Stark's captivity in Afghanistan,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [20]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which was filmed in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Inyo_County,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Inyo County, California}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [21]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production also occurred on the former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Howard_Hughes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hughes Company}}\'a0soundstages in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Playa_Vista,_Los_Angeles,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Playa Vista, Los Angeles, California}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [22]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with additional filming at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edwards_Air_Force_Base"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edwards Air Force Base}}
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caesars_Palace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caesars Palace}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas,_Nevada"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas, Nevada}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [24]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greater_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greater Union}}\'a0theater in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Street,_Sydney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Street, Sydney}}, on April 14, 2008,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [25]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and was released internationally on April 30, and in the United States on May 2.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The film ends with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}\'a0featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samuel L. Jackson}}\'a0as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, who approaches Stark regarding the "Avenger Initiative". Favreau said that he included the scene as "a little tip of the hat for the fans...a way to sort of tee up\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ." Jackson was only on set for a day, with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Skeleton_crew"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skeleton crew}}\'a0to avoid the news of his cameo leaking.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America's shield}}\'a0is also visible in the background of a scene; it was added by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ILM}}\'a0artist as a joke, and Favreau decided to leave it in the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After being exposed to gamma radiation that causes him to transform into the monstrous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, scientist Bruce Banner goes on the run and isolates himself from his love,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Betty_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Betty Ross}}. Hunted by the military, Banner seeks to cure himself and prevent his condition from being weaponized.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In January 2006,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel reclaimed the film rights for the Hulk character from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Pictures}}\'a0after Universal failed to meet a deadline to develop a sequel to director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ang_Lee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ang Lee}}'s 2003 film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Universal retained distribution rights for future\'a0
\f1\i Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Instead of moving forward with a sequel, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Louis_Leterrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Louis Leterrier}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 , a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reboot}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Leterrier initially turned down the job out of respect for Lee, but later reconsidered and signed on.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The script was written by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zak_Penn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zak Penn}}, who drafted a treatment for the 2003 film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In April 2006,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edward_Norton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edward Norton}}\'a0entered negotiations to portray Bruce Banner and rewrite Penn's script,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [34]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0although Penn received sole credit for the screenplay.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production began on July 9, 2007 and filming primarily took place in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toronto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toronto}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The film premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gibson_Amphitheatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gibson Amphitheatre}}\'a0on June 8, 2008, and was released on June 13.

\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 ,

\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Downey briefly reprised his role from\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0as Tony Stark in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearance}}\'a0at the end of the film. Downey said that the filmmakers "were just cross-pollinating our superheroes. It happens to be a scene where I basically approach [actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Hurt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Hurt}}'s character General Ross], and we may be considering going into some sort of limited partnership together. The great thing is he\'97and I don't want to give too much away\'97but he's in disrepair at the time I find him. It was really fun seeing him play this really powerful character who's half in the bag."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In addition,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0is briefly seen frozen in ice in an alternate opening of the film, included in the DVD release.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After Tony Stark reveals himself to be Iron Man, the U.S. government demands he hand over his technology. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Hammer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a rival industrialist}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ivan_Vanko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a Russian scientist}}\'a0conspire to use his own technology against him.

\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The filmmakers continued to refer to other Marvel films by again including Captain America's shield. Favreau explained, "We introduced Captain America's shield briefly in one shot in the last film. So now it really was in his room, so we had to figure out how to deal with the reality that the shield was in his workshop."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A scene toward the end of\'a0

\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0displayed on a monitor to pointers on a map indicating several locales related to other Marvel films, including one pointing toward a region of Africa in reference to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Panther}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [56]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0appears as the child wearing an Iron Man mask whom Stark saves from a drone; the appearance was confirmed in June 2017 by Spider-Man actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Holland_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Holland}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kevin_Feige"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kevin Feige}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming"}}{\fldrslt

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [59]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, crown prince of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}, is banished to Earth and stripped of his powers after he reignites a dormant war. As his brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}, plots to take the throne for himself, Thor must prove himself worthy and reclaim his hammer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mj\'f6lnir}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [60]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Protosevich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Protosevich}}\'a0was hired to develop a script for\'a0
\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 \'a0in April 2006, after the rights were acquired from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sony_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sony Pictures}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In August 2007 Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Matthew_Vaughn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Matthew Vaughn}}\'a0to direct the film,

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [62]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In September 2008,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kenneth_Branagh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kenneth Branagh}}\'a0entered into negotiations to replace Vaughn.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In May 2009,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chris Hemsworth}}\'a0was in negotiations to portray the titular character,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [63]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Hiddleston"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Hiddleston}}was set to play his brother, Loki.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [64]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Both actors were contracted to star in several films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [65]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel hired the writing team of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ashley_Miller_(screenwriter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ashley Edward Miller}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zack_Stentz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zack Stentz}}\'a0to write a new script for the film, which was then rewritten by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Don_Payne_(writer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Don Payne}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production began on January 11, 2010 in Los Angeles, California,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [66]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0before moving to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galisteo,_New_Mexico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galisteo, New Mexico}}\'a0in March.

\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 ,

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clark_Gregg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clark Gregg}}, who appeared in\'a0

\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 . About his role in\'a0

\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 . And I was just very lucky that they chose to expand that character and [chose] to put him more into the universe of it."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [71]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0After signing on to appear as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton / Hawkeye}}\'a0in\'a0

\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [72]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Branagh said that they "were always going to have a guy in a basket above the action where Thor breaks in the S.H.I.E.L.D. camp", and that he was thrilled when the producers told him they wanted to use Renner's Hawkeye for that role.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [73]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [75]

\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [76]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1942, Steve Rogers is deemed physically unfit to enlist in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U.S._Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Army}}\'a0and fight the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Reich}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}. Recruited for a secret military operation, he is physically transformed into a super-soldier dubbed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0and must battle the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, head of a Nazi science division known as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [77]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \

Nick Fury, the director of S.H.I.E.L.D., gathers the superheroes Iron Man, Thor, Captain America, the Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye to fight Thor's brother Loki, who plots to subjugate the Earth.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [89]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [97]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gwyneth_Paltrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gwyneth Paltrow}}, who portrayed Pepper Potts in\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 , was included in the film at Downey's insistence. Prior to this, Whedon had not intended the film to include supporting characters from the heroes' individual films, commenting, "You need to separate the characters from their support systems in order to create the isolation you need for a team."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [98]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avi_Arad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avi Arad}}\'a0said that Sony Pictures and Disney discussed incorporating the OsCorp Tower from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [99]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but Feige said that "the deal was never close to happening."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [100]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The supervillain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0appears in a mid-credits scene, portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damion_Poitier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damion Poitier}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [101]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Billionaire industrialist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0builds himself a suit of armor after he is taken captive by a terrorist organization. Free from his captors, he decides to upgrade and don his armor in order to hunt down weapons that were sold under the table.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In April 2006, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Favreau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Favreau}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with the writing teams of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Art_Marcum_and_Matt_Holloway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Art Marcum and Matt Holloway}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Fergus_and_Hawk_Ostby"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Fergus and Hawk Ostby}}\'a0writing competing scripts.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4][17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Favreau consolidated both into one script, which was then polished by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_August"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John August}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Downey,_Jr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Downey, Jr.}}\'a0was cast in the title role in September 2006, after growing out a goatee and working out to convince the filmmakers he was right for the part.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Principal_photography"}}{\fldrslt

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caesars_Palace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caesars Palace}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas,_Nevada"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas, Nevada}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [24]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greater_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greater Union}}\'a0theater in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Street,_Sydney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Street, Sydney}}, on April 14, 2008,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [25]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and was released internationally on April 30, and in the United States on May 2.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The film ends with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}\'a0featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samuel L. Jackson}}\'a0as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, who approaches Stark regarding the "Avenger Initiative". Favreau said that he included the scene as "a little tip of the hat for the fans...a way to sort of tee up\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ." Jackson was only on set for a day, with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Skeleton_crew"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skeleton crew}}\'a0to avoid the news of his cameo leaking.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America's shield}}\'a0is also visible in the background of a scene; it was added by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ILM}}\'a0artist as a joke, and Favreau decided to leave it in the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After being exposed to gamma radiation that causes him to transform into the monstrous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, scientist Bruce Banner goes on the run and isolates himself from his love,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Betty_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Betty Ross}}. Hunted by the military, Banner seeks to cure himself and prevent his condition from being weaponized.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In January 2006,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel reclaimed the film rights for the Hulk character from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Pictures}}\'a0after Universal failed to meet a deadline to develop a sequel to director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ang_Lee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ang Lee}}'s 2003 film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Universal retained distribution rights for future\'a0
\f1\i Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Instead of moving forward with a sequel, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Louis_Leterrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Louis Leterrier}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i The Incredible Hulk

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Leterrier initially turned down the job out of respect for Lee, but later reconsidered and signed on.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The script was written by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zak_Penn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zak Penn}}, who drafted a treatment for the 2003 film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In April 2006,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edward_Norton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edward Norton}}\'a0entered negotiations to portray Bruce Banner and rewrite Penn's script,

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production began on July 9, 2007 and filming primarily took place in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toronto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toronto}},

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The film premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gibson_Amphitheatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gibson Amphitheatre}}\'a0on June 8, 2008, and was released on June 13.

\f1\i Iron Man 2

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Downey briefly reprised his role from\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0as Tony Stark in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearance}}\'a0at the end of the film. Downey said that the filmmakers "were just cross-pollinating our superheroes. It happens to be a scene where I basically approach [actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Hurt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Hurt}}'s character General Ross], and we may be considering going into some sort of limited partnership together. The great thing is he\'97and I don't want to give too much away\'97but he's in disrepair at the time I find him. It was really fun seeing him play this really powerful character who's half in the bag."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In addition,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0is briefly seen frozen in ice in an alternate opening of the film, included in the DVD release.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42]

After Tony Stark reveals himself to be Iron Man, the U.S. government demands he hand over his technology. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Hammer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a rival industrialist}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ivan_Vanko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a Russian scientist}}\'a0conspire to use his own technology against him.

\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The filmmakers continued to refer to other Marvel films by again including Captain America's shield. Favreau explained, "We introduced Captain America's shield briefly in one shot in the last film. So now it really was in his room, so we had to figure out how to deal with the reality that the shield was in his workshop."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A scene toward the end of\'a0

\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0displayed on a monitor to pointers on a map indicating several locales related to other Marvel films, including one pointing toward a region of Africa in reference to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Panther}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [56]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0appears as the child wearing an Iron Man mask whom Stark saves from a drone; the appearance was confirmed in June 2017 by Spider-Man actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Holland_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Holland}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kevin_Feige"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kevin Feige}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spider-Man: Homecoming}}\'a0director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Watts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Watts}}.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [59]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \

As his brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}, plots to take the throne for himself, Thor must prove himself worthy and reclaim his hammer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mj\'f6lnir}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [60]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Protosevich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Protosevich}}\'a0was hired to develop a script for\'a0
\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 \'a0in April 2006, after the rights were acquired from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sony_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sony Pictures}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In August 2007 Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Matthew_Vaughn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Matthew Vaughn}}\'a0to direct the film,

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In May 2009,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chris Hemsworth}}\'a0was in negotiations to portray the titular character,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [63]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Hiddleston"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Hiddleston}}was set to play his brother, Loki.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [64]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Both actors were contracted to star in several films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [65]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel hired the writing team of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ashley_Miller_(screenwriter)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ashley Edward Miller}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zack_Stentz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zack Stentz}}\'a0to write a new script for the film, which was then rewritten by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Don_Payne_(writer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Don Payne}}.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [66]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0before moving to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galisteo,_New_Mexico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galisteo, New Mexico}}\'a0in March.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [76]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1942, Steve Rogers is deemed physically unfit to enlist in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U.S._Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Army}}\'a0and fight the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Reich}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}. Recruited for a secret military operation, he is physically transformed into a super-soldier dubbed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0and must battle the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, head of a Nazi science division known as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [77]

Nick Fury, the director of S.H.I.E.L.D., gathers the superheroes Iron Man, Thor, Captain America, the Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye to fight Thor's brother Loki, who plots to subjugate the Earth.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [97]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gwyneth_Paltrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gwyneth Paltrow}}, who portrayed Pepper Potts in\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 , was included in the film at Downey's insistence. Prior to this, Whedon had not intended the film to include supporting characters from the heroes' individual films, commenting, "You need to separate the characters from their support systems in order to create the isolation you need for a team."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [98]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avi_Arad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avi Arad}}\'a0said that Sony Pictures and Disney discussed incorporating the OsCorp Tower from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt
