\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [99]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but Feige said that "the deal was never close to happening."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [100]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The supervillain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0appears in a mid-credits scene, portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damion_Poitier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damion Poitier}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [101]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Having acquired the Power Stone, one of the six\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}, from the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Xandar#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Xandar}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0and his lieutenants\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ebony_Maw"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ebony Maw}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Dwarf_(comics)#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cull Obsidian}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Proxima_Midnight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Proxima Midnight}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Corvus_Glaive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Corvus Glaive}}\'97intercept a spaceship carrying the last survivors of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0As they extract the Space Stone from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cosmic_Cube"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tesseract}}, Thanos subdues\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, overpowers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, and kills\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}. The latter of which sends the Hulk to Earth using the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st#Adaptations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st}}\'a0before being killed. Thanos departs with his lieutenants and obliterates the ship.\
Hulk crash-lands at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sanctum_Sanctorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sanctum Sanctorum}}\'a0in New York City, reverting to Bruce Banner. He warns\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Strange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Strange}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wong_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wong}}\'a0about Thanos' plan to kill half of all life in the universe; in response, Strange recruits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}. Maw and Obsidian arrive to retrieve the Time Stone from Strange, drawing the attention of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}. Maw captures Strange, but fails to take the Time Stone due to an enchantment. Stark and Parker pursue Maw's spaceship, Banner contacts\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}, and Wong stays behind to guard the Sanctum.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edinburgh"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edinburgh}}, Midnight and Glaive ambush\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlet_Witch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}\'a0in order to retrieve the Mind Stone in Vision's forehead. Rogers,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}\'a0rescue them and take shelter with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0and Banner at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'a0Facility. Vision offers to sacrifice himself by having Maximoff destroy the Mind Stone to keep Thanos from retrieving it, but Maximoff refuses. Rogers suggests they travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakanda}}, which he believes has the resources to remove the stone without destroying Vision.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(2008_team)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Guardians of the Galaxy}}\'a0respond to a distress call from the Asgardian ship and rescue Thor, who surmises Thanos seeks the Reality Stone, which is in the possession of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Collector_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Collector}}\'a0on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knowhere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knowhere}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocket_Raccoon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocket}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Groot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Groot}}accompany Thor to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nidavellir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nidavellir}}, where they and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eitri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eitri}}\'a0create Stormbreaker, a battle-axe capable of killing Thanos. On Knowhere,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star-Lord"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Quill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gamora}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drax}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mantis}}\'a0find Thanos with the Reality Stone already in his possession. Thanos kidnaps Gamora, his adopted daughter, who reveals the location of the Soul Stone to save her captive adopted sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nebula_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nebula}}\'a0from torture. Thanos and Gamora travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_planets_in_Marvel_Comics#Vormir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vormir}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, keeper of the Soul Stone, informs him the stone can only be retrieved by sacrificing someone he loves. Thanos reluctantly kills Gamora, earning the stone.\
Nebula escapes captivity and asks the remaining Guardians to meet her on Thanos' destroyed homeworld,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Titan_(Marvel_Comics_location)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Titan}}. Stark and Parker kill Maw and rescue Strange. Landing on Titan, they meet Quill, Drax, and Mantis. The group forms a plan to remove Thanos' Infinity Gauntlet after Strange uses the Time Stone to view millions of possible futures, seeing only one in which Thanos loses. Thanos arrives, revealing his plans to be necessary to ensure the survival of a universe threatened by overpopulation. The group subdues him until Nebula deduces that Thanos has killed Gamora. Enraged, Quill attacks him, allowing Thanos to break the group's hold and overpower them. Stark is seriously wounded by Thanos, but is spared after Strange surrenders the Time Stone.\
In Wakanda, Rogers reunites with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0before Thanos' army invades. The Avengers, alongside\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}\'a0and the Wakandan forces, mount a defense while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shuri}}\'a0works to extract the Mind Stone from Vision. Banner, unable to transform into the Hulk, fights in Stark's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulkbuster_armor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulkbuster armor}}. Thor, Rocket, and Groot arrive to reinforce the Avengers; Midnight, Obsidian, and Glaive are killed and their army is routed. Despite Maximoff's attempt to destroy the Mind Stone, Thanos arrives and reverts time to remove it from Vision's head, killing him.\
Thor severely wounds Thanos, but Thanos activates the completed Infinity Gauntlet and teleports away. Half of all life across the universe disintegrates, including Barnes, T'Challa, Groot, Maximoff, Wilson, Mantis, Drax, Quill, Strange, and Parker, as well as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, although Fury is able to transmit a signal first.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Stark and Nebula remain on Titan while Banner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Man-Ape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M'Baku}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Okoye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Okoye}}, Rhodes, Rocket, Rogers, Romanoff, and Thor are left on the Wakandan battlefield. Meanwhile, Thanos watches a sunrise on another planet.\
Thousands of years ago, five African tribes war over a meteorite containing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vibranium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vibranium}}. One warrior ingests a "heart-shaped herb" affected by the metal and gains superhuman abilities, becoming the first "Black Panther". He unites all but the Jabari Tribe to form the nation of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakanda}}. Over centuries, the Wakandans use the vibranium to develop advanced technology and isolate themselves from the world by posing as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Third_World"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Third World}}country. In 1992, Wakanda's King\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Chaka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Chaka}}\'a0visits his brother N'Jobu, who is working undercover in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Oakland,_California"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Oakland, California}}. T'Chaka accuses N'Jobu of assisting black-market arms dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klaw_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ulysses Klaue}}\'a0with stealing vibranium from Wakanda. N'Jobu's partner reveals he is\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zuri}}, another undercover Wakandan, and confirms T'Chaka's suspicions.\
In the present day, following T'Chaka's death,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0his son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Challa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}\'a0returns to Wakanda to assume the throne. He and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Okoye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Okoye}}, the leader of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dora_Milaje"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dora Milaje}}\'a0regiment, extract T'Challa's ex-lover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Malice_(Nakia)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nakia}}\'a0from an undercover assignment so she can attend his coronation ceremony with his mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ramonda_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ramonda}}\'a0and younger sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shuri_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shuri}}. At the ceremony, the Jabari Tribe's leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Man-Ape"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 M'Baku}}\'a0challenges T'Challa for the crown in ritual combat. T'Challa defeats M'Baku and persuades him to yield rather than die.\
When Klaue and his accomplice\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Killmonger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Stevens}}\'a0steal a Wakandan artifact from a London museum, T'Challa's friend and Okoye's lover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/W%27Kabi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 W'Kabi}}\'a0urges him to bring Klaue back alive. T'Challa, Okoye, and Nakia travel to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Busan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Busan, South Korea}}, where Klaue plans to sell the artifact to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 CIA}}\'a0agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Everett_K._Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Everett K. Ross}}. A firefight erupts and Klaue attempts to flee but is caught by T'Challa, who reluctantly releases him to Ross' custody. Klaue tells Ross that Wakanda's international image is a front for a technologically advanced civilization. Erik attacks and extracts Klaue as Ross is gravely injured protecting Nakia. Rather than pursue Klaue, T'Challa takes Ross to Wakanda, where their technology can save him.\
While Shuri heals Ross, T'Challa confronts Zuri about N'Jobu. Zuri explains that N'Jobu planned to share Wakanda's technology with people of African descent around the world to help them conquer their oppressors. As T'Chaka arrested N'Jobu, the latter attacked Zuri and forced T'Chaka to kill him. T'Chaka ordered Zuri to lie that N'Jobu had disappeared and left behind N'Jobu's American son in order to maintain the lie. This boy grew up to be Stevens, a U.S.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_ops"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 black ops}}\'a0soldier who adopted the name "Killmonger". Meanwhile, Killmonger kills Klaue and takes his body to Wakanda. He is brought before the tribal elders, revealing his identity to be N'Jadaka and claim to the throne. Killmonger challenges T'Challa to ritual combat, where he kills Zuri, defeats T'Challa, and hurls him over a waterfall to his presumed death. Killmonger ingests the heart-shaped herb and orders the rest incinerated, but Nakia extracts one first. Killmonger, supported by W'Kabi and his army, prepares to distribute shipments of Wakandan weapons to operatives around the world.\
Nakia, Shuri, Ramonda, and Ross flee to the Jabari Tribe for aid. They find a comatose T'Challa, rescued by the Jabari in repayment for sparing M'Baku's life. Healed by Nakia's herb, T'Challa returns to fight Killmonger, who dons his own Black Panther suit. W'Kabi and his army fight Shuri, Nakia, and the Dora Milaje, while Ross remotely pilots a jet and shoots down planes carrying the vibranium weapons. M'Baku and the Jabari arrive to reinforce T'Challa. Confronted by Okoye, W'Kabi and his army stand down. Fighting in Wakanda's vibranium mine, T'Challa disrupts Killmonger's suit and stabs him. Killmonger refuses to be healed, choosing to die a free man rather than be incarcerated.\
T'Challa establishes an outreach center at the building where N'Jobu died, to be run by Nakia and Shuri. In a mid-credits scene, T'Challa appears before the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Nations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Nations}}\'a0to reveal Wakanda's true nature to the world. In a post-credits scene, Shuri helps\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0with his recuperation.\
In 1991, the brainwashed super-soldier\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James "Bucky" Barnes}}\'a0is dispatched from a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}\'a0base in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Siberia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Siberia}}\'a0to intercept an automobile carrying a case of super-soldier serum. In the present day, approximately one year after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ultron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ultron}}'s defeat in the nation of Sokovia at the hands of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Scarlet_Witch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}\'a0stop\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crossbones_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brock Rumlow}}\'a0from stealing a biological weapon from a lab in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lagos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lagos}}. Rumlow blows himself up, attempting to kill Rogers. Maximoff telekinetically contains the explosion and throws it upward, damaging a nearby building and accidentally killing several\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakandan}}\'a0humanitarian workers.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Secretary of State}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thunderbolt_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thaddeus Ross}}\'a0informs the Avengers that the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_Nations"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 United Nations}}\'a0(UN) is preparing to pass the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Registration_acts_(comics)#Marvel_Cinematic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sokovia Accords}}, which will establish a UN panel to oversee and control the team. The Avengers are divided:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0supports oversight because of his role in Ultron's creation and Sokovia's devastation, while Rogers has more faith in his own judgment than that of a government. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helmut_Zemo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helmut Zemo}}\'a0tracks down and kills Barnes' old Hydra handler, stealing a book containing the trigger words that activate Barnes' brainwashing. At a conference in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vienna"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vienna}}\'a0where the Accords are to be ratified, a bomb kills King\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%27Chaka"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Chaka}}\'a0of Wakanda. Security footage indicates the bomber is Barnes, whom T'Chaka's son,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T'Challa}}, vows to kill. Informed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sharon_Carter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sharon Carter}}\'a0of Barnes' whereabouts and the authorities' intentions to kill him, Rogers decides to try to bring in Barnes\'97his childhood friend and war comrade\'97himself. Rogers and Wilson track Barnes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucharest"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucharest}}\'a0and attempt to protect him from T'Challa and the authorities, but all four, including T'Challa, are apprehended.\
Impersonating a psychiatrist sent to interview Barnes, Zemo recites the words to make Barnes obey him. He questions Barnes, then sends him on a rampage to cover his own escape. Rogers stops Barnes and sneaks him away. When Barnes regains his senses, he explains that Zemo is the real Vienna bomber and wanted the location of the Siberian Hydra base, where other brainwashed "Winter Soldiers" are kept in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Suspended_animation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cryogenic stasis}}. Unwilling to wait for authorization to apprehend Zemo, Rogers and Wilson go rogue, and recruit Maximoff,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ant-Man_(Scott_Lang)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scott Lang}}\'a0to their cause. With Ross's permission, Stark assembles a team composed of Romanoff, T'Challa,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0to capture the renegades. Stark's team intercepts Rogers' group at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leipzig/Halle_Airport"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leipzig/Halle Airport}}, where they fight until Romanoff allows Rogers and Barnes to escape. The rest of Rogers' team is captured and detained at the Raft prison, while Rhodes is partially paralyzed after being inadvertently shot down by Vision, and Romanoff goes into exile.\
Stark discovers evidence that Barnes was framed by Zemo and convinces Wilson to give him Rogers' destination. Without informing Ross, Stark goes to the Siberian Hydra facility and strikes a truce with Rogers and Barnes, unaware that they were secretly followed by T'Challa. They find that the other super-soldiers have been killed by Zemo, who then shows them footage that reveals that the automobile Barnes had intercepted in 1991 contained Stark's parents, whom Barnes subsequently killed. Enraged that Rogers kept this from him, Stark turns on them both, leading to an intense fight, in which Stark destroys Barnes' robotic arm, and Rogers disables\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor_in_other_media#Live_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark's armor}}. He departs with Barnes, leaving\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his shield}}\'a0behind. Satisfied that he has avenged his family's deaths in Sokovia from the Avengers' actions by successfully fracturing them, Zemo attempts suicide, but he is stopped by T'Challa and taken to the authorities.\
In the aftermath, Stark provides Rhodes with exoskeletal leg braces that allow him to walk again, while Rogers breaks his allies out of the Raft. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mid-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, Barnes, granted asylum in Wakanda, chooses to return to cryogenic sleep until a cure for his brainwashing is found. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Parker explores the features of the web shooters built for him by Stark.\
Following the Battle of New York,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Adrian_Toomes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Adrian Toomes}}\'a0and his salvage company are contracted to clean up the city, but their operation is taken over by the Department of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damage_Control_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damage Control}}\'a0(D.O.D.C.), a partnership between\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0and the U.S. government. Enraged at being driven out of business, Toomes persuades his employees to keep the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chitauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chitauri}}\'a0technology they have already scavenged and use it to create and sell advanced weapons. Eight years later,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peter_Parker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0is drafted into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'a0by Stark to help with an internal dispute,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but resumes his studies at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Midtown_High_School"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Midtown School of Science and Technology}}\'a0when Stark tells him he is not yet ready to become a full Avenger.\
Parker quits his school's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Academic_decathlon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 academic decathlon}}\'a0team to spend more time focusing on his crime-fighting activities as Spider-Man. One night, after preventing criminals from robbing an ATM with their advanced weapons from Toomes, Parker returns to his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Queens"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Queens}}\'a0apartment where his best friend Ned discovers his secret identity. On another night, Parker comes across Toomes' associates\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Montana_(comics)#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jackson Brice / Shocker}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shocker_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Herman Schultz}}\'a0selling weapons to local criminal\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Prowler_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aaron Davis}}. Parker saves Davis before being caught by Toomes and dropped in a lake, nearly drowning after becoming tangled in a parachute built into his suit. He is rescued by Stark, who is monitoring the Spider-Man suit he gave Parker and warns him against further involvement with the criminals. Toomes accidentally kills Brice with one of their weapons, and Schultz becomes the new Shocker.\
Parker and Ned study a weapon left behind by Brice, removing its power core. When a tracking device on Schultz leads to Maryland, Parker rejoins the decathlon team and accompanies them to Washington, D.C. for their national tournament. Ned and Parker disable the tracker Stark implanted in the Spider-Man suit, and unlock its advanced features. Parker tries to stop Toomes from stealing weapons from a D.O.D.C. truck, but is trapped inside the truck, causing him to miss the decathlon tournament. When he discovers that the power core is an unstable Chitauri grenade, Parker races to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Washington_Monument"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Washington Monument}}\'a0where the core explodes and traps Ned and their friends in an elevator. Evading local authorities, Parker saves his friends, including his fellow classmate and crush\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Liz_Allan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Liz}}. Returning to New York City, Parker persuades Davis to reveal Toomes' whereabouts. Aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Staten_Island_Ferry"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Staten Island Ferry}}, Parker captures Toomes' new buyer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mac_Gargan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mac Gargan}}, but Toomes escapes and a malfunctioning weapon tears the ferry in half. Stark helps Parker save the passengers and takes away the suit as a result of his recklessness.\
Parker returns to his high school life, and eventually asks Liz to go to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Homecoming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 homecoming}}\'a0dance with him. On the night of the dance, Parker learns that Toomes is Liz\'92s father. Deducing Parker's secret identity from Liz's account about him, Toomes threatens retaliation if he interferes with his plans. During the dance, Parker realizes Toomes is planning to hijack a D.O.D.C. plane transporting weapons from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers Tower}}\'a0to the team's new headquarters, dons his old homemade Spider-Man suit and races to Toomes' lair. He is first ambushed by Schultz, but defeats him with the help of Ned. At the lair, Toomes destroys the building's support beams and leaves Parker to die. Parker escapes the rubble and intercepts the plane, steering it to crash on the beach near\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coney_Island"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coney Island}}. He and Toomes continue fighting, ending with Parker saving Toomes' life after the damaged Vulture suit explodes, and leaving him for the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City_Police_Department"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 police}}\'a0along with the plane's cargo. After her father's arrest, Liz moves away, and Parker declines an invitation from Stark to join the Avengers full-time. Stark returns Parker's suit, which he puts on in his bedroom just as his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aunt_May"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aunt May}}\'a0walks in.\
In a mid-credits scene, an incarcerated Gargan approaches Toomes in prison. Gargan has heard that Toomes knows Spider-Man's real identity, which Toomes denies.\
In 2014,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star-Lord"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Quill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gamora}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drax}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocket_Raccoon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocket}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Groot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baby Groot}}\'a0are renowned as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(2008_team)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Guardians of the Galaxy}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kismet_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ayesha}}, leader of the Sovereign race, has the Guardians protect valuable batteries from an inter-dimensional monster in exchange for Gamora's estranged sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nebula_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nebula}}, who was caught attempting to steal the batteries. After Rocket steals some for himself, the Sovereign attacks the Guardians' ship with a fleet of drones. These are destroyed by a mysterious figure, and the Guardians crash-land on a nearby planet. There, this figure reveals himself as Quill's father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ego_the_Living_Planet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ego}}, and invites Quill, Gamora, and Drax to his home planet. Rocket and Groot remain behind to repair the ship and guard Nebula.\
Ayesha hires\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yondu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yondu Udonta}}\'a0and his crew, who have been exiled from the greater Ravager community for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Human_trafficking"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 child trafficking}}, to recapture the Guardians. They capture Rocket, but when Yondu hesitates to turn over Quill, whom he raised, his lieutenant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Taserface"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Taserface}}\'a0leads a mutiny with help from Nebula. Taserface imprisons Rocket and Yondu aboard the latter's ship and executes his loyalists by releasing them into space. Nebula leaves to find and kill Gamora, whom she blames for the torture inflicted on her by their father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}. While imprisoned, Rocket and Yondu bond. Groot and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kraglin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kraglin}}, a remaining Yondu loyalist, free Rocket and Yondu, and they destroy the ship and its crew as they escape, though not before Taserface warns the Sovereign.\
Ego, a god-like\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Celestial_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Celestial}}\'a0that manipulated the matter around its consciousness to form this "home" planet, explains that it projected a humanoid guise to travel the universe and discover a purpose, eventually falling in love with Quill's mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Meredith_Quill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Meredith}}. Ego hired Yondu to collect the young Quill after Meredith's death, but the boy was never delivered and Ego has been searching for him ever since. He teaches Quill to manipulate Celestial power. Nebula arrives at Ego's planet and tries to kill Gamora, but the pair reach an uneasy alliance when they discover a cavern filled with skeletal remains. Ego reveals to Quill that in his travels, he planted seedlings on thousands of worlds which can\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Terraforming"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 terraform}}\'a0into new extensions of himself, but they can only be activated by the power of two Celestials. To that end, he impregnated countless women and hired Yondu to collect the children, but killed them all when they failed to access the Celestial power. Under Ego's influence, Quill helps him activate the seedlings, which begin to consume every world, but Quill fights back when Ego reveals that he gave Meredith the tumour that killed her due to the distraction she posed.\
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mantis}}, Ego's na\'efve\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Empath_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 empath}}\'a0servant, grows close to Drax and warns him of Ego's plan. Gamora and Nebula also learn of the plan as Rocket, Yondu, Groot, and Kraglin arrive. As they come under attack from the Sovereign's drones, the reunited Guardians find Ego's brain at the planet's core. Rocket makes a bomb using the stolen batteries, which Groot plants on the brain. Quill fights Ego with his newfound Celestial powers to distract him long enough for the other Guardians and Mantis to escape. The bomb explodes, killing Ego and disintegrating the planet. Yondu sacrifices himself to save Quill, who realizes that the reason Yondu kept him was to spare him from the fate of Ego's other progeny, and that Yondu was Quill's true "daddy". Having reconciled with Gamora, Nebula still chooses to leave and resume her quest to kill Thanos by herself. The Guardians hold a funeral for Yondu, which is attended by Kraglin and dozens of Ravager ships, acknowledging Yondu's sacrifice and accepting him as a Ravager again.\
In a series of mid- and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credit_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credit scenes}}, Kraglin takes up Yondu's telekinetic arrow and control-fin; Ravager leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Starhawk_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stakar Ogord}}\'a0reunites with his ex-teammates; Groot has grown into a teenager;
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Ayesha creates a new artificial being with whom she plans to destroy the Guardians, naming him Adam;
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and a group of uninterested\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Watcher_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Watchers}}\'a0abandon their informant, who is discussing his experiences on Earth.\
Two years after the battle of Sokovia,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}\'a0is imprisoned by the fire demon\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Surtur_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Surtur}}, who reveals that Thor's father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Odin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Odin}}\'a0is no longer on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}. He explains that the realm will soon be destroyed during the prophesied\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ragnar\'f6k}}, once Surtur unites his crown with the Eternal Flame that burns in Odin's vault. Thor frees himself, defeats Surtur and takes his crown, believing he has prevented Ragnar\'f6k.\
Thor returns to Asgard to find\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}\'a0gone and his brother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0posing as Odin. After exposing Loki, Thor forces him to help find their father, and with directions from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Strange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Strange}}\'a0on Earth, they locate Odin in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Norway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Norway}}. Odin explains that he is dying and Ragnar\'f6k is imminent despite Thor's efforts to prevent it. He then reveals his passing will allow his firstborn child,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hela_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hela}}, to escape from a prison she was sealed in long ago. Hela was the leader of Asgard's armies, conquering the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nine_worlds"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nine Realms}}\'a0with Odin, but Odin imprisoned her and wrote her out of history after he feared that she had become too ambitious and powerful. Odin dies as Thor and Loki watch on, and Hela appears, destroying Thor's hammer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mjolnir_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mjolnir}}. She pursues the two as they attempt to flee through the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st Bridge}}, forcing them out into space. Arriving in Asgard, she defeats its army and kills the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warriors_Three"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warriors Three}}. She then resurrects the ancient dead who once fought with her, including her giant wolf\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fenris_Wolf_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fenris}}, and appoints the Asgardian\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Executioner_(comics)#Skurge"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Skurge}}\'a0as her executioner. Hela plans to use the Bifr\'f6st to expand Asgard's empire, but Heimdall sneaks in, takes the sword that controls the Bridge and begins hiding other Asgardians.\
Thor crash-lands on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sakaar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sakaar}}, a garbage planet surrounded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormholes}}. A slave trader designated\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valkyrie_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scrapper 142}}\'a0subdues him with an obedience disk and sells him as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gladiator"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gladiator}}\'a0to Sakaar's ruler, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Grandmaster_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Grandmaster}}, with whom Loki has already ingratiated himself. Thor recognizes 142 as one of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Valkyrior"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Valkyrior}}, a legendary force of female warriors who were killed fighting Hela long ago. Thor is forced to compete in the Grandmaster's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Marvel_Super_Hero_Contest_of_Champions"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Contest of Champions}}, facing his old friend\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}. Summoning lightning, Thor gets the upper hand, but the Grandmaster sabotages the fight to ensure Hulk's victory. Still enslaved after the fight, Thor attempts to convince Hulk and 142 to help him save Asgard, but neither is willing. He soon manages to escape the palace and finds the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quinjet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quinjet}}\'a0that brought Hulk to Sakaar. Hulk follows Thor to the Quinjet, where a recording of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Natasha_Romanoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}makes him transform back into Bruce Banner for the first time since Sokovia.\
The Grandmaster orders 142 and Loki to find Thor and Hulk, but the pair come to blows and Loki forces her to relive the deaths of her fellow Valkyrior at the hands of Hela. Deciding to help Thor, she takes Loki captive. Unwilling to be left behind, Loki provides the group with the means to steal one of the Grandmaster's ships. They then liberate the other gladiators who, led by
\fs20 \super [{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wikipedia:Accuracy_dispute#Disputed_statement"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 dubious}}
\f1\i \'a0\'96\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Talk:Thor:_Ragnarok#Dubious"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 discuss}}
\f0\i0 ]
\fs24 \nosupersub \'a0two aliens named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Korg_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Korg}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miek"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miek}}, stage a revolution. Loki again attempts to betray his brother, but Thor anticipates this and leaves him behind, where Korg, Miek, and the gladiators soon find him. Thor, Banner, and 142 escape through a wormhole to Asgard, where Hela's forces are attacking Heimdall and the remaining Asgardians in pursuit of the sword that controls the Bifr\'f6st. Banner chooses to become Hulk again, defeating Fenris, while Thor and 142 battle Hela and her warriors. Loki and the gladiators arrive to rescue the citizens, and a repentant Skurge sacrifices himself to enable their escape. Thor, facing Hela, loses his right eye and then has a vision of Odin that helps him realize only Ragnar\'f6k can stop her. He sends Loki to retrieve Surtur's crown and place it in the Eternal Flame. Surtur is reborn and destroys Asgard, seemingly killing Hela.\
Aboard the Grandmaster's spaceship, Thor, now king, decides to take his people to Earth. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mid-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, they are intercepted by a large spacecraft.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the Grandmaster is confronted by his former subjects.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kathmandu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kathmandu}}, the sorcerer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kaecilius"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kaecilius}}\'a0and his zealots enter the secret compound\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kamar-Taj"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kamar-Taj}}\'a0and behead its librarian. They steal a few pages from an ancient, mystical text belonging to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ancient_One"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ancient One}}, a long-lived sorcerer who has taught every student at Kamar-Taj, including Kaecilius, in the mystic arts. The Ancient One pursues the traitors, but Kaecilius and his followers escape.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stephen_Strange"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stephen Strange}}, a wealthy, acclaimed, and arrogant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Neurosurgeon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 neurosurgeon}}, severely injures his hands in a car accident, leaving him unable to operate. Fellow surgeon and former lover\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Night_Nurse_(comics)#Christine_Palmer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Christine Palmer}}\'a0tries to help him move on, but Strange vainly pursues experimental surgeries to heal his hands, nearly bankrupting himself. Strange learns about Jonathan Pangborn, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Paraplegia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 paraplegic}}\'a0who mysteriously regained use of his legs. Pangborn directs Strange to Kamar-Taj, where he is taken in by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baron_Mordo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mordo}}, a sorcerer under the Ancient One. The Ancient One demonstrates her power to Strange, revealing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Astral_plane"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astral plane}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Marvel_Comics_dimensions"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 other dimensions}}\'a0such as the Mirror Dimension. She reluctantly agrees to train Strange, whose arrogance and ambition remind her of Kaecilius.\
Strange studies under the Ancient One and Mordo, and from ancient books in the library that is now guarded by Master\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wong_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wong}}. Strange learns that Earth is protected from threats from other dimensions by a shield generated from three buildings called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sanctum_Sanctorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sanctums}}, in New York City,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/London"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 London}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hong_Kong"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hong Kong}}, which are all connected and accessible from Kamar-Taj. The sorcerers' task is to protect the Sanctums, though Pangborn instead chose to channel mystical energy only into walking again. Strange progresses quickly, and secretly reads the text from which Kaecilius stole pages, learning to bend time with the mystical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eye_of_Agamotto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eye of Agamotto}}. Mordo and Wong warn Strange against breaking the laws of nature, drawing a comparison to Kaecilius' desire for eternal life.\
Kaecilius uses the stolen pages to contact\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dormammu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dormammu}}\'a0of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dark_Dimension_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dark Dimension}}, where time is non-existent. Kaecilius destroys the London Sanctum to weaken Earth's protection. The zealots then attack the New York Sanctum, killing its guardian, but Strange holds them off with the help of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cloak of Levitation}}\'a0until Mordo and the Ancient One arrive. Mordo becomes disillusioned with the Ancient One after Strange reveals that the Ancient One has been drawing power from the Dark Dimension to sustain her long life. After a fight in the Mirror Dimension of New York, Kaecilius mortally wounds the Ancient One and escapes to Hong Kong. Before dying, she tells Strange that he too will have to bend the rules to complement Mordo's steadfast nature in order to defeat Kaecilius. Strange and Mordo arrive in Hong Kong to find Wong dead, the Sanctum destroyed, and the Dark Dimension engulfing Earth. Strange uses the Eye to reverse time and save Wong, then enters the Dark Dimension and creates a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Time_loop"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 time loop}}\'a0around himself and Dormammu. After repeatedly killing Strange to no avail, Dormammu finally gives in to Strange's demand that he leave Earth and take Kaecilius and his zealots with him in return for Strange breaking the loop.\
Disillusioned by Strange and the Ancient One defying nature's laws, Mordo departs. Strange returns the Eye to Kamar-Taj, and takes up residence in the New York Sanctum to continue his studies. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mid-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, Strange decides to help\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, who has brought his brother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0to Earth to search for their father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Odin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Odin}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Mordo confronts Pangborn and steals the mystical energy that possessed him, telling him that Earth has "too many sorcerers".\
Two years after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ant-Man_(Scott_Lang)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scott Lang}}\'a0was placed on house arrest due to his involvement with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'a0in violation of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Registration_Acts_(comics)#Marvel_Cinematic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sokovia Accords}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hank_Pym"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hank Pym}}\'a0and his daughter,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hope_Pym"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hope van Dyne,}}\'a0briefly manage to open a tunnel to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Features_of_the_Marvel_Universe#Extradimensional_places"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quantum realm}}. They believe Hank's wife,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wasp_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Janet van Dyne}}, might be trapped there after shrinking to sub-atomic levels in 1987. When he had previously visited the quantum realm, Scott had unknowingly become\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Quantum_entanglement"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quantum entangled}}\'a0with Janet, and now he receives an apparent message from her.\
With only three days left of house arrest, Scott contacts Hank about Janet despite the strained relationship they have due to Scott's actions with the Avengers. Hope and Hank kidnap Scott, leaving a decoy so as not to arouse suspicion from FBI agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jimmy_Woo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jimmy Woo}}. Believing the message from Janet to be confirmation that she is alive, the trio work to build a stable quantum tunnel so they can take a vehicle to the quantum realm and retrieve her. They arrange to buy a part needed for the tunnel from black market dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sonny_Burch"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sonny Burch}}, who has realized the potential profit that can be earned from Hank's research and double-crosses them. Donning the Wasp outfit, Hope fights off Sonny and his men until she is attacked by a quantumly unstable masked woman. Scott tries to help fight off this "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ghost_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ghost}}", but the woman escapes with Hank's lab, which has been shrunk down to the size of a suitcase.\
Hank reluctantly visits his estranged former partner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bill_Foster_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bill Foster,}}\'a0with Hope and Scott. Bill helps them locate the lab, where the ghost captures the trio and reveals herself to be Ava Starr. Her father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Egghead_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Elihas}}, another of Hank's former partners, died along with his wife during the experiment that caused Ava's unstable state. Bill reveals that he has been helping Ava, whom they plan to cure using Janet's quantum energy. Believing that this will kill Janet, Hank refuses to help them and escapes with Hope, Scott, and the lab.\
Opening a stable version of the tunnel, Hank, Hope, and Scott are able to contact Janet, who gives them a precise location to find her but warns that they only have two hours before the unstable nature of the realm separates them for a century. Sonny learns the trio's location from Scott's business partners\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luis_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luis}}, Dave, and Kurt, and informs a contact at the FBI. Luis warns Scott, who rushes home before Jimmy Woo can see him violating his house arrest. Hank and Hope are arrested by the FBI, allowing Ava to take the lab.\
Scott is soon able to help Hank and Hope escape custody, and they find the lab. Scott and Hope distract Ava while Hank enters the quantum realm to retrieve Janet, but Burch and his men also attack Scott and Hope which allows Ava to begin forcibly taking Janet's energy. Luis, Dave, and Kurt help incapacitate Sonny and his men so that Scott and Hope can stop Ava. Hank and Janet return safely from the quantum realm, and Janet voluntarily gifts some of her energy to Ava to temporarily stabilize her. When the authorities arrive, everyone flees the scene. A regretful Ava urges Bill to leave her behind, though he refuses and the pair go into hiding.\
Scott returns home once again, in time for a now suspicious Woo to release him at the end of his house arrest. Now a free man, Scott goes to work with his friends at their security company and rekindles his relationship with Hope. Hank and Janet travel to a tropical island where Hank unshrinks their old house on the beach.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}}, Hank, Scott, Hope, and Janet plan to harvest quantum energy to help Ava remain stable. While Scott is in the quantum realm doing this, the other three disintegrate.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Billionaire industrialist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0builds himself a suit of armor after he is taken captive by a terrorist organization. Free from his captors, he decides to upgrade and don his armor in order to hunt down weapons that were sold under the table.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In April 2006, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Favreau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Favreau}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with the writing teams of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Art_Marcum_and_Matt_Holloway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Art Marcum and Matt Holloway}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Fergus_and_Hawk_Ostby"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Fergus and Hawk Ostby}}\'a0writing competing scripts.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4][17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Favreau consolidated both into one script, which was then polished by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_August"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John August}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Downey,_Jr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Downey, Jr.}}\'a0was cast in the title role in September 2006, after growing out a goatee and working out to convince the filmmakers he was right for the part.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [18]{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Principal_photography"}}{\fldrslt

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [20]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [23]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Caesars_Palace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Caesars Palace}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Las_Vegas,_Nevada"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Las Vegas, Nevada}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [24]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greater_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greater Union}}\'a0theater in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/George_Street,_Sydney"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 George Street, Sydney}}, on April 14, 2008,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [25]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and was released internationally on April 30, and in the United States on May 2.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The film ends with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}\'a0featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samuel L. Jackson}}\'a0as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, who approaches Stark regarding the "Avenger Initiative". Favreau said that he included the scene as "a little tip of the hat for the fans...a way to sort of tee up\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ." Jackson was only on set for a day, with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Skeleton_crew"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skeleton crew}}\'a0to avoid the news of his cameo leaking.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America's shield}}\'a0is also visible in the background of a scene; it was added by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ILM}}\'a0artist as a joke, and Favreau decided to leave it in the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After being exposed to gamma radiation that causes him to transform into the monstrous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, scientist Bruce Banner goes on the run and isolates himself from his love,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Betty_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Betty Ross}}. Hunted by the military, Banner seeks to cure himself and prevent his condition from being weaponized.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In January 2006,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel reclaimed the film rights for the Hulk character from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Pictures}}\'a0after Universal failed to meet a deadline to develop a sequel to director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ang_Lee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ang Lee}}'s 2003 film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Universal retained distribution rights for future\'a0
\f1\i Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Instead of moving forward with a sequel, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Louis_Leterrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Louis Leterrier}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 , a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reboot}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Leterrier initially turned down the job out of respect for Lee, but later reconsidered and signed on.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The script was written by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zak_Penn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zak Penn}}, who drafted a treatment for the 2003 film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In April 2006,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edward_Norton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edward Norton}}\'a0entered negotiations to portray Bruce Banner and rewrite Penn's script,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [34]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0although Penn received sole credit for the screenplay.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production began on July 9, 2007 and filming primarily took place in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toronto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toronto}},

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The film premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gibson_Amphitheatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gibson Amphitheatre}}\'a0on June 8, 2008, and was released on June 13.

\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Thor

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Downey briefly reprised his role from\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0as Tony Stark in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearance}}\'a0at the end of the film. Downey said that the filmmakers "were just cross-pollinating our superheroes. It happens to be a scene where I basically approach [actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Hurt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Hurt}}'s character General Ross], and we may be considering going into some sort of limited partnership together. The great thing is he\'97and I don't want to give too much away\'97but he's in disrepair at the time I find him. It was really fun seeing him play this really powerful character who's half in the bag."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In addition,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0is briefly seen frozen in ice in an alternate opening of the film, included in the DVD release.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After Tony Stark reveals himself to be Iron Man, the U.S. government demands he hand over his technology. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Hammer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a rival industrialist}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ivan_Vanko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a Russian scientist}}\'a0conspire to use his own technology against him.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [39]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The filmmakers continued to refer to other Marvel films by again including Captain America's shield. Favreau explained, "We introduced Captain America's shield briefly in one shot in the last film. So now it really was in his room, so we had to figure out how to deal with the reality that the shield was in his workshop."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A scene toward the end of\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 \'a0in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0safe house contains several\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Easter_egg_(media)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Easter eggs}}, ranging from footage from\'a0
\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0displayed on a monitor to pointers on a map indicating several locales related to other Marvel films, including one pointing toward a region of Africa in reference to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Panther_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Black Panther}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [56]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Parker}}\'a0appears as the child wearing an Iron Man mask whom Stark saves from a drone; the appearance was confirmed in June 2017 by Spider-Man actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tom_Holland_(actor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tom Holland}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kevin_Feige"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kevin Feige}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Spider-Man: Homecoming}}\'a0director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Watts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Watts}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [57][58]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [59]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \

As his brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}, plots to take the throne for himself, Thor must prove himself worthy and reclaim his hammer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mj\'f6lnir}}.
