\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [76]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1942, Steve Rogers is deemed physically unfit to enlist in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U.S._Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Army}}\'a0and fight the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Reich}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}. Recruited for a secret military operation, he is physically transformed into a super-soldier dubbed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0and must battle the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, head of a Nazi science division known as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}.

Nick Fury, the director of S.H.I.E.L.D., gathers the superheroes Iron Man, Thor, Captain America, the Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye to fight Thor's brother Loki, who plots to subjugate the Earth.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [97]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gwyneth_Paltrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gwyneth Paltrow}}, who portrayed Pepper Potts in\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 , was included in the film at Downey's insistence. Prior to this, Whedon had not intended the film to include supporting characters from the heroes' individual films, commenting, "You need to separate the characters from their support systems in order to create the isolation you need for a team."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [98]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avi_Arad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avi Arad}}\'a0said that Sony Pictures and Disney discussed incorporating the OsCorp Tower from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt

\f1\i The Avengers

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [100]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The supervillain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0appears in a mid-credits scene, portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damion_Poitier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damion Poitier}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [101]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Eastern_Europe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Eastern European}}\'a0country of Sokovia, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}\'97{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bruce Banner}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Natasha_Romanoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clint_Barton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}\'97raid a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}\'a0facility commanded by Baron\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wolfgang_von_Strucker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wolfgang von Strucker}}, who has been experimenting on humans using the scepter previously wielded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}. They encounter two of Strucker's test subjects\'97twins\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pietro_Maximoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pietro Maximoff}}, who has superhuman speed, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wanda Maximoff}}, who has telepathic and telekinetic abilities\'97and apprehend Strucker, while Stark retrieves Loki's scepter.\
Stark and Banner discover an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_intelligence_in_fiction#Sentient_AI"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artificial intelligence}}\'a0within the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 scepter's gem}}, and secretly decide to use it to complete Stark's "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ultron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ultron}}" global defense program. The unexpectedly sentient Ultron, believing he must eradicate humanity to save Earth, eliminates Stark's A.I.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J.A.R.V.I.S."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.A.R.V.I.S.}}\'a0and attacks the Avengers at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 their headquarters}}. Escaping with the scepter, Ultron uses the resources in Strucker's Sokovia base to upgrade his rudimentary body and build an army of robot drones. Having killed Strucker, he recruits the Maximoffs, who hold Stark responsible for their parents' deaths by his company's weapons, and goes to the base of arms dealer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Klaw_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ulysses Klaue}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Johannesburg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Johannesburg}}\'a0to obtain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wakanda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wakandan}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vibranium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vibranium}}. The Avengers attack Ultron and the Maximoffs, but Wanda subdues them with haunting visions, causing the Hulk (Banner) to rampage until Stark stops him with his anti-Hulk armor.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
A worldwide backlash over the resulting destruction, and the fears Wanda's hallucinations incited, send the team into hiding at a safe house. Thor departs to consult with Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0on the apocalyptic future he saw in his hallucination, while\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}\'a0arrives and encourages the team to form a plan to stop Ultron. In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Seoul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Seoul}}, Ultron uses Loki's scepter to enslave the team's friend Dr. Helen Cho. They use her synthetic-tissue technology, vibranium, and the scepter's gem to craft a new body. As Ultron uploads himself into the body, Wanda is able to read his mind; discovering his plan for human extinction, the Maximoffs turn against Ultron. Rogers, Romanoff, and Barton find Ultron and retrieve the synthetic body, but Ultron captures Romanoff.\
The Avengers fight amongst themselves when Stark secretly uploads J.A.R.V.I.S.\'97who is still operational after hiding from Ultron inside the Internet\'97into the synthetic body. Thor returns to help activate the body, explaining that the gem on its brow\'97one of the six\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Stones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}, the most powerful objects in existence\'97was part of his vision. This "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vision}}" and the Maximoffs accompany the Avengers to Sokovia, where Ultron has used the remaining vibranium to build a machine to lift a large part of the capital city skyward, intending to crash it into the ground to cause global extinction. Banner rescues Romanoff, who awakens the Hulk for the battle. The Avengers fight Ultron's army while Fury arrives in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarrier}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0agents to evacuate civilians. Pietro dies when he shields Barton from gunfire, and a vengeful Wanda abandons her post to destroy Ultron's primary body, which allows one of his drones to activate the machine. The city plummets, but Stark and Thor overload the machine and shatter the landmass. In the aftermath, the Hulk, unwilling to endanger Romanoff by being with her, departs in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_Quinjet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Quinjet}}, while the Vision confronts and seemingly destroys Ultron's last remaining body.\
Later, with the Avengers having established a new base run by Fury, Hill, Cho, and Selvig, Thor returns to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}\'a0to learn more about the forces he suspects have manipulated recent events. As Stark leaves and Barton retires, Rogers and Romanoff prepare to train new Avengers: Rhodes, the Vision,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}, and Wanda.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mid-credits scene}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}, dissatisfied by the failures of his pawns, dons a gauntlet
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and vows to retrieve the Infinity Stones himself.\
At a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Year%27s_Eve"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Year's Eve}}\'a0party in 1999,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0meets scientist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maya_Hansen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maya Hansen}}, the inventor of an experimental regenerative treatment named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Extremis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Extremis}}\'a0that allows recovery from crippling injuries. Disabled scientist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Aldrich_Killian"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Aldrich Killian}}\'a0offers them a place in his company\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Advanced_Idea_Mechanics"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Advanced Idea Mechanics}}, but Stark rejects him. In 2013, Stark is having panic attacks due to his experiences during the alien invasion and subsequent Battle of New York.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 2
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 Restless, he has built dozens of new\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor_in_other_media#Live_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Iron Man suits}}, creating friction with his girlfriend\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pepper_Potts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pepper Potts}}.\
A string of bombings claimed by a terrorist known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mandarin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mandarin}}\'a0has left intelligence agencies bewildered by a lack of forensic evidence. Stark's security chief\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Happy_Hogan_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Happy Hogan}}\'a0is badly injured in one such attack, prompting Stark to brazenly issue a televised threat to the Mandarin. The Mandarin sends gunship helicopters to destroy Stark's home. Hansen, who came to warn Stark, survives the attack with Potts. Stark escapes in an experimental new Iron Man suit, which his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Artificial_intelligence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 artificial intelligence}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edwin_Jarvis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.A.R.V.I.S.}}\'a0pilots to rural Tennessee, following a flight plan from Stark's investigation into the Mandarin. Stark's new armor is not fully functional, and lacks sufficient power to return to California, leaving the world to believe him dead.\
Teaming with Harley, a 10-year-old boy, Stark investigates the remains of a local explosion bearing the hallmarks of a Mandarin attack. He discovers the "bombings" were triggered by soldiers subjected to Extremis whose bodies explosively rejected the treatment. These explosions were falsely attributed to a terrorist plot in order to cover up Extremis's flaws. Stark witnesses Extremis firsthand when Mandarin agents\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ellen_Brandt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Brandt}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coldblood"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Savin}}\'a0attack him. Meanwhile, Killian resurfaces and kidnaps Potts and Hansen. American intelligence agencies continue to search for the Mandarin's location, with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'97the former War Machine, now re-branded as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Patriot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Iron Patriot}}\'97lured into a trap to steal his Iron Man-like armor.\
With Harley's help, Stark traces the Mandarin to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Miami"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Miami}}\'a0and infiltrates his headquarters using improvised weapons. Inside he discovers the Mandarin is actually an English actor named\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Trevor_Slattery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Trevor Slattery}}, who is oblivious to the actions carried out in his image. Killian, who appropriated Hansen's Extremis research as a cure for his own disability and expanded the program to include injured war veterans, reveals he is the real Mandarin behind Slattery's cover. After capturing Stark, Killian reveals that he has subjected Potts to Extremis in the hope that Stark will help fix Extremis's flaws while trying to save her. Killian kills Hansen when she tries to stop him.\
Stark escapes and reunites with Rhodes, discovering that Killian intends to attack President Ellis aboard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Air_Force_One"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Air Force One}}, using the Iron Patriot armor. Stark saves some surviving passengers and crew but cannot stop Killian from abducting Ellis and destroying Air Force One. They trace Killian to an impounded damaged oil tanker where Killian intends to kill Ellis on live television. The Vice President will become a puppet leader, following Killian's orders in exchange for Extremis to cure his young daughter's disability. On the platform, Stark works to save Potts, as Rhodes goes after the President. Stark summons his remaining Iron Man suits, controlled remotely by J.A.R.V.I.S., to provide air support. Rhodes secures the President and takes him to safety, while Stark discovers Potts has survived the Extremis procedure; before he can save her, a rig collapses around them and she falls to her apparent death. Stark confronts Killian and traps him in an Iron Man suit that he self-destructs, but fails to kill him. Potts, whose Extremis powers allowed her to survive her fall, intervenes and kills Killian.\
Stark orders J.A.R.V.I.S. to remotely destroy each Iron Man suit as a sign of his devotion to Potts, while the Vice President and Slattery are arrested. With Stark's help, Potts' Extremis effects are stabilized, and Stark promises to scale back his life as Iron Man, undergoing surgery to remove the shrapnel near his heart and throwing his obsolete chest arc reactor into the sea. He muses that, even without the technology, he will always be Iron Man.\
In 1988, following his mother's death, a young\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star-Lord"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peter Quill}}\'a0is abducted from Earth by the Ravagers, a group of space pirates led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yondu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yondu Udonta}}. Twenty-six years later on the planet Morag, Quill steals a mysterious orb but is attacked by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Korath_the_Pursuer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Korath}}, a subordinate to the fanatical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kree"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kree}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ronan_the_Accuser"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ronan}}. Although Quill escapes with the orb, Yondu discovers his theft and issues a bounty for his capture, while Ronan sends the assassin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamora"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gamora}}\'a0after the orb.\
When Quill attempts to sell the orb on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Xandar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Xandar}}, capital of the Nova Empire, Gamora ambushes him and steals it. A fight ensues, drawing in a pair of bounty hunters: the genetically and cybernetically modified raccoon\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocket_Raccoon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocket}}, and the tree-like humanoid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Groot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Groot}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nova_Corps"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nova Corps}}\'a0officers capture the four, detaining them in the Kyln prison. A powerful inmate there,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Drax}}, attempts to kill Gamora due to her association with Ronan and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}, who killed his family. Quill convinces Drax that Gamora can bring Ronan to him, though Gamora reveals that she has betrayed Ronan, unwilling to let him use the orb's power. Learning that Gamora has a buyer for the orb, Quill, Rocket, Groot, and Drax work with her to escape the Kyln in Quill's ship, the\'a0
\f1\i Milano
\f0\i0 .\
Ronan meets with Gamora's adoptive father, Thanos, to discuss her betrayal. Quill's group flee to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Knowhere"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Knowhere}}, a remote criminal outpost in space built in the giant severed head of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Celestial_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Celestial}}. A drunken Drax summons Ronan while the rest of the group meet Gamora's contact, the collector\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Collector_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Taneleer Tivan}}. Tivan opens the orb, revealing an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stone}}, an item of immeasurable power that destroys all but the most powerful beings who wield it. Tivan's slave Carina grabs the Stone, triggering an explosion that engulfs Tivan's archive.\
Ronan arrives and easily defeats Drax, while the others flee by ship, pursued by Ronan's followers and Gamora's adoptive sister\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nebula_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nebula}}. Nebula destroys Gamora's ship, leaving her floating in space, and Ronan's fighters capture the orb. Quill contacts Yondu before following Gamora into space, giving her his helmet to survive; Yondu arrives and retrieves the pair. Rocket, Drax, and Groot threaten to attack Yondu's ship to rescue them, but Quill negotiates a truce, promising the orb to Yondu. Quill's group agrees that facing Ronan means certain death, but that they cannot let him use the Infinity Stone to destroy the galaxy. On Ronan's flagship, the\'a0
\f1\i Dark Aster
\f0\i0 , Ronan embeds the Stone in his warhammer, taking its power for himself. He contacts Thanos, threatening to kill him after first destroying Xandar; hateful of her adoptive father, Nebula allies with Ronan.\
The Ravagers and Quill's group join with the Nova Corps to confront the\'a0
\f1\i Dark Aster
\f0\i0 \'a0at Xandar, with Quill's group breaching the\'a0
\f1\i Dark Aster

\f1\i Milano
\f0\i0 . Ronan uses his empowered warhammer to destroy the Nova Corps fleet. Drax and Gamora defeat Korath and Nebula, the latter escaping, but the group find themselves outmatched by Ronan's power until Rocket crashes a Ravager ship through the\'a0
\f1\i Dark Aster
\f0\i0 . The damaged\'a0
\f1\i Dark Aster
\f0\i0 \'a0crash-lands on Xandar, with Groot sacrificing himself to shield the group. Ronan emerges from the wreck and prepares to destroy Xandar, but Quill distracts him, allowing Drax and Rocket to destroy Ronan's warhammer. Quill grabs the freed Stone, and with Gamora, Drax, and Rocket sharing its burden, they use it to destroy Ronan.\
In the aftermath, Quill tricks Yondu into taking a container supposedly containing the Stone, and gives the real Stone to the Nova Corps. As the Ravagers leave Xandar, Yondu remarks that it turned out well that they did not deliver Quill to his father per their contract. Quill's group, now known as the Guardians of the Galaxy, have their criminal records expunged, and Quill learns that he is only half-human, his father being part of an ancient, unknown species. Quill finally opens the last present he received from his mother: a cassette tape filled with her favorite songs. The Guardians leave in the rebuilt\'a0
\f1\i Milano
\f0\i0 \'a0along with a sapling\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cutting_(plant)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cut}}\'a0from Groot.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Tivan sits in his destroyed archive with two of his living exhibits: a canine cosmonaut and an anthropomorphic duck.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Two years after the Battle of New York,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0works in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Washington,_D.C."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Washington, D.C.}}\'a0for the espionage agency\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0under Director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, while trying to adjust to contemporary society. Rogers and Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}\'a0are sent with S.H.I.E.L.D.'s\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Counter-terrorism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 counter-terrorism}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.T.R.I.K.E."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.T.R.I.K.E.}}\'a0team, led by Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crossbones_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rumlow}}, to free hostages aboard a S.H.I.E.L.D. vessel from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Batroc_the_Leaper"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Georges Batroc}}\'a0and his mercenaries. Mid-mission, Rogers discovers Romanoff has another agenda: to extract data from the ship's computers for Fury. Rogers returns to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Triskelion_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Triskelion}}, S.H.I.E.L.D.'s headquarters, to confront Fury and is briefed about Project Insight: three\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarriers}}\'a0linked to satellites, designed to eliminate threats before they have a chance to grow. Later, when unable to access the data recovered by Romanoff, Fury becomes suspicious about Project Insight and asks senior S.H.I.E.L.D. official and Secretary of Internal Security\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alexander_Pierce"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alexander Pierce}}\'a0to delay the project.\
On his way to a rendezvous with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}, Fury is ambushed by disguised assailants, including a mysterious assassin known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes#Winter_Soldier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Winter Soldier}}. Fury escapes to Rogers' apartment, and warns Rogers that S.H.I.E.L.D. is compromised and he should trust nobody. Fury is suddenly gunned down by the Winter Soldier, before handing Rogers a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/USB_flash_drive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 flash drive}}\'a0containing Romanoff's data. Rogers pursues the Winter Soldier, but he disappears before he can reach him. After undergoing surgery, Fury is pronounced dead, and Hill arrives to recover the body. Rogers hides the flash drive in the hospital. The next day, Pierce summons Rogers to the Triskelion. When Rogers withholds Fury's information, Pierce brands him a fugitive, and sends Rumlow, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Double_agent"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 double agent}}\'a0for Hydra, to take Rogers down. Hunted by S.T.R.I.K.E., Rogers seeks out the flash drive; Romanoff reveals herself to have taken it, and Rogers decides to trust her after learning that she has encountered the Winter Soldier before. Using data in the flash drive, they discover a secret S.H.I.E.L.D. bunker in New Jersey, where they activate a supercomputer containing the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mind_uploading"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 preserved consciousness}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arnim_Zola"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arnim Zola}}. Zola reveals that ever since S.H.I.E.L.D. was founded after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}, the antagonistic organisation\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}\'a0has secretly operated within its ranks, sowing global chaos with the objective of making humanity surrender its freedom in exchange for security. Rogers and Romanoff narrowly escape death when a S.H.I.E.L.D. missile destroys the bunker. It is revealed that Pierce is Hydra's leader within S.H.I.E.L.D. when the Winter Soldier is seen in his apartment.\
Rogers and Romanoff enlist the help of former\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/United_States_Air_Force_Pararescue"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 USAF pararescueman}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}, an acquaintance of Rogers, and acquire his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wingsuit_flying"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 powered wingpack}}, code named "Falcon". Deducing that Pierce is Hydra's leader and that S.H.I.E.L.D. agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jasper_Sitwell"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jasper Sitwell}}\'a0is a Hydra\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mole_(espionage)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 mole}}, they force Sitwell to divulge that Zola developed a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Data-mining"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 data-mining}}\'a0algorithm that can identify individuals that have been, are, or will become threats to Hydra. The Insight Helicarriers will sweep the globe, using satellite-guided guns to eliminate these individuals. While driving back to the Triskelion, planning to infiltrate it, Rogers, Romanoff, and Wilson are ambushed by the Winter Soldier, who kills Sitwell. During a subsequent fight with Rogers, the Winter Soldier's mask is dislodged; Rogers recognizes him as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}, his childhood best friend who supposedly fell to his death on a mission. Shaken by the reveal, Rogers, along with Romanoff and Wilson, is captured by S.T.R.I.K.E. Rogers deduces that Bucky survived the fall after being captured and experimented on by Zola, and that Hydra must have found him afterwards. Having infiltrated the S.T.R.I.K.E. agents, Hill manages to extract the trio to a safehouse where Fury, revealed to have faked his death, is waiting with plans to sabotage the Helicarriers by replacing three of their controller chips. At a bank, Hydra agents come together to debrief the Winter Soldier; after discovering that he recognized Rogers, Pierce orders that his memory be wiped.\
As members of the World Security Council arrive for the launch of Project Insight, Rogers infiltrates the Triskelion and broadcasts Hydra's plot to everyone there. Romanoff, disguised as one of the Council members, disarms Pierce and accesses his computer. Fury then arrives and forces Pierce to help him unlock S.H.I.E.L.D.'s database so that Romanoff can leak classified information, exposing Hydra to the public. Pierce attempts to escape after revealing he can indirectly kill all the World Security Council members, including the disguised Romanoff; following a struggle, Fury kills Pierce. Meanwhile, Rogers and Wilson storm two of the Helicarriers and replace the controller chips. However, the Winter Soldier is waiting on the third one, and after destroying Wilson's suit he begins to fight Rogers. Rogers fends him off and replaces the final chip, allowing Hill to take control and have the vessels destroy each other. Seeing the Winter Soldier still on the Helicarrier, Rogers approaches him, refusing to fight him in an attempt to reach his friend. As the Winter Soldier once again begins to recognize him, the ship collides with the Triskelion, throwing Rogers into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Potomac_River"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Potomac River}}. Diving in after him, the Winter Soldier rescues the unconscious Rogers before disappearing into the woods.\
With S.H.I.E.L.D. in disarray, Romanoff makes an official statement before a Senate subcommittee, and Fury, under the cover of his apparent death, heads to Eastern Europe in pursuit of Hydra's remaining cells. Rumlow is hospitalized after being crushed during the Triskelion's destruction, Romanoff (who revealed her own tainted past after leaking the S.H.I.E.L.D. files) leaves to find a new cover, and Wilson decides to help Rogers search for the Winter Soldier.\
In a mid-credits scene set in a Hydra lab,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Baron_Strucker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Baron Wolfgang von Strucker}}\'a0proclaims that the "age of miracles" has begun as scientists examine an energy-filled scepter
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and two test subjects whom Strucker calls the 'twins': one with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Speedster_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 superhuman speed}}, the other with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychokinesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telekinetic powers}}. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the Winter Soldier visits his own memorial at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Smithsonian_Institution"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Smithsonian Institution}}.\
Eons ago,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bor_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bor}}, father of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Odin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Odin}}, clashes with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Elves_(Marvel_Comics)#Dark_Elves"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dark Elf}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Malekith_the_Accursed"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Malekith}}, who seeks to unleash a weapon known as the Aether on the nine realms. After conquering Malekith's forces, including enhanced warriors called the Kursed, on their home world of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Svart%C3%A1lfar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Svartalfheim}}, Bor safeguards the Aether within a stone column. Unknown to Bor, Malekith as well as his lieutenant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kurse"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Algrim}}\'a0and a handful of Dark Elves escape into suspended animation.\
In present-day\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0stands imprisoned for his war crimes on Earth.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, alongside warriors\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fandral"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fandral}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Volstagg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Volstagg}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sif_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sif}}, repel marauders on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vanaheim"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vanaheim}}, home of their comrade\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogun}}; it is the final battle in a war to pacify the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)#The_Nine_Worlds"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nine Realms}}\'a0following the reconstruction of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st}}, the "Rainbow Bridge" between realms, which had been destroyed two years earlier.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The Asgardians soon learn that the Convergence, a rare alignment of the Nine Realms, is imminent; as the event approaches, portals linking the worlds appear at random.\
In London, astrophysicist Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jane_Foster_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jane Foster}}\'a0and her intern Darcy Lewis travel to an abandoned factory where such portals have appeared, disrupting the laws of physics around them. Separating from the group, Foster is teleported to another world, where she is infected by the Aether.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}\'a0alerts Thor that Foster has moved beyond his near all-seeing vision, leading Thor to Earth. When Thor finds Foster, she inadvertently releases an unearthly force, and Thor returns with her to Asgard. Odin, recognizing the Aether, warns that the Aether will not only kill Foster but that its return heralds a catastrophic prophecy.\
Malekith, awakened by the Aether's release, turns Algrim into a Kursed and attacks Asgard. During the battle, Malekith and Algrim search for Foster, sensing that she contains the Aether. Thor's mother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frigga_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frigga}}\'a0is killed protecting Foster, and Malekith and Algrim are forced to flee without Foster. Despite Odin's orders not to leave Asgard, Thor reluctantly enlists the help of Loki, who knows of a secret portal to Svartalfheim, where they will use Foster to lure and confront Malekith, away from Asgard. In return, Thor promises Loki vengeance on Malekith for killing their mother. With Volstagg and Sif stalling Asgardian soldiers and Fandral assisting their escape, Thor, Loki, and Foster head to Svartalfheim.\
There, Loki tricks Malekith into drawing the Aether out of Foster, but Thor's attempt to destroy the exposed substance fails. Malekith merges with the Aether and leaves in his ship as Loki is fatally wounded while killing Algrim. Thor, cradling Loki in his arms, promises to tell their father of his sacrifice. Afterward, Thor and Foster discover another portal in a nearby cave and reunite in London with Lewis and Foster's mentor Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'97who was briefly institutionalized due to the mental trauma he suffered during Loki's attack on Earth. They learn that Malekith plans to restore the Dark Elves to dominance by unleashing the Aether at the center of the Convergence in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Greenwich"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Greenwich}}. Thor battles Malekith through various portals and across multiple worlds until one portal separates them, leaving Malekith unopposed on Earth. Thor returns in time to help his mortal comrades use their scientific equipment to transport Malekith to Svartalfheim, where he is crushed by his own damaged ship.\
Thor returns to Asgard, where he declines Odin's offer to take the throne and tells Odin of Loki's sacrifice. As he leaves, Odin's form transforms into Loki, who is alive and impersonating Odin.\
In a mid-credits scene, Volstagg and Sif visit the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Collector_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Collector}}\'a0and entrust the Aether to his care, commenting that with the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Gems#Film"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tesseract}}\'a0already in Asgard, having two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Infinity_Stones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Infinity Stones}}\'a0so close together would be unwise. As they leave, the Collector states his desire to acquire the other five Stones. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Foster and Thor reunite on Earth, while somewhere in London, a frost monster from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheimr"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jotunheim}}\'97accidentally transported to Earth during the final battle\'97continues to run amok.\
In 1989, scientist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hank_Pym"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hank Pym}}\'a0resigns from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0after discovering their attempt to replicate his\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ant-Man"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ant-Man}}\'a0shrinking technology. Believing the technology is dangerous, Pym vows to hide it as long as he lives.\
In the present day,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Pym's estranged daughter,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hope_Pym"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hope van Dyne}}, and former prot\'e9g\'e9,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darren_Cross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darren Cross}}, have forced him out of his company, Pym Technologies. Cross is close to perfecting a shrinking suit of his own, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yellowjacket_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yellowjacket}}, which horrifies Pym.\
Upon his release from prison, well-meaning thief\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ant-Man_(Scott_Lang)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Scott Lang}}\'a0moves in with his old cellmate, Luis. Lang visits his daughter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cassandra_Lang"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Cassie}}\'a0unannounced and is chastised by his former wife Maggie and her police-detective fianc\'e9, Paxton, for not providing child support. Unable to hold down a job because of his criminal record, Lang agrees to join Luis' crew and commit a burglary. Lang breaks into a house and cracks its safe, but only finds what he believes to be an old motorcycle suit, which he takes home. After trying the suit on, Lang accidentally shrinks himself to the size of an insect. Terrified by the experience, he returns the suit to the house, but is arrested on the way out. Pym, the homeowner, visits Lang in jail and smuggles the suit into his cell to help him break out.\
Pym, who manipulated Lang through an unknowing Luis into stealing the suit as a test, wants Lang to become the new Ant-Man to steal the Yellowjacket from Cross. Having been spying on Cross after discovering his intentions, Van Dyne and Pym train Lang to fight and to control ants. While Van Dyne harbors resentment towards Pym about her mother Janet's death, he reveals that Janet, known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wasp_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wasp}}, disappeared into a subatomic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Features_of_the_Marvel_Universe#Extradimensional_places"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 quantum realm}}\'a0while disabling a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Soviet_Union"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Soviet}}\'a0nuclear missile. Pym warns Lang that he could suffer a similar fate if he overrides his suit's regulator. They send him to steal a device that will aid their heist from the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers}}' headquarters, where he briefly fights\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falcon_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sam Wilson}}.\
Cross perfects the Yellowjacket and hosts an unveiling ceremony at Pym Technologies' headquarters. Lang, along with his crew and a swarm of flying ants, infiltrates the building during the event, sabotages the company's\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Server_(computing)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 servers}}, and plants explosives. When he attempts to steal the Yellowjacket, he, along with Pym and Van Dyne, are captured by Cross, who intends to sell both the Yellowjacket and Ant-Man suits to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}. Lang breaks free and he and Van Dyne dispatch most of the Hydra agents, though one flees with a vial of Cross' particles and Pym is shot. Lang pursues Cross, while the explosives detonate, imploding the building as Pym and Van Dyne escape.\
Cross dons the Yellowjacket and attacks Lang before Lang is arrested by Paxton. Cross takes Cassie hostage to lure Lang into another fight. Lang overrides the regulator and shrinks to subatomic size to penetrate Cross' suit and sabotage it to shrink uncontrollably, killing Cross. Lang disappears into the quantum realm but manages to reverse the effects and returns to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Macroscopic_scale"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 macroscopic}}\'a0world. Out of gratitude for Lang's heroism, Paxton covers for Lang to keep him out of prison. Seeing that Lang survived and returned from the quantum realm, Pym wonders if his wife is alive as well. Later, Lang meets up with Luis, who tells him that Wilson is looking for him.\
In a mid-credits scene, Pym shows Van Dyne a new Wasp prototype suit and offers it to her. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Wilson and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0have\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bucky Barnes}}\'a0in their custody. Unable to contact\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0because of "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Registration_Acts_(comics)#Marvel_Cinematic_Universe"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the accords}}",
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Wilson mentions that he knows someone who can help.\
Billionaire industrialist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0builds himself a suit of armor after he is taken captive by a terrorist organization. Free from his captors, he decides to upgrade and don his armor in order to hunt down weapons that were sold under the table.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In April 2006, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jon_Favreau"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jon Favreau}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0with the writing teams of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Art_Marcum_and_Matt_Holloway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Art Marcum and Matt Holloway}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Fergus_and_Hawk_Ostby"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Fergus and Hawk Ostby}}\'a0writing competing scripts.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4][17]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Favreau consolidated both into one script, which was then polished by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/John_August"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 John August}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Robert_Downey,_Jr."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Robert Downey, Jr.}}\'a0was cast in the title role in September 2006, after growing out a goatee and working out to convince the filmmakers he was right for the part.

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The film ends with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}\'a0featuring\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samuel L. Jackson}}\'a0as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, who approaches Stark regarding the "Avenger Initiative". Favreau said that he included the scene as "a little tip of the hat for the fans...a way to sort of tee up\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ." Jackson was only on set for a day, with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Skeleton_crew"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 skeleton crew}}\'a0to avoid the news of his cameo leaking.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America's shield}}\'a0is also visible in the background of a scene; it was added by an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 ILM}}\'a0artist as a joke, and Favreau decided to leave it in the film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After being exposed to gamma radiation that causes him to transform into the monstrous\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}, scientist Bruce Banner goes on the run and isolates himself from his love,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Betty_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Betty Ross}}. Hunted by the military, Banner seeks to cure himself and prevent his condition from being weaponized.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In January 2006,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel reclaimed the film rights for the Hulk character from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Universal_Pictures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Universal Pictures}}\'a0after Universal failed to meet a deadline to develop a sequel to director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ang_Lee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ang Lee}}'s 2003 film\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Universal retained distribution rights for future\'a0
\f1\i Hulk
\f0\i0 \'a0films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Instead of moving forward with a sequel, Marvel hired\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Louis_Leterrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Louis Leterrier}}\'a0to direct\'a0
\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 , a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reboot}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Leterrier initially turned down the job out of respect for Lee, but later reconsidered and signed on.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The script was written by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Zak_Penn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Zak Penn}}, who drafted a treatment for the 2003 film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In April 2006,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edward_Norton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Edward Norton}}\'a0entered negotiations to portray Bruce Banner and rewrite Penn's script,

\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0although Penn received sole credit for the screenplay.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Production began on July 9, 2007 and filming primarily took place in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Toronto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Toronto}},

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [36]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The film premiered at the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gibson_Amphitheatre"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gibson Amphitheatre}}\'a0on June 8, 2008, and was released on June 13.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [37][38]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The film takes place simultaneously with the events of\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Thor
\f0\i0 ,

\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Downey briefly reprised his role from\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0as Tony Stark in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cameo_appearance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cameo appearance}}\'a0at the end of the film. Downey said that the filmmakers "were just cross-pollinating our superheroes. It happens to be a scene where I basically approach [actor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/William_Hurt"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 William Hurt}}'s character General Ross], and we may be considering going into some sort of limited partnership together. The great thing is he\'97and I don't want to give too much away\'97but he's in disrepair at the time I find him. It was really fun seeing him play this really powerful character who's half in the bag."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In addition,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0is briefly seen frozen in ice in an alternate opening of the film, included in the DVD release.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After Tony Stark reveals himself to be Iron Man, the U.S. government demands he hand over his technology. Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Hammer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a rival industrialist}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ivan_Vanko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a Russian scientist}}\'a0conspire to use his own technology against him.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [43]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Immediately following the successful release of\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0in May 2008, Marvel Studios announced it was developing a sequel,\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 .
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [44]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Favreau returned as director
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Theroux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Justin Theroux}}\'a0was hired to write the screenplay, which would be based on an original story by Favreau and Downey.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [76]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 1942, Steve Rogers is deemed physically unfit to enlist in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U.S._Army"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Army}}\'a0and fight the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nazi_Germany"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German Reich}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}. Recruited for a secret military operation, he is physically transformed into a super-soldier dubbed\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain America}}\'a0and must battle the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Red Skull}}, head of a Nazi science division known as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [77]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \

\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [88]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Nick Fury, the director of S.H.I.E.L.D., gathers the superheroes Iron Man, Thor, Captain America, the Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye to fight Thor's brother Loki, who plots to subjugate the Earth.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [89]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \

\f1\i The Incredible Hulk
\f0\i0 , was hired to write a script for\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 \'a0in June 2007.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [90]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In April 2010,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Joss_Whedon"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Joss Whedon}}\'a0closed a deal to direct the film, and to rework Penn's script.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [14]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Marvel announced that Edward Norton would not be reprising the role of Bruce Banner / Hulk,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [91]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0and in July 2010,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Ruffalo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Ruffalo}}\'a0was cast in his place.

\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Downey, Evans, Hemsworth, Johansson, Renner, Hiddleston and Jackson reprised their respective roles from previous films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [93]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Principal photography began in April 2011 in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Albuquerque,_New_Mexico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Albuquerque, New Mexico}},
