\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [97]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gwyneth_Paltrow"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gwyneth Paltrow}}, who portrayed Pepper Potts in\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i Iron Man 2
\f0\i0 , was included in the film at Downey's insistence. Prior to this, Whedon had not intended the film to include supporting characters from the heroes' individual films, commenting, "You need to separate the characters from their support systems in order to create the isolation you need for a team."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [98]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avi_Arad"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avi Arad}}\'a0said that Sony Pictures and Disney discussed incorporating the OsCorp Tower from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Amazing Spider-Man}}\'a0into the climax of\'a0
\f1\i The Avengers
\f0\i0 ,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [99]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but Feige said that "the deal was never close to happening."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [100]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The supervillain\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thanos"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thanos}}\'a0appears in a mid-credits scene, portrayed by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Damion_Poitier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Damion Poitier}}.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [101]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgardian}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}\'a0encounters the Other, the leader of an extraterrestrial race known as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chitauri"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chitauri}}. In exchange for retrieving the Tesseract,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0a powerful energy source of unknown potential, the Other promises Loki an army with which he can subjugate Earth.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, director of the espionage agency\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}, and his lieutenant Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maria_Hill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maria Hill}}\'a0arrive at a remote research facility during an evacuation, where physicist Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0is leading a research team experimenting on the Tesseract. Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0explains that the object has begun radiating an unusual form of energy. The Tesseract suddenly activates and opens a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormhole}}, allowing Loki to reach Earth. Loki takes the Tesseract and uses his scepter to enslave Selvig and a few other agents, including\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hawkeye_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clint Barton}}, to aid him in his getaway.\
In response to the attack, Fury reactivates the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avengers Initiative}}". Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}\'a0is sent to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kolkata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Calcutta}}\'a0to recruit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Bruce Banner}}\'a0to trace the Tesseract through its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamma_ray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gamma radiation}}\'a0emissions. Coulson visits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0to have him review Selvig's research, and Fury approaches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0with an assignment to retrieve the Tesseract.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stuttgart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stuttgart}}, Barton steals\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iridium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 iridium}}\'a0needed to stabilize the Tesseract's power while Loki causes a distraction, leading to a brief confrontation with Rogers, Stark, and Romanoff that ends with Loki's surrender. While Loki is being escorted to S.H.I.E.L.D.,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}, his adoptive brother, arrives and frees him, hoping to convince him to abandon his plan and return to Asgard. After a confrontation with Stark and Rogers, Thor agrees to take Loki to S.H.I.E.L.D.'s flying aircraft carrier, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Helicarrier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Helicarrier}}. Upon arrival, Loki is imprisoned while Banner and Stark attempt to locate the Tesseract.\
The Avengers become divided, both over how to approach Loki and the revelation that S.H.I.E.L.D. plans to harness the Tesseract to develop weapons as a deterrent against hostile extraterrestrials. As the group argues, Barton and Loki's other possessed agents attack the Helicarrier, disabling one of its engines in flight and causing Banner to transform into the Hulk. Stark and Rogers work to restart the damaged engine, and Thor attempts to stop the Hulk's rampage. Romanoff reluctantly fights Barton, and knocks him unconscious, breaking Loki's mind control. Loki escapes after killing Coulson and ejecting Thor from the airship, while the Hulk falls to the ground after attacking a S.H.I.E.L.D. fighter jet. Fury uses Coulson's death to motivate the Avengers into working as a team. Stark and Rogers realize that for Loki, simply defeating them will not be enough; he needs to overpower them publicly to validate himself as ruler of Earth. Loki uses the Tesseract, in conjunction with a device Selvig built, to open a wormhole above\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Tower"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark Tower}}\'a0to the Chitauri fleet in space, launching his invasion.\
Rogers, Stark, Romanoff, Barton, and Thor rally in defense of New York City, the wormhole's location. Banner arrives and transforms into the Hulk, and together the Avengers battle the Chitauri while evacuating civilians. The Hulk finds Loki and beats him into submission. Romanoff makes her way to the wormhole generator, where Selvig, freed from Loki's mind control, reveals that Loki's scepter can be used to shut down the generator. Meanwhile, Fury's superiors from the World Security Council attempt to end the invasion by launching a nuclear missile at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Midtown Manhattan}}. Stark intercepts the missile and takes it through the wormhole toward the Chitauri fleet. The missile detonates, destroying the Chitauri mothership and disabling their forces on Earth. Stark's suit runs out of power, and he falls back through the wormhole just as Romanoff closes it. Stark goes into freefall, but the Hulk saves him from crashing into the ground. In the aftermath, Thor returns Loki and the Tesseract to Asgard, while Fury expresses confidence that the Avengers will return if and when they are needed.\
In a mid-credits scene, the Other confers with his master
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0about the failed attack on Earth. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, the Avengers eat in silence at a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shawarma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 shawarma}}\'a0restaurant.\
In Russia, the media covers\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}'s disclosure of his identity as Iron Man.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Whiplash_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ivan Vanko}}, whose father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crimson_Dynamo#Anton_Vanko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anton Vanko}}\'a0has just died, sees this and begins building a miniature arc reactor similar to Stark's. Six months later,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Stark is a superstar and uses his Iron Man suit for peaceful means, resisting government pressure to sell his designs. He reinstitutes the Stark Expo to continue his father\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Howard_Stark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Howard}}'s legacy.\
The\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palladium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 palladium}}\'a0core in the arc reactor that keeps Stark alive and powers the armor is slowly poisoning him, and he cannot find a substitute. Growing increasingly reckless and despondent about his impending death, and choosing not to tell anyone about his condition, Stark appoints his personal assistant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pepper_Potts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pepper Potts}}\'a0CEO of Stark Industries, and hires Stark employee Natalie Rushman to replace her as his personal assistant. Stark competes in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Historic_Grand_Prix_of_Monaco"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Monaco Historic Grand Prix}}, where he is attacked in the middle of the race by Vanko, who wields electrified whips. Stark dons his Mark V armor and defeats Vanko, but the suit is severely damaged. Vanko explains his intention was to prove to the world that Iron Man is not invincible. Impressed by Vanko's performance, Stark's rival,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Justin_Hammer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Justin Hammer}}, fakes Vanko's death while breaking him out of prison and asks him to build a line of armored suits to upstage Stark. During what he believes is his final birthday party, Stark gets drunk while wearing the Mark IV suit. Disgusted, Stark's best friend,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/U.S._Air_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 U.S. Air Force}}\'a0Lieutenant Colonel\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0dons Stark's Mark II prototype armor and tries to restrain him. The fight ends in a stalemate, so Rhodes confiscates the Mark II for the U.S. Air Force.\
The next morning,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}, director of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}, approaches Stark at\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Randy%E2%80%99s_Donuts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Randy\'92s Donuts}}, revealing "Rushman" to be Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Black_Widow_(Natasha_Romanova)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Natasha Romanoff}}\'a0and that Howard Stark was a S.H.I.E.L.D. founder whom Fury knew personally. Fury explains that Vanko's father jointly invented the arc reactor with Stark, but when Anton tried to sell it for profit, Stark had him deported. The Soviets sent Anton to the gulag. Fury gives Stark some of his father's old material; a hidden message in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Diorama"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 diorama}}\'a0of the 1974 Stark Expo proves to be a diagram of the structure of a new element. With the aid of his computer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Edwin_Jarvis#J.A.R.V.I.S."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.A.R.V.I.S.}}, Stark synthesizes it. When he learns Vanko is still alive, he places the new element in his arc reactor and ends his palladium dependency.\
At the Expo, Hammer unveils Vanko's armored drones, led by Rhodes in a heavily weaponized version of the Mark II armor. Stark arrives in the Mark VI armor to warn Rhodes, but Vanko remotely takes control of both the drones and Rhodes' armor and attacks Iron Man. Hammer is arrested while Romanoff and Stark's bodyguard\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Happy_Hogan_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Happy Hogan}}\'a0go after Vanko at Hammer's factory. Vanko escapes, but Romanoff returns control of the Mark II armor to Rhodes. Stark and Rhodes together defeat Vanko and his drones. Vanko commits\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Suicide"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 suicide}}\'a0by blowing up his suit, along with the defeated drones.\
At a debriefing, Fury informs Stark that because of Stark's difficult personality, S.H.I.E.L.D. intends to use him only as a consultant. Stark and Rhodes receive medals for their heroism. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, S.H.I.E.L.D. agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0reports the discovery of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mjolnir_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 a large hammer}}\'a0at the bottom of a crater in a desert in New Mexico.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}, who has inherited the defense contractor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stark_Industries"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stark Industries}}\'a0from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Howard_Stark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 his father}}, is in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_in_Afghanistan_(2001%E2%80%93present)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 war-torn Afghanistan}}\'a0with his friend and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Civil-Military_Co-operation#Doctrine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 military liaison}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lieutenant_Colonel"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lieutenant Colonel}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Machine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Rhodes}}\'a0to demonstrate the new "Jericho" missile. After the demonstration, the convoy is ambushed and Stark is critically wounded by a rocket-propelled grenade used by the attackers: one of his company's own. He is captured and imprisoned in a cave by a terrorist group, the Ten Rings;\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ho_Yinsen"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yinsen}}, a fellow captive who is a doctor, implants an electromagnet into Stark's chest to keep the shrapnel shards that wounded him from reaching his heart and killing him. Ten Rings leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Raza_(Marvel_Comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Raza}}\'a0offers Stark freedom in exchange for building a Jericho missile for the group, but Tony and Yinsen know that Raza will not keep his word.\
Stark and Yinsen secretly build a small, powerful electric generator called an arc reactor to power Stark's electromagnet and a prototypical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor_in_other_media#Live_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 suit of powered armor}}\'a0to aid in their escape. Although they keep the suit hidden almost to completion, the Ten Rings discover their hostages' intentions and attack the workshop. Yinsen sacrifices himself to divert them while the suit is completed. The armored Stark battles his way out of the cave to find the dying Yinsen, then burns the Ten Rings' weapons in anger and flies away, crashing in the desert and destroying the suit. After being rescued by Rhodes, Stark returns home and announces that his company will no longer manufacture weapons.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Iron_Monger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obadiah Stane}}, his father's old partner and the company's manager, advises Stark that this may ruin Stark Industries and his father's legacy. In his home workshop, Stark builds a sleeker, more powerful version of his improvised armor suit as well as a more powerful arc reactor for his chest. Personal assistant\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Pepper_Potts"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Pepper Potts}}\'a0places the original reactor inside a small glass showcase. Though Stane requests details, a suspicious Stark keeps his work to himself.\
At a charity event held by Stark Industries, reporter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Christine_Everhart"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Christine Everhart}}\'a0informs Stark that his company's weapons were recently delivered to the Ten Rings and are being used to attack Yinsen's home village, Gulmira. Stark then learns that Stane has been\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arms_trafficking"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 arms trafficking}}\'a0to criminals worldwide and is staging a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coup_d%27%C3%A9tat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 coup}}\'a0to replace him as Stark Industries' CEO. Stark dons his new armor and flies to Afghanistan, where he saves the villagers. While flying home, Stark is shot at by two\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/F-22_Raptor"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 F-22 Raptor}}\'a0fighter jets. He reveals his secret identity to Rhodes over the phone in an attempt to end the attack. Meanwhile, the Ten Rings gather the pieces of Stark's prototype suit and meet with Stane, who subdues Raza and has the rest of the group killed. Stane has a massive new suit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reverse_engineering"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reverse engineered}}\'a0from the wreckage. Seeking to track his company's illegal shipments, Stark sends Potts to hack into its database. She discovers that Stane hired the Ten Rings to kill Stark, but the group reneged. Potts meets with Agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}, an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Intelligence_agency"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 intelligence agency}}, to inform him of Stane's activities.\
Stane's scientists cannot duplicate Stark's miniaturized arc reactor, so Stane ambushes Stark at his home and takes the one from his chest. Stark manages to get to his original reactor to replace it. Potts and several S.H.I.E.L.D. agents attempt to arrest Stane, but he dons his suit and attacks them. Stark fights Stane, but is outmatched without his new reactor to run his suit at full capacity. The fight carries Stark and Stane to the top of the Stark Industries building, and Stark instructs Potts to overload the large arc reactor powering the building. This unleashes a massive electrical surge that causes Stane and his armor to fall into the exploding reactor, killing him. The next day, at a press conference, Stark defies suggestions from S.H.I.E.L.D. and publicly admits to being "Iron Man."\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, S.H.I.E.L.D. Director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}\'a0visits Stark at home, telling him that Iron Man is not "the only superhero in the world", and explaining that he wants to discuss the "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Avengers_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Avenger}}\'a0Initiative".\
In 965 AD,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Odin_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Odin}}, king of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Asgard}}, wages war against the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Giants_(Marvel_Comics)#Giants_of_Jotunheim_2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frost Giants}}\'a0of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jotunheim"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jotunheim}}\'a0and their leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Laufey_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Laufey}}, to prevent them from conquering the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Asgard_(comics)#The_Nine_Worlds"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 nine realms}}, starting with Earth. The Asgardian warriors defeat the Frost Giants and seize the source of their power, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Casket_of_Ancient_Winters"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Casket of Ancient Winters}}.\
In the present,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Odin's son\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thor}}\'a0prepares to ascend to the throne of Asgard, but is interrupted when Frost Giants attempt to retrieve the Casket. Against Odin's order, Thor travels to Jotunheim to confront Laufey, accompanied by his brother\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Loki_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Loki}}, childhood friend\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sif_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sif}}\'a0and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Warriors_Three"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Warriors Three}}:\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Volstagg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Volstagg}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Fandral"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Fandral}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hogun"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hogun}}. A battle ensues until Odin intervenes to save the Asgardians, destroying the fragile truce between the two races. For Thor's arrogance, Odin strips his son of his godly power and exiles him to Earth as a mortal, accompanied by his hammer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mjolnir_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mj\'f6lnir}}, now protected by an enchantment that allows only the worthy to wield it.\
Thor lands in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Mexico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Mexico}}, where astrophysicist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jane_Foster_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dr. Jane Foster}}, her assistant Darcy Lewis, and mentor Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Erik_Selvig"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Erik Selvig}}\'a0find him. The local populace finds Mjolnir, which\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Phil_Coulson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Phil Coulson}}\'a0soon commandeers before forcibly acquiring Foster's data about the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormhole}}\'a0that delivered Thor to Earth. Thor, having discovered Mjolnir's nearby location, seeks to retrieve it from the facility that S.H.I.E.L.D. has constructed, but he finds himself unable to lift it and is captured. With Selvig's help, he is freed and resigns himself to exile on Earth as he develops a romance with Foster.\
Loki discovers that he is Laufey's biological son, adopted by Odin after the war ended. A weary Odin falls into the deep "Odinsleep" to recover his strength. Loki takes the throne in Odin's stead and offers Laufey the chance to kill Odin and retrieve the Casket. Sif and the Warriors Three, unhappy with Loki's rule, attempt to return Thor from exile, convincing\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heimdall_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heimdall}}, gatekeeper of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bifr\'f6st}}\'97the means of traveling between worlds\'97to allow them passage to Earth. Aware of their plan, Loki sends the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Destroyer_(Thor)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Destroyer}}, a seemingly indestructible\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Automaton"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 automaton}}, to pursue them and kill Thor. The warriors find Thor, but the Destroyer attacks and defeats them, prompting Thor to offer himself instead. Struck by the Destroyer and near death, Thor's sacrifice proves him worthy to wield Mj\'f6lnir. The hammer returns to him, restoring his powers and enabling him to defeat the Destroyer. Kissing Foster goodbye and vowing to return, he and his fellow Asgardians leave to confront Loki.\
In Asgard, Loki betrays and kills Laufey, revealing his true plan to use Laufey's attempt on Odin's life as an excuse to destroy Jotunheim with the Bifr\'f6st Bridge, thus proving himself worthy to his adoptive father. Thor arrives and fights Loki before destroying the Bifr\'f6st Bridge to stop Loki's plan, stranding himself in Asgard. Odin awakens and prevents the brothers from falling into the abyss created in the wake of the bridge's destruction, but Loki apparently commits suicide by allowing himself to fall when Odin rejects his pleas for approval. Thor makes amends with Odin, admitting he is not ready to be king; meanwhile, on Earth, Foster and her team search for a way to open a portal to Asgard.\
In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Selvig is taken to a S.H.I.E.L.D. facility, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}\'a0opens a briefcase and asks him to study a mysterious cube-shaped object,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which Fury says may hold untold power. An invisible Loki prompts Selvig to agree, and he does.\
In the present day, scientists in the Arctic uncover an old, frozen aircraft. In March 1942, Nazi officer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Red_Skull"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Johann Schmidt}}\'a0and his men steal a mysterious relic called the Tesseract,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which possesses untold powers, from the town of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/T%C3%B8nsberg"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 T\'f8nsberg}}\'a0in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/German_occupation_of_Norway"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 German-occupied Norway}}.\
In\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_York_City"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New York City}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Steve Rogers}}\'a0is rejected for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}\'a0military recruitment because of various health and physical problems. While attending an exhibition of future technologies with his friend, Sgt.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bucky_Barnes"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James "Bucky" Barnes}}, Rogers again attempts to enlist. Overhearing Rogers' conversation with Barnes about wanting to help in the war, Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abraham_Erskine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Abraham Erskine}}\'a0allows Rogers to enlist. He is recruited into the Strategic Scientific Reserve as part of a "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supersoldier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 super-soldier}}" experiment under Erskine, Col.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chester_Phillips"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chester Phillips}}, and British agent\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Peggy_Carter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Peggy Carter}}. Phillips is unconvinced by Erskine's claims that Rogers is the right person for the procedure but relents after seeing Rogers commit an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Falling_on_a_grenade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 act of self-sacrificing bravery}}. The night before the treatment, Erskine reveals to Rogers that Schmidt underwent an imperfect version of the procedure and suffered permanent side-effects.\
Schmidt and Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arnim_Zola"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Arnim Zola}}\'a0harness the energies of the Tesseract, intending to use the power to fuel Zola's inventions, mounting an offensive that will change the world. Schmidt discovers Erskine's location and dispatches assassin\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Heinz_Kruger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Heinz Kruger}}\'a0to kill him. Erskine subjects Rogers to the super-soldier treatment, injecting him with a special serum and dosing him with "vita-rays". After Rogers emerges from the experiment taller and more muscular, an undercover Kruger kills Erskine and flees. Rogers pursues and captures Kruger, but the assassin avoids interrogation by committing suicide with a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Cyanide"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 cyanide}}\'a0capsule. With Erskine dead and his super-soldier formula lost, U.S. Senator Brandt has Rogers tour the nation in a colorful costume as "Captain America" to promote\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/War_Bond"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 war bonds}}\'a0while scientists study him and attempt to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Reverse-engineer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 reverse-engineer}}\'a0the formula. In 1943, while on tour in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Italian_Campaign_(World_War_II)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Italy}}\'a0performing for active servicemen, Rogers learns that Barnes' unit was\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Missing_in_action"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 MIA}}\'a0in a battle against Schmidt's forces. Refusing to believe that Barnes is dead, Rogers has Carter and engineer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Howard_Stark"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Howard Stark}}\'a0fly him behind enemy lines to mount a solo rescue attempt. Rogers infiltrates the fortress of Schmidt's Nazi division\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hydra_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hydra}}, freeing Barnes and the other prisoners. Rogers confronts Schmidt, who removes a mask to reveal a red, skull-like visage that earned him the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sobriquet"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 sobriquet}}\'a0"the Red Skull". Schmidt escapes and Rogers returns to base with the freed soldiers.\
Rogers recruits Barnes,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dum_Dum_Dugan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dum Dum Dugan}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gabe_Jones"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gabe Jones}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Morita"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Morita}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Union_Jack_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 James Montgomery Falsworth}}, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jacques_Dernier"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jacques Dernier}}\'a0to attack other known Hydra bases. Stark outfits Rogers with advanced equipment, most notably a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 circular shield}}\'a0made of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vibranium"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vibranium}}, a rare, nearly indestructible metal. Rogers and his team sabotage various Hydra operations. The team later assaults a train carrying Zola. Rogers and Jones succeed in capturing Zola, but Barnes falls from the train to his assumed death.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Using information extracted from Zola, the final Hydra stronghold is located, and Rogers leads an attack to stop Schmidt from using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Weapon_of_mass_destruction"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 weapons of mass destruction}}\'a0on major American cities. Rogers climbs aboard Schmidt's aircraft as it takes off. During the subsequent fight, the Tesseract's container is damaged. Schmidt physically handles the Tesseract, which opens a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wormhole"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 wormhole}}\'a0into space, sucking him into it. The Tesseract burns through the plane and is lost in the ocean. Seeing no way to land the plane without the risk of detonating its weapons, Rogers crashes it in the Arctic. Stark later recovers the Tesseract from the ocean floor but is unable to locate Rogers or the aircraft, presuming him dead.\
Rogers awakens in a 1940s-style hospital room. Deducing from an\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anachronism"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 anachronistic}}\'a0radio broadcast that something is wrong, he flees outside and finds himself in present-day\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Times_Square"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Times Square}}, where\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D."}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 S.H.I.E.L.D.}}\'a0director\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nick_Fury"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nick Fury}}\'a0informs him that he has been "asleep" for nearly 70 years. In a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Post-credits_scene"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 post-credits scene}}, Fury approaches Rogers and proposes a mission with worldwide ramifications.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
At Culver University in Virginia, General\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thunderbolt_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thunderbolt Ross}}\'a0meets with Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bruce Banner}}, the colleague and boyfriend of his daughter\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Betty_Ross"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Betty}}, regarding an experiment that Ross claims is meant to make humans immune to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gamma_radiation"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 gamma radiation}}. The experiment\'97part of a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/World_War_II"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 World War II}}-era\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Weapon_Plus"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 "super soldier" program}}\'a0that Ross hopes to recreate\'97fails, and the exposure to gamma radiation causes Banner to transform into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hulk_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Hulk}}\'a0for brief periods of time, whenever his heart rate rises above 200 beats per minute. The Hulk destroys the lab and surrounding area, killing several people inside, and injuring the General and Betty, along with others outside. Banner becomes a fugitive from the U.S. military and Ross in particular, who wants to weaponize the Hulk.\
Five years later,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [N 2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Banner works at a bottling factory in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rocinha"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rocinha}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rio de Janeiro}}\'a0in Brazil, while searching for a cure for his condition. On the internet, he collaborates with a colleague he knows only as "Mr. Blue", and to whom he is "Mr. Green". He is learning\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoga"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoga}}\'a0techniques to help keep control, and has not transformed in five months. After Banner cuts his finger, a drop of his blood falls into a bottle, and is eventually ingested by an elderly consumer in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Milwaukee,_Wisconsin"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Milwaukee, Wisconsin}}, giving him gamma sickness. Using the bottle to track down Banner, Ross sends a special forces team, led by Russian-born British\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Royal_Marine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Royal Marine}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Abomination_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Emil Blonsky}}, to capture him. Banner transforms into the Hulk and defeats Blonsky's team. After Ross explains how Banner became the Hulk, Blonsky agrees to be injected with a small amount of a similar serum, which gives him enhanced speed, strength, agility, and healing, but also begins to deform his skeleton and impair his judgment.\
Banner returns to Culver University and reunites with Betty, who is dating psychiatrist\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Doc_Samson"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leonard Samson}}. Banner is attacked a second time by Ross and Blonsky's forces, tipped off by the suspicious Samson, causing him to again transform into the Hulk. The ensuing battle outside the university proves futile for Ross' forces and they retreat, though Blonsky, whose sanity is faltering, attacks and mocks the Hulk. The Hulk seemingly kills Blonsky and flees with Betty. After the Hulk reverts to Banner, he and Betty go on the run, and Banner contacts Mr. Blue, who urges them to meet him in New York City. Mr. Blue is actually cellular biologist Dr.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leader_(comics)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Samuel Sterns}}, who tells Banner he has developed a possible antidote to Banner's condition. After a successful test, he warns Banner that the antidote may only reverse each individual transformation. Sterns reveals he has\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Organic_synthesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 synthesized}}\'a0Banner's blood samples, which Banner sent from Brazil, into a large supply, with the intention of applying its "limitless potential" to medicine. Fearful of the Hulk's power falling into the military's hands, Banner wishes to destroy the blood supply.\
Blonsky has survived the battle at Culver University and completely healed. He joins Ross' forces for a third attempt to take Banner into custody. They succeed and Banner, along with Betty, are taken away in a helicopter. Blonsky stays behind and orders Sterns to inject him with Banner's blood, as he covets the Hulk's power. Sterns warns that the combination of the super-soldier formula and Banner's blood may cause him to become an "abomination", but Blonsky insists. The experiment mutates Blonsky into a creature with size and strength surpassing that of the Hulk, but drives him insane. He attacks Sterns, who gets some of Banner's blood in a cut on his forehead, causing him to begin mutating as well.\
Blonsky rampages through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Harlem"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Harlem}}. Realizing that the Hulk is the only one who can stop Blonsky, Banner convinces Ross to release him. He jumps from Ross' helicopter and transforms after hitting the ground. After a long and brutal battle through Harlem, the Hulk defeats Blonsky. After having a peaceful moment with Betty, the Hulk flees New York.\
A month later, Banner is in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bella_Coola,_British_Columbia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bella Coola, British Columbia}}. Instead of trying to suppress his transformation, he begins to transform in a controlled manner.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tony Stark}}\'a0approaches Ross at a local bar and informs him that a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Avengers_(2012_film)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 team}}\'a0is being put together.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise depicts the adventures of characters "A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Many species of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_creatures"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 aliens}}\'a0(often\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Humanoid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 humanoid}}) co-exist with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Droid_(robot)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 droids}}\'a0who may assist them in their daily routines, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Spaceflight"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 space travel}}\'a0between planets is common due to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace#Star_Wars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperspace}}\'a0technology.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [5][6][7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The rises and falls of different governments are chronicled throughout the saga: the democratic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Republic}}\'a0is corrupted and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coup_d%27%C3%A9tat"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 overthrown}}\'a0by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}},
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0which is fought by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}. The Rebellion later gives rise to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}\'a0and rebuilds society,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but the remnants of the Empire reform as the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0and attempt to destroy the Republic.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [10]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Heroes of the former rebellion lead the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Resistance_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Resistance}}\'a0against the oppressive dictatorship.\
A mystical power known as "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}" is described in the original film as "an energy field created by all living things ... [that] binds the galaxy together."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Those whom "the Force is strong with" have quick reflexes; through training and meditation, they are able to perform various\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Superpower_(ability)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 superpowers}}\'a0(such as\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Psychokinesis"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telekinesis}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Precognition"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 precognition}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Telepathy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 telepathy}}, and manipulation of physical energy).
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [12]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The Force is wielded by two major\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Military_order_(religious_society)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 knighthood orders}}\'a0at conflict with each other: the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi}}, who act on the light side of the Force through\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Detachment_(philosophy)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 non-attachment}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Arbitration"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 arbitration}}, and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sith}}, who use the dark side through fear and aggression. The latter's members are intended to be limited to two: a master and their apprentice.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [13]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
According to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Hamill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Hamill}}, who plays\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}, in 1976,\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars

\f1\i Star Wars

\f0\i0 , which he imagined filming by 2011.

\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0films he wanted to make. He said he had "twelve-page outlines" for those films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In an interview with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jim_Steranko"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jim Steranko}}\'a0in\'a0

\f0\i0 \'a0magazine published in late 1980, Lucas described how the expansive scope of\'a0
