\f0\i0 \'a0had started with an overlong screenplay:\
He added that he had:\
In this interview, Lucas also stated that he had "titles and ten-page story outlines for each of" the nine episodes.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In an interview with Gary Kurtz in the same magazine, Kurtz said:\
In an interview with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Starlog"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Starlog}}\'a0magazine published in September 1981, Lucas confirmed that he had the nine-film series plotted, cautioning:\
Shortly after 1980's release of\'a0
\f1\i Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
\f0\i0 , Lucas had already written\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Film_treatment"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 story treatments}}\'a0for episodes:\'a0
\f1\i VI
\f0\i0 , and the sequel trilogy consisting of episodes\'a0
\f1\i VII
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i VIII
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i IX
\f0\i0 .\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dale_Pollock"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dale Pollock}}, George Lucas's biographer, revealed in a 2012 interview, that as part of his biographical research during the 1980s, Lucas had allowed him to read the plot outlines for the at the time comprising 12 planned\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0film episodes, albeit on the condition of signing a confidentiality agreement.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Those plans Pollock saw, however were drastically changed after\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Empire_Strikes_Back"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Empire Strikes Back}}\'a0released because Lucas decided not to make the sequel trilogy, and instead finish the story as a trilogy, by ending the storyline with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Episode_VI:_Return_of_the_Jedi"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Episode VI: Return of the Jedi}}. This led Lucas to rework and fully incorporate many of the plots from his discarded sequel trilogy directly into\'a0
\f1\i Return of the Jedi
\f0\i0 .\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gary_Kurtz"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gary Kurtz}}, the producer of\'a0
\f1\i A New Hope
\f0\i0 \'a0and\'a0
\f1\i The Empire Strikes Back
\f0\i0 , opened about those incorporated elements, albeit remained coy about the discarded ideas that could be still used on future sequels. About the elements from such discarded sequel trilogy, that were directly incorporated into\'a0
\f1\i Return of the Jedi
\f0\i0 , Kutz said those were:\
About the 1980s sequel trilogy drafts, and their surviving elements that could still have been used after\'a0
\f1\i Return of the Jedi
\f0\i0 , in 2012, Pollock said:\
Other than Pollock's vague description, no official information about the 1980s script treatments for the sequel trilogy has been released. Comenting in the announcement of Lucas selling Lucasfilm to Disney in 2012, and the official announcement of a sequel trilogy. Pollock said that Disney would probably use Lucas's outlines from 1980 as the basis for the sequel trilogy, saying "That's in part what Disney bought."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [11]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
This period lasted from 1983 to the 2010s, when Lucas started to develop his ideas for a sequel trilogy.\
After release of\'a0
\f1\i Return of the Jedi
\f0\i0 \'a0in 1983, Lucas gave many hints about many of the plot elements from his discarded 1980s script treatments for the sequel trilogy, or what would happen if he were to make a sequel trilogy. Those discarded plots continued to fascinate fans for decades, as many of them were completely unaffected by the conclusion of the original trilogy; thus leaving the sequel trilogy a possibility of using them.\
While many ideas seem to have been retained, these two particular ideas were apparently discarded for Lucasfilm's sequel trilogy, under Disney's ownership:\
Lucas' ideas that have been somewhat partially or completely retained by the trilogy that ultimately was made, include:\
During the early 1990s, Lucas allowed writer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Timothy_Zahn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Timothy Zahn}}\'a0to write a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_expanded_universe"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars expanded universe}}\'a0novel series set after the events in the original trilogy, which was called the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Thrawn_Trilogy"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Thrawn Trilogy}}. This decision meant that Lucas decided to further cancel the sequel trilogy, with many hundreds of subsequent other works set after the original trilogy. From 1997 onwards, Lucas took it a step further, when he ceased to talk about his sequel trilogy ideas. When asked, he would frequently repeat that he had no plans to make the sequel trilogy and that he would not allow other directors to make it.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16][22][23][24][25]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He gave various explanations for the apparent abandonment of plans to film the sequel trilogy.\
At a 1997 "Special Edition" press conference, Lucas said: "Everyone said, 'Well, are you going to do sequels to the first three?' But that was an afterthought; I don't have scripts on those stories. The only notion on that was, wouldn't it be fun to get all the actors to come back when they're 60 or 70 years old and make three more about them as old people."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [16]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In a 1997 issue of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_Insider"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars Insider}}, he said: "The whole story has six episodes.... If I ever went beyond that, it would be something that was made up. I really don't have any notion other than, 'Gee, it would be interesting to do Luke Skywalker later on.' It wouldn't be part of the main story, but a sequel to this thing."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [22]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
However Lucas was not made with the\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0franchise, his attention however was not on the sequel trilogy, as it had shifted towards the story before the original trilogy. Between 1999 and 2005, Lucas would return to the universe he had created, by writing and directing, what would become the prequel trilogy of Episodes\'a0
\f1\i I
\f0\i0 ,\'a0
\f1\i II
\f0\i0 , and\'a0
\f1\i III
\f0\i0 . and decided to end the saga as six films. This prevented him from developing a sequel trilogy during that time-frame.\
In an interview published in the February 1999 issue of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vanity_Fair_(magazine)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vanity Fair}}, Lucas said: "When you see it in six parts, you'll understand. It really ends at part six. I never had a story for the sequels, for the later ones."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In early May 2002, just before the worldwide release of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Episode_II:_Attack_of_the_Clones"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Episode II: Attack of the Clones}}\'a0and while Lucas was working on the script for\'a0
\f1\i Episode III
\f0\i0 , rumors of\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0episodes VII, VIII, and IX were posted on the Internet.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In reply, Lucas noted that there would be no Star Wars Episodes VII, VIII, and IX, since the time feels right to move on:\
In 1999, when asked about the possibility of someone else making\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0films, Lucas said, "Probably not, it's my thing."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [26][27]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In August 1999, at a press conference in New York City to discuss\'a0
\f1\i The Phantom Menace
\f0\i0 , Lucas described the "nine year commitment" required to make a\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0trilogy.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [29]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In 2002, he said: "Basically what I said as a joke was, 'Maybe when Harrison and Carrie are in their 70s, we'll come back and do another version.' The thing I didn't realize then, and that I do realize now very clearly, is that not only would they be in their 70s, but\'a0
\f1\i I
\f0\i0 \'a0would be in my 70s too."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [30]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Lucas also noted "Ultimately, the saga will be six films, a 12-hour story. Then people can watch all six films together as they were intended to be seen."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [28]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In 2007, Lucas described making the films at that age as "an idea that seemed amusing at the time, but doesn't seem realistic now", and suggested that "off-the-cuff" comments he had made in earlier years had been misconstrued as absolute statements.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [31]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In 2008, after all six films had been released, Lucas said: "The movies were the story of Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker, and when Luke saves the galaxy and redeems his father, that's where that story ends."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [32]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In another 2008 interview in\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Total_Film"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Total Film}}, Lucas ruled out anybody else making\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0films, and additionally added that the\'a0
\f1\i Expanded Universe
\f0\i0 \'a0novels and comics did not lined up with his six films\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0saga. Asked if he was happy for new\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0films to be made after his death, he said: "I've left pretty explicit instructions for there not to be any more features. There will definitely be no\'a0
\f1\i Episodes VII
\f0\i0 \'96
\f1\i IX
\f0\i0 . That's because there isn't any story. I mean, I never thought of anything. And now there have been novels about the events after\'a0
\f1\i Episode VI
\f0\i0 , which isn't at all what I would have done with it. The\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 story is really the tragedy of Darth Vader. That is the story. Once Vader dies, he doesn't come back to life, the Emperor doesn't get cloned and Luke doesn't get married..."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [33]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In May 2011, Lucas and Disney CEO\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bob_Iger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bob Iger}}\'a0began discussing the acquisition of Lucasfilm by Disney.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [34]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0A few months later, Lucas discreetly began working on guidelines for a sequel trilogy involving "a microbiotic world" and creatures known as the Whills, Force-beings that "control the universe".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [35][36][37]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He considered directing\'a0
\f1\i Episode VII
\f0\i0 \'a0for a May 2015 release,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [38]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but decided to leave the franchise in the hands of other filmmakers, announcing in January 2012 that he would step away from making blockbuster films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [39]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
In addition to his concept of a microscopic Force-world, Lucas also wanted the main cast of the new films to be teenagers, but not all of his ideas would be used.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [40]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Lucas stated, "If I'd held onto the company I could have done it, and then it would have been done. Of course a lot of fans would have hated it, just like they did (with prequel trilogy film)\'a0
\f1\i Phantom Menace
\f0\i0 \'a0and everything but at least the whole story from beginning to end would be told."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [41]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
After Disney's acquisition of Lucasfilm, and turning over the company presidency to former\'a0co-chair\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kathleen_Kennedy_(producer)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kathleen Kennedy}}\'a0in 2012, Lucas stated, "I always said I wasn't going to do any more, and that's true, because I'm not going to do any more. But that doesn't mean I'm unwilling to turn it over to Kathy to do more."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [42]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Lucas said at some point, he had planned to finish Episode VII, release it in May 2015 and then sell the company afterward. But Disney expressed interest, with Lucas saying "It's better for me to get out at the beginning of a new thing and I can just remove myself. The time is more important to me than the money."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [43]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Both plot outlines, the one written in the 1980s and the one written in the 2010s, were turned over to Disney chairman\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bob_Iger"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bob Iger}}\'a0around the time that Disney acquired Lucasfilm in 2012.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [44]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Previously mentioned veteran writer of\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0novels, Zahn was interviewed about the at-the-time just-announced sequel trilogy in 2012, he confirmed the sequel trilogy was never meant to be based on his Thrawn novels nor the expanded universe but said he had been briefed years before on Lucas's plans for the sequels.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [45]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0(Zahn had discussions with Lucas before the first Thrawn novel was published in 1991.)\
As announced by Lucasfilm, the sequel trilogy also meant the end of most of the existing\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0expanded universe, so as to give "maximum creative freedom to the filmmakers and also preserve an element of surprise and discovery for the audience". Much of the old expanded universe content would continue to be available under the\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars: Legends
\f0\i0 \'a0brand, which was created to brand the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Canon_(fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 non-canonical}}\'a0works of the franchise. Only\'a0
\f1\i Episodes I-VI
\f0\i0 \'a0would remain canon to the franchise, along\'a0
\f1\i The Clone Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0animated film and series. Everything produced after the announcement, would also be considered remain canon.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [46]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
The first film in the sequel trilogy was titled\'a0
\f1\i Episode VII: The Force Awakens
\f0\i0 \'a0and written by Lucas co-writer on two sequels in the original trilogy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lawrence_Kasdan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lawrence Kasdan}}, along\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/J.J._Abrams"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 J.J. Abrams}}, who also directed it. As noted by Lucas in 2013, the film had seemingly discarded his ideas for\'a0
\f1\i Episode VII
\f0\i0 . During an interview with Cinemablend in January 2014, while promoting the upcoming release of the Lucasfilm animated movie\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Strange_Magic_(film)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Strange Magic}}, Lucas revealed that ultimately, Disney chose not to use the story treatments which he had written and turned over with the acquisition, and that the company chose to create brand new stories for the upcoming movies instead: "The ones that I sold to Disney, they came up to the decision that they didn't really want to do those. So they made up their own. So it's not the ones that I originally wrote [on screen in\'a0
\f1\i Star Wars: The Force Awakens
\f0\i0 ]".
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [47]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Some details about Lucas's story treatments from the early-2010s were revealed in the book\'a0
\f1\i The Art of Star Wars: The Last Jedi
\f0\i0 . In January 2013 at Skywalker Ranch, George Lucas held the first story briefing about the as-yet untitled\'a0
\f1\i Episode VII
\f0\i0 . Related concept art includes:\
Lucas seemingly had planned for the conclusion of Luke's story to happen in\'a0
\f1\i Episode VII
\f0\i0 \'a0instead of\'a0
\f1\i Episode VIII
\f0\i0 , with Luke dying at the end of the film; this element was instead incorporated into Johnson's film.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [48]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 Conversely, some months later,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mark_Hamill"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mark Hamill}}\'a0contradicted this statement, saying that George Lucas' original vision for the ending of\'a0
\f1\i Episode IX
\f0\i0 \'a0was to have Luke dying there instead of a simple cameo, leaving his sister Leia as a Jedi.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [49]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0No plot points such as the Whills or microbiotic worlds have appeared so far.\
Thirty years after the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Civil War}}, the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0has risen from the fallen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}\'a0and seeks to eliminate the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/New_Republic_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 New Republic}}. The Resistance, backed by the Republic and led by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Leia Organa}}, opposes them while Leia searches for her brother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}.\
On the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jakku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jakku}}, Resistance pilot\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0receives a map to Luke's location from Lor San Tekka.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Stormtrooper_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Stormtroopers}}\'a0commanded by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}\'a0destroy the village and capture Poe, while Kylo kills San Tekka. Poe's droid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}\'a0escapes with the map and encounters a scavenger,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}, near a junkyard settlement. Kylo tortures Poe using\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0and learns of\'a0BB-8. Stormtrooper\'a0FN-2187, unwilling to kill for the First Order, frees Poe, and they escape in a stolen\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/TIE_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 TIE fighter}}; Poe names\'a0FN-2187\'a0"{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}}". As they turn back to Jakku to retrieve\'a0BB-8, they are shot down by a First Order\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Destroyer"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Destroyer}}\'a0and crash-land. Finn survives and assumes that Poe died in the crash. He encounters Rey and\'a0BB-8, but the First Order tracks them and launches an airstrike. Finn, Rey, and\'a0BB-8\'a0flee the planet in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}, which they steal from a junkyard.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0is captured by a larger ship piloted by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}, looking to reclaim their former vessel. The group is attacked by gangs seeking to settle debts with Han, and flee in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . At the First Order's Starkiller Base, a planet converted into a superweapon that harnesses star energy,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0allows\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Hux"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Hux}}\'a0to use the weapon for the first time. Snoke questions Kylo's ability to deal with emotions relating to his father, Han Solo, who Kylo says means nothing to him.\
The\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 \'a0crew determines BB-8's map is incomplete. Han explains that Luke attempted to rebuild the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Order}}\'a0but exiled himself when an apprentice turned to the dark side, destroyed the temple, and slaughtered the other apprentices. The crew travels to the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Takodana"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Takodana}}\'a0and meets with cantina owner\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Maz_Kanata"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Maz Kanata}}, who offers assistance getting\'a0BB-8\'a0to the Resistance. Rey is drawn to a secluded vault and finds the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightsaber"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightsaber}}\'a0that once belonged to Luke and his father,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}. She experiences disturbing visions and flees into the woods. Maz gives Finn the lightsaber for safekeeping.\
Starkiller Base destroys a few planets including the Republic capital and a portion of its fleet. The First Order attacks Takodana in search of\'a0BB-8. Han, Chewbacca, and Finn are saved by Resistance\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/X-wing_fighter"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 X-wing fighters}}\'a0led by Poe, who is revealed to have survived the crash on Jakku. Leia arrives at Takodana with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}\'a0and reunites with Han and Chewbacca. Meanwhile, Kylo captures Rey and takes her to Starkiller Base, but she resists his mind-reading attempts. Discovering she can use the Force, Rey escapes by using a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_mind_trick"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi mind trick}}\'a0on a nearby guard.\
At the Resistance base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/D%27Qar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 D'Qar}}, BB-8 finds\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}, who has been inactive since Luke's disappearance. As Starkiller Base prepares to fire on D'Qar, the Resistance devises a plan to destroy it by attacking a critical facility. Using the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , Han, Chewbacca, and Finn infiltrate the facility, find Rey, and plant explosives. Han confronts Kylo, calling him by his birth name, Ben, and implores him to abandon the dark side. Kylo refuses and kills Han, enraging Chewbacca, who shoots Kylo and sets off the explosives, allowing the Resistance to attack and destroy the base.\
The injured Kylo pursues Finn and Rey to the surface. Kylo defeats Finn in a lightsaber duel, leaving him wounded. Rey takes the lightsaber and uses the Force to defeat Kylo before they are separated by a fissure as the planet begins to disintegrate. Snoke orders Hux to evacuate and bring Kylo to him to complete his training. Rey and Chewbacca escape with the unconscious Finn in the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . On D'Qar, Leia, Chewbacca, and Rey mourn Han's death.\'a0R2-D2\'a0awakens and reveals the rest of the map, which Rey follows to the oceanic planet Ahch-To. She finds Luke and presents him with the lightsaber.\
Following the battle of Starkiller Base, General\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Leia_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leia Organa}}\'a0leads\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Resistance_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Resistance}}\'a0forces to flee D'Qar when a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/First_Order_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 First Order}}\'a0fleet arrives.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Poe_Dameron"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Poe Dameron}}\'a0leads a costly counterattack that destroys a First Order dreadnought, but after the Resistance escapes to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperspace_(science_fiction)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperspace}}, the First Order tracks them and attacks the Resistance convoy.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kylo_Ren"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kylo Ren}}, Leia's son, hesitates to fire on the lead Resistance ship after sensing his mother's presence, but his wingmen destroy the bridge, killing most of the Resistance leadership and incapacitating Leia, who survives by using the Force. Disapproving of new leader\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vice_Admiral_Holdo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Vice Admiral Holdo}}'s passive strategy, Poe helps\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Finn_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Finn}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/BB-8"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 BB-8}}, and mechanic\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rose_Tico"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rose Tico}}\'a0embark on a secret mission to disable the First Order's tracking device.\
Meanwhile,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rey_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rey}}\'a0arrives on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Ahch-To"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Ahch-To}}\'a0with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Chewbacca"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chewbacca}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}}\'a0aboard the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Millennium_Falcon"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Millennium Falcon}}\'a0to recruit\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke Skywalker}}\'a0to the Resistance. Disillusioned by his failure to train Kylo as a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi}}, and under self-imposed exile from\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}, Luke refuses to help \'96 even after he learns of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Han_Solo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Han Solo}}'s death at Kylo's hands \'96 and believes the Jedi should go extinct. Unbeknownst to Luke, Rey and Kylo communicate through the Force, puzzling the two enemies. As Rey and Kylo learn about each other, both have visions of themselves as future partners.\
R2-D2 persuades Luke to train Rey. After Kylo tells Rey what happened between him and Luke that caused him to choose the dark side, Luke confesses that he momentarily contemplated killing Kylo upon sensing that\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Leader Snoke}}\'a0was corrupting him, causing Kylo to destroy Luke's new Jedi Order in retaliation. Convinced that Kylo can be redeemed, Rey leaves Ahch-To without Luke. Luke prepares to burn the Ahch-To Jedi temple and library, but hesitates.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}'s ghost appears and destroys the temple by summoning a bolt of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Lightning"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 lightning}}, claiming Rey has all she needs to learn, and encourages Luke to learn from his failure.\
Holdo reveals her plan to discreetly evacuate the remaining Resistance members using small transports. Believing her actions cowardly and risky, Poe leads a mutiny. Finn, Rose, and BB-8 travel to the Canto Bight casino and acquire the help of the hacker\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/DJ_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 DJ}}. They infiltrate Snoke's ship, where all but BB-8 are captured by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Captain_Phasma"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Captain Phasma}}. Meanwhile, Rey lands on the ship, and Kylo brings her to Snoke, who says he facilitated the mental connection between her and Kylo as part of a plan to destroy Luke. Ordered to kill Rey, Kylo instead kills Snoke and defeats Snoke's guards alongside Rey. Rey believes that Kylo has returned to the light side of the Force, but he instead invites her to rule the galaxy with him. Refusing, she fights Kylo for possession of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}'s lightsaber, which splits in two.\
Leia recovers and stuns Poe, allowing the evacuation to begin. Holdo remains on the ship to mislead Snoke's fleet as the others flee to an abandoned\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rebel_Alliance"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rebel Alliance}}\'a0base on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Crait"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Crait}}. DJ reveals the Resistance's plan to the First Order, and the evacuation transports are slowly destroyed. Holdo sacrifices herself by ramming Snoke's fleet at lightspeed; Rey escapes in the chaos, while Kylo declares himself Supreme Leader. BB-8 frees Finn and Rose, who escape after defeating Phasma, and join the survivors on Crait. When the First Order arrives, Poe, Finn, and Rose attack with old speeders. Rey and Chewbacca draw the TIE fighters away with the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 , while Rose stops Finn from completing a suicide run against the enemy siege cannon, which subsequently penetrates the Resistance fortress.\
Luke appears and confronts the First Order to enable surviving Resistance members to escape. Kylo orders the First Order's forces to fire on Luke, to no effect. He then engages Luke in a lightsaber duel; upon striking Luke, Kylo realizes he has been fighting a Force projection of him. Rey uses the Force to help the Resistance escape on the\'a0
\f1\i Falcon
\f0\i0 . Luke, exhausted, becomes one with the Force and dies peacefully on Ahch-To. Rey and Leia sense his death, and Leia tells surviving rebels that the Resistance has all it needs to rise again. At Canto Bight, one of the children who helped Finn and Rose escape grabs a broom with the Force and gazes into space.\
According to producer Gary Kurtz, loose plans for a prequel trilogy were developed during the outlining of the original two films.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [1]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0In 1980, Lucas confirmed that he had the nine-film series plotted,
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [2]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0but due to the stress of producing the original trilogy and pressure from his wife to settle down, he had decided to cancel further sequels by 1981.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [3]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \
Technical advances in the late 1980s and early 1990s, including the ability to create\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Computer-generated_imagery"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 computer-generated imagery}}, inspired Lucas to consider that it might be possible to revisit his saga. In 1989, Lucas stated that the prequel trilogy would be "unbelievably expensive."
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [4]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0After viewing an early CGI test created by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Industrial Light & Magic}}\'a0for\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jurassic_Park"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jurassic Park}}, Lucas said:\
In 1992, Lucas acknowledged that he had plans to create the prequel trilogy in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_Insider"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Lucasfilm Fan Club}}\'a0magazine, and announced this to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Variety_(magazine)"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Variety}}\'a0in late 1993.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [6]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0Producer\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Rick_McCallum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Rick McCallum}}\'a0reached out to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Frank_Darabont"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Frank Darabont}}, who had had previously written\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Young_Indiana_Jones_Chronicles"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Shawshank_Redemption"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 The Shawshank Redemption}}, for possible future writing duties.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [7]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0He was considered until at least 1995, but as time went on, Lucas continued writing the screenplays himself.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [8]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The popularity of the franchise had been prolonged by the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars_expanded_to_other_media"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Star Wars
\f0\i0 \'a0Expanded Universe}}, so that it still had a large audience. A theatrical\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Changes_in_Star_Wars_re-releases"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 rerelease}}\'a0of the original trilogy in 1997 "updated" the 20-year-old films with the style of CGI envisioned for the new episodes.\
\pard\pardeftab720\sl280\sa240\partightenfactor0
{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_I_%E2%80%93_The_Phantom_Menace"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Episode I: The Phantom Menace}}\'a0was released on May 19, 1999, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_II_%E2%80%93_Attack_of_the_Clones"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Episode II: Attack of the Clones}}\'a0on May 16, 2002, both to mixed reviews.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_%E2%80%93_Revenge_of_the_Sith"}}{\fldrslt 
\f1\i \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Episode III: Revenge of the Sith}}, the first\'a0PG-13\'a0film in the franchise, was released on May 19, 2005.
\fs20 \cf3 \super \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 [9]
\fs24 \cf2 \nosupersub \ulnone \strokec2 \'a0The plot of the trilogy focuses on the fall of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Republic}}, the formation of the Empire, and the tragedy of Anakin Skywalker's turn to the dark side.\
The Trade Federation upsets order in the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Republic"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Republic}}\'a0by\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Blockade"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 blockading}}\'a0the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Naboo"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Naboo}}\'a0in preparation for a full-scale\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Invasion"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 invasion}}. The Republic's leader,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor_Valorum"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Supreme Chancellor Valorum}}, dispatches\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Master}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Qui-Gon Jinn}}\'a0and his apprentice,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}, to negotiate with Trade Federation Viceroy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Nute_Gunray"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Nute Gunray}}.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Sidious}}, a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sith Lord}}\'a0and the Trade Federation's secret benefactor, orders the Viceroy to kill the Jedi and begin their invasion with an army of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Battle_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 battle droids}}. The Jedi escape and flee to Naboo. During the invasion,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0saves the life of a clumsy\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Gungan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Gungan}}\'a0outcast,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jar_Jar_Binks"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jar Jar Binks}}, from being run over by a droid transport. Indebted to\'a0Qui-Gon,\'a0Jar Jar\'a0leads the Jedi to Otoh Gunga, an underwater city of Naboo. The Jedi try to persuade the Gungan leader,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Boss_Nass"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Boss Nass}}, to help the planet's surface dwellers, but are unsuccessful. However, the Jedi manage to obtain\'a0Jar Jar's\'a0guidance and underwater transport to Theed, the capital city of Naboo; they narrowly avoid getting eaten by sea monsters on the way. They rescue Naboo's queen,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Padm\'e9 Amidala}}, and escape from the blockaded planet on her Royal Starship, intending to reach the Republic capital planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coruscant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coruscant}}.\
Amidala's ship is damaged as they pass the Federation blockade and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Hyperdrive"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 hyperdrive}}\'a0is caught in the crossfire, rendering it useless. They land for repairs on the desert planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}.\'a0Qui-Gon,\'a0Jar Jar,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Astromech_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 astromech droid}}{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/R2-D2"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 R2-D2}},\'a0and Padm\'e9\'97disguised as one of her handmaidens\'97visit a settlement of Mos Espa to purchase spare parts at a junk shop. They meet the shop's owner,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Watto"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Watto}}, and his nine-year-old slave,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}, a gifted pilot and engineer who has built a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Protocol_droid"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 protocol droid}}\'a0called\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/C-3PO"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 C-3PO}}.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0senses a strong presence of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}\'a0within Anakin, and is convinced that he is the prophesied "{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Messiah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Chosen One}}". Unable to buy the required hyperdrive parts due to the Republic's currency being worthless on Tatooine,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0wagers both the parts and Anakin's freedom with Watto in a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Podrace"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 podrace}}. Anakin wins, and joins the group to be trained as a Jedi, leaving behind his mother,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Shmi_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Shmi}}. En route to their starship,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0encounters\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Maul"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Maul}}, Darth Sidious' apprentice, who intends to capture Amidala. A duel ensues, but\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0quickly disengages and escapes onboard the starship.\
Qui-Gon and Obi-Wan escort Amidala to Coruscant so that she can plead her people's case to Chancellor Valorum and the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Senate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Senate}}.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0asks the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_Council"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Council}}\'a0for permission to train Anakin as a Jedi, but the Council refuses, concerned that Anakin is vulnerable to the dark side of the Force. Undaunted,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0vows to take up Anakin as his new disciple. Meanwhile, Naboo's senator\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Palpatine}}\'a0persuades Amidala to call for a\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Vote_of_no_confidence"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 vote of no confidence}}\'a0in Chancellor Valorum to elect a more capable leader to resolve the crisis. Though she is successful in pushing for the vote, Amidala grows frustrated with the corruption in the Senate and decides to return to Naboo.\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0and\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0are ordered by the Jedi Council to accompany the queen, and investigate the return of the Sith, whom they had believed to be extinct.\
On Naboo, Padm\'e9 reveals herself to the Gungans as Queen Amidala and persuades them to join in an alliance against the Trade Federation. Despite being inept at combat,\'a0Jar Jar\'a0joins his people in a battle against the droid army, while Padm\'e9 leads the search for Viceroy Gunray in Theed. During a battle in the starship hangar,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0tells Anakin to wait in the cockpit of a vacant starfighter. Anakin inadvertently triggers its\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Autopilot"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 autopilot}}, joining the battle against the Federation droid control ship in space. Anakin blunders into the hangar of the droid control ship and causes its destruction from within before escaping, deactivating the droid army in the process. Meanwhile,\'a0Qui-Gon\'a0and\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0battle Darth Maul, who mortally wounds\'a0Qui-Gon, but is then bisected by\'a0Obi-Wan.\
As he lays dying, Qui-Gon requests that\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0train Anakin. Palpatine is elected as the new supreme chancellor, and Gunray is arrested.\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}\'a0promotes\'a0Obi-Wan\'a0to the rank of Jedi Knight and reluctantly accepts Anakin as\'a0Obi-Wan's\'a0apprentice. Padm\'e9 presents a gift of thanks to the Gungans during a celebratory parade.\
Three years after the beginning of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clone_Wars_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Clone Wars}},\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Master}}\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Obi-Wan Kenobi}}\'a0and Jedi Knight\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Anakin Skywalker}}\'a0lead a mission to rescue the kidnapped Supreme Chancellor\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Palpatine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Palpatine}}\'a0from the cyborg Separatist commander,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/General_Grievous"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 General Grievous}}, during a space battle over\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Coruscant"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Coruscant}}. After infiltrating Grievous's flagship, the Jedi battle\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Count_Dooku"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Count Dooku}}, whom Anakin executes at Palpatine's urging. Grievous escapes the battle-torn ship in which the Jedi crash-land on Coruscant. There, Anakin reunites with his wife,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Padm\'e9 Amidala}}, who reveals that she is pregnant. While initially excited, Anakin begins to have prophetic visions of Padm\'e9 dying in childbirth.\
Palpatine appoints Anakin to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Jedi_Council"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Jedi Council}}\'a0as his representative and informant, but the Council declines to grant Anakin the rank of Jedi Master, and orders him to spy on Palpatine, diminishing Anakin's faith in the Jedi. Palpatine tempts Anakin with his knowledge of the dark side of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/The_Force"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 the Force}}, including the power to prevent death. Meanwhile, Obi-Wan travels to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Utapau_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Utapau}}, where he kills Grievous, and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Yoda"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Yoda}}\'a0travels to the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Wookiee"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Wookiee}}homeworld of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Kashyyyk"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Kashyyyk}}\'a0to defend it from invasion. Palpatine reveals to Anakin that he is the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Sith"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Sith Lord}}\'a0Darth Sidious and that he knows how to save Padm\'e9. Anakin reports Palpatine's treachery to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mace_Windu"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mace Windu}}, who confronts and subdues the Sith Lord, disfiguring his face. However, fearing that he will lose Padm\'e9, Anakin severs Windu's hand, allowing Palpatine to cast him out the window to his death. Anakin pledges himself to Sidious, who dubs him\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Darth_Vader"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Darth Vader}}. As the Supreme Chancellor, Palpatine issues an order that causes the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Clone_trooper"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 clone troopers}}\'a0to betray and kill their commanding Jedi officers. Vader kills the remaining Jedi in the temple including the child younglings, then travels to the volcanic planet of\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Mustafar"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Mustafar}}\'a0to slaughter the Separatist leaders. Palpatine declares himself Emperor before the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Senate"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Senate}}, transforming the Republic into the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Galactic_Empire_(Star_Wars)"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Galactic Empire}}. Having survived the chaos, Obi-Wan and Yoda return to Coruscant and learn of Vader's betrayal.\
Padm\'e9 goes to Mustafar and implores Vader to return to the light side. Vader sees Obi-Wan on Padm\'e9's ship, and thinking they have conspired to kill him, angrily chokes Padm\'e9. Obi-Wan engages Vader in a lightsaber duel, and after gaining the higher ground, warns his former pupil to stand down. When Vader attacks, Obi-Wan severs his legs and arm, leaving him at the bank of a lava flow, severely burned. On Coruscant, Yoda battles Palpatine until their duel reaches a stalemate. Yoda then flees with\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Bail_Organa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Bail Organa}}\'a0while Palpatine, sensing that his apprentice is in danger, travels to Mustafar.\
Obi-Wan regroups with Yoda on the asteroid\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Polis_Massa"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Polis Massa}}, where Padm\'e9 gives birth to a boy and girl, whom she names\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Luke_Skywalker"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Luke}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Princess_Leia"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Leia}}, respectively, before dying. On Mustafar, Palpatine finds Vader still alive and brings him to Coruscant, where his mutilated body is treated and covered in a black armored suit. Meanwhile, Obi-Wan and Yoda conceal the twins from the Sith. Yoda exiles himself to the planet\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Dagobah"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Dagobah}}, while Vader and the Emperor oversee the construction of the\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Death_Star"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Death Star}}. Bail Organa adopts Leia and takes her to\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Alderaan"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Alderaan}}, while Obi-Wan delivers Luke to his step-family,\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Owen_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Owen}}\'a0and\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Beru_Lars"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Beru Lars}}, on\'a0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "applewebdata://7998BC3A-FC84-49B5-A62D-C9951A11A103/wiki/Tatooine"}}{\fldrslt \cf3 \ul \ulc3 \strokec3 Tatooine}}.}
